Reviews.Title: “Great Safe Place to Stay Downtown Near Union Square”
Reviews.Author: windsova
Reviews.Content: It was my first trip to SF and I was there for a conference. The hotel I was supposed to stay at was full, so I booked the Chancellor Hotel based on my travel agents reco's and trip advisor reviews. It's a great little hotel. The rooms are small, but great for 1 person. The hotel is old, but all the hotels in the area are old, that's what makes SF, SF! The best was comfy, free wi-fi, nice little resto int he lobby for breakfast, starbucks across the street. My room was not facing the street, but I'm glad it wasn't. I know the cable cars can be loud, and if I opened my window I could hear them slightly. Everyone at the hotel was super friendly. Good to know, there is no AC. I was there first week of March and it was little warm during the day (I'm Canadian, anything about freezing is warm) so I had the window open during the day and up until I went to sleep. There is a celling fan and the front desk told me they had a cooling far for the room if I wanted it. Great hotel, great charm, would certainly stay there again if I was in SF!

Reviews.Title: “What could be better?”
Reviews.Author: picnicPerth
Reviews.Content: Great location/Union Square. Easy walk to AT & T. Wonderful history to hotel, clean rooms, all important room safe!, great breakfast dining downstairs ...and lovely coffee and cookies always available in lobby. Nothing to complain about! A great stay, friendly,helpful staff, perfect location for shopping/eating/trolley/tours/hire cars/public transport. And building had the 'feel' of San Francisco, which for anyone travelling from overseas, it is lovely to experience. Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “European-style Hotel in Heart of the City”
Reviews.Author: southendgirl05401
Reviews.Content: I enjoy high end hotels, generally, but was on a budget. This hotel really fit the bill for me: nice decor, comfortable beds, many amenities, including large closet, iron/ironing board, vanity mirror, luggage racks, internet/TV. The bathroom was older but clean and very roomy (though with odd industrial-style toilet), and walls are more like plaster than wallboard, which, for me, was some of the charm. The front desk was very helpful, friendly, and graciously stored our luggage after we checked out. Also***FANTASTIC RESTAURANTS right next door: Sears Fine Dining for breakfast and Scalas restaurant for dinner. Great meals! You can jump on the cable car across the street and head straight to Fisherman's Wharf or head down two blocks to Market street and pick up any/all city transportation. Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Great Trip!!”
Reviews.Author: RomeoandJuliet1989
Reviews.Content: We went to San Francisco with our Granddaughters 19 and 21 and had the best time while staying at The Chancellor. Its small and intimate and the service is great. My husband and I are not fans of big impersonal hotels but this was the first boutique hotel experience for the girls and they loved it. The rooms are nice although not big and the location of the hotel is excellent. We stayed on the 13th floor hoping to meet some ghosts but that was the only disappointment of the trip. The staff was helpful and friendly and the restaurant made a great start to our day with making us a good breakfast. Service in the restaurant was great and the location of the hotel was perfect, close to Macy's and shopping, transit and cable cars etc. Our room was at the back and quiet, girls were in the front and no complaints. This was the second stay at The Chancellor for us and we were happy the girls enjoyed it as well on this trip. Great value as well so we could splurge on the ballet and some wonderful dinners. We will return for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, poor service - missed wake up call”
Reviews.Author: pugl0ve
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on Union Square, so it's expected to be noisy, but because there is no air conditioning, you have to sleep with the windows open, and the noise is terrible, even at the back of the hotel. Also, the walls are very thin, so you hear every little noise in the rooms around you. We were on the uppermost floor, and the noise was still so bad that we could barely sleep. The beds are also very noisy. If your sleep mate moves the slightest bit in the night, the bed creaks terribly. We had a very early flight out of San Francisco and requested a 3:40am wake up call, but never got the wake up call, so if you're staying here, be sure to use the wake up call as a back up only. The front desk clerk was very nice to us, which made up for the bell boy's bad attitude.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel on Union Square in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: jford5678
Reviews.Content: The Chancellor has to be one of the best values in San Francisco. In addition to value, it has a fabulous location, very nice rooms, and a wonderful, helpful staff. Check out the various packages that are offered which include a daily restaurant/bar credit and reduced parking fees. We were there with friends from London, and they thoroughly enjoyed it as well. We were able to book city tours and other arrangements at the tour desk in the lobby, and hop on the Powell Street cable car right outside the front door, and stroll to the many shops and restaurants in and around Union Square and Chinatown. All in all, the Chancellor is an absolute gem! Highly recommended! J & MA Carmel, California

Reviews.Title: “ideally located,friendly atmosphere.”
Reviews.Author: robert d
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated right in the middle of all the action in the city centre. The hotel is not the modern uptodate type but it has character and is homely. It is clean and comfortable and is the sort of place that grows on you the longer you are there. The staff were very friendly and we would go back there again. City Tour transport is just two minutes away in the square. The world famous Sears Restaurant is next dooor for great food. If you like shopping Macy's is on the square with the Cheesecake Factory Restaurant on the roof. The main cable car line runs outside the hotel which will take you to Fishermans Wharf on the other side of town.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing start to honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Clare1973
Reviews.Content: A huge thanks to Wes and all at The Chancellor for an amazing start to our honeymoon. I would recommend this hotel without hesitation. We were in regular contact with Wes before our stay, no question too much and he gave us some great tips, including a visit to the gold dust bar where I believe we made many new friends, a great night! We found the hotel easily, parked up dropped the cases off then went round to the organised parking, it was a breeze! On arrival we discovered that Wes had organised a top floor suite for us, there was champagne on ice and a card and gift from the hotel team. We felt so special and welcome. During our travels around California we discovered many people who knew of the Chancellor and were big fans too. We definitely know why, it's friendly, quirky and perfectly placed. We fell in love with San Fransisco and the Chancellor was responsible!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, but watch out at the lobby area”
Reviews.Author: FlaviaQA
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading the reviews posted here on Tripadvisor. Me, my husband and three children stayed in two connected rooms, on the 12th floor. The location is perfect, a lot of options to eat, a Walgreens on the corner.. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We needed a doctor and they helped us to book an emergency appointment, just after our check in time. The only matter that worried me is that , on our check out day, we got a shuttle to the airport, and my son forgot a paper bag with a toy he bought at Exploratorium Museum, at the hotel lobby. We had a lot of luggage and the bag was left on the side of the sofa. We called the hotel 10 min after we had left and they didnt find the bag. It is a small lobby, very close to the front desk, Concierge and bell man.. And the toy was never found. it really disappointed me.

Reviews.Title: “Location!!”
Reviews.Author: bookmarks42
Reviews.Content: This is such a great little hotel. We stayed here for four nights as part of our honeymoon. After check in, which was quick and hassle free, we arrived to the room to find a card saying congratulations on our honeymoon, and a free bottle of champagne and chocolates. Now, the rooms are small, but i knew that already from other reviews on Tripadvisor. The decor is just lovely, bright modern colours and modern furniture mixed with the old style of the building. We were on the 9th floor, and had a room that overlooked a roof of another building. This wasn't a problem however, as it made the room quiet, even at night with both the windows open we still couldn't hear any street noise. I found the beds to be a little uncomfortable, a bit to firm for my liking, plus i am used to sleeping in a King bed, this was a queen.There is a large flat screen television in the room. No coffee machine or bar fridge. However, in the lobby there is free help your self coffee and cookies, plus chilled water. It wasn't particularly warm when we visited, but i noted that in terms of cooling they only have a ceiling fan and the windows which open. It wasnt an issue for us though during our stay. The concierge was fantastic, outlining everything on our map that we should see and how to get there. We bought a three day muni pass for $21 which gets you access on all the cable car and other buses that run. San Francisco is a fairly easy city to navigate, the public transport is pretty good. There is a bit of wait for the cable cars however, and sometimes they get so full they just go straight past. The location is great, right in the action. Its a shame there are so many homeless people, it started to become a real turn off that you couldn't walk anywhere without someone asking you for money. I would totally stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very central location”
Reviews.Author: w m h
Reviews.Content: My wife and myself found the hotel through trip advisor and the favourable reviews were accurate. We really enjoyed our stay and the friendly helpful people on the front desk. We were in a corner room on the 15th floor facing Powell and found the street noise to be what you would expect in a large city. Would definately choose The Chancellor again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: designergenes
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to SF and my first stay in The Chancellor. Both the hotel and the staff have bags of character and charm, and the location is perfect for exploring San Francisco. You'll find yourself in the heart of a district of shops, bars and restaurants. (If you want to treat yourself Matt the Bellhop's recommendation of the Italian restaurant Fino was right on the money.) The rooms were comfortable but without air-conditioning; I didn't find the lack of a/c a problem and the weather hit 93F this weekend. If you are bringing a car to the hotel you'll have to budget on valet parking with a 20-25 min delivery time (book your car collection time to avoid this). I had a great stay and I'll certainly be coming back again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: MrsShrt
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for a week in April 2012. The checkin was smooth and we were able to check in earlier than expected, which after 14 hr flight was a massive relief. The hotel is close (but not too close) to Powell St Station and we easily caught the BART (train service) and walked up to the hotel. The lobby is clean and offers coffee and tea making services, apples and cookies (think subway but better). The room was a little poky and we got twins but the facities were immaculately clean and the beds really comfortable and cozy. San Fran was going through a heat wave supposedly but I come from Sydney and didn't find the weather unbearable and the room ceiling fan offered comfort. In the middle of the shopping district Saks, Tiffany, Macy's and Bloomingdales are really close by and accessible by foot. The cable car stops half a block away and there are great cafes and eateries close by. The staff are approachable friendly and helpful and part of the reason we chose this hotel was from the replies that the manager posted on tripadvisor. We found our actual experience very much the same. Great hotel in fantastic location with clean amenities and an AWESOMEhuge tub!! Only con to think of was that there was crap reception on the tv. But if your in San Fran only for the tv you are missing out on a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Traditional on San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: George R
Reviews.Content: excellent location in the middle of union square everything around you and also is near the cable car station power & Hyde.

Reviews.Title: “A Terrific Location with Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Michelle_6532
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel flustered after the GPS put us on the wrong side of the street and we had to figure out how to negotiate the one way streets to get back. Thankfully the trusty Rand McNally road atlas saved the day and we arrived. It all got better from there, the Bell Hop was extremely pleasant, soothing and not even a little bit put out that we had a fair bit of luggage. Check in was very efficient even though we had problems with our credit card, the nice lady was patient and eventually we got it all sorted and we got into our room on the 13th floor. These rooms are small. Thankfully there is quite a roomy closet which managed to hold a ski bag, two suit cases and some other small bags - quite the Tardis. Even with this the room still felt confined, but we weren't there to lie about in our room all day! We had no noise issues. An in-room coffee maker would have been a good thing, coffee/tea is available in the lobby but I couldn't 'aquire' the taste for American drip coffee (anywhere). But I'll forgive them that because the cookies were always very yummy. The handy free ice machine was well apreciated by me. Great restaurants were in abundance around the hotel corner. There is a Walgreen's seemingly everywhere which was handy and I thought had the best souvenirs. Shopping - well that's legendary as is the cable car that stopped right out the lobby door but be prepared to wait or find an alternative, they were always full. We bought a muni passport from the hotel kiosk which was very efficient and cheaper. There's even a very good doctor the hotel can recommend. The bathroom was built on a postage stamp - we are tall people and it was a bit of comedy sketch at times. The bathroom as with the rest of the room, was always scrupulously clean and the toiletries are lovely. Thanks to the complimentary umbrella in the closet our tour of Alcatraz was not a total wash out. Very good thinking! On the whole, the hotel was very pleasant. If we stayed in SF again, we would probably stay somewhere else, not because of the hotel but away from touristy Union Square - it was always so busy and us country folks just didn't cope well. SF is a great city, surprisingly compact and very easy to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: dot15409
Reviews.Content: Selected the Chancellor after reading all the good reviews and was not let down! Room was comfy, clean and came with its own stocked candy jar!. They have a pillow bar where you can select 2 of any number of interesting pillows to try during your stay for free. Cookies were available as an afternoon snack, and coffee in the morning. We had breakfast at the cafe inside and it was convenient and filling. The location was great - right off union square. It was just about 3 blocks for us to walk to the start of the historic trolley car line and enjoy a day of sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel with a heart in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: nomadCork
Reviews.Content: It's located at the corner of Union Square, the cable cars run up and down Powell Street passing its fron door, there is a stop just outside. The reception staff were all most helpful, good fun and yet very efficient. they seemed to be in no hurry and yet there was no delay in processing our bookings/requests. They took the trouble to tell us waht was available...internet, teas/coffee/cookies 24 hours etc. The room was perfect and looked out on the cablecar route. The room had a safe....a great facility and it was free (unlike many European sun destinations). The hotel is within walking distance of great shopping centres (Macy's of course, but Ross is worth a look...very good value and Urban for great shop design). There are art galleries and museums and urban parks nearby. At weekends there is a great art exhibition in the square (they can sell but can't take money in the square...you must walk with the artist a few paces away...a weird law!). A trumpeter played marvellous jazz in the early evening and there are buskers aplenty. The drummers using everything but drums are wonderfu. Two streets down on O'Farrell street Johnny Foley's pub is well worth a visit. the service is first class, the food is wonderful and best value in toen, bands play at weekends but the real gem is the duelling piano bar dwon stairs . we were mesmerised by the two pianists we heard and you can put bread in the jar if you want a request played...you can also dance...we did..couldn't resist!. It was like returning home each night as we went back to the Chancellor. Well done all! Oh Friday lunch at $5! AMazing value.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice for tourists in SF”
Reviews.Author: miss_observant
Reviews.Content: This hotel definitely lived up to our expectations. It is clean, friendly, in a nice location very near Union Square. I was a little worried there would be street noise, but I was not bothered at all. Our room was on the 7th floor facing the street. The rooms arent huge, but I dont think that matters. When you're visiting a city like San Francisco you shouldnt spend a whole lot of time in the hotel any way.

Reviews.Title: “Second Visit to a Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: v11rah
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed here for the second time at Easter. I looked on various sites to find a hotel but decided that the location of The Chancellor cannot be beaten. We asked for a forward facing room on a higher floor and got exactly that. The staff at this hotel are excellent, Very friendly and helpful. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting San Francisco. The hotel is a three star operation with five star operatives ! Thankyou for a great stay

Reviews.Title: “A great choice”
Reviews.Author: dustylin
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights on a stopover back to London from Auckland.This is a small hotel very close to Union Square . The lobby has attractive decor and a cosy bar area. The barman was very knowledgeable about local wines and beers. There is a tour desk in the lobby and complimentary tea coffee and cookies.We had requested a high floor and were given a room on the 15th floor(1500) with a view of Union Square and the sea in the distance. The room was bigger than we expected with a double bed, armchair and stool and writing desk. There was a large walk in wardrobe big enough to store our 2 suitcases . There was no air conditioning but a ceiling fan was provided and there was also a safe in the wardrobe. A nice touch was the jar of sweets in th room which I resisted only for one day.Free Wi.Fi was available in the room. The bathroom was small but adequate with a bath and shower over bath and some nice toiletries.Although the lift was next door we were not disturbed by noise.We could hear some traffic noise from below but only with the windows open. The location is excellent close to shops restaurants transport and Union Square where the Hop on Hop off buses stop. We were very pleased we had booked this hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very courteous staff”
Reviews.Author: Mark Z
Reviews.Content: After following advice from TravelAdvisor and a few other sources, I stayed at The Chancellor for about 5 days recently and had a good experience. The hotel is older and has a bit of character (in a good way) so don't expect the "corporate DoubleTree" decor. I had no noise issues like some other reviewers may have noted and found it's location very convenient because it's walkable to the Muni/Bart and all the shops in Union Sq - the Powell st cable car trolley stops practically right in the front door. The restaurant inside will make regular tourists happy, but if your a foodie than you won't be that excited - but it is reasonably priced and sometimes they have great deals. I did have an issue regarding billing and the management swooped in and rectified the situation very fast and accommodated me. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It’s like staying at a friend’s place.”
Reviews.Author: TickingBucketList
Reviews.Content: This is our first visit to San Francisco. We picked this hotel after reading reviews here. The hotel is old but very comfortable and clean. It’s like staying at a friend’s place. Room and bathroom are clean, bed is firm and comfortable with clean sheets, bathroom is well-stocked with organic shampoo, conditioner, lotion, etc. The spacious walk-in closet is a bonus as we stored our luggage there. There is a good sized safe in the closet. Free wifi. We got a mini fridge in the room free on request. The housekeeping staff are very efficient, they clean your room fast and job well done too. Though there is no tea/coffee facility in the room, there are lovely cookies, tea, coffee and apples available all day at the lobby. They have disposable tray and cups for guests to enjoy their drinks in the room. We booked a tour to Muir Woods and Sausalito from the hotel. The person at the hotel tour kiosk is very helpful. What a perfect location: cable car stops right in front of hotel, Sears restaurant serves good food on the right and Designer Shoe Warehouse is on the left of the hotel. My only dissatisfaction is the weak shower pressure. However, we have enjoyed our stay and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “location location.......”
Reviews.Author: warey55
Reviews.Content: What a charming clean freindly hotel the chancellor is. Read reviews on here and we were not dissapointed, loved the chancellor. Book in was pleasant with friendly staff, up to our fresh smelling clean room. Bed extremely comfortable as were the pillows, room size adequate I'm not a big room fanatic, fit for purpose is all I want. Free coffee, apples, biscuits is a nice touch. Small bar and a restaurant, can't comment as we ate / drank out ! For breakfast turn left as you exit Chancellor up the hill one block for a nice usa diner (pic) We caught BART from airport $8 each one way, very efficient way to get to Union Square get off at Powell St then a short walk less than 5 mins to hotel, we had light cases so no problem walking this distance uphill. ( Cheaper than Taxi. ) We booked a 2 day open top bus tour with the red bus comp, a great way to see the city with tour guide, you can hop on and off catch next bus approx every 30 mins or so, Also goes across Golden gate. Also check out the F line antique trams (pic) $2 each ride but you can use this same ticket to ride any municipal bus up to a certain time on the same day, save your legs. Highly reccommend this hotel and would not hesitate to rebook, enjoy SF.

Reviews.Title: “Chancellor Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Veronica G
Reviews.Content: Excellent service. Cute decor. Great location, close to everything. Will definitely stay there again on my next visit to San Francisco

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Stress Free Vacation”
Reviews.Author: maolsen
Reviews.Content: We found the Chancellor hotel to a great spot for our first trip to San Francisco. We could easily access transportation, shopping, and restaurants. We also enjoyed people watching in Union Square. Our room was small, but very quiet and comfortable--we requested a room in back when we made our reservation. The view was not great, but we had no problems with street noise. There was always plenty of apples, cookies, coffee, and tea in the lobby. All of the staff members were helpful and friendly. The tours we booked picked us up and dropped us off at the hotel. It was one of our least stressful vacations.

Reviews.Title: “1920's CHARM”
Reviews.Author: Aerovergalineas
Reviews.Content: This hotel is old. Different than modern plastic resorts of now. The room was very small, but well appointed. Nice touch with the "rubber ducky" they give, for the bathtub. The staff was accomodating my change of room request. And gracious when I extended my stay by one more night. The little in house restaurant was very nice, cocktails too. AND THE SERVICE WAS BEYOND EXCELLENT

Reviews.Title: “Location is the best”
Reviews.Author: pb47
Reviews.Content: This was a very well placed hotel with comfortable rooms, friendly helpful staff. An excellent hotel if you want to be where the action is.

Reviews.Title: “Spring in San Fran”
Reviews.Author: mgonz045
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our first trip to San Fran and we had an amazing time! Stayed at the Chancellor from Fri-Sun, location is great, close to shopping and restaurants, little loud at night. Complimentary coffee and cookies made my honey happy. Rooms are a little small, but updated decor. Staff is very accomadating. Free wi-fi available. Very comfy bedding. Trams pass right in front of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I can see why the Chancellor's fans are fanatics!”
Reviews.Author: SoItinerant
Reviews.Content: I was a bit puzzled by the evangelistic tone of many of the Chancellors' reviewers here on TripAdvisor - that was, until my wife and I stayed there on a recent business trip to San Francisco. In fact, the reviews were so good we canceled our booking at another, nearby hotel and switched over to the Chancellor. I am glad we did. Every guest experience at the Chancellor seems calculated to be out-of-the-ordinary in terms of customer service, thoughtfulness, and ambiance. The details are legion, from the extremely helpful front-desk staff to the entertaining Irish bartender to the umbrella in the cupboard and the exhaustive list of available pillow options. Everything conspires to say, this is NOT an ordinary hotel, this is a place that receives you and turns you into a customer advocate. Dang, these people could and should write a book to re-teach the mega-chains (talkin'-a' you, Mr. Marriott) how to run a hotel. Internets are free. The breakfast has healthy options available that are not over-salted and are, in fact, delicious. The bar has a happy hour from 17h00 to 19h30 and provides an entertaining option for meeting fellow-guests and hangers-on. Nothing is perfect, of course. The hotel would do well to pay a bit more attention to its infrastructure, such as, Do the bathroom doors close and stay closed when closed (hint: In our case, no). Barring a major breakthrough in physics, the rooms cannot increase in size, but it would be nice if that could be arranged. But of course such things are more likely in Los Angeles than San Francisco (Go, Caltech! :) And, though tram bells are charming, if they get on your nerves you will want to request a room on a higher floor. But the Chancellor appears to be very receptive to such requests. Though no coffee is available in the room, free coffee is available in the lobby. One important hint: When you book your room, pay a few dollars extra for the meal credit. $10 extra per day buys you $25 credit at the Chancellor's restaurant and bar - more than enough to cover a good breakfast, or some wine in the evening; whatever floats your boat. The credit isn't available after arriving, so be sure to order it in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: Paul H
Reviews.Content: Small room, but fine for a City hotel. Very comfortable bed. Excellent location, especially for the vintage trams! Staff not always completely attentive, but fine overall. Bar was a bit small and dark.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great room”
Reviews.Author: Mara P
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to a suite which was nice. The room was classic yet quirky. They even have a pillow menu from which you can choose different pillows every night! The hotel is bang in the middle of the city, you can get free tea when you get back, which is nice as outside it was cold and windy. The only thing, the people at the reception could smile a bit more.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: carlynhill
Reviews.Content: Just back from a trip to San Fran and Las Vegas. Our stay at The Chancellor was wonderful. The location is superb and the room was lovely. The bed was exceptionally comfy and the room was a good size, perhaps in US terms it would be classified as small, but in European terms it was good. The staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful and it was so easy to get access to the hotel computer to print out my boarding pass. The free tea/ coffee in the lobby was great as after a full day walking about the city, it was fab to have a refreshing cuppa and a biscuit. The ice water with cucumber was also a lovelt touch and I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for an Old, Union Square Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Moonette
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chancellor for 4 nights in April, 2012, chosen mostly because of tripadvisor reviews and the cost. Given that the hotel is old and close to Union Square, I wasn't sure what to expect. Some of the hotels in that area are not very nice. .. Just saying. At any rate, I'd made reservations stating that our flight arrived SFO at 9:30 am. They said they would do what they could to make sure the room was ready. It wasn't ready when we arrived at 10:30, but that was fine since we knew we were arriving before official check-in. They stored our bags, told us to check back in 2 hours, and off we went. Three hours later, the room was still not ready. They checked in several other people who came in while we were sitting there waiting for the room to be ready. . . Not happy about that at all. We waited almost another hour before they gave us our keys. At least the small lobby was comfortable. We got to the room to find had provided a bottle of champagne and box of chocolates as a birthday present. That soothed my consternation over the delay in getting the room keys. The room, while small, was larger than some we've stayed in in SF, and it was clean. We had a corner room, and the closet was huge. That said, there was not a lot of room to hang things up as it was long but not too wide. Still, it was good to put suitcases in there and out of the way in the room. The tiny bathroom, while dated, reminded me of European bathrooms. There was a tub with shower, and stepping over the edge wasn't fun. The towels were as old as the hotel, I think. I did, however, like the soaps, shampoos and cute yellow duck. Three things I appreciated (other than the birthday gifts): hot coffee, cold water and cookies in the lobby all day long. What I would change: Update the bathrooms and the towels. While we didn't partake, they did offer an extensive choice of pillows different from the ones in the room. I would stay there again given the Chancellor's location and general upkeep.

Reviews.Title: “Going downhill?”
Reviews.Author: Letmetravel!
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here twice now, but won't be going back. The first time I stayed at the Chancellor, it was fantastic. We requested a room with a view of Union Square and had a great stay. The room was reasonably sized for SF and immaculately clean. The staff were fantastic and we came back with friends a year later. Our neighbouring rooms didn't have nice views and were much smaller than the room we'd stayed in previously. The staff didn't seems as helpful as they had been and we were disappointed after recommendng the hotel so highly to our friends. It may be that we were unlucky this time and ended up with poorer rooms - if you stay, request a room on a higher floor with a view of Powell St or Union Square. On the plus side, the location is still as great as ever!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the price and very well located”
Reviews.Author: doug_fernando
Reviews.Content: The hotel was pretty nice, extremely well located (union square) and the staff very helpful. The price is very just for the quality/location. The only two suggestions that I have are: the menu for the breakfast could be more extensive including simpler options with items such as fruits, breads and juices, besides that I would like to have more channels in the TV. However, definitely I will stay again in this hotel in my next trip to SF.

Reviews.Title: “You'll love San Fran!”
Reviews.Author: ladybug4656
Reviews.Content: My husband and I choose this hotel after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor. The hotel met, if not exceeded our expectations. The hotel staff was very helpful and accommodating. Their was a travel desk within the hotel which made great recommendations of things to do in San Fran. Our favorite part of the hotel was the wonderful, complimentary coffee, cookies, fruit, and flavored cucumber water. The Chancellor has a fantastic location and really goes the extra mile to make you feel welcome!

Reviews.Title: “So wanted to agree with reviews”
Reviews.Author: BuckBrisbaneAus
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel after reading the reviews here on TA. I do agree with the comments re location, the staff going the extra mile to help and the hot drinks and cookies availability. our biggest gripe was the very poor water pressure. i do undertsnad this is an old hotel but this is something that must be addressed sooner rather than later.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: EvanstonCubFan
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel near Union Square in San Francisco and don't want to pay over $200 a day, you should try the Chancellor Hotel. Our room had limited space, but was just fine for us.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in top location”
Reviews.Author: Robertsclubman
Reviews.Content: This was our second and third stays at the Chancellor on Union Square, 3 nights each, interrupted by a road trip. And it just confirms my view- why would you stay anywhere else in San Francisco. OK it's not the last word on luxury but it's clean and comfortable and by far the best value hotel in the Downtown area. The hotel 's location on Powell Street just off Union Square is hard to beat. The cable cars run right outside and the shops and restaurants are right on your doorstep. Buy a Muni Passport from the kiosk in reception and the City is at your feet. Can't wait to come back for a 4th time. I love this City and the Chancellor is the place to stay. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location...”
Reviews.Author: Brazilian_2012
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a good location with good price, you should go to Chancellor - but do not expect any fancy room. The room is clean, but it is a little bit old (but it was okay for me). It has some great little extras like umbrellas, sweets, pillow menu.... Also free tea/coffee, cookies and apple all day! The staff are very friendly and we had no issues at all. As I always look for hotels with good location, Chancellor was perfect for me - near Macy's, Cheesecake Factory, malls and many other restaurants and stores.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent stay! Thank you all! Good Job!”
Reviews.Author: Lenny N
Reviews.Content: Thank you to all staff to make my stay very comfortable. Great location, very friendly and helpful staff. Good amenities, great little extras in room like sweets, umbrellas, pillow menu. Free tea/coffee all day. Thank you all! Good Job!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place”
Reviews.Author: 574Nancyr
Reviews.Content: Fantastic central hotel. Room was large enough for the two of us (twin room) so that we were not falling over each other, the beds were comfortable and with the lovely views of the square and the sound of the man playing the trumpet of an evening we had a brilliant stay. Complimentary tea, coffee and fresh cookies are available 24 hrs (due to jet lag I was a regular visitor at 4am) if the coffee and water isn't hot enough go and spend your money in a Starbucks. My stay was to celebrate my birthday and we arrived to a lovely chilled bottle of sparkling wine, glasses and gift in the room, a really nice touch (as was the jar of sweets). For breakfast the hotel is cheaper than Sears up the road and just as tasty. All in all a brilliant hotel which we would stay at again and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite hotel in SF”
Reviews.Author: mmwc
Reviews.Content: Whenever we visit San Francisco we stay at The Chancellor. Its location is excellent, on Powell Street right at Union Square. Wonderful restaurants are nearby, shopping is literally across the street, and the cable car stops right outside the door. The hotel glories in its history, and maintains a decor reminiscent of a gentler time. The rooms tend to be on the small side, but only in comparison with the huge rooms offered by some of the big chains: we find the rooms cozy and intimate, but certainly with room easily to accommodate two 26" suitcases and carry-ons in the spacious closet. The hotel is perfectly clean and neat, and staff are warm, friendly, knowledgeable, professional and very helpful. It's one of our favorite places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location near Union Square”
Reviews.Author: pshah19
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last year for the SF marathon (I know I know , a little belated) and was very happy with the location and quality. Keep in mind that during the summer, SF can be very pricey so this hotel does provide a decent value. Parking is two minutes away in a garage and tons of restaurants all around for almost any kind of meal. Hotel also provides snacks in the lobby for guests to munch on. And fairly typical of the area, the building is a little old so the elevators are slow. Rooms are small but adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay At The Chancellor!”
Reviews.Author: jkkjhrdn
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our 6 night stay at the Chancellor Hotel. What a wonderful gem in the city! From the time we made our reservations to check out, we had nothing but exceptional service. A special thanks to Nate in reservations. His kindness in helping us with our reservations and even during our stay there. He gave us great recommendations and always friendly! The rooms were clean, the location perfect and we would definately be returning! Thanks again Chancellor Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Chris V
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights and had a suite on 15th floor. What a great location. Bed was very comfortable.The room was clean and in good shape for a building of this age. Bathrooms were ok but could probbly do with an upgrade soon. Staff were excellent and helped us through the trauma of losing a case. I would stay at the Chancellor again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Centrally located in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: MightyredEngland
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel in the centre of San Francisco. Hotel price came with car parking which was located less than a few hundred yards away. Quiet room with a lovely deep bath which came in handy after all the walking that I tend to do. Only 2 lifts but never really that busy. Very close to the best of SF, Cable car stops outside and all the best stores in SF are literally just around the corner from Macy's, Louis Vuitton and all the other quality shops on union square. We used taxi's a lot as they were so easy to grab as they went past. Would stay again when I next go to SF. Free Wi-fi which really came in handy as i grabbed the latest uk news.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort at the Chancellor hotel”
Reviews.Author: msprim
Reviews.Content: Excellent location and very nice comfortable hotel. Coffee, tea and cookies in the lobby a nice touch but unfortunately coffee was never hot enough nor the hot water for the tea. There is room for improvement here. But overall enjoyed our time here and would highly recommend the hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy hotel, great location to explore the city!”
Reviews.Author: nkdewitt
Reviews.Content: We were visiting friends on the nearby Air Force base and decided to spend our last night in the city by ourselves. We chose this hotel because of its close proximity to Chinatown, that it had a cable car stop right outside the hotel, and that it was so highly rated on TripAdvisor. We took the cable car down to the pier and back, were able to take a nice stroll through Chinatown, access the Mission district via BART, and get to the airport via BART. I couldn't recommend this hotel more, just based on its location, but it was also cozy and sweet and perfectly comfortable. It kind of reminded me of a hotel we stayed at in Florence, Italy, a few years ago--just the right amount of space to put your things down, take a nice shower, and get a good night's rest.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, wonderful location!”
Reviews.Author: SharonI1958
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a four day get away in San Francisco. We stayed at the Chancellor Hotel. The hotel is in a perfect location with the cable car stop just outside the front door. The room was quiet, clean, airy, and very comfortable. We took advantage of trying out their pillow choices during our stay. The staff was friendly and helpful. If you want a home away from home in San Francisco I would definitely suggest the Chancellor!

Reviews.Title: “The Original "San Francisco Treat"”
Reviews.Author: Soccermom1964
Reviews.Content: My family and I have spent quite a few nights at The Chancellor over the years, where the staff maintain the highest standards in professionalism, courtesy, and friendliness. The rooms are well-appointed, comfortable, and clean. While the cost is very affordable, the location is priceless. The Chancellor embodies all that is special about San Francisco. It is our home away from home and always a real treat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Helensara
Reviews.Content: This place more than met our expectations. Clean , well decorated rooms, and such a great location and of course the price couldn't be beat. We were at the back of the hotel so there was no street noise, the beds were very comfortable . The staff was very helpful, check-in and out was easy. Did have a lunch there and it was fine. Above all the location is so handy for walking and the cable car is outside the door. This can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Darlene3838
Reviews.Content: We always stay at the Chancellor. It is friendly, clean and in a great location. The restaurant is very good. Nice little bar and comfortable lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Felt old and loud”
Reviews.Author: siren913
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from San Francisco where we stayed at the Chancellor. The other reviews are correct; this location is tough to beat. The lobby is lovely, as well. Unfortunately, our visit started out badly when the gentleman at check-in couldn't find that I'd reserved a "parking included" rate on Expedia. It was late in the evening after many flight delays and this certainly wasn't a warm welcome. We parked our car in their offsite garage and hauled our luggage through the rain to the hotel - I suppose it should be expected that parking is, of course, off site. In the end, it took speaking to two people until the issue was resolved. Our room was nicely decorated but is just a facelift on an aging hotel. It was tiny, loud (!) at night (overlooking cable cars and Union Square) and the bathroom struck me as almost creepily old. The toilet is that of a public restroom. Although there are deep bathtubs, these have been there forever and there was no way I would get in one, despite the lovely bathsalts and rubber duck provided. My overall verdict is "meh." Walking past the Westin on Union Square had my heart longing to return there, instead. For the price, I suppose this is what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Happiness at the Chancellor hotel union square”
Reviews.Author: Sheila Y
Reviews.Content: Fabulous!!!!!!!!!! Stayed many times, wont stay any where else!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyment & Comfort”
Reviews.Author: debra b
Reviews.Content: The Chancellor is a wonderful place to stay. We enjoy the rooms and the location of the hotel. We have been coming here for ten years.

Reviews.Title: “Saved our trip”
Reviews.Author: rebecca c
Reviews.Content: We were staying in another hotel that was WAY out of the way and not currently on the train route, due to construction. It was a nightmare using public transportation to get places and the hotel itself was dirty and we wanted out! Thankfully we had booked through Tripadvisor and were able to cancel and book Chancellor. The representative for Chancellor quoted me a LOWER rate than what was on the internet. Chancellor is in an EXCELLENT location. It is close to shopping, wonderful restaurants, and the conference center, & the price was extremely competitive.

Reviews.Title: “A Family Tradition”
Reviews.Author: Stephen D
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been staying at the Chancellor 1-2 times per since 1988 (not a typo) for Christmas shopping, going to the ballet, or going to the symphony. Haven't stayed anyplace else in the city for many years. Best deal for such a location, and the best for parking too.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: LancashireLass21
Reviews.Content: Very central for everything! Room was quite small but very comfortable - no view, we looked onto the fire escape stairs but because of that there was no noise from the street which could be a problem with rooms at the front. Helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: SarahF1203
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 3 nights over Feb. Unfortunately become ill with the flu on my stay so spent most my time in the hotel room. Room was small but very comfortable and clean. Even though it is in the middle of the city, the hotel room was quiet. Loved that there was a jar full of lollies in the room, free cookies, tea and coffee in the lobby, and the hotel restaurant was very nice and reasonably priced. Lucky I didn't need to leave the hotel for anything other than some medication, as I had everything I needed for a restful stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: JayM224
Reviews.Content: If you want to be close to public transit, museums, Chinatown, or retail shopping it's a great location. The staff and general ambience are the Chancellor's other best features. Susan at the concierge desk is extremely helpful, as are all the front desk staff. There's a lot going on at Union Square so it does tend to be noisy, especially nights on the weekends, and there is no air conditioning so you'll want to leave the windows open at least part of the time. There is a ceiling paddle fan though. The beds are pretty comfy, pillows are pretty good. If you pre-purchase the Luques card at a discount, breakfast is a good deal. Pick up a Muni passport at the concierge desk -- you can hop on a cable car at Powell and Post if there's room.

Reviews.Title: “European style in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: karlowsj
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed around Union Square at different hotels for our short stays in lovely San Francisco, but this hotel is our favourite. Staff are amazing - long term and know their city so share wonderful advise of hidden gems. The rooms are small but if you are a tourist in the city, you are out most of the time. Pillow menu is amazing - wish every hotel had one. Breakfast or a cocktail in the afternoon is covered as you start out or regroup. Ideal location for transportation or walking to shops.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to stay in Union Square, this is the place to be!”
Reviews.Author: JezandStacy
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean and cozy. The pillow menu was a particularly nice touch. The hotel was clean and the staff Very Friendly. The restaurant serves a great breakfast. We checked out early, but only because we decided not want to stay in Union Square. The staff was very accommodating and let us check out early. The normal policy is to tell them before 3:00 and they allowed us a leeway of an hour and a half, which was really nice of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way!!!”
Reviews.Author: dreams2008
Reviews.Content: Last week I had the pleasure to stay at Chancellor Hotel, LOVED IT!!! Hotel is very easy to get to from Powell/Bart station ( three short blocks) Location is perfect, right in the middle of everything. Checking in was a breeze (staff is nice and helpful). Rooms are small, but have a nice feel to them, very clean. BEDS are out of this world, very comfortable! so are the pillows. There are two elevators, hotel offers complementary coffee and cookies, apples in the lobby. The only bad thing I can say is that free WIFI service has a weak signal. Had to sit in the hallway to access the internet or right next to the exit door of my room. Would stay here again without any hesitations.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Union Sqaure”
Reviews.Author: sford87
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights in February and everything was perfect. I went on a girls trip with my mom. We stayed in a room with 2 twin beds. It wasn't a large room but it was plenty for us. I loved the big walk in closet, it was perfect for storing our bags. The room was very clean and we had absolutely no complaints at all with the hotel. I loved the free coffee, tea, and cookies downstairs. Room service from the restaurant was great and well priced. The cable car pick up was right across the street. It really is a perfect location for shopping, it's only a short ride to Fisherman's Wharf, and I felt very safe in our location.The staff was always polite. Mike at the tour desk was really helpful. He advised us to get the 3-day MUNI pass which is by far the best deal. I would recommend that to anyone who will be staying at least 3 days. He gave us a map and highlighted the routes that they go. He also set up our shuttle to get to the airport.I would definitely stay at the Chancellor again.

Reviews.Title: “Chancellor Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Deborah O
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and helpful staff, and a great location on Union Square. No complaints to speak of. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here anytime!”
Reviews.Author: bbeadles
Reviews.Content: I just could not believe all the great reviews of the Chancellor before staying there. Have these people ever stayed at a Ritz Calrton or Four Seasons? Well, I get it now. While it is not one of those properties, it is one of the most friendly, well located and well-kept (older) properties I have visited in a long time. My 15 year-old son and I did a last minute trip to San Francisco. He too has experienced club level at the Ritz, etc. and he loved it. Rooms and bathrooms are small and as shown on everyone's pictures but incrediably well kept. My matress wasn't great but after walking San Francisco each day I slept like a baby. For the class of hotel and value, it is unbeatable. Bottom line: I will make this hotel my first choice to stay in San Francisco especially when not travelling on my company's account.

Reviews.Title: “e”
Reviews.Author: john_rose3
Reviews.Content: My partner and I just returned from three nights at the Chancellor Hotel on Union Square. I couldn't have been happier with our stay. There were efforts to be green while maintaining a very high level of service. We loved the fruit, coffee, tea, and cookies available in the lobby. We encountered people who had been returning for 30 years and we will surely join them. The location was great. We hopped on cable cars 8 times in three days and had easy access to the Bart and airport. We liked the city noises and great places to eat nearby. This time San Francisco seemed like home.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Good Value”
Reviews.Author: SunHol1
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to San Fran and we loved this hotel - the location is fantastic (much prefer Union Square to Fishermans Wharf). Professional and friendly staff, felt like a family run hotel with little extras such as free tea/coffee and biscuits in reception. Rooms were very clean, bathrooms a little on the small side but functional. Great value for money and a location that would be hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value -and Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VTLongTimeTraveler
Reviews.Content: The location just off Union Square is fantastic. Walk from BART. The lobby is a little small and has lots of activity. The room is nicely updated, and the bed is super comfortable. The windows open so real air is possible. The bathroom is not big but it has the deepest tub I've seen short of a hot tub. I would definitely be happy with the room at almost twice what we're paying. Besides the desk said that it's expected that the guests will take the rubber ducky. Now that's a real nice touch. The room is very clean and has no smell at all.

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: fujido
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Chancellor before, so we had the pleasure of already knowing some of the staff and being familiar with all the great features of the hotel. Such a convenient location on Union Square so it was easy to get to where we wanted to go each day. And absolutely the best deep extra-long bathtub ever--blissful to soak in after each day's adventures. A very good restaurant and bar staffed with friendly folks; who could ask for more?

Reviews.Title: “we´d like to come back”
Reviews.Author: Petra_DL
Reviews.Content: We´ve been to San Francisco many times, and never stayed in this hotel; but we were pleasantly surprised. The hotel is located in a building which is more than 100 years old. Therefore, the rooms are quite small and so are the bathrooms. The location is great, on Powell, almost on Union Square. Our room was in the back on the fifth floor and even with our window a few inches open at night, we never heard any noise from the city! When we arrived in the middle of the day, we heard some terrible hammering and drilling, so we were very afraid about that, (construction work in the former Borders building I guess) but luckily we were never disturbed by that in the early mornings, and we stayed for 6 nights. I loved the bed, very comfortable. There´s also a pillow menu, if you like. The room and bathroom were both very clean. There´s a walk in closet to store your luggage. The only thing missing in the room was a fridge. The free wifi in the room was excellent, we even used it to make skype calls. I liked the little candy jar and the nice rubber duckie; a nice touch. Staff was very friendly. In the lobby is free coffee and tea (and cookies!) available the whole day, we enjoyed that too. If you need it, the hotel has its own tourmanager to help you find your way in the city. When we will be back in San Francisco, this hotel will be our first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome visit!”
Reviews.Author: Habermas
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Chancellor Hotel and I love it. The location is excellent – it is central to many sites/areas and not far from transportation. There are many great restaurants nearby. And, on both trips, I have found the staff to be super friendly (actually, all of the service we had in San Francisco was excellent). Also, the room was very clean, which is one of my most important considerations. The room isn’t large, but it was fine for the two of us. The bathrooms have those deep bathtubs, which I love. Although the hotel was renovated a few years ago, it is an older hotel – meaning, if you like things modern and sleek, this probably isn’t the hotel for you. Our room, on the eighth floor, faced Powell Street. Once the window was shut, it wasn’t too noisy. I could see noise being a problem if you stayed in warmer weather. Since the hotel doesn’t have air conditioning I imagine you’d have to leave the windows open. Also, oddly, the windows (ours anyway) don’t have screens, so I think bugs could be a problem in warmer weather. The tv channels are limited and the cost of movies are (I think) outrageous - $16.95! – maybe that’s standard, but I wouldn’t pay it. Internet if free (yay!), but $10/day if you want to be able to access if through the tv. The hotel provides free coffee/tea, cold water, cookies and apples throughout the day. All of these were much appreciated for quick returns between destinations. However, the coffee was lukewarm on several occasions – maybe it would be worthwhile to invest in better carafes? Anyway, as I said, I love this hotel and I wouldn’t hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Visitors from UK”
Reviews.Author: Ferret70
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in the hotel last week (Feb 2012) and really enjoyed it. Our travel company suggested it and we saw no reason to doubt their choice when we checked the reviews. There are some dodgy reviews but I loved the responses from the general manager! Our experience was entirely positive. We arrived at the hotel more than hours before check in after a 27 hour journey with little sleep. The receptionist was brilliant and found us a quiet room which we could access immediately! All the staff were super friendly and helpful, especially Mao and colleagues in the breakfast room. The hotel has character and the room we occupied wasn't huge, but it was really clean and comfortable. The bath was in need of replacement, but we only showered anyway. Cities are always noisy, but the location on Powell Street was great, and our room was quiet. I wonder if the "construction noise" someone mentioned was actually the cable system for the street cars which run right past. We loved it, the free coffee, the comfortable bed, all the original features in the hotel, and the Sears restaurant next door. Excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: AlbuquerqueWilly
Reviews.Content: A very comfortable hotel in a terrific central location. I had a room at the back which was surprisingly quiet for downtown. Free internet, pillow-top beds, and full-sized bathtub. I'll come here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: KLeinSeattleWA
Reviews.Content: Located on Powell between Sutter and Post, Cable Car right out the front door, kitty corner to Union Square. Spent a great deal of research time looking for an inexpensive but touted location and you can't beat the Chancellor. Room was small but very cozy and clean and the bed was extremely comfortable. One amenity that I didn't realize was the complimentary gym membership at Club One just a block away. That pretty much tipped my satisfaction meter over the top. Definitely re-visit next year.

Reviews.Title: “Once Again Enjoyed Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: ccardnut
Reviews.Content: Last year we booked the Chancellor and the experience was delightful. So we decided to try again and we were not disappointed. The shopping,dining and transportation is readily available. I recommend Chancellor Hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise on Powell Street”
Reviews.Author: SandeeandAndrew
Reviews.Content: The Chancellor Hotel was a great choice for us. The location was perfect for many reasons. 1. Location right in the heart of the city; loved the big city atmosphere. 2. Trolly car stop right around the corner & tour bus stops as well. 3. Many restaurants, CVS stores close by which gave us many choices. 4. The Chancellor Hotel was quaint, very friendly staff & the restaurant in the hotel was excellent with the food & service. The whole stay we were treated as their guests & that is rare these days. When going to San Francisco for the first time I recommend the Alcatraz tour it was excellent. The hop on hop off bus is great but beware that all buses do not have a live person & they suck with out it. Before getting on a bus ask if the bus has the live person & if not it's worth waiting for the next bus especially going thru the city. They give you inside information that you wont get otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Top Dollar”
Reviews.Author: GreedyMessiah
Reviews.Content: Chronic jetlag isn't the best way to enter the towering hustle and bustle of Market St. San Francisco, and on arriving in Union Square, my first impressions weren't helped by my post flight (12 hours via London) state of mind. However, by Sunday, the magnificence of the city had been amplified by this wonderful charming hotel and its fantastic staff. There is also free passes to the excellent Square One gym on nearby Mason, the whole city of course is world class, and there is always something to do there. I also wish to compliment the fabulous restaurant staff, and the scrambled eggs are quite possibly the best in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: petarandreev
Reviews.Content: This stay was at the end of our 2 and a half week holiday in the US, great way to finish our holiday. The Hotel staff were outstanding, extremely helpful in all areas. They made you feel welcome, which was lovely. We had no issues with noise. All facets of this stay were outstanding, I would recommend the Hotel to anyone staying in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: redqueeg
Reviews.Content: Myself & my Daughter stayed for 5 nights and loved it, the free cookies & tea/coffee went down a storm with her :) staff were great, spoke with Rory a couple of times asking directions and how best to get to places, nothing was too much trouble. just across the way from union square, cable car stops almost outside the door, a few blocks up from powell st station... easy walk with a wheeled case. wallgreens few doors away incase you need anything, liquor store round the corner if you want a couple of beers to take back. Ate at Sears next door among other places and found the Steak amazing :) rooms spotlessly cleaned everyday (thank you room attendent enjoy the mintballs) if i went back to san francisco without any question this is where i would want to stay. thank you for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint & Charming”
Reviews.Author: rhoward160
Reviews.Content: We enjoy our stay every time. Centrally located, within walking distance from just about anything you decide to do. The staff is fabulous.....always friendly & always willing to go above & beyond to help out. This is a jewel in the middle of the city.....we are so glad we discovered it. What a treasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great, well maintained old fashioned charm”
Reviews.Author: Dragonfly2
Reviews.Content: My young adult son and I stayed here for one night at the end of my birthday weekend, early February. Though a bit more expensive than deals at other boutique hotels in Union Square, the very positive reviews and ratings intrigued me and made me curious. The Chancellor's friendly, helpful staff, cozy charm, and clean old fashioned rooms were perfect. Watched the Super Bowl at the cute hotel bar, with elegant Irish bartender and other guests (all men except for me). Late dinner delivered, free of charge, from a nearby restaurant. Perfect stay! So glad I chose the Chancellor, and look forward to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy hotel, ideal location”
Reviews.Author: MongoSchwartz
Reviews.Content: Somewhat accidentally found this hotel after searching my "regular" hotel on Union Square bumped their prices from my previous stay there. A quick search on tripadvisor yielded this superb, economical find. The rooms are small, reflective of an "older hotel," but well-appointed. The staff is extremely friendly and willing to assist as best they can--they even offer day/multi-day passes for the cable car/streetcar/bus lines which offers a tremendous value to travelers. Be aware, though, if you're looking for a late night bite, or a cocktail, the bar and smallish restaurant close early (around 9:30). But there are plenty of other walkable nearby options if the mood strikes you there. The "business center" such as it is, consists of a computer on a desk next to the reception desk. But it served my basic functional needs. So, in sum, The Chancellor is not luxurious (and is the reason I did not give it all five stars), but it is very comfortable, and almost quaint. And for my visit (early February 2012) very reasonably priced as well.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet sanctuary off of busy Union Square”
Reviews.Author: Jen C
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located right in the heart of Union Square, this charming little hotel was steps away from a myriad of restaurants, cafes, shopping options, and all methods of public transportation. The trolley stop is about 10 steps away -- passing right in front of the hotel, on Powell St.; and the BART (subway train) is less than a 5 minute walk. The staff -- from the front desk clerks, to the housekeeping, to the tour desk advisers, to the bartender -- were some of the friendliest people we encountered on our trip. And though the rooms were surprisingly small, the walls were thick and the room was quiet (other than the street noise, which was actually kind of soothing). Another fun perk: free coffee, cookies, and apples 24 hours a day down in the lobby!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location - perfect for the first time and repeat visitor”
Reviews.Author: Shona-Charlie
Reviews.Content: We are doing a round the world trip and staying in 5 hotels along the way. This was the lowest star rating but in fact from the moment I booked it until today (which is nearly 1 year on) this hotel has remained consistently as No 10 hotel in SF. Little wonder - it is in a perfect location so close to Union Square and with the cable car stop right outside. There has been lots said about the hotel before including small(ish) rooms, coffee in the lobby etc etc and it's all true so nothing I can add to that. For a first time (or repeat) visitor to the city this is a perfect hotel. We spoke with one member of staff who said that the owners have a policy of occupancy over rates and as a result the hotel is almost always full and they have never had to lay off staff. There are plenty bigger and more expensive chain hotels in the area and beyond but this hotel was a perfect base for us and we have thoroughly enjoyed our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “great place, great location”
Reviews.Author: Justin R
Reviews.Content: The staff was excellent. We were in our room less than 15 minutes after arriving at the hotel. We had a couple of drinks in the small lounge. We had two different bartenders. Both of them were very helpful. Told us cool places to go for food and drink. The room is small but very cozy. Plenty large enough for a couple on vacation. The bed was very comfortable. The room had a huge bathtub. Now my girlfriend wants one that size at home. Location is perfect for whatever you want to do in the city. We will definitely be going back to The Chancellor.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place”
Reviews.Author: Jayala1
Reviews.Content: The Chancellor was a wonderful hotel to stay at for many reasons. The people there were very friendly and helpful. The location, right near Union Square, was perfect for us. It's an older hotel and although it doesn't have all the amenities of a larger hotel (room service, gym), the small rooms were clean and very comfortable. The price was very reasonable, which included garage space for our car.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Union Square”
Reviews.Author: lena456
Reviews.Content: Cannot praise this hotel enough. Staff, Location, Rooms all excellent. The Tour desk was first class for information and booking trips and airport transfer etc. Spent 7 nights here and did something different every day. Right by Cable car stop. Was very sad to leave San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Nice comfy hotel”
Reviews.Author: castruml
Reviews.Content: We were not really familiar with the area but relied on some of the previous reviews. Most were spot on. My wife and I spent a long weekend at the Chancellor Hotel and were pleasantly surprised at being able to get just about anywhere within the city without having to depend on a car. We were able to get to where we wanted to go in the city using just about every mode of transportation within walking distance of this hotel. The room was small but clean, comfy and well maintained. Would have given it a better rating if the room was a bit larger. Everything in the hotel seemed undersized compared to some of the other hotels I have visited, but that's what gives this hotel it's character. Staff was knowledgeable and friendly. Was a plus to be able to buy tix for the cable car, trains, and buses from the lobby. Being downtown, and hopefully not sounding too insensitive, but be prepared to be hit up for change by the local hobos at least three times on every block. Overall we had a very positive experience and probably would stay here again on our next trip to SF.

Reviews.Title: “Best stay on the Square!”
Reviews.Author: James D
Reviews.Content: I have stayed all over Union Square, and this is a gem! Very quaint and friendly hotel. Rooms with high ceilings, nice bath and great beds. everyone cant stay in a room with a view, but if you can, its a must. The rooms here are much better than the very popular hotel down the street and better than the one across the street. Those hotels have bigger bars and restaurants, but there is something about staying at the Chancellor. You can always walk down the street to the other bar or restaurant. You even get a drink token per day with your stay here. Very nice ;) Only drawback is the spa and pool is at a remote place, used as a complimetary feature with health Club around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stansmum4420
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hotel on a tour of the west coast of USA. really nice central hotel. A 2 minute walk from the Tram turn. Stones throw from union square, Maceys and Bloomingdales. The breakfast at this hotel was great, lots of choice, plenty of food. I would strongly recommend the steak & eggs, they were lovely. The room was very nice not huge, just right. The bathroom was very clean and the bed was comfy. We felt the price was very very good. two very satisfied customers.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive”
Reviews.Author: celticolleen
Reviews.Content: I searched quite extensively to find a reasonably priced hotel in San Francisco. Finally decided on Chancellor. I was skeptical because the price was so reasonable, given its location. And I'm quite a picky person so I was prepared to be disappointed. The desk staff was wonderful! There was cucumber water, coffee, apples and cookies in the lobby at all times for guests. We paid the extra $6 a day for valet parking since the parking was already some of the cheapest in town. We went up the elevator to the 14th floor (I had requested a high room at the back as I am very sensitive to noise). We went into the room and was amazed to find that this was a suite! Bedroom, Living Room, and two FULL bathrooms!! The room was immaculately clean and tastefully decorated. The bathrooms had shampoo, conditioner, body lotion and rubber duckies!! The bed was comfortable, there was a small walk in closet, there were extra pillows and blankets in the closet. Small refrigerator, coffee maker in a little kitchen area. Desk in the living room. And a chair and table in the bedroom. Lots of drawers for putting stuff away. And a TV in each room. This meant my husband could watch TV in the living room whilst I read in the bedroom. And the location was right across the street from the St Francis and Sax Fifth. There was a Starbucks at the corner so we could grab breakfast. Union Square at the corner. Cable car runs right out front! I could still hear the cable cars but not very much. Earplugs were able to bring complete silence. This will be my home away from home in San Francisco from now on!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel - room could be noisy”
Reviews.Author: sun20
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location; the room is adequately sized; the facilities have been updated and the rooms have a fresh coat of paint; the people are very friendly and helpful. The only issue I have with this hotel is its thin wall. If you have a noisy neighbor, you can hear every conversation. Several people congregated at a room next to me in later evenings. One night pass the mid night I had to call the front desk to complain. High floors have less street noise; but the shower water tends to be small at high floors.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: f00dmama
Reviews.Content: A great small hotel right in the centre of union square, close to all the great shops ,trams running past outside.I have never been to a hotel before which has a pillow menu or umbrellas in the rooms.the staff were exceptional here as we had to organise faxs and so helpful,wonderful free cookies and coffee in the mornings,great value for money,will have to come back

Reviews.Title: “A True Gem! San Francisco Charm... WOW!”
Reviews.Author: VivianMc
Reviews.Content: I had the unique experience of staying at the Chancellor Hotel in San Francisco, California. All I can say is WOW! I was sent to San Francisco for training. I am not a traveler. I rarely leave home without my husband. SO it was quite a surprise to me when my Boss said I would be going away (by myself) for two weeks, possibly 16 weeks I know nothing about big City living and I was scared. I went to The Chancellor's website to see what was available. There was a link to contact the manager so I did. I mentioned that I would be in the City alone and that I was afraid. When I checked in I got a big surprise as I was upgraded to a SUITE on the 15th floor! The Room was beautifully charming. It is not a brand new hotel but a cozy and historic building from around 1914. The bed was comfortable. The pillows were wonderful. They even have a pillow menu where you can order up what ever type of pillow you are used to sleeping with!! Rooms are very clean and updated with new and trendy furniture. The bathroom has a very deep bath tub which was perfect for taking hot baths after a long days work. Shampoo, conditioner, lotion, cotton balls and even Q-tips are provided. For my second week at the hotel (I went home on the weekend) I did not have the SUITE.. However, I was given a room on the 15th floor that was equally as cozy and comfortable. Since I was staying for 5 days and wanted to have cold waters, I called down to the front desk and asked if they had a refrigerator that they could bring to me. They brought it up right away! Both rooms that I stayed in had a beautiful view of Union Square. I felt safe to walk around this area. This Hotel is in the Heart of things. You can easily catch a taxi or any other public transportation by just stepping outside of the building. The Staff was extremely friendly. The facility was very clean. The elevators were fast. The bar is small but I had a great time talking to other hotel guests and the Awesome Bartender named Alicia. She made me feel comfortable and even gave recommendations on things to do in San Fran as well as places to eat if I had craving for certain foods. They even have a plug underneath the bar to plug in your phone :) I thought that was cool!! Oh, there was a walk-in closet in both of my rooms. In the closet there was a safe where I kept personal items. Lastly I want to say that this hotel is VERY AFFORDABLE! I will be returning to San Francisco and when I do... I will be staying here at The Chancellor! If you want to experience the charm of San Francisco, you will stay here....

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: martin_ebdon
Reviews.Content: Trying to find a hotel for our stay in San Francisco was a nightmare, I finally settled on the Chancellor Hotel, it was a good choice, it’s a little old fashioned and that gives it character, service was good, rooms clean. Here’s a tip, breakfast time the hotel provides coffee, tea and lovely soft cookies FOC in reception, that really helped get the day started. Location wise its right on Powell Street, walk to the bottom of the hill and you can get the tram to the piers, the tram does stop right outside the hotel, but you’ll be lucky if you can get on there with a family. Again, down the hill is Macys store with its roof top cheese cake restaurant/café which we visited twice LOL. The start of China Town is just up the hill to the right on California Street. There are a couple of eateries nearby on Powell Street, a couple of independents and two Lories Diner’s one up the hill, one down the hill, all were fine. When it came time to pick up our hire car, I’d pre arranged pick up one block away at the National garage on Bush Street. All in all it couldn’t have worked better and I’d stay at the Chancellor again without a moment hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Getaway”
Reviews.Author: leafygirl
Reviews.Content: The room was great--We were upgraded to a better room (at no charge). The rooms do not come with a fridge--but just ask! They were more then happy to get one for you. Huge bathtub and yes---there was a rubber ducky. Great value and location. A little noisy on the Union Square side. Jack hammers at 7 am sharp. :)

Reviews.Title: “Cozy place with great service and super location”
Reviews.Author: ChaiPure
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband on a recent weekend getaway. It's a small place, only about six or so rooms on a floor, and the rooms are small but user-friendly and comfortable. We never had to wait more than a minute for the elevator. The people at the bar and downstairs restaurant and very accommodating and the restaurant is good value compared to other places around there. Their eggs Benedict was supposed to be the house special, but because I'm a vegetarian the waiter offered to make it Florentine and very tasty it was! The bar also has a decent happy hour. The only drawback was our room didn't have a very good view -- maybe a room higher up (we were on the 6th floor) and/or maybe facing Union Square (but then you might have more noise). And it didn't have a fridge. The location is superlative, half a block from Union Sq., the Powell/Hyde cable car goes right past, and a lot of great restaurants and watering holes are within walking distance. One day we walked all the way to Pier One of the Embarcadero and then along the waterfront up to the Powell/Hyde cablecar for the ride back. A long walk but lots of fun. It was very brisk weather while we were there so we appreciated being able to duck out of the hotel and to have a choice of places to go within a three-block radius. While you're there check out the little concierge/gift stand in the lobby. Some very eclectic pieces there and some bargains -- I think the salesperson's mom collects stuff and then sells it through that place. I'd definitely stay here again, and the price was very reasonable given the quality, amenities and location.

Reviews.Title: “Another perfect stay at the Chancellor Hotel”
Reviews.Author: London.dreaming
Reviews.Content: We have had many lovely weekends in San Francisco - the Chancellor Hotel seems like home away from home. It has been said before but worth repeating....the hotel is friendly, safe, perfect location, and most of all....clean, clean, clean.
