Beds are comfy and for warmish evenings, the ceiling fan is quiet and efficient - keeps the room comfortable. If you have questions...the manager is most receptive and answers promptly. We love this hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “In the Heart of SF”
Reviews.Author: laudette
Reviews.Content: My daughter an I had a fun weekend in SF and this hotel was part of our memorable experience. The staff is so friendly and accommodating. The room while small had so much character and the bed was great along with the best pillows-even a body pillow was available. The complementary teas and coffee along with the cookies and apples made this place feel like home! And of course you are in the middle of everything.

Reviews.Title: “What a awesome week”
Reviews.Author: Rocky49009
Reviews.Content: If you want a great place to stay that is close to everything and transportation too. This is the charmer.. Its a little on the dated side, but...... There is 7 different pillows to chose from at no cost. The staff was outta this world friendly and helpful. The beds were great. The only thing I didn't care for was there was no fan in the restroom but other then that its 8 fingers and 2 thumbs up. Price was great to.. We purchased it on line. They take AAA. If you really want to save money to travel all over purchase a City Pass for 69 buck it also includes you to get into some of the attactions that you would have to pay seperate for.. Have fun!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “SF in January”
Reviews.Author: Paul D
Reviews.Content: This is a great small hotel on Union Square that my wife and I have been coming to yearly for the past few years. It is nice to see the save faces of the staff year after year,

Reviews.Title: “Great location but narrow beds”
Reviews.Author: SunnySis60
Reviews.Content: Stayed here to attend a workshop. Flew in to SFO and had easy BART to Union Station and short walk up Jill to hotel. Loved looking down on street cars and traffic and listened to a most excellent trumpet player in the Square for several hours. Awesome. Food was good and plentiful at restaurant. But I am used to a bigger bed than a twin size.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: simmyseal
Reviews.Content: The Chancellor is an amazing, lovely botique hotel with smallish(who cares..part of the charm,Perfect for couples) rooms that are clean and the bed and pillows are so comfy..just what you need after a big day sightseeing in SF. Many thanks to Wes Tyler and his staff. Special mention to Matt on front desk for his help with the internet station. Great location with so much to see and do right on your doorstep. We will be back and YES we would choose the Chancellor again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Ruwise77
Reviews.Content: We were here last year and I kept meaning to do a review and never got round to it. Watching a film about San Francisco reminded me that I must do this. Firstly before I even arrived The Chancellor had given me a great first impression as we ha booked our holiday for Fleet week without even knowing what it was and were surprised at how expensive the hotels were. Somebody suggested contacting The Chancellor to see if they had any offers or could do a special rate and they obliged. The room was very charming with nice touches like a rubber duck. It is also a fantastic location. However it was the warmth and friendliness of the staff that we most appreciated. We were there when the Giants were in the playoff's for the world series. My husband has always said he didn't like baseball but is a sports nut and so was interested in why the whole of SF seemed to be buzzing. We sat in the hotel bar 1 night to watch one of the games and the bellboy spent the night explaining all the rules to him. We left SF with a Giants baseball cap and my husband is now a baseball fan for life.

Reviews.Title: “Your best choice for this price”
Reviews.Author: wayne234
Reviews.Content: Overall a great place to stay, location, service, accommodation. Everything you need! I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely my choice for when I return to SF”
Reviews.Author: TravellingLili
Reviews.Content: The Chancellor Hotel has a perfect location, as other reviewers have pointed out. They are right! A few steps from Union Square and the tram stop and just a couple of blocks from the Metro Station . The Hotel staff is nice and helpful, the rooms are small, but comfortable. I found the bed and pillows to be wonderful too. It would be amazing if it had a continental breakfast included in the rate, but even with no breakfast, I believe the value/price relation is very good, just because of the location. They do have cookies in the front desk everyday and a complimentary hot drinks station. There are also coffee shops and restaurants very close by . Will definitely stay again at the Chancellor when I return to SF.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Tzigane15
Reviews.Content: Absolutely perfect location....near to Union Square and also right next to a Tram stop. Cute, characterful room....little on the small side but I was fully expecting this and the room had all the key amenities. Lady on reception the day we checked out was charmless and blunt with me and lacked the friendliness of the lady who checked us in, but I'm from the UK so I'm more than used to this kind of customer services and I was amused rather than annoyed by her (not so sure that someone of a more sensitive disposition would have been as generous as me tho!!). Would definitely recommend the hotel despite this one-off tiny complaint!

Reviews.Title: “OK if it's all you can get.”
Reviews.Author: Happywalkabout
Reviews.Content: It's OK. No fridge, very tiny, pokey rooms. But if it's all that's available you can get by - it is at least clean and good location. We booked a twin room, we got to the hotel early and were told to come back as the room wasn't ready. When we came back but were given a king bed and told it was the last room left, despite having been sent away earlier. They then charged us for an extra cot. That's just not cool - but that's San Fran accommodation for you and I've learnt to not expect much better.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic deal on Union Sq”
Reviews.Author: skm22
Reviews.Content: If you're looking to stay in the heart of San Francisco (across the street from Saks 5th Ave) and want to pay a fraction for what the Westin (next door) will charge you .. then this is the hotel. Free internet, clean/cozy rooms, great service. Cant say enough about the location - Bank of America ATM right next to the main entrance, Walgreens on the same street, multiple car rentals companies at walking distance. Step outside and you're at the door to all the nice shopping places... In terms of the room itself .. our window overlooked union sq from the 15th flr so we had an amazing view though there is a ladder thing spoiling the view (didn't really care too much though). Each room comes with a portable heater and safe. They even threw in an umbrella in case you need one! Room service is quick/efficient and staff were polite. Ive stayed at many 5 stars but this 3 star hotel was one of my better stays.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay!”
Reviews.Author: AimerL
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chancellor Hotel for 4 nights in late November and our stay was great. We arrived around 11PM on our first night and check-in was very smooth. Our room was on the top floor, very clean, and decorated very tastefully. The bathroom was small, but more than adequate, and the complimentary bath products were very nice. The hotel was in a beautiful historic building with a lot of character. We were in San Francisco to celebrate my birthday and hotel had a complimentary bottle of wine waiting for us in our room. It was such a nice treat! The 24 hour coffee and tea, cookies, and apples were a very nice touch. The pillow menu was also amazing--it was fun trying out different types of pillows. We did eat breakfast at the hotel one day and it was our favorite breakfast in San Francisco (even better than Sears Fine Food in our opinion). Service was great. The location made it very easy to walk or take the Cable Cars around the city, and the hotel is only a few blocks from the BART station. We will definitely stay at the Chancellor again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Junit1988
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay here for 2 nights Great location easy to walk to everything. Great tour desk man helped us with so many requests even when they had nothing to do with tours! Front Desk where nice. Onething that wasn't great was no room service dinner on Sunday's - Wednesday but not a huge issue as plenty of dining around. Rooms are small but very nice had no problems at all, I didn't know the bathrooms where 'old' when I booked but didnt have any problems with it when I walked in, who spends their time in their room toilet anyway???

Reviews.Title: “Gracious Elegance & Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: alleycat76
Reviews.Content: I stumbled upon this hotel while searching for accommodations for a few of the Executive VP’s from my company. Choices were slim because of 2 very big conferences going on in SF and since one of the VP’s was a presenter, they needed to be within walking distance of the conference venues; which were right around Union Square. I usually put these guys in a Starwood hotel; however, that chain was completely booked; as were all of the other major hotels in the vicinity. I narrowed the choices down to a few hotels I hadn’t heard of before, and checked the reviews on this site. The deciding factor was based on the fact that the manager, Wes Tyler, took the time to respond to the comments (both positive and negative) and also gave his direct contact info. & suggested getting in touch w/him if guests had any issues or concerns. I thought that was pretty outstanding & decided to test it out. Emailed him, let him know I was booking some Exec’s there for the first time and asked him if he could please help to make their stay as comfortable and pleasant as possible. He responded quickly and assured me he would make every effort to do so. And he did just that! They all came back and said their stay was great, absoultely no complaints, location was perfect, staff was gracious and the hotel was very charming. Thank you to Wes and the entire staff at the Chancellor Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Remarkable in every way”
Reviews.Author: Guy_North_Of_Hope
Reviews.Content: Our three night stay was perfect. Thanks for having the gym facilites near by as part of the package. With everything so close by (good food, a nice variety of bars, live music and the waterfront a short walk away), we can not imagine a better palce to stay in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal in many ways”
Reviews.Author: AnitaLovesTravel
Reviews.Content: We loved our 2-night stay in this hotel. Our reservation was complicated (involving a total of 8 travelers in 4 rooms with various rates) but Darla, the reservations agent, sorted out everything with grace and ease, creating a stress-free experience. The hotel was comfortable and the rooms had a European feel (small but well appointed), and the location couldn't have been more convenient. I would definitely stay here again. Also: We loved the pillow menu, and "sampled" several of the different options. It was great!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic choice”
Reviews.Author: bcm9114
Reviews.Content: Four day stay at Chancellor was wonderful. We love small boutique hotels and this one really fits the bill. Very well maintained, clean, with friendly, helpful staff in the best location. Convenient to cable cars, busses, etc. We used the valet parking and were glad we did. Allow 20-30 minutes for car delivery. Good coffee and cookies and fruit all day in the lobby. Our room was on 12th floor back corner so there wasn't much of a view but we weren't there for the view. A front room would have a great view toward Union Square but might be noisier. Our room was completely quiet. Small, cozy rooms with tiny bath but very well cared for and clean. We would certainly choose this hotel again. We skipped the touristy Sears Fine Foods but it is right next door for those who want to wait in line for breakfast. The hotel breakfast was very good and we took advantage of an offer to purchase a $20.00 coupon for food or drinks for just $10.00. With that, a nice breakfast for two cost only $10.00 plus appropriate tip. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect situation”
Reviews.Author: CazB45
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very comfortable and has all the amenities I would expect. It is situated in a perfect position, the trolley cars pass right at the front door and for a small fee you can buy a three day pass and they'll take you wherever you want to go. Union Square is only about half a block away. We found most things very close by or within very easy reach.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Laurence_and_Trudi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chancellor Hotel for 3 nights in January 2012. The Chancellor is a really nice "cute" hotel, with an excellent location, right across the road from Union Square on Powell Street (a great street with lots of shops, and the Cable Cars going up and down all day!). The rooms are really nice; quite small, but with a quaint and cute feel. Very comfortable bed, with a pillow menu of a full range of different pillows to try! There is a bar and restaurant in the hotel, but we didnt try these as there are so many options all around you on Powell Street. There is a Lories Diner a few doors down for a great breakfast! So, the Chancellor is a good value, nice clean hotel, with an excellent location. We'd stay here again, and we'd recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: charlottedallmer
Reviews.Content: Good attention to detail sets this hotel apart from others in the mid-price range.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: irishgirlie2010
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on the basis of reviews I had read and was a little nervous as we had never been to SF before and I was worried about location, and some reviews people had left following my booking about hotel being old etc... But I have to say this was a great hotel experience for both my husband and I and I really don't know why some people seemed to comment negatively. This hotel is charging 3.5 star prices with 4.5 star cleanliness, staff, location. We had our iPad with us during our stay at beginning of January and used it all the time no Internet problems (we stayed 6 nights). The location is fantastic, right in heart of downtown, across from union square. We took the Bart in from SFO and the stop was right at bottom of powell street. Perfect. The only slight slight flaw was no fridge, but I can live with that. They had ice so we just filled ice bucket and put our water/juice in here. Well done Chancellor Hotel. I've already recommended you twice this week.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay in the middle of San Fran”
Reviews.Author: Emma071
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with 3 girlfriends for 4 nights in January. It was a great base for seeing the city. There is a Walgreens just up on the corner, the cable car stops out the front and the hop on hop off bus leaves just down the road. The tour desk in the hotel was very helpful. The rooms are small but modern and well equipped. I would come back again. Ps the candy jar in the rooms is super cute!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, would recommend without hesitation”
Reviews.Author: Larysa23
Reviews.Content: I had booked a road trip across Arizona, Nevada and California and this hotel was recommended to me by a friend from work as the perfect way to regain some comfort into my life after a week of roughing it. She was definitely right. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. I had been in contact with the hotel reservation desk prior to my visit and they answered all my questions without any hesitation and during my visit all the staff throughout the hotel were very pleasant and accommodating.The room itself was very welcoming, clean and comfortable and the little touches like the bowl of sweets and the little rubber duck both made me smile. The hotel is perfectly centrally situated for a visit to San Francisco. I would not hesitate to book this hotel again and would recommend it to anyone planning a visit to SF, especially if you're not so keen on the large, commercial hotel chains.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: RichandCarmen
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in a great location. I only gave it a 4 star as it does not have an airconditioner this wasn't an issue at the time of year we were there. The room was a little small but clean and in a great location just walking distance to shop, restaurants and you have the cable car stop out the front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location and price point is great, BUT.......Not a hotel if you need real internet”
Reviews.Author: tman12
Reviews.Content: I agree with every other review about location....couldn't be better and price is good. Here is the good... Staff is friendly and helpful; breakfast price is reasonable for a hotel and was good; free coffee,tea and cookies; hotel is relatively clean; complimentary use of gym around the corner (they don't appear to advertise this, but if you ask, they will tell; good bed with nice sheets. Now of the not so good....Internet is free but not adequate to run skype, hotel knows this and says that is why don't charge for it; you have controls for heat in the room,but they don't control the heat, you need to use a portable heater, which they provide. They told me the hotel runs on a boiler and only comes on when hotel is cold (the hallway is warm and my room is cold, so there is heat somewhere); the hotel is old and looks old...old electrical outlets, layers of paint over old stucco walls, old doors. To be fair, you get what you pay for and they deliver what you pay for. I am writing this review in the lobby, because the Internet is way too slow in room.

Reviews.Title: “A san Francisco gem”
Reviews.Author: Maureen N
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel, good value for money and generously gives you the extras: free WiFi, complmentary tea, coffee, fruit and cookies all day, a range of newspapers to read, lollies in the rooms and cheap drinks every evening during happy hour. It is in an excellent location and I would highly recommend it to anyone spending a few days in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, reliably good and always improving”
Reviews.Author: Theos_leftluggage
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in a newly renovated queen room at the Chancellor for 3 nights in August 2011. Due to a busy travel schedule I am only now getting around to writing a review. Our room was small but well-designed and comfortable, with 2 easy chairs as well as the bed and desk. It was very clean. We have stayed here on multiple occasions over about 15 years, and are always impressed with the pleasantness and attentiveness of the reception staff, and the very good upkeep of the hotel. It is also nice that there is a cafe in the lobby and and always a bowl of apples in the lobby. There are newer and fancier places to stay in San Francisco, but the location could not be better, and the reliability of this hotel counts for a lot! Also, very few hotels have 2 comfortable chairs in guestrooms, and one person has to sit on the bed---not the case here!,

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room in great location”
Reviews.Author: Snurful
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable large bed with modern touches in an older character hotel with deep bathtub and spacious closet. Great shopping for many blocks around the hotel and central for visiting other sights. I was able to take the Bart from the airport easily with a short uphill walk. I would recommend this hotel. Actual date travelled - July 2010.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and an ideal hotel for exploring the city”
Reviews.Author: NicolaandChris
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of May and found it a great place for exploring San Fran. It's right on the tram line that goes down to the bay and it's close to restaurants and bars in the union square area. The rooms were smallish but clean and had everything we needed. Loved the pillow menu and the infamous bath duck!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy environment but it got better...”
Reviews.Author: fantasia112
Reviews.Content: Very noisy work in next door building. We got moved from 9th floor to 14th floor within minutes. Got upgraded to a suite in the process. Very professional handling of the situation. We had a good night of sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, excellently located with good sized rooms”
Reviews.Author: Taylor B
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean, of generous proportions and well stocked with hotel amenities. The personalised rubber ducks were a quirky touch, and good for a souvenir upon returning home. Staff were generally helpful, although seemed as if they were preoccupied in some instances. Sometimes staff were caught leaning or playing on mobile phones when guests were seemingly requiring service. The fresh fruit and cookies in the lobby each day were appreciated and make a good morning or afternoon snack. The location of the Chancellor is excellent - right in the heart of Union Square, only 1.6 miles down to fisherman's wharf and a stones throw away from Macy's, Bloomingdale's, Saks's and Nordstrom for any shopping requirements. Just over the hill from this hotel is Chinatown - this precinct is well worth the visit, where cheap eats, interesting shops and traditional culture still abound. Requesting a room at the rear of the hotel is worth it if you are a light sleeper. Additionally, the mattresses are of a good quality, and coupled with the extensive pillow menu, one should get a good sleep in any of the Chancellors room. In all, the price of this hotel, its central location and reasonably attentive staff make this hotel excellent for both families and the business traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Best location possible, great value”
Reviews.Author: Roberto M
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in early 2011. It was a great experience, the rooms were clean, adequate and refurbished. The best thing about this hotel is the location, about 30 meter from Union Square (The hottest tourist spot in SF). For the price you pay I can't think of a better deal.

Reviews.Title: “The Chancellor”
Reviews.Author: Anne33388
Reviews.Content: Wonderful staff, clean room and a great location. It is not a quiet location but, it is where the action is happening. So you have to weigh your pros and cons. For us it was perfect. Not for families.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: pjbfilm
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here serveral times. For location and value, it is the best in the city. Service is outstanding. Rooms are always clean and nice. Coffee and Cookies all day long.... just the best....

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay In SF”
Reviews.Author: Redlands_CAFoodie
Reviews.Content: Went for New Year's weekend and had a great experience. is this a small hotel with small rooms? Yes. But, the location, price and friendly staff make it a fun place to stay. It has the feel of a European hotel with very personal service. The concern voiced in a previous review about interior noise was not an issue for us. However, I have had the same problem in 4-star hotels so it is not unique to the Chancellor. Taken together, this is a great little hotel that makes a visit to San Francisco quite memorable and I can't wait to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great New Years”
Reviews.Author: redlandsSoCal
Reviews.Content: First time at the Chancellor Hotel. Great location! Excellent friendly staff. Comfortable affordable and right in the heart of the city. We went with friends and had an great experience. We go to the city often and will use this as our new "go to hotel."

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel in the perfect location!!”
Reviews.Author: FMBChicago
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a unique place to stay in SF this is definitely the place to go! My fiance and I stayed here for the weekend to celebrate his birthday and we couldn't have asked for more special attention. I contacted the hotel manager, Wes a few weeks before to arrange a few surprises for my fiance. They took care of every detail, which helped to make it his best birthday ever! The location of the hotel is great too. You are right in the middle of everything. Parking was easy and we were right next to the cable car stop. Forget about staying at nearby chain hotels, the Chancellor is definitely the way to go. Thanks again Wes!!!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected, cheaper than expected of a Union Square location!”
Reviews.Author: Rybas
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised that you can stay in a nice hotel in this price range right in the center of SF. My room was small but adequate, the view from the window quite breathtaking, the breakfast was fine. All in all, a good place to stay for a budget-mindful tourist.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: denyse86
Reviews.Content: The title says it all..... you really cant beat the location of this hotel, it is in the centre of all the action and right by the tram stop. On first impressions I was really disappointed with the hotel, the rooms are very small as is the bar, but I very quickly warmed to its querky nature and weighed up the fact that for the price we paid, the hotel was very good. We were on a high floor overlooking union square which was lovely and quiet. The bell boy was very very helpful not only in bringing our luggage promptly to our room but also spending a long time with us looking at a map and giving us advice on restaurants and bars. He was also very helpful in recommending where we should NOT go, especially at night time. The beds at The Chancellor were super comfy and we really appreciated the complimentary coffee and cookies in the foyer everyday. The front desk staff were also exceptionally helpful when we encountered a problem with a tour that we had booked to Napa valley. There is a huge variety of places to eat in San Francisco we tried Johns Steakhouse for AMAZING steak, The Stinky Rose (which is a tourist trap and seriously over rated), and B44 which was fantastic for paella and spanish style food and lovely wine. If you are looking for a clean, homely place to stay that is simple and not flashy then this is a good option. Just beware there is no air con, we stayed in October and were fine but not sure that it would have been quite so good in the heat!

Reviews.Title: “Great 1 Night Stay”
Reviews.Author: jam536
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 1 night for the 49ers vs. Steelers game. Great downtown location, awesome price, and friendly staff. Nothing too special but served the purpose we needed. Would definitely stay here again, if I would need a downtown hotel. The valet was a little confusing but once we figured it out, it worked great.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem”
Reviews.Author: JudyGSanDiegoCA
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel by other reviews. I was a little worried but no need to be. We have stayed in alot of high end hotels & the Chancellor is a very nice boutique hotel. The room is small but it has all you need. The bed is so comfortable & they have great pillows. I always have a problem with hotel pillows as they seem to never be soft & comfortable but theirs are. The real bonus is the ceiling fan. We have a ceiling fan at home & always miss it when traveling. This is one of the only hotels we've stayed in with one. The location is great - a couple blocks from all the shopping at Union Square. It is right on the cable car line to get to Fisherman's Wharf. Also, Starbucks is right across the street. The Chancellor is a very good deal for the price. Staff is very courteous & helpful. We will definitely stay here when we return to SF.

Reviews.Title: “Cherry Choice the Chancellor Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bdbc
Reviews.Content: First rate stay at the Chancellor Dec.21-22. Arrived early afternoon and unloaded our bags right in front in their load zone. Bellman very friendly and helpful. Front desk staff very nice and prompt. Held our bags, room wasn't quite ready. We received a free upgrade to a fabulous suite 1502. Warm colors living room, full bath spotless, coffee and refrig. area nice plus. Seperate large bedroom, wonderful queen featherbed/pillows, full bath. Glorious view of Union Square Christmas tree, ice skating rink, decorated Macy's. Fresh coffee and warm bake cookies everyday in the lobby nice touch. Location is fantastic. Will definitely stay at the Chancellor again.

Reviews.Title: “Chancellor: Excellent Holiday getaway”
Reviews.Author: nwebb
Reviews.Content: A trip across the bay to San Francisco, Christmas/Chanukah getaway on Union Square seemed like the thing to do. After studying many hotels on tripadvisor, I picked the Chancellor Hotel, for location, price and quality. It met all my needs, including walking distance from BART. Arrived at 3, had a pleasant evening in town, and we were home by the same time next day. The staff were welcoming and friendly, they gave me my preferred room, top floor rear (decided on because of the noise reported by others) and the room was small but charming. The bed was very comfortable, and there was a pillow menu which we didn't take advantage of. The room did have a slight smell, cleaning fluid? The windows were open, and the smell wasn't too bad; my husband didn't even notice. If it had bothered me I would have asked for another room. Open windows were a plus since we don't like it too warm at night. Loved the green accent wall, the rubber ducky in the bathroom and very nice shampoo/conditioner/lotion (organic no less). Loved the bar and bartender Rory, where we took advantage of a two-for-one coupon and happy hour to have a relaxing drink - Rory was very friendly. Hotel is 1/2 block from Union Square, which was alive with people, ice skaters, music, performers, a giant Christmas tree and the lighting of the first Chanukah candle on a giant menorah. The shops were decorated, Macy's had a wreath in every window. We walked all over. In the morning, Sears Fine Food is just up the block, a famous breakfast somehow I've never sampled. We decided to try that instead of using the 20% off coupon for Luques, found on the hotel website. Luques looked good too, next year maybe we'll try that. Great place for a mini-mini vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: dan P
Reviews.Content: Excellent value & location! Bellman was terrific at arrival with great, successful dinner tips.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: Pati-chueca
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel, very well located in Union Square, great to go shopping and eating. The rooms are clean, the staff is really polite, in general a good experience. The hotel doesnt have a parking, so you have to first park in front unload your luggage and leave it with the bell boy at reception or bring it already to your room and then go and park the car. The garage is a public one that also serves the hotel, and is like a block away, so this might be a problem for some people, for us it was ok. The rooms are tiny, really little, and as we had lots of luggage, that wasnt optimal, but we managed. The hotel is not new, but well kept and clean. The hotel also doesnt have a restaurant, there is a restaurant there but doesnt belong to the hotel, so if you want, you can have breakfast there and they even will charge it to the room, but is a separate business. I will not recommend it though, because we had breakfast there twice and you have to wait FOREVER to get your food. So if you are staying here, I would recomend you to go the Cafe du Paris that is very close (great breakfast) or next door, there is a great place, a little expensive, but with a wide range of options, very nice food and efficient service. All in all a good place to stay in San Francisco, not so expensive and central.

Reviews.Title: “Decent But Not Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: ColinTheGreat
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Chancellor for several nights in mid-December 2011. The hotel is definitely nice and it's in a good location, but I don't think it's spectacular in any way. That is to say, nothing really stood out as being above average. The staff was helpful, the Internet connection was slow, the room was clean. I didn't eat at the hotel's restaurant because the menu was decidedly unimpressive. I'd stay there again but I'm going to check out some of the many other hotels in the neighborhood before I do.

Reviews.Title: “I keep coming back”
Reviews.Author: Jeff D
Reviews.Content: I keep wanting to try a different hotel in The City to try a different experience, but I keep coming back to The Chancellor Hotel for its friendly atmosphere, great location and excellent value. The Luques restaurant is convenient for breakfast or lunch, and there is a cordial atmosphere in the lobby bar. The friendly staff can't be beat for a relaxed hotel stay, and the added amenities are great (such as the pillow menu).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: ThePassionateShopper
Reviews.Content: Booked this due to recommendations online. Our first stop on a 4 week US trip, it was fantastically located right near union square. Lack of service from staff, but I guess that is expected with its rating - however we arrived from airport early at 11am & without even asking our room was available immediately, very appreciated after the long flight from Sydney. Our room was very clean & well maintained & I love the green colour theme they use! Bathroom was spotless & the rubber duck was very cute. We had a view out of our window of the alley I think but could also see Union Square Park & Macys. Although the room was on the small side there was a huge walk in wardrobe where we stored our luggage - this made a big difference in terms of room space! Room was cleaned daily. Others have commented about the lack of air conditioning, San Fran was unseasonally warm in the days we were there, but we slept with the windows open & were surprised how quiet the city was! Also walked down to Fishermans Wharf from here - never felt unsafe at night! Being across the road from saks was handy as could drop our purchases back before heading to other stores. Free wifi was much appreciated & although there was no tea/coffee facilities in the room, they were always available complimentary in the lobby bar. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't just listen to the hype about the Chancellor!”
Reviews.Author: connieamethyst
Reviews.Content: Take advantage of the hype! You'll be proud of yourself for being so smart. Friendly, smiling and helpful staff throughout the whole hotel - Voula, Olga, JeSara, Rory, Karla, Harris, Alicia at the bar, Mao in the restaurant, as well as our housekeeper, and the engineer who got the heat going nicely in our room. We hadn't been to San Francisco in 2 years, but Rory and Alicia remembered us! The rooms are beautiful with very comfortable beds and pillows, flat screen tv's, roomy closet with a safe, and an umbrella to borrow in the case of rain. Bath salts are provided for soaking in the huge bathtub after a day of enjoying the greatness of San Francisco. I'm kicking myself for forgetting to bring home my rubber ducky from the bathroom to commemorate my birthday trip and great stay! The lobby is cozy, with delicious cookies and coffee available throughout the day. We had breakfast at Luques twice, and it was very good. Our waiter Mao used to live in my hometown - small, small world. We had an especially good time with him. This location is absolutely excellent. Cable car a few steps from the front door. Great shopping in Union Square a few steps. 24 hour Walgreen's a few steps. Chinatown just 3 or 4 blocks. At the tour counter in the lobby, be sure to get your Muni pass for unlimited rides on the city's great transportation system including cable cars, buses, and streetcars. Great bus routes and the F-line streetcar are quite convenient to the hotel. An e-mail to the wonderful Mr. Wes Tyler prior to my birthday visit last week resulted in an unexpected upgrade to a 2-room suite on the top floor, with a view of Union Square, as well as welcoming gifts in the room - a birthday card, a picture frame, champagne and flutes. So thoughtful. So gracious. Wow and double wow. San Francisco is wonderful, and I look forward to many more visits. I use the word great many times in this review. This hotel, the city and its people deserve all the "greats" I give to them. And I'm so grateful to tripadvisor and fellow travelers for helping me to find this gem of a hotel. If a clean, cozy, charming older building with beautiful rooms, modern amenities, dedication to service and a great location appeals to you, you're home here. It's 5 stars in our book. I won't consider staying anywhere else in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Better than ever”
Reviews.Author: lizone
Reviews.Content: Well, I'm back again and this place just keeps getting better each time. The lobby has been refurbished since I was here last . A new look but the same wonderful service from everyone I encountered. We requested the same room as our last visit and that was arranged and also requested a fridge in the room and that was waiting for us as well along with a nice welcome gift. Took advantage of the pillow menu and the bed was just right. Spent one day walking absolutely everywhere and a soak in the very deep bath tub was just what I needed. Once again we ate breakfast in the restaurant each day and loved it. This place is perfectly located and is really good value. Looking forward to our next stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in an amazing location.”
Reviews.Author: MOTAtascadero
Reviews.Content: Our family of four really loved this hotel. We chose adjoining rooms, one with a queen bed for us and the other with twin beds for our girls. What a perfect arrangement. The rooms were smaller than we are used to, but they were totally fine....especially for the amount of time you spend in the room. The bathrooms were small, so there really was no room for two people to be using the sink/mirror at the same time like in other hotels. Not really a big deal for us. We were in rooms 1200 and 1201 and had great views of Union Square. My girls and I loved hearing the city noises, but my husband was bothered by it a bit. All of the staff was great, especially Jesara at the front desk who helped me a ton with reservations, etc. We requested a fridge in our room and it was there in record time. The valet parking worked well, as long as you remembered to request your car 25 minutes or so in advance. The only complaint was trying to find the right temperature for the rooms. It was often cold and hard to get to warm up with the wall thermostat. We did use the inroom portable heaters, but they made the room too hot. Again, not that big of a deal, but it was a bit of an issue. I would stay here again and again and again. We went in early December 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in central San Fran”
Reviews.Author: Ads_and_Wennie
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights in December and cant fault the place. Great location for shopping, central to everything and getting transport, however we did spend more time out of this area in fishermans wharf, bridge area etc. A refrigerator would have been nice. Complimentary coffee and cookies were a nice touch, and all staff very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Still a Fan of the Chancellor Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Mailgirl
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying at the Chancellor Hotel. I was just as happy with my time here on this trip as I was before. Since this was a longer stay, I had a chance to take advantage of the hotel bar and restaurant. I had breakfast at Luque's twice and the service was prompt and the prices reasonable. It's nice to not have to look for a place to eat before heading out for the day. It's also nice to be able to hit Happy Hour at your own hotel before heading to a show. While it's not a large hotel, it gives you more of that feeling of going back to your own apartment at the end of the day than that sterile feeling you sometimes get from a larger property. It's not unusual for me to get tired of a hotel after a few days, but that did not happen at the Chancellor. It's in a perfect location when you are using public transportation to get around. Same as last time, all the employees I came in contact with were friendly and helpful. I asked for a refrigerator this time and it was very handy to have. It was brought up to the room as soon as I checked in and I didn't have to wait around. Everything in the room worked and my room location on the side of the building was very quiet. The bed was comfortable and I had no problem falling right to sleep. Again, I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to someone looking for a hotel with a great location, good price and great service.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, location, and experience”
Reviews.Author: SunSnorkelTan
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the Chancellor Hotel and had a great experience. The rooms were small but very clean and well maintained. The fact that you could actually take a bath and soak was a bonus after a late night on the town. Most hotel bath tubs aren't very deep, this one was perfect. The room decor was fresh and modern and the furnishings in good shape. My only complaint was our too-soft mattress and my sore back in the morning. The front desk told me if we were staying longer they could have added something to our mattress that would have made it firmer (next time!). Breakfast was a good value and very tasty. The bellmen were very helpful and everyone we dealt with provided excellent service. We normally stay at the Hyatt on the Embarcadero, but for the price and overall great experience we'll definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: DWBKY
Reviews.Content: Have stayed several times in the Union Square, but this was the first time at the Chancellor. Lots of character. Rooms are well equipped, wireless was good (and free!), good bed, ceiling fan, LCD TV. Windows open to take advantage of great weather. Ate breakfast at restaurant not once, but twice. Great food and awesome service. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Gives the neighboring, higher priced hotels a run for their money”
Reviews.Author: Caryjames
Reviews.Content: So, neighboring hotels include The Sir Francis Drake, Marriott and The Westin St. Francis... with top hotels like those as neighbors, how can The Chancellor Hotel not be great? The Chancellor Hotel has immense character at a fraction of the cost. Highlights include: nice, clean rooms with LCD TV's, free Wi-Fi, room safe, ceiling fan over the bed, complimentary gym access to Club One (a block away) and close by sundry items easily available from Walgreens and 7-Eleven. I come down to San Francisco each holiday season and this is my NEW favorite hotel. If you want to experience true San Francisco charm, try the Chancellor Hotel! You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “The most fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: RMS83
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel! A little small in size but we were hardly in the room. The hotel is located on Powell street, right in the heart of Union Square. The shopping was just fantastic with Macy's just across the street and restaurant and cafes all a few minutes away. We didn't bother with the breakfast in the hotel as there was a great breakfast cafe next door (can't remember the name though) and Starbucks was right across the street. Another charming thing about Powell street is that the tram runs through this street so it was very interesting to see it every time it went by. We loved that the hotel had free flow of coffee (not so good) and cookies (awesome!) which we enjoyed. Overall a lovely hotel and would surely return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location off Union square.”
Reviews.Author: charlottetate
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for a week in The chancellor Hotel in room 1408 which was a suite consisting of two rooms one with a nice bedroom area and bathroom. The other consisting of Another bathroom and Lounge area. The hotel was just off union square .The only downside was the view from out windows was off the back of the hotel. We did not eat in the hotel but The bar and restaurant looked nice, Staff in reception where always happy to help. There was free coffee and cookies in the area which was good. There was a nice cocktail bar called harry Denton Starlight bar and also scalars Restaurant which was good. The cable cars were very close but often full. I would stay at this hotel again as a great location for all San Francisco has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: travellingwoman2222
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located. Although the rooms are small, they are big enough to fit your luggage bags as each room has a little walk in wardrobe that can fit all your luggage. I found this place to be quite comfortable. The price is great for the excellent location! A short walk to Chinatown, Fisherman's Wharf and all the major shopping centers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: barkman
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 4 nights recently on our trip to San Francisco. We picked this location based on price, location and tripadvisor reviews and we are glad we stayed here. I think the Union Square neighbourhood is one of the best in the city for a hotel location. You are close to great shopping, nice restaurants and public transportation. The Bart train from the airport has a station 2 blocks away and the hotel is right on the street car line so you have easy access. The hotel is a smaller hotel, which we prefer. The small hotels seem to have a more personal atmoshpere unlike the large hotels with hundred's of rooms. The staff were all familiar and friendly and quick to answer any questions. The beds were comfortable, the showers were plenty hot and there was lots of room in the closet for storing your luggage and shopping bags. The tv had lots of stations and the two times we used a wake up service it was spot on. Overall great place and we will stay there again one day. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in this price range”
Reviews.Author: Eduardo M
Reviews.Content: Perfect. Clean. Very well located and with a friendily and professional staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, very good service, nice room”
Reviews.Author: patm82
Reviews.Content: You can't beat this location, it's right next to the famous cable car. Room size is adequate and it was clean. Nothing to complain at all. It's not the cheapest hotel, but reasonably priced for it's location and standard.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT START TO OUR TRIP”
Reviews.Author: William5290
Reviews.Content: We where a group of 16 on a 2 week tour of the USA from Australia. this hotel is in an excellent location. the staff were more than helpfull getting our group into there rooms early,bar on site was great, bed and room facilities were excellent all our group had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “California Dreaming ( with pillow menu)”
Reviews.Author: Robertsclubman
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location on Powell Street opposite Saks 5th Avenue just up from Union Square shops. The cable cars run outside up to Nob Hill and Russian Hill (for Lombard Street) and on to Fisherman's Wharf at the other end of the line. We stayed 7 nights. The hotel is fairly basic, but very comfortable with a relaxed ambience, and the location is everything. With a 7 day muni-passport for $27pp you can hop on and off the cable cars ( otherwise $6 per single trip), street cars, buses and muni-metro at will, making it really easy to get around this fabulous city. You can buy the muni-passport as well as tickets and excursions from the kiosk in the hotel lobby. We stayed room only because there are so many breakfast/dining options within yards of the hotel it seemed a waste to eat in, although there is a bar and restaurant. Every floor has an ice machine and there is free coffee/ tea and cookies available in the lobby. Value for money was unbelievably good considering the central location. We'll definitely stay there again on our next trip. For tea-craving Brits you can buy a $14 kettle from the 24hr Walgreens next door (also handy for 3am battery and candy emergencies) and wake to freshly brewed hot tea.with milk kept fresh overnight on ice. The hotel also provides a pillow menu which allows you to select up to 2 pillows from a menu of 12, free of charge, including an MP3 pillow if that floats your boat. However, we found the standard pillows to be perfectly adequate, especially after a hard day's sightseeing and shopping. The hotel staff were unfailingly friendly and helpful and we had a brilliant experience. As a base from which to explore this amazing city it's hard to beat. We can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, somewhat small rooms”
Reviews.Author: Travellel
Reviews.Content: Chancellor Hotel on Union Square in SF is located just a block away from the Union square and 10-15 min walk from Chinatown. The hotel is located in an old building, but all the facilities are in good working condition. The lobby is smallish but cozy. Service was excellent. The rooms are quite small for the price, and there is no coffee machine.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel plumbing through my bathroom”
Reviews.Author: mollysouthisland
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was great and you could walk easily to most places. Unfortuntely the street trams weren't working for the week which was very disappointing. The hotel is very tired and needs money spent on it. The hotel pumbing sounded as if it went through my bathroom, I kept the toilet seat down as it sounded as if there was going to be an explosion!! The walls were thin and I could hear people talking which was annoying at times. It was great having access to the computer in the lobby. I wish I was told there was free coffee in the lobby and you could help yourself at any time, discovered this two days later. Would prefer to have coffee making facilities in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great vintage hotel in the middle of the City”
Reviews.Author: ka0z
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights here throughout Thanksgiving weekend. Staff was really accomodating and helpful with all the requests we had. Location, as already described by many others, is excellent. We found it great that we could take the cable car to the BART station, was really convenient for our airport ride. Room was nice, ours was located on the 12th floor with view of half Union Square. We really liked the waredrobe room and the provided amenities. The TV does not really have a good selection of programmes but we did not stay in the room too much. The only downside that the room is a bit noisy but earplugs will help. We enjoyed our stay and would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: TheMilkMan2000
Reviews.Content: We had a nice stay at the hotel. The room was really well done but the bathroom was a little dated although it was clean. The location is excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Babara W
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a three night stay. This hotel was great. The staff was friendly. The rooms were lovely and our Double Queen room was big and roomy. We traveled with another couple who were also extremely satisfied with our choice for a hotel. From the moment we checked in we felt at ease and relaxed in our surroundings. Location, location, location, was great. We loved San Francisco and we decided that, San Francisco is our future home.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, excellent location - slightly retro!”
Reviews.Author: Love_flying
Reviews.Content: This is a good value hotel for the location - very close to the BART from the airport and right next to Union Sq. It's not luxurious but is very clean and the staff are very friendly. The hotel provide coffee and cookies in the lobby free of charge. Wifi is also free - something that can't be said for other local hotels including the Westin next door where we had to pay! Overall - if your looking for clean and close to public transport and shopping without a huge price tagthen this is for you. There are (as other reviewers mentioned) a lot of homeless people on the streets but I didn't feel threatened and personally view this as a reflection on the lack of a welfare state in the US and therefore an issue in most US cities you visit.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Noodlie066
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay at the Chancellor during our stay in SF. Our room was quiet, the bed comfortable, and room decor was tastefully done with marble topped furniture. There was some paint chipping in the bathroom and deglazing on the bathroom mirror. The flush lever on the toilet was a little awkward in that you needed to tip down the toilet lid to access it. These issues with the bathroom were minor. The from desk staff was pleasant and the location of the hotel is close to public transportation and good restaurants. We had a pleasant dinner at Scala's Bistro which is right across the street from the hotel. I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Location was perfect”
Reviews.Author: Suzanne K
Reviews.Content: Definitely the perfect location to explore San Francisco for the first time. Front desk staff was good and made our early check in (holding our bags) easy and efficient. Bell staff as well. Had an issue with fresh coffee the first day but it was handled quickly and I enjoyed hanging in the lobby each morning with my paper and coffee. the free apples and cookies 24 hours a day was a nice touch. The room was cozy, nothing spectacular but fine. Beds were very comfortable but I forgot to order my pillow from the "pillow menu". If you need a quiet location this probably isnt your spot you can hear the music from Union Square (which I loved) people hollaring in the middle of the night from outside and the cable car lines. Didnt bother me but just thought I should mention. Great big bathtub, after all that walking I enjoyed taking a bath with the window open and listening to the music from Union Square~

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic !”
Reviews.Author: AlisonandJoe
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to SF and the Chancellor. We raved so much about the hotel to my sister and her husband we decided to take them back with us. Hotel is in absolutely fantastic location. Union Square is central, full of atmosphere and facilities. Every sort of transport available within a short walk .. we used BART, F Streetcar, Cable Car and Muni Bus to name a few. Rooms are on the smaller side and bathrooms are small but for the price you pay for this location who cares? We certainly didn't spend much time in our room. Weather very warm when we arrived so slept with windows open. As we'd asked for rooms overlooking Union Square it was noisy to some extent but nice to lie there listening to the city though I don't think we'll ever get used to the fire engines screaming through! No problems sleeping though. Bar staff serve lovely cocktails and gave great recommendations as to where to eat and the restaurant serves amazing breakfasts. We will return!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: TravellerBrussels
Reviews.Content: The biggest selling point of this hotel it's location, so central for everything you need in San Francisco, with the cable cars right outside the door. OK, the decor in the rooms is a little dated and there is no air conditioning, but when you take into account the price it's well worth it. The staff were all so very friendly and helpful which really made for a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Cute, comfy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jenny W
Reviews.Content: It is a cute little hotel with small, but comfy rooms. Its a bit noisy but its in the heart of the city so you have to expect that a bit. The bath room was rather small, but for the price and location you can look past the smaller rooms and see the quality you are getting!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy traditional style and great location”
Reviews.Author: redborn51
Reviews.Content: The Chancellor is very conveniently located on Union Square. Right next to Sears, which is a good little local restaurant. Hotel staff is super friendly. The valet/concierge was very helpful with tips about getting around the City. The room was small but very nicely and comfortably decorated. Parking special rates were only $20 per night which is fantastic for the City, but your car is taken at the curb to who-knows-where....the garage is not on site. But that's okay; it was quick enough when we needed it at departure time but might be a pain if you were taking the car in and out frequently. I would recommend The Chancellor as a good value for the money and comfortable accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “All about the location”
Reviews.Author: MazCA
Reviews.Content: After reading other reviews (and responses!) here we weren't sure what to expect, especially after arriving and dropping off our bags with a less than friendly receptionist. However, when we did get to our room we were pleasantly suprised. It was nicely furnished and a good size. It was quite warm, but we knew there was no A/C - it is a nice old building. We opened the windows, obviously it was fairly noisy being right in the city centre but it didn't keep us awake. Breakfast at the restaurant downstairs was very good. Although the staff didn't volunteer any information when we approached them subsequently they were helpful. The location is great - short walk to China Town and North Beach, right on Union Square with a tram stopping outside so you can get around everywhere really easily. You can buy a MUNI transport pass in the reception - its good value and the staff at the kiosk were brilliant. This is a great place to stay if you're visiting San Fran for the first time and want to be able to get around easily. The only realy downside is that its quite expensive for what it is.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, no air-con, WiFi is fair (but not the best)”
Reviews.Author: elodTlv
Reviews.Content: Location is great. I knew there was no air condition in the room but didn't expect I would feel cold at night. There is an electric heater in the room, but it was too small to have any significant effect. You get 10% discount for breakfast, but you can find cheaper options outside the hotel. This hotel was top rated in San Francisco. I found it to be decent and good, but not sure I understand the enthusiasm of other reviewers. I found nothing special except the location and the reasonable price. WiFi was available in the room, signal was fair (not strongest) but speed wasn't the best (failed to upload large files). The WiFi login screen is a bit annoying (especially on mobile device).

Reviews.AuthorLocation: La Canada Flintridge, California, United States
Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Joyce C
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Chancellor Hotel. We could not have ask for anything more. The room was comfortable and nicely furnished, the staff was very friendly and very helpful and the location was excellent. The travel desk was very helpful, arranging transportation and giving directions. There were eight of us in our group and the hotel put us on our own hallway so we were all together. I will definitely choose the Chancellor Hotel for my future stays in San Francisco

Reviews.Title: “Many happy returns.”
Reviews.Author: Anna-Roz
Reviews.Content: And we have about a dozen rubber duckies to prove it! (A souvenir rubber duckie awaits in every guest room). One could not ask for a finer location - on Powell Street; across from Saks and the cable car stop, and right on the Union Square. It is an architecturally interesting old building but there are plenty of modern amenities: newly remodeled rooms, flat screen TV, free internet access, valet parking for a fee. The rooms, as well as the common areas are spotless, service in general is super gracious, and there are fresh baked cookies, coffee and tea in the lobby 24/7. Upon check in, guests receive a two-for-one voucher for a cocktail at the wonderful bar/lounge area. Ayisha mixes pretty mean Side Cars ;)

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel with clean rooms in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: nicolegal78
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the hotel. The rooms are very clean and comfortable with ceiling fans - which is a nice addition. The location is amazing and very close to Union Square, yet the rooms are quiet. There are nice touches such as rubber ducks and HBO in the rooms. This is a great value hotel in a super spot.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and size”
Reviews.Author: Carol S
Reviews.Content: An older, well-maintained hotel very near Union Square and on the cable car line. The rooms are tastefully decorated for calm; the bathroom, well-equipped. Staff is professional and friendly; I felt welcome and safe. I stayed on the 7th floor and was amazed at the quiet; I sometimes heard sirens, but not regular street noise. Coffee and cookies available at all times. Nice restaurant. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shea09
Reviews.Content: I visited The Chancellor in November of 2011. Let me start by saying the location is awesome. Right across from Union Square. The Powell cable car stops right outside the front door, making a trip to Chinatown or Fishermans Wharf an easy 10-15 min trip The hotel itself is very old, but also very well kept. The front desk was very helpfull and pleasnt. The rooms are a little on the smallish side, but very comfortable. They have a pillow menu. If you dont like your pillow, you can get a new one. They have a small restauraunt and bar in the hotel lobby. The front of the hotel faces the front street and can get kind of noisey, so if you are a light sleeper, i suggest getting your room on the backside of the hotel. Overall I give this hotel a 8.5/10

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Location, Price”
Reviews.Author: al_d555
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights recently on the eleventh floor in this great hotel. It is very much small, boutique style that is exceptionally clean and comfortable. Deep bath tubs, plush linens, and free wifi were certainly welcomed on a city stay. Be warned there is no AC, but there is ceiling fans which are plenty adequate. This hotel is located in Union Square which is a bustling area filled with taxis, restaurants, and shopping galore. The most popular neighborhoods are all a short walk away. This hotel is a great value in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great union square hotel”
Reviews.Author: bindy30
Reviews.Content: After reading the great reviews on trip advisor we choose this hotel for our first visit to San Francisco. It is centrally located and near the union square and market St shopping area. We walked to the ferry building for a yummy breakfast. If you want a nice expresso coffee visit blue bottle coffee company in the ferry building well worth the wait. The chancellor hotel staff were so friendly and helpful. We stored our bags overnight whilst we visited yosemite park this was no problem. We also needed to send a 15 page fax to Australian customs regarding a bike bag we were sending home this was done at no charge by the hotel. We loved the cookies, fresh fruit and coffees in the lobby and the candy jar in our room was a nice touch. Don't expect massive rooms as you are in central San Francisco but really it doesn't matter as if you are like us you will be out all day exploring the city. Great hotel will be recommending to our friends!

Reviews.Title: “Mick & Mary(Dublin,Ireland)”
Reviews.Author: clonmel147
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Chancellor Hotel for 11 nights it was our second time to stay @ this Hotel & it is in great location, easy to go on Day trips,walking or going for a morning run along the bay , so easy to get to Bart station,Muni and cable cars,etc.We asked for a high ,quiet room and it was perfect. It would be nice if there was less furniture in the room and perhaps a fridge would be a good idea.Staff very friendly and helpful . Nice to meet a fellow countryman @ reception.....Rory. We'll return again hopefully

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with a cosy feel and great location”
Reviews.Author: Rossmore99
Reviews.Content: I spent four nights here which was a return visit from 15 years ago. It hadn't changed and was still a charming, quietly efficient hotel with lots of character. It's incredibly good value and retains a sort of family-feel that is the complete opposite of the big faceless, characterless chains. There is something quite romantic about hearing the clang of the bells of the cable cars going past which constantly reminds you where you are - with the potential of a view into the bay - which I have had each time. I was quite put out when I returned after a two week trip to find I could not get a room at all. Serves my right for not booking well enough in advance.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: FCsantacruz
Reviews.Content: I was impressed with the Front Desk when I called to make my reservation. Lyz there was fabulous and our first experience with the hotel was a very positive one. Checking in was seamless. Our room was great - we had a complimentary bottle of wine and some chocolates too! We ordered room service for brunch the next day and again the staff were very polite and helpful, the food was good too. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, great location”
Reviews.Author: Peng-Wai
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Chancellor Hotel for five nights and I must say it was one of the most enjoyable hotel stays I ever had. When I checked in, I asked for a room on the higher floors but none was available as the hotel was fully booked. I was given a room on the 5th floor facing Powell Street and was told by the front desk staff that she would move me to a higher floor once a room was available. Two nights later, I moved to a room at the back of the hotel on the 12th floor, where it was a lot quieter than on the 5th floor. Kudos to the front desk staff who not only arranged for me a room on a higher floor but also had my luggage moved while I was out attending a conference that day. Although the room was a little small, I found it was cozy and clean. The bed was large and comfortable and I slept well. There was no air-conditioning in the room and no need for it since it was cool enough when the windows were opened. Complimentary wireless internet worked without any problems. Hotel location is great: The hotel is next to Sears Fine Foods where I had breakfast; it is within walking distance to all the retail shops and department stores; less than three minutes walk to the cable car stop where I took the cable car to Fisherman’s Wharf; less than five minutes walk to Market Street where I took the F Line to the Ferry Building and Embarcadero; ... and less than one minute to free coffee and cookies down in the lobby. I will definitely stay here again the next time I am in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Nancy D
Reviews.Content: We love this small hotel. It has everything we love about a hotel this size and price--great linens, great bath amenities, friendly staff and GREAT LOCATION.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Loaction”
Reviews.Author: Jim S
Reviews.Content: This was a return visit for us and the hotel was just as good as we remembered. Staff was great and location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in San Fran”
Reviews.Author: Kater214
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because we wanted something nice but didn't want to pay an arm and a leg for it. Although the rooms are on the smaller side (think Europe if you've ever been) but they were clean and nicely decorated. The location of the hotel couldn't be better. It's right on Union Square with plenty of restaurants, bars and shops within walking distance. There is also a cable car stop right out front that goes directly to Fisherman's Warf. We enjoyed our stay and would recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Small but nice”
Reviews.Author: LittleCesar
Reviews.Content: Very well located in Union Square. They have a small room, but very nice and clean. The staff treat you with respect and are often helpful. We used to have breakfast at Sears, the next door restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Best location, friendly, pretty”
Reviews.Author: jrewing88
Reviews.Content: Pretty hotel. Very nice. If i must say something negative, the breakfast wasn't fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Great mid-market hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Leroy252
Reviews.Content: The chancellor makes use of a good location and offers decent accommodation in the heart of San Francisco. The room was quite small and had no view, but this was never the reason we chose this hotel. We wanted a place to explore (I take the same view when in New York) and on this front it serves its purpose. The basics were all well covered and the hotel was clean, the beds were comfortable and the staff friendly. The concierge recommended a wine tour that was easily the highlight of the trip. So overall, we left happy. If you want a decent hotel to explore the city, you could do a lot worse.

Reviews.Title: “A welcome return visit to the best hotel in san francisco”
Reviews.Author: SteveMarsh73
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd visit to the chancellor, and boy do they look after their returning guests! Reservation process was so efficient, and we were made to feel super special and appreciated. We were here for our wedding/honeymoon trip - thanks so much for looking after us so well! 2 visits in one trip, the first on the 15th floor which was VERY special, even though we had a scary moment with a 3.9 earthquake! Everything about the Chancellor is quality, especially the attitude and helpfulness of the staff. And they have little touches which make them stand out from the rest. They really do make the most of this landmark hotel. We always prefer rooms looking out over the front of the hotel rather than the side, but that's just a personal thing. Thanks ever so much and can't wait to sample your hospitality again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Annie-and-Jeff
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in town for a concert at the Warfield and stayed at this hotel the night of November 1, 2011. All I can say is Kudos! The hotel was nice, with clean rooms and very comfortable beds (love the pillow menu) and an absolutely terrific location, but what really stood out to me was the staff. Apparently, they were short handed on housekeeping staff that day, so there was a backup in getting rooms ready and getting people checked in. I can't say enough about the professionalism, patience and courtesy exhibited by the front desk staff in dealing with the backup. Every member of staff that I ran into was so nice and polite and a pleasure to deal with, but I just thought the front desk staff (and the short handed housekeeping staff) deserve a special shout out. Can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Smaller, Dated Rooms and Decor”
Reviews.Author: QuinnA
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the loaction of this hotel. Right on Powell Street and Union Square. Plenty of nearby shopping and dining options. If you have a car, the off-site parking is a bit expensive.

Reviews.Title: “A Union Square treasure”
Reviews.Author: 505022p
Reviews.Content: Our recent three day stay at the Chancellor in San Francisco was a delight by any measure. Conveniently located with easy access to Union Square, Cable Cars, BART and a host of other attractions, it was always a pleasure to return to the hotel at the end of our busy day. We were a short taxi ride to the magnificent Opera House, a short BART trip to Harding Park to see the Champions Golf event. Fisherman's Wharf was easily accessed via the Powell/Mason Cable Car stop just across the street from the Chancellor. The cookies and coffee in the lobby were well utilized by us and our travelling partner couple. We shall return! Tony Southwell

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in the middle of everything”
Reviews.Author: Ray055
Reviews.Content: Hotel has free tea/coffee/cookies available all day, rooms are small but very clean, modern and beds are very comfortable and a pillow menu is available as well.Hotel staff are very friendly and helpful. We bought a 3 day pass for the Muni transport system, unlimited travel all over San Francisc including the famous cable cars. Hotel is just off Union Square, with Macys, Bloomingdales, Nieman Marcus 5 mins walk away, Try Sears restaurant next door to the hotel, they do nice meals , also the hotel does nice breakfasts. Would I stay at this hotel again - definitely!

Reviews.Title: “good location, very noisy, expensive parking”
Reviews.Author: salit_11
Reviews.Content: the location of the hotel is grate a lot of restaurants and shops near, the room was clean and comfortable and nice decorated. the cable car in front of the hotel makes a lot of nois and the rooms on the street side are very noisy. The cookies, coffee and tea in the lobby throughout the day is great.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: listershaun
Reviews.Content: I booked The Chancellor in early 2011 for my honeymoon in September. I emailed Kevin, the reservations manager, to check availability, and see whether I could book a 'special' room for the occasion. He promised he would sort it, and when we arrived we were very happy that he had given us a room with a view of Union Square, and high enough up to not be affected by the noise. A man of his word, and we were very grateful. The hotel itself, well, we couldn't fault it. It is what it is, an old style hotel in a fantastic location, with nice staff, even the lady and gentleman in the kiosk were brilliant. Our room was clean, and plenty big enough for the two of us, and the aforementioned view was just awesome, especially at night. I have to say that it was an absolute bargain too, and I can see why it is such a popular hotel, far better than one of the stuffy 'upmarket' offerings elsewhere. All in all, we couldn't fault a thing, I'd like to thank Kevin and all the staff for excellent service from start to finish, and for the lovely gift which was left for us. We couldn't have asked for better on our first trip to San Francisco, in fact, or first trip to the States. I would highly recommend staying here, and I hope to return in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Always a pleasure to return to the Chancellor.”
Reviews.Author: WillyRandom
Reviews.Content: We got in late in the evening. The rooms were exactly as I requested. It seemed as if they had been freshly painted, but maybe that is just because the place is so clean. The beds are quite comfortable. The downstairs restaurant is a real "plus" for breakfast in the morning. It has become a real home away from home for me, and the staff-- many of whom I now recognize after having stayed for 4 years-- thanks to TripAdvisor-- are great.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and EXCELLENT customer service”
Reviews.Author: Angela D
Reviews.Content: The Chancellor Hotel was built in the early 1900's. You wouldn't know it by the interior. This wonderfully appointed hotel is situated in a perfect location to enjoy the city. Not only that, the rooms were incredibly clean, the bell staff was more than attentive, the front desk personnel answered every question we had AND even printed out maps to the various locations we mentioned. Our bell staff person was named Matthew and he stood out in the rain on a very busy Saturday night and relentlessly attempted to hail a cab. Not an easy task under the circumstances. The complimentary coffee was a nice touch along with the apples and cookies. The hallways are narrow and the rooms are of a modest size but that is due to the age of the property which I might add was completely charming, elegant and totally perfect for our visit. This hotel has class and has been very well maintained. Our bed linens were clean and new and there were a variety of pillows to choose from including buckwheat! It was our honeymoon and the hotel staff placed 2 souvenier champagne flutes along with a bottle of pink champagne in our room before our arrival. Very nice touch. The cleanliness of the room was wonderful. We slept with the window open each and every night. The city is noisy but you can request a room up high and you can avoid the street car/city noise. We enjoyed fine dining right next door at Sears restaurant and Starbucks was on the corner. The cable cars run right in front of the hotel and the entire city is at your feet and within walking distance. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: David F
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in a good location. Clean rooms of a good size. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Third stay”
Reviews.Author: leegin
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Chancellor several times in the last seven or so years and have returned because it is a nice hotel and a good value. I was not going to write another review but reading the absurd review by "fedeanddelsman" prompted me to do so. Nothing in that review is even remotely true. The hotel is immaculate and well maintained. The rooms are small but that should be known going in. We will stay there again the next time we are in SF--probably next year.

Reviews.Title: “THE WORST HOTEL EVER”
Reviews.Author: fedeandelsman
Reviews.Content: IT WAS HORRIBLE. We went to san francisco to have some great time and it wasnt great at all. The people where mean. One of the receptionist guys even insulted my son. If you go to that hotel you will regret. The bedrooms were not comfortable at all, they were dirty, small, a lot of noise. And the restaurant was awful. It was so horrible that I dont want to return to San Francisco ever again. You suck Chancellor Hotel on Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “Noise, noise and more noise”
Reviews.Author: 578Charlton
Reviews.Content: No sound insulation so you will experience the traffic (and construction) noise throughout the night. General Manager Wes Tyler denied that any construction work was being undertaken in the hotel vicinity! Ha! We were there! We heard it! We spent whole evenings unable to sleep because of the noise issues! Do not stay at this hotel! Charlton

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: heyshoowhah
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel in a great location. Rooms were comfortable and staff very friendly and helpful. Thanks for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Judy L
Reviews.Content: Visited San Fran in August and found this hotel to be accommodating and in a great location- good value for the price! Trolley and bus stops were nearby and Chinatown was within walking distance. Wonderful restaurants nearby, and found all staff to be most friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great reception, perfect location, reasonable value”
Reviews.Author: ourholiday
Reviews.Content: This hotel lived up to the expectations Tripadvisor reviews had raised. We have no hesitation in recommending it.
