Reviews.Title: “Chancellor hotel San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: RexEdward
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this hotel. Good Value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic business trip”
Reviews.Author: LittleCityFarms
Reviews.Content: I was pretty sure I was going to love this place when I booked it and I was not at all disappointed. I prefer hotels with character and this one had a little historic charm, lots of modern amenities, and tons of class. When I walked in the windows were cracked to provide fresh air (what a change of pace!) and the room felt breezy and light. I suppose one could complain about the street noise but you can't really chose to stay on Powell St. and complain about the trolley's bell can you! It didn't keep me up. The staff were extremely helpful and I couldn't have felt more at home. I suppose the rooms might be small--I lucked into a free upgrade to a suite and it was spacious and lovely. Can't wait for my next trip back!

Reviews.Title: “We will be back!”
Reviews.Author: CallieCo8
Reviews.Content: After much research, we decided on the Chancellor Hotel for a 3-night stay for family from Ohio (their first trip to Northern California). Everything we had read about the hotel was spot on. The rooms were clean and nicely remodeled (the bathroom is small but workable), coffee, tea and cookies were available from early morning to late evening in the lobby, breakfast at their restaurant was very good and the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. We had booked three rooms on one floor; however, one room was not ready and my husband and I were moved to another floor. For our trouble, we were given a gift certificate to be used at the hotel's restaurant. The location is fantastic -- right on Powell Street where we could pick up the Cable Car and head for Fisherman's Wharf, walk to Union Square, is close to shopping and great restaurants. We were assisted with transportation to Pier 33 for an Alcatraz tour, told about a great pizza place just a half a block away and answered the many questions we had about local places to eat, shop, etc. There was a book on their table in the lobby that we inquired about -- wanted to find out where we could get it for my brother-in-law. One of the staff told us how much it was and went out to purchase it for us while we waited for our car. Cannot say enough about our great experience here. My husband and I will be staying here on our next trip to San Francisco -- highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Best 3* hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Flighty31
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Chancellor was everything we hoped it would be having read many other reviews. The location is superb right in the heart of the action and very close to all the transport links. The rooms are reasonably small but have everything we needed and they use the available space intelligently. Who wants a long walk to the bathroom anyway? There is no air conditioning but you do not need it. When we were there in August and were told that we had picked the hottest week of the summer and it was fine, the ceiling fans were more than adequate. I requested a fridge for our drinks which was quickly provided at no extra charge. What I think makes this hotel great is its character and all of the many small touches that you would maybe not expect. Such as free cookies, coffee and popcorn plus a pillow menu. If I was being uber picky (to give the review some balance) I would say the bell service personal did seem uninterested and did not match the other high levels of service we received from all the other staff. To summarise, this is the best 3 star property I have ever stayed in and if I return to San Francisco I cannot see myself staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “good old hotel”
Reviews.Author: welltraveledA
Reviews.Content: we liked the hotel but was little mislead by website room photos which shows a much newer hotel than it really is rooms are ok but ailes and reception are in need of an urgent renovation rate wasnt cheap so i was expecting something better rooms are on the small size pros:location at union square,parking just one block away (they deal the price for you paying directly to the hotel),coffee apples and cookies for free just a place to stay no long last memories here

Reviews.Title: “Thanks to Tripadvisor, no Surprises-- Just a Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Daniel D
Reviews.Content: Based on TripAdvisor reviews, my wife and I chose the Chancellor Hotel for our stay in San Francisco. We were not let down. This is a wonderful hotel situated in the heart of San Francisco. Major attractions are just a walk away or easily accessible by cable car, bus or light rail; so this is the area to be in if you are planning on walking or using transit to see the city. As others have mentioned, the rooms at the hotel are not the biggest, but they are clean, tastefully decorated and always look sparkling when we returned from a long day out on the city. Those things are important to us. In closing, if you are looking for a clean room, great location and competitive price, the Chancellor Hotel is an option you should look into.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: jen m
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chancellor for 3 nights in October. The location is fantastic with a view of Union Square, close to shops, restaurants and all methods of transportation. The price was very good and the rooms were clean and a nice size. It was my husbands 40th birthday and they left a card and bottle of wine which was a nice touch. The only thing I would recommend is, if you prefer a quieter room, to request a room on the back of the hotel. Union Square can be noisy until quite late, but with the window closed it was not too much of a problem. The hotel staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful to us.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: SharonAJ
Reviews.Content: We booked this on recommendations from friends based on the location and value for money and it does tick those boxes perfectly. We got a great rate and all e-mail correspondence was quick, effecient and helpful. The rooms are "cosy" as they say on their website and a bit of a challenge if like us you have lots of luggage - but you're not in the room much and the benefits outweigh that issue. Staff are welcoming and friendly and you are well placed for Union Sq, the main tram stop and shops. Sears, just next door, is great for breakfast and there is a handy food store on the corner. We did request a high floor at the back of the hotel and noise wasn't a problem. A good base if you are on a budget but still want to be in the centre of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, poor staff”
Reviews.Author: joeyjo99
Reviews.Content: Right on Union Square- great location. Rooms are nice, modern and nicely decorated but not plush. Staff on the front desk not in the slightest professional, lost my mailed package and only once I phoned Internationally to confirm with the firm's courier that it had been delivered did they manage to find in in their cupboard. Sent item for dry cleaning and they forget to check the driver had delivered it back so he left with it and had to go out to business meeting without suit jacket. Colleague on the same rate ($200pn) ended up with room 3 times the size and 2 bathrooms while I had small one so worth upgrading?

Reviews.Title: “It was as good as you all said.”
Reviews.Author: AucklandRose
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in early October, and chose the Chancellor because of the T.A reviews and comments. It was every bit as good as the reviews suggest.We liked the very friendly, approachable front-desk staff, the room was comfortable and very clean , and the location was superb.We had breakfast one morning in Luques,and were happy with the meal and service. We really liked the coffee and biscuits in the lobby, and the little bar had a great "happy hour." I think the Chancellor markets itself very honestly. It is certainly not a flashy chain hotel , but that was fine with us!We loved being in San Francisco, and if we ever get the chance to return we would be happy to return to the Chancellor.

Reviews.Title: “You're best bet for SFO!!”
Reviews.Author: ccsaltlake
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at The Chancellor the 1960's when I would come with my family often for our summer vacations. Coincidentally, so has my husband!! We wouldn't think of staying anywhere else. Not only is it because of the PERFECT location, but the staff, price and value. Walk out the door to the best shopping and dining in California. Hop on the cable car to soak in the city. Union Square is my favorite spot in San Francisco and at The Chancellor, you are 10 steps away. Chinatown is around the corner and if you are in town for a ballgame at AT&T Park you can even walk there if you're up for it, cab fare to the park is about $10. The rooms are small but functional. Be prepared for very small bathrooms, but that's a minor compromise for the overall advantages of the hotel. You're bed choices are either one queen or two twins, no king beds. Street side rooms face right on Powell where the trolley runs, but we always request an upper floor and the noise never keeps me awake. If this concerns you, request a backside room. I happily recommend The Chancellor for your visit to San Fran!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sarbel_135
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chancellor Hotel for 4 nights. We found everything to be perfect for our stay. The staff were extremely friendly, the room was really nice with little extras such as coffee and cookies in reception, bottle of wine and chocolate on arrival and even a rubber duck for the bath! Although the room was a little small (we had just been to Las Vegas where the room was huge) it was very clean, tastefully furnished and well decorated. The room was a bit too warm, but there was a fan in the room and we kept the window open - yes there was a lot of traffic noise but you are in an excellent central location so this is to be expected and you do get used to it. As mentioned, one of the positive aspects of this hotel is the location, extremely well placed for transport (cable car, street cars, taxis etc) and for resteraunts, bars and sightseeing. We did the trip to Alcatraz which was good (pre book before you go as it gets really busy) but the best activity we did was to hire bikes (expensive but worth it) and cycle across the Golden Gate Bridge to Sausalito - which is a beautiful place. We're not mega fit, but had a fantastic day - and you can come back on the ferry which give you lovely views of the bridge. Would definitely go back to the Chancellor if we returned to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced hotel in central SF”
Reviews.Author: wishiwasthere78
Reviews.Content: For a mid priced city centre hotel , this is a very good choice . I had a 4 night stay and was very happy with everything . The rooms were very clean and the hotel is centrally located to make all the main attractions easily accessible ( we walked everywhere !) . The only negative comment which is more for feedback for the hotel than as a potential guest - is personally I would prefer tea/ coffee making facilities in my room instead of a communal area. It's nice to be able to have a cuppa when I wake rather than having to get showered / dressed first etc . But this is only a minor detail ;)

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly placed”
Reviews.Author: oscar0734
Reviews.Content: It's central position is great for shopping and eating out which is just as well as there is no restaurant ,just a small bar and the free coffee in the lobby. The rooms are clean and comfortable and the staff pleasant and helpful.Just one irritation though as we booked an important early morning wake up call which never came!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay.”
Reviews.Author: Kamaile M
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during the Nike Women's Marathon and it was the perfect location. I was literally across the street from the start line and close to restaurants, shopping and two Starbucks. I requested an in room refridgerator which was so convenient to store water, gatorade and left overs to eat later. I also requested and got a room on a higher floor so I would have no trouble sleeping since I'm a light sleeper. I really liked having coffee, hot tea, cookies and apples in the lobby. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a nice clean room at a fair price.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay at union square!”
Reviews.Author: 3rdyrrunner
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable room at union square...no AC. Great location. We did not eat at the hotel nor use the complimentary gym but both looked great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Vicky L
Reviews.Content: We found The Chancellor Hotel on Trip advisor and discovered it was a great location for our visit to San Francisco. The staff were friendly and helpful (especially after we had to modify our stay) and our room was modern, very clean and well appointed. There is no coffee in the rooms but the complimentary coffee and cookies in the lobby more than made up. The location is great for getting around the city and if you are driving (as we were) there is a convenient parking lot less than a block away (we took the parking option with the room). There are plentiful restaurants and Chinatown is a short walk away. The bar/restaurant in the hotel is fine if you don't want to venture out upon your arrival. Also I'd recommend you use the tour desk in the lobby, they were very helpful and have some great ideas. If you want quiet room get one at the back but we were offered this upon booking.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: mimi200608
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to San Francisco...Chancellor Hotel was convenient and comfortable. An older hotel with character. We asked for a quiet room....we were on the 8th floor facing the other buildings.....but it was quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Historic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mija1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on the recommendation of a friend who prefers a smaller hotel to the chains. As many have commented, the rooms are on the small side, especially the bathroom, but they are representative of hotels of The Chancellor's era. It's not glitzy, but it has a lot of character (and no, that's not a euphemism for something else) and old school charm. It was immaculately clean, had a very nice flatscreen TV, and the beds were comfy. Even though we were facing Powell Street, the street noise did not disturb our sleep (request a higher floor). The location --diagonal to Union Square -- is excellent for shopping, cable cars, and theaters.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: sdoutre
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the location of this hotel. Right off Union Square and close to everything. Room was small but clean and updated. Nice sheets and a good bed and pillows make all the difference! They have fresh cookies in the lobby and free tea and coffee. Staff is friendly. Very easy check-in and check-out. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “So friendly and comfy!”
Reviews.Author: bookit2
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I loved the hotel, staff and warmth of the room as soon as we entered! The lighting was beautiful, and decorations with the 1930's hotel. As we were on the street side, we worried about noise, but other than ding-ding of cable car bells, it was delightfully peaceful. The reception was quick and all were very friendly. We also booked our 3 day bus pass, which was great on Bart, cable cars and buses, at the commisionarie's desk. Breaky at the restaurant was always wonderful, with great coffee too! We wished we hadn't gone to Sears for breaky, but stayed in our hotel! Once again, San Fran is such a gorgeous city, and I know we'll be back to the Chancellor in the near future! Lois & Sage

Reviews.Title: “Very cute hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: Gr8greta
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in great location. Friendly and courteous staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot!”
Reviews.Author: Susan B
Reviews.Content: Amazing location! Very friendly and accommodating! Rooms small but very clean and comfortable! Would definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: joe a
Reviews.Content: great location and price...have stayed multiple times...restaurant breakfast better than sears next door and much less crowded...very quiet despite location on busy powell st....would recommend highly..

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: holmakerrachel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right in Union Square so I would recommend it for this reason. Bedroom was small but very clean and comfy. This is not a cheap hotel to stay in but you are definitely paying for such a great location, a great base for seeing all the sights and shopping San Francisco has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Bob1NZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights and found the Chancellor matched the positive recommendations we had read. The location was great for a holiday in San Francisco. The room was very well set up. The availability of complimentary tea and coffee 24/7 in the bar and apples in the lobby showed an interest in customer welfare. The staff were all very helpful. Overall this was a most pleasant stay and for southern hemisphere travellers represented great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: Richard B
Reviews.Content: The location could not be better. The staff was very friendly and the room was very clean although somewhat small. The closet was very large walk in which was nice. I would not eat in the restaurant again. There are complimentary cookies and coffee in the lobby which was a nice treat. The location was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “very good 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: pinoy99
Reviews.Content: Arrived mid-day, room not yet ready (was told half hour wait) so bags were put in storage. Needed a quick lunch, had to choose between Scala’s Bistro across the street or Sears next door(look another for review). Back to the hotel to checked in – got high floor, room-facing Powell St.(requested in advance thru email which was responded promptly). Found a bottle of wine and small box of chocolate on the cocktail table – nice touch, thanks! Room has 32” flat tv on top of dresser with a marble? top. Next to it is a table/chair with lamp (with a/c outlets) and telephone. Chairs are on each side of the cocktail table by the window. There are end tables with lamps on each side of the queen bed-one with a clock radio. Pillows and bed were very nice and comfortable. Ceiling fan produced enough circulation – vibration/noise is noticeable at top speed but that’s not the preferred setting anyway. Noise from cable cars, construction (Stockton & Post) and everything else going on (Powell/Union Square/HVAC of the building across the street) is on a medium high level with the window in full open position. I could not close it fully as the room gets too hot for our taste. Although, I think the noise level will be much better when the road constructions are over. Bathroom size is fine, the only really complaint is how close the potty is to the door. Wi-Fi signal was very good and VPN connection worked properly – for free! Closet has iron/board and a safe big enough to fit a 15.6 laptop with plenty of clothes hangers and an umbrella too (came in handy for a few rainy days/nights). The Icebox is nicely hidden inside a closet by the elevator. The elevators are quick and seem to handle the traffic very well. Hotel is central to all public transit – cable car at Powell, buses at Post, Sutter or Stockton. I believe BART is a short walk as well. Muni passport can be bought at the tour desk. Hotel is practically next door to major shops – Saks, NM, Macy’s, Bulgari/Tiffany, Uggs and more. Ditto for different restaurants/bars. Only used the hotel restaurant for breakfast (3x) – food was very good with great service – with 20% off for conference attendees. There is a small bar by the lobby where the free coffee is (didn’t particularly liked the flat taste/flavor), but has very good selection of tea bags. On several occasions, the thermos for coffee or hot water ran dry, although they were replenished quickly. There were also free cookies and fruits available for guests. All the staff seems genuinely friendly, from the front desk, bellhop, tour desk, restaurant wait/help, maintenance & maids. Normally, there will be staff(s) that are indifferent but not at this hotel, at least not the ones we encountered in our 6 nights stay. The hotel is a very good (4.5) 3 star property. If/when I’m in the city/Union Square, I will definitely consider staying at Chancellor again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but some glitches”
Reviews.Author: bizzylizzy158
Reviews.Content: Like many other people who have stayed at the Chancellor we booked on the strength of Trip Advisor ratings. I'm sorry to say I have to disagree with those people who have given the hotel four and five stars. The desk staff were efficient and pleasant, other staff we came across were also courteous and polite. The room was very small, but we did expect this as we'd read the info on the hotel before booking. The room itself was clean and the bed linens were of good quality. The bath was pretty parlous, with pieces missing from the enamel. Luckily neither my husband nor I actually wanted to use it as a bath, preferring to shower. So we were able to put a mat over the top of the damaged area. But the hotel should really fix these kinds of basic faults. Our booking had been in place for several months prior to our arrival, so we were hoping for a half decent room, and not one of those rooms you take because there's nothing else available and you're desperate. But this room overlooked some kind of rumbling, thrumming plant - air conditioning I think. The noise was unacceptably loud, it also meant we had to keep the window closed at night. Bad enough in reasonably clement weather, but if you'd been in the room during a heat wave you would have had to choose between a baking hot room or being kept awake by the roar of the plant. Regarding the free coffee and cookies. The cookies did seem to hang around under a plastic dome for some time, they appeared not be home baked (although I apologise if I'm wrong). We came across the coffee and hot water dispensers (for tea) in several hotels on our trip. People from the UK may not be familiar with them. They're rather like very large vacuum flasks - you push the top to dispense a measure of coffee or hot water to make tea. A good idea of course, and it was nice to have a coffee first thing in the morning before we set off. But we did notice that the water didn't seem to be replaced on a regular basis and was occasionally tepid. The bar in the hotel seemed rather dark and dismal - not at all welcoming. Very few people seemed to use it as far as we could see. That also applies to the restaurant. A few tips for you all. Eating around Union Square is not cheap, if you're on a budget I would suggest booking a hotel offering breakfast as part of the package. This could easily be the fault of our travel agent, but we were not offered this option for the Chancellor at the time of booking and I don't know if breakfast is offered as part of a room package. The cable car turntable is at the other end of Union Square, just a short walk down the road. There always seemed to be long queues there - this means that the cable cars are very often full by the time they get to the Chancellor stop. So take the 'it's easy to hop onto a Cable car outside the Chancellor' advice with a pinch of salt. It isn't. My final piece of advice which doesn't actually relate to the hotel, but is worth knowing. If you want a quick snack, some chocolate, postcards to send home, or maybe some sandwiches to take out with you for the day, go to Walgreens. What a great shop. You'll find branches all over the place. The one we used was a few yards up the road from the Chancellor. Go out of the door and turn left. We bought delicious pots of melon, sandwiches and boxed salads for just a few dollars. To sum up. The Chancellor is a good average hotel in an excellent location. It was our first visit to the city, so, to be fair, we have no other hotels with which to make a comparison. I'm not entirely sure that the characterful hotel descriptions are appropriate. Sadly it seemed a little lacking in character as far as we were concerned. Also, many hotels offer fridges in the rooms these days. Although ice was easily available, a fridge would have been very useful to keep our bottled water and snacks in as the room was pretty warm. I expect a rebuttal from the hotel manager regarding our opinion of the Hotel's shortcomings as he seems very pro-active on the Trip Advisor site. You can't fault him for that. But perhaps rather than going on the defence he might care to look accept this review as constructive criticism. We have stayed in far, far worse places than the Chancellor, but if we are lucky enough to visit San Francisco again, I suspect we'll look for another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jeffh383
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to say a big thank you to Wes the manager for having such a wonderful hotel. It was so charming and the room we had overlooking Union Square was wonderful. Your staff are so friendly and knowledgeable which was of a great help to us. We thought that Matthew your bellboy was such a lovely person. So lovely!! You made us feel very welcome with your champagne and chocolates in our room when we arrived as we were on our honeymoon having just got married in New York 3 days prior to arriving. The room was so comfortable and we loved the touch with the candy jar and the bottle of wine in the room. I couldn't resist mentioning to you when you were stood behind the reception desk that you had a great hotel and fantastic staff. The location of the hotel is fantastic!! Keep up the good work. We will definitely be using your hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: straveler57
Reviews.Content: In the heart of Union Square. The rooms are small but very clean and comfortable. If you are looking for 5 star, this is not it, but the price also reflects that. I would highly recommend this hotel and would stay there again in the future. That staff was superb and all were very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: teentripper
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I I stayed for 4 nights and totally enjoyed ourselves. Hotel staff was really helpful. Room was wonderful. Cookies and coffee in the lobby great. Easy walk with suitcases to BART so didn't need to taxi from airport. Didn't hear a thing from neighbouring rooms. Eventually had to shut the window to block out downtown noise but fan made that possible. Tried breakfast in the hotel and at Sears next door. Would give a pass on both next time. Even though the decor was interesting at Sears, it was definitely not worth a 1/2 hour stand in line for a very basic Denny's breakfast. Highlight of the trip was a Segway tour with City Segway and Alcatraz.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, average hotel”
Reviews.Author: bd007
Reviews.Content: As everyone points out, this hotel is where you want to be in SFO. The rooms have recently been upgraded, however they are still small, and the bathrooms need an upgrade. The walls are paper thin, and conversations in the rooms next door can easily be heard. If you have a room on the front of the hotel, expect alot of noise, the back of the hotel is much quieter. The cleaning staff is great. I have stayed in this hotel about 15 times and I always find it interesting how my room is never made up until after 3. The door man was of no use when it came to bringing my luggage in or helping me get a cab. I am not too sure if i will choose this hotel again on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: KellyanneJake
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel that is so central! Check in was fast and hassle free. The staff were very welcoming and helpful whenever I spoke with them. The room my son and I had had two twin beds and he loved the large bath! He also loved the jar or lollies!! The hotel was just a stones throw from Union Square, Macys and Market Street Shopping. There were some great eateries close by, Walgreens on the corner and StarBucks just over the road. We utilised the off street parking facility and they too were really friendly and helpful. In the evening cookies welcomed us in the lobby and tea and coffee are also available. Gracia was the lady that serviced our room on the 13th floor and it was always perfect. I had such a hard time trying to find a modern, affordable, central hotel in San Francisco and am so glad I found the Chancellor! It is terrific. I cannot fault it. You do hear the sounds of the city but once we closed our windows it was not an issue at all. I highly recommend this hotel and this city!! We had an amazing time!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: bhavana_praveen
Reviews.Content: I went through the reviews on trip advisor and planned on staying here I was dissappointed ,the rooms are tiny ,there is no air condiion , the fan was not perfuming well, because of which we had to keep the windows open and it got really noisy, apart from the hotel being centrally located there was nothing more to look out for. The bathrooms are tiny too.We even tried upgrading we were just moved from 3rd to 11th floor but it didn't make much difference .

Reviews.Title: “Top location, clean and very comfortable room.”
Reviews.Author: Meloby
Reviews.Content: Excellent location - very central for tourists. Outstanding room condition, including super comfortable bed and fresh new looking linen. Clean fresh bathroom facilities. Great breakfast service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: SharonandKeith
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Chancellor Hotel and it's really very good, the room had all the facilities we needed. There was no tea/coffee making facilities in the room but they had it free in the Hotel Lobby. The staff were helpful and friendly and the location was brilliant for the tour buses and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Good but to hot”
Reviews.Author: jmannz
Reviews.Content: This hotel needs aircon the rooms are to warm to sleep.The hotel is almost boutique style as it is quite small the other problem is parking there is a small area outside to park and unload your bags but if this is full you cannot double park as there are trams lines that cannot be blocked.they charge $36 to valet park which to us was the only option as not to sure where the self parking garage would be. The hotel is clean and modern and has a nice feel about it.We enjoyed our breakfast in the retaurant plenty of choice on the menu.The rooms are small but big enought to be comfortable as long as you travel light Apart from my two issues I enjoyed my stay at the chancellor recommend if it is cold weather and you have no vehicle!

Reviews.Title: “Can't fault this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: RLS1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Chancellor for five nights during my first trip to San Francisco, and I couldn’t fault this hotel! The location was excellent and the staff were friendly. We stayed in a twin room on the 14th floor – we had requested a high level room to avoid street noise, which paid off as we weren’t disturbed by this during our stay. The beds were really comfortable too, with a choice of pillows! San Francisco was having a bit of a heat wave during our stay, but the lack of air con wasn’t a problem as the ceiling fan was more than enough to keep the room cool. We enjoyed the free apples, cookies, tea and coffee in the foyer, and the free WIFI! We ate breakfast in the hotel one morning, which was delicious. We also ate at Sears next door a couple of times, which I would highly recommend. Overall I had absolutely no complaints about this hotel and would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Great location just off Union Square”
Reviews.Author: shortperson
Reviews.Content: This was probably the smallest hotel room we stayed in during a California road trip, but it was in the city, the location was excellent, and it was very quiet! The room size was akin to New York, so we weren't surprised - though the oversized lampshade that kept getting bashed by the curtains was probably the wrong thing to have in there! Nevertheless, there was plenty of suitcase storage in the closet - we had two big suitcases and two backpacks with us. The bathroom was fine and the room itself was comfortable and well decorated. We went in September, so no airconditioning did not bother us, but I guess it might if it got hotter. The in-hotel restaurant was OK - we had breakfast there one morning, but to be honest, Sears next door was better value and better food. Valet parking was a godsend for us, and most of the staff in the hotel were very helpful. This was a great location for the three nights we were there. We did walk to Fishermans' Wharf, which was a long walk, but a trolley bus home helped there! But it is one block back from Union Square and all the shopping you could need.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: wherenext_10
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a great location with rooms that are modern and clean. The trolley stop right outside was a definite plus. Breakfast at the on-site restaurant was good and average priced for the area. We would stay there again. Just down the street was John's Grill which was an excellent meal!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: K1980G
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 5 night stay at The Chancellor hotel with my lovely daughter. What a wonderful time we had in this fantaastic city and in a very comfortable and friendly hotel. We enjoyed the complimentary cookies, apples, tea and coffee on our return from a long day shopping and sightseeing. Our room was a decent size with a fairly small bathroom (big enough for a short stay though) and a big walk in wardrobe. We were on the seventh floor at the back of the hotel so lovely and quiet. There is also a pillow menu which is worth trying and an ice machine on each floor. There is a restaurant in the hotel where we enjoyed a good breakfast. They also serve other meals although we didn't try them. We enjoyed cocktails in the small bar and happy hour was between 5.00pm-7.30pm. Next door to the hotel there is a very nice restaurant called Sears where we enjoyed breakfast - they make great pancakes! We also had dinner there on several occasions which was also very good. The location is perfect, close to shops, cable cars, trams, restaurants and all the sights. We really could not have chosen a better hotel for the location and price and can recommend this hotel for a great stay in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: deelicious
Reviews.Content: We have arrived home today after a fantastic 3 week trip to California. We arrived at the Chancellor to stay for 3 nights before flying back to the UK and we were really are glad we chose this hotel. All the staff work so hard and are always at hand if you need anything. A very special thanks to Wes Tyler the General Manager who arranged a nice Wedding Anniversary surprise for us on our arrival. This Hotel is so well located for everything you need. Eating, shopping and getting about on all the transport is all on the doorstep here. On check in we arrived early but no problem they took our luggage off us and stored it away which allowed us to go off and look about. The complimentary beverages and cookies in the lobby were also something we looked forward to when we returned after a long day out and about. The room was very nice and had a nice big bath so i could have long soak before getting ready for a night out.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in a fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: Teganw
Reviews.Content: I arrived after 26hrs traveling & was greeted at check in by Voula, who was friendly, efficient & sympathetic to the fact I just wanted to get to my room. I can't tell you how long it took - I was in my room before I could look at my watch! I loved the furnishings, bed was the most comfortable I've had in a hotel & the pillows were so comfy! Loved the umbrella in the wardrobe but San Fran gave me no reason to use it! Located in Union Square - fantastic! Cable car stop outside was great for returning from a long days sightseeing! Also walking distance to Powell St muni station where I caught muni to At&T Park & Golden Gate Park.

Reviews.Title: “Reservation fouled up, but good value, service, location and maintainance.”
Reviews.Author: doddsfamily
Reviews.Content: I had reserved a room with one bed, then called four days before arrival to change that to two twin beds because I needed to bring along another employee. I was assured that the change would be made, but when we arrived (not at all late) was told that only a queen was available, but they could bring a rollaway. The rooms are fine but small, and it was pretty tight with the rollaway in there. The hotel is very clean, staff is extremely pleasant, location couldn't be better, price is very fair, but someone should have called me back if the change I requested was indeed not available. I would otherwise rate this a four or five.

Reviews.Title: “Great accomodations at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: jlandarose
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and the staff was extremely accomodating. The room was average size for an older downtown hotel. The location could not have been better. You are in the heart of dining, shopping and many attractions. The value is outstanding and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Like Always”
Reviews.Author: Ryan T
Reviews.Content: This hotel by far is the best in the area for the money, you cant beat the charm of the hotel and the rest of the staff actually like to work here. I've usually only stay at four diamond and up property's and this one deserves one.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD HOTEL...GOOD LOCATION...DECENT PRICE...and NO BEDBUGS!!!”
Reviews.Author: BamBam637
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I had stayed here for 4 nights for our vacation in San Francisco. We did a lot of research before hand including for bedbugs and we are glad we had picked this hotel. Chancellor Hotel is not the best of the best; however, it’s not the worst either. Location was good and the price was decent. PARKING: If you drive here, parking in SF is NOT free; $29/night PLUS tax, which I thought was ridiculous with the tax. Chancellor hotel will have complimentary cookies, water, apples, maps, tea and coffee in the lobby all for FREE! SERVICE: The staffs here were nice and friendly. The tour desk guy was really helpful with info about places to go and how to get there. Our room didn’t have a fridge, we call and requested one and they brought it up to our room right away at no charge. BEDROOM: The bedroom is exactly like what you see in the pictures. It’s small but cozy. If you can take advantage of the pillow menu, I suggest you should. I had forgotten about it; therefore, some nights I couldn’t sleep on their pillows (the fabric makes too much noise). The room has no air condition, but a ceiling fan. They also have free Wi-Fi, a flat screen TV, closet, umbrella, a safe, and an ironing board. BATHROOM: The bathroom was small but decent. I didn’t like how the toilet paper was right against the wall on top of you. You have to actually twist your back around to get it. They should have placed it on the wall in front of you (near the towels) instead of on top of you. That was a disadvantage for me. We had stayed in a remodeled room but my bathtub didn’t look like it was remodeled at all. The paint had peeled off and you will see paint holes in your tub. LOCATION: You will find lots of shopping places and restaurants right outside of Chancellor. Chancellor is near a lot of the popular attractions like: fisherman wharf, Chinatown, Lombard St, etc. The cable cars are right in front of the hotel so it’s very convenient to go to these places. You can buy the Muni pass right there at the tour desk to try it out. Some of the farther places like the Golden Gate Park, GG Bridge, and Palace of Fine Arts were better off if you take your own car. The cable cars don’t go to these places. Waiting for the Muni buses will waste a lot of time and they are always full. We drove instead of taking the buses and were glad we did. HOUSEKEEPING: Everyday cleaning lady always cleaned our room. She gave us extra soap and towels, which was nice of her. NOTE: There will be plenty of homeless people everywhere you go including right outside of Chancellor Hotel. But don’t worry because Chancellor is located where there are lots of people around you so you won’t be alone, kind of like being in New York. We even came prepared with pepper spray just in case, but never even use them. At night this place is pretty quiet, you could barely hear your neighbors or the street noise so I thought that was good about the quietness. Overall, a 4 rating was right for the Chancellor Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, reasonably priced for SF”
Reviews.Author: MovieGuyParadise_CA
Reviews.Content: A colleague and I stayed at the Chancellor on business recently, rooms are clean and comfortable. As with all older SF hotels, the rooms are small, unless you want to pay $150 more per night that is what you get in SF. The Chancellor is a great location, I recommend the booking the parking package if you are driving, you won't find a better deal on hotel parking. Fresh baked cookies at check in.Free Wifi. You can jump on a cable car right outside the front door.Great for shopping, theatre district, and only a easy 5 block walk to Moscone Center.

Reviews.Title: “The Sounds of the City”
Reviews.Author: Nedzer
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed on the fifth floor facing busy Powell Street. Although, I did not hear noise from the neighboring rooms, the noise from outside the hotel was unbelievable. I checked the windows twice to make sure they were closed. It sounded like the street was running right through the room. The windows are not double paned and they are useless in blocking out noise. I felt like I should tip the street musicians on Union Square since it sounded like they were playing in my room. Powell Street is very busy and the noise did not diminish all night. There is no air conditioning and the evening was quite warm. I thought I would be saved by the ceiling fan. In theory, this would provide some cooling air and some white noise. However the fan was so poorly mounted to the ceiling, that even at the lowest speed it shook so badly I was certain it would fall out at any moment. Further it had a noisy and irregular rattle that added to the general cacophony. I would suggest that future guests insist on a room away from the street and check out the ceiling fan before settling in. Other than the noise, which as you can gather, was a big problem, I liked other aspects of the hotel. The location is good, and the price, considering the cost of other comparable hotels was quite reasonable. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful. The room was clean and the bathroom facilities comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Just good enough”
Reviews.Author: IntrepidinMontreal
Reviews.Content: The best thing about the Chancellor Hotel is its location. We stayed there 3 nights and walked down to Powell and Market St. to catch the bus towards Embarcadero/Ferry Building. (We came back on BART to test the subway. TIP: cheaper to pay Bart $1.75 than the $2 bus fare.) We also got on the 38 bus that rides out west on Geary Ave. The central location also puts you in the heart of shopping action, many stores within a 3 block radius. We wanted to try Sears restaurant next door for breakfast but the line was too long, so we took out from Starbucks at the corner of Powell and Sutter. At the opposite corner, there is a drugstore to pick up beverages, snacks and other conveniences. Our two best meals were at Slanted Door (Ferry Building) and Empero Taste on 42nd St. near the Golden Gate Park. We tried Fino Ristorante in Andrews Hotel on Post Street … but it turned out not so fino. Back to the Chancellor Hotel. Overall, we were satisfied with the room for the price we paid. We had two twin beds in a very small room that also included a desk and chair, flatscreen tv on a bureau of drawers, and two more chairs around a small “coffee” table. I was put off by the poor lighting in the bedroom; you have to turn on all the lights to see properly. Fortunately, with all lights on, it was adequate. I laughed at another reader’s comment that the closet was larger than the bathroom. True! Actually, we had to keep closet closed at all times (losing the use of the full-length mirror on the door) because of the horrible odour. It smelled like 1864 in there. The bathroom could use some design tricks – one skimpy towel bar to carry six towels (2 sets of towels) was not wide enough to hang used towels… Why not install a pivoting towel bar on the wall? Only one short hook on the back of the door… Why not install a double hook? Hardly any counter space, certainly not for two people. The best thing in the room was the bed linen – pillows and duvet. Sadly, the same could not be said of the bed mattresses, which sagged in the middle. There is no a/c in the small room, so fortunately, we didn’t need it. If you go in months hotter than Sept, you may want to find another hotel. Such a small room without a/c can be claustrophobic. In the hotel lobby, you can do web check-in for your flight boarding pass. Very handy. While not the best hotel experience, other hotels were charging $20-40 more per night for about the same quality. So overall, Chancellor Hotel was good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Boutique Hotel in GREAT area!”
Reviews.Author: geewalt
Reviews.Content: The Chancellor is quite a find right at Union Square. I did quite a bit of research before deciding on The Chancellor. For the price it was perfect. There are lots of high end hotels around it, but for comfort and value this can't be beat. The hotel: very clean public areas, very friendly staff. My room was still being cleaned when I arrived so went and grabbed a bite and came back. Very friendly bellman retrieved my stored luggage and escorted me up to my room. NOTE: I was impressed with the elevators. There were only two and I was staying on the 13th floor, and they always arrived promptly and moved quickly. The rooms are small but comfortable and nicely appointed. I was traveling alone so the smallness didn't bother me as much as if I had had my wife along. The closet was HUGE. Lots of hanging space with safe, ironing board, umbrella and portable heater all inside with still lots of room for my luggage to sit on the luggage rack. I agree with several reviewers that you should request a high floor. It can get noisy, especially the cable car bell that dings constantly. And there is no A/C, but the open window and ceiling fan keep the room cool (and I was there during a SF "heat wave": 80 degrees! Location is fantastic. 1/2 block to Union Square with shopping and dining galore. I walked the neighborhood and found tons of restaurants, both chains and independent. Scala's is right across the street who's chefs were both on Top Chef. I just ordered a takeaway margarita pizza and it was delish. Transportation is easy to secure. The SF MUNI system is very efficient. While there is a cable car stop right out the hotel door, by the time it gets there from it's origin at the base of Powell street, it was always full. I did catch it early one morning around 8:30 and it wasn't bad. Walk about 2 blocks and you can catch a trolley car to Fisherman's Wharf. The trolley cars are old restored trolley cars from various cities. The city name is printed on the side. I rode one that was from Milan, Italy and still had signs in Italian. They literally are "museums on wheels." And BART line is right there as well, which you can take to and from the airport. I also rode it into Oakland to go to a Rangers/A's game and it was great. Anyway I ramble. Bottom line. Great hotel in a great location for a great price. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Very charming hotel.”
Reviews.Author: CammyO
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful. The staff is first rate. The rooms have been remodeled and are very nice. We were near the end of July and the temps got up to around 80 for a couple of days. We were on the 15th floor and there was no air circulating. There are ceiling fans above the beds. The sun hits the room if you stay on the back side, but there are blackout curtains. Leave the windows closed and curtains drawn during the day. We didn't and it was a little warm when we returned in the evening. You risk the noise from the street if you stay on the front side, as you have to have the windows open that time of year. You still get some noise on the back side, but not as loud. However, I called and asked for another fan, and they were prompt on getting it for me. I'd like to have had a coffee pot in my room. Every morning I had to throw glasses and clothes on and ride 15 floors down to the lobby for a cup of coffee. I got use to it, but it was still a pain. Otherwise, good location, and reasonably priced for such a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel For The Price”
Reviews.Author: Carolind
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chancellor Hotel for 4 nights and had never been to San Francisco before. The hotel itself is right on Union Square so is good if you are wanting to get onto transport or tour buses. There are trams right out front and the tour buses all line up outside Macy's across the road. The hotel itself was nice - while we were there they were re-painting the lobby. The hotel style is sort of like the old victorian style buildings so don't expect modern or sleek at this hotel (not in a bad way). The roooms were tiny - probably the smallest rooms I've ever stayed in but I hear this is normal for San Francisco, especially if you're on a budget. The rooms were clean and tidy, the bed comfy and they had a pillow menu which we didn't use but I thought was a great idea. The bathroom was even smaller and the thing I found funny was that the closet was almost bigger than the bathroom. I would prefer a larger bathroom than some closet space as I just leave my stuff in my suitcase when I'm at hotels, but that's just my opinion. We only went to the bar for an hour or so one night and it's really small so it's not really designed for if you're looking for a night out. There was a market a couple of blocks away from the hotel where we were able to buy beer, toiletries and general stuff. We asked the concierge where we could eat - we aren't foodies so we generally look for averaged priced restaurants, nothing fancy. We were advised that there was a pizza place a few blocks away that was good. As we had spent the whole day travelling to San Fran we weren't looking forward to the hike up the hills to find this place and as we stood outside we noticed right next door a place called Sears Fine Food. After looking at the menu this is exactly the place we were looking for. Reasonably priced food - steaks, pasta, that kind of stuff. The food was great we ate here for dinner twice and breakfast twice. I have no idea why the concierge didn't tell us there was a restaurant right next door. We also used the concierge to book a hop on hop off tour and a city. We are usually the kind who likes to explore on our own but as we only had two days here we wanted to get the most out of the two days. The hop on hop off wasn't worth it. They were meant to loop around ever 15-30mins and we got off to look at the crookedest street and we waited over and hour for them to come back, in the end we rang the tour company to find out if they were going to come back for us! They did come but it was annoying because it took precious time from our schedule. In saying all this, this was nothing to do with the hotel itself. All in all a nice hotel and one of the cheaper around San Francisco. I would probably not stay here again, but only because we aren't "city people" and would most likley visit the outer suburbs of San Francisco if we return.

Reviews.Title: “Best recommendation”
Reviews.Author: Ursula l
Reviews.Content: For many year I chose this Hotel And was never disappointed about the service, location and food. Staff is well trained and could not be friendlier. Mrs. Ursula Lederer.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: norgenvaaz
Reviews.Content: Union Square is a brilliant location if you wish to stay near the city centre. Close to all forms of public transport and get a travel pass if your there for a few days and it gets you on most forms of public transport (except the BART) so it's easy to get around and you then get a choice of which form of transport you want to use - use them all! Hotel is satisfactory and all was good just the room was quite small as they could have got rid of a couple of items of furniture which would have made it a bit more roomy. But we don't see that as real problem as you only sleep, shower and dress in the room so it was fine. I would say it was above average for our needs but not very good but as there is nothing in between we've given it the very good tick of approval.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: Hollies2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights as part of our two week Californian road trip. We absolutely fell in love with San Francisco and this hotel was just what we wanted for our stay. The location is great and it was very good value. It’s not a luxury hotel but the rooms are very clean and have everything you need. The staff we’re friendly and helpful, we particularly liked the barman, we spent several hours in the bar drinking and chatting with him, it was great fun We’d really recommend the Tadich grill as a place to eat in San Francisco, we loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Linny_1975
Reviews.Content: We're about to check-out of the Chancellor after a 3 day stay. The location of the Hotel is great, near Union Square on Powell Street. From the BART station it's a few hundred meters up the hill. The rooms are a bit small, but it was large enough for us. Very clean, nicely decorated, a LCD tv and everything works fine. Beds are good. There is also a safe in the room. The only thing that was not so great was the view when we looked out of our window: we were looking at another wall at the fire exit (room on 2nd floor). The hotel is also very quiet, not enough noise. Breakfast is not included, so you have to pay if you want to have breakfast in the hotel. We had breakfast in the hotel all 3 days, it was very good!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Elliott22
Reviews.Content: The Chancellor is a basic, clean and friendly spot in a perfect location for visiting the core of SF. The rooms and bathrooms are small but clean and the service personnel are very eager to please. It's also next door to Sears Restaurant; a great 3 mael a day restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “It is, what-it-is...”
Reviews.Author: Mim E
Reviews.Content: The Chancellor is not a 4 or 5 star quality hotel (more like 3.5 star), but it is exactly what you are paying for and it is reliable and well worth the 170/night we paid. I would not stay there for business. The rooms are quintessential late 1800’s small, but they have been nicely maintained and newly painted, carpeted, decorated and surprisingly quiet. They feature flat screen TV, full bath with cute amenities, new windows (very nice in SF) and a giant closet! It is great for couples looking for an affordable hotel in Union Square. The only complaint I have is the bed. Although not completely uncomfortable, they are hard; just a step up from a kid mattress; springy. The lobby is outdated and the bell station is static, but the front desk on top of things, courteous, friendly, informative, helpful… everything you would want to be greeted by. There were a lot of younger couples and singles, but completely appropriate for any age. It is not a party hotel. If you are on a budget and want the Union Square area, I would definitely recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous vacation.”
Reviews.Author: Brenda Sullivan S
Reviews.Content: Went with six other ladies to see the sights of San Francisco. The hotel is located in a great area, easy to walk lots of places and convenient for public transit. The staff were very helpful and never lost patience with us :-) The hotel provided coffee, cookies and fruit which was great. The hotel is older but very clean and adequate. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous, fabulous”
Reviews.Author: fluff
Reviews.Content: thanks Wes and all your staff for another wonderful stay. once again everyone was gracious and helpful to the max.

Reviews.Title: “Second visit”
Reviews.Author: BeakerRX
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the Chancellor. This time we stayed for 5 nights and were not disappointed. The Chancellor is so convenient to everything in SF. It's location is right on a stop on the Powell Street cable cars and only 4 blocks from the Powell St BART station. We took the BART train from the airport and its about a 5 minute walk from the station. This visit was for our anniversary and the hotel had a bottle of champagne, chocolates and a gift for us in the room when we arrived. The rooms are very comfortable and you MUST take advantage of the pillow menu. This is THE hotel to stay in in SF if you want great service, nicely appointed and comfortable rooms, convenient location and very good value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Harveysgirl
Reviews.Content: Hubby and I spent 8 days at the Chancellor and had a very pleasant stay. I was very skeptical and worried when I read some of the reviews about small rooms, no air conditioning, thin walls and no coffee maker in the room. I was worried for nothing! We had the best nights sleep ever! The room was just perfect and suited our needs, with a large walk-in closet that included extra pillows, an extra comforter, safe, hangers, ironing board/iron. We were able to put everything away! No need for an air conditioner. We were on the 11th floor facing Powell Street, had a good view of Union Square. We kept the front and bathroom windows open, plus the ceiling fan going and most nights had to close the window because it got chilly in the room! We weren't bothered at all with noise outside because by midnight it was pretty much quiet. The bathroom was small but not overly small and there was plenty of space to place toiletries, so not a big thing. Some reviewers complained of thin walls so I came prepared with ear plugs just in case, but I never even unpacked my earplugs! It was so quiet on our floor and we never heard anything! The hotel is old but with character, the staff were nice and did their job, they are not there to entertain us and were always helpful when needed. We had breakfast in the restaurant 3 times and by far was the best value and best breakfast that we had in San Francisco. Our waiter on our 1st visit to the restaurant started out slow but managed to redeem himself in the end. The all day fresh cookies and coffee in the lobby was better than having to make a mess in the room trying to make coffee. The small bar always had a crowd and we enjoyed the 2 for 1 drink special! And the best part? LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION!!! Could not be beat! Oh and the rate we paid was crazy good! We would definitely stay at the Chancellor again and would recommend it to others! In the end do your research and decide what is important to make your visit comfortable and if the Chancellor does not suit your needs then it is not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good location, great price”
Reviews.Author: ellcee2
Reviews.Content: Don't be put off by the appearance of this hotel's downstairs reception area or staircase, the rooms have been refurbished to a good standard and are very comfortable and spacious for a city center hotel. Walking distance to everywhere, good enough area, helpful staff. Well recommended for a short, budget city break.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, comfortable and good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Al_and_Daz
Reviews.Content: Stayed for five nights and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Yes, the rooms are 'cosy' but in a city like San Francisco there's so much to see and do that you'll not spend long in your room anyway. Stayed in one of the infamous low level, front facing rooms and I have to say the double-glazing works a treat and the room wasn't at all noisy. The free tea and coffee in the lobby is a nice touch. I only used the restaurant for breakfast but found the food quality to be good and reasonably priced. The staff in the restaurant were particularly helpful.

Reviews.Title: “GreatlLocation in a fantastic City”
Reviews.Author: Tom R
Reviews.Content: The hotel was perfectly nice, big room. Great location close to all the shops and the cable car station.

Reviews.Title: “THANK YOU FOR A WONDERFUL 2 WEEK STAY IN YOUR LOVELY HOTEL !”
Reviews.Author: sevillafan
Reviews.Content: I chose the Chancellor Hotel after reading all the positive reviews on TA and was not disappointed. Everything was just as described. I booked directly with the hotel and the communications were very prompt and helpful with our requests. I stayed with my grandson in a twin room on the 7th floor. We could see Macys and Union Square from our window and hear the cable cars go past. It was perfect for us and the sounds from the street were not a problem, even with the window open. It added to the charm of the hotel and this great city. I can't praise the staff enough, from the ladies when we checked in to the the lovely May who looked after our room for the two weeks. Special thanks to Mike who was so helpful when I needed to send a fax at 2.30AM, due to the time difference in England. All the staff on the front desk were so polite and helpful no matter how often we asked for advice, We bought tickets for a 49ers game from them and the seats were great. We booked a trip to Monterey from the tour desk. That was very handy. We didn't make use of the gym option as we were so busy with other things but it's a great free extra if it's your thing. The free wi fi was a bonus, especially the free use of a PC and printer for when we had to book extra baggage to take home our purchases from the shoppers paradise that is SF. This is the first holiday ever that I only used one cab !! That was when we arrived from SFO to the hotel. Between the fab hotel location as so much was walking distance, and our 7 day Muni passes we must have covered most of the city . Apologies for this review being long ! It bugs me when I've read the negative comments as they mostly mention things that people should be aware of when they book this hotel' or are not about the hotel directly. Keep up the good work Chancellor, You will def be my hotel of choice if I get the opportunity to return to SF.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly disappointed”
Reviews.Author: MM1027
Reviews.Content: We just completed a 4 night stay in the Chancellor. We chose the hotel based on reviews on trip advisor. With the hotel ranked in the top 10, it's fair to say that we had high expectations. By far the best aspect of our stay was the location. It's right on Union Square so perfect for shopping and getting the cable car to Fishermans Wharf. We were even close enough to walk to the Wharf on a couple of occasions. We found the hotel itself to be quite average. The service was fine and staff perfectly friendly. The room itself was okay if a little small (although we were prepared for this from doing some research). We were quite disappointed with the cleanliness of the bathroom. It looked like the tub could have done with a good clean. Overall we were satisfied with our stay. The location definitely made it worthwhile but still can't understand why it's ranked in the top 10.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, good value, but not a fan of Union Sq”
Reviews.Author: ChrissyF123
Reviews.Content: I wanted to stay in the Union Sq area because I had stayed in the area once before and thought it would be convenient for the airport, BART, restaurants, and sight seeing. I choose the Chancellor because it was a good price ($145 a night + tax) and had gotten written up in the NY Times for its bedbug prevention strategy. Coming from NYC I am super paranoid about bedbugs and a lot of hotels in SF have bedbug reports, so the Chancellor gave me piece of mind in that regard. And the hotel itself was fine, but nothing too fancy. I also appreciated the fact they let me check in early (around 11 am), even though I hadn't requested early check in. But I must say I was NOT a fan of Union Sq this time around. Maybe it has gotten worse since my last trip, or maybe it was super crowded because it was a holiday weekend, but it was absolutely mobbed with tourists, to the point where it was difficult to walk on Powell St from the BART to the hotel. It reminded me of Times Square and that is not a good thing -- like most New Yorkers I typically avoid Times Square like the plague.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in beautiful SF”
Reviews.Author: SML1969
Reviews.Content: Soundless nights (in a busy street) are great. There are a lot of bus stops nearby, heading to everywhere in SF. Good value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly, comfortable and worth the money”
Reviews.Author: iagray206
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for union square and shopping. Very professional and friendly staff. Convenient tour desk who were proactive in ensuring I was taken care of for airport transfers, activities etc. Room was small, but pleasantly furnished and very clean. Hotel itself is older but charming. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “THANK YOU!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lebanon52999
Reviews.Content: Outstanding location! Entire staff was outstanding!!! Just came back fron EUROPE--they can learn a lesson from the CHANCELLOR STAFF!!

Reviews.Title: “A good experience, and a perfect location for our purposes”
Reviews.Author: Peggy v
Reviews.Content: We knew nothing of the Chancellor other than reading positive online reviews, and decided to take a chance. It more than satisfied our hopes. We loved walking right out the door to the cable car stop (and could purchase ride passes at the hotel), and being so near Union Square and places to eat. My husband loved being so near Walgreen's and it's 24/7 icees! We used Lorrie's shuttle service both ways and were very satisfied with it as well.

Reviews.Title: “Overall an excellent position to take advantage of the many attractions in San Fran.”
Reviews.Author: Emuchick
Reviews.Content: There is a cable car stop at the door and a short walk to other Muni transport as a quick and cheap way to get around. The hotel was clean and staff friendly and a spot of trouble with tickets bought for the red bus was quickly and efficiently dealt with. Easy walking to major shops to browse and plenty of varied eateries nearby. The only gripe I really have is that there were no tea/coffee making facilities in the room. They do supply free tea/ coffee and cookies downstairs but when you are tired after walking around all day and have had a shower you don't feel like dressing again to get a late night cup of tea. We bought a jug and a couple of mugs fairly cheaply (around $20) and made our own early morning and late night teas. Overall a good experience and one I'd recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice in Union Square”
Reviews.Author: funfamilytime
Reviews.Content: Close proximity to shopping, restaurants and cable cars. Clean and comfortable rooms, albeit quite small. Friendly, helpful staff. Excellent value for the location. Others have already written great reviews ... that's how we came to choose The Chancellor Hotel for our trip!

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch for Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: teammcw
Reviews.Content: Let me start with the con - It is an older hotel. The pros - Location, location, location. Value, value, value. The rooms were clean. The pillow menu is great. There were about 8 or so pillows you could request in addition to what was already in the room. The staff was great. The hotel is across the street from a cable car stop and a 5-10 minute walk from a public bus stop. Next door is a great restaurant with large portions, comfort foof, and wallet friendly prices. The wait is long at breakfast but I would recommend it for dinner. I appreciated the apples in the lobby in the morning. It saved me money for breakfast and was a healthy snack. The evening cookies were great too. Inside the hotel is a stand that sells postcards, muni passes, etc. If I ever visit SF again, I would stay at the Chancellor.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed it, central in union square, good room and services”
Reviews.Author: Guyonatrip
Reviews.Content: Pulled up outside and it didn't have a large frontage but everything else about this hotel was great. Good room and services. Great location for food, shopping and the trams. Enjoyed it and will be back. Now in hawaii for some sun

Reviews.Title: “Ethical and Honest”
Reviews.Author: Christine U
Reviews.Content: In addition to the nice, clean accommodations, excellent location, complimentary coffee, tea, cookies and apples, this hotel is staffed with people of integrity!! When I realized on my way to the airport that I had left all of my jewelry on the desk in my room, I was panicked. My jewelry consisted of 5 gold, diamond and gemstone rings and a pair of gold earrings. The value was considerable, but the sentimental value was even higher (including my father's wedding band). I called the hotel immediately and they assured my that the housekeeping staff would be made aware of this and they would return my belongings via overnight delivery service (at my cost of course...no problem since it was my fault). The package arrived to my home the next business day!! Everything was there and I was thrilled!!

Reviews.Title: “Happy in SF”
Reviews.Author: ScubadiverNy
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a pleasant surprise. It was right in the heart of Union Square and easily accessible to other points of interest by cable car or trolley. The room was a bit small, but I knew that going in and adapted quickly. However, it's more comfortable that a cabin in cruise ship. I was also impressed with the cleanliness and the "ambiance and charm" of the hotel. When I return to SF on business, I hope to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A friendly, comfortable hotel in the centre of San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: TravellingMan53
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice during a trade show I normally attend annually in January. The staff are very polite and it felt like home very quickly, which was good, since I stayed for nearly 1 week on both occasions. The rooms were clean, there was 24 hour coffee in the lobby (with warm cookies if you timed it right). There was a commercial gym round the block at the back of the hotel, temporary membership for which was included in the room rate. This offered plenty of equipment, nice showers and a unisex steamroom in each changing room. Right on Union Sqare, so a short walk from major department stores, good restaurants and the convention centre

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: disneyfan1002
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. Right on the trolley line, which gives you great access to all downtown attractions and not far from Fisherman's Wharf. Very clean room, just a tad small but the bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was spotless.Complimentary newspapers, coffee, cookies and fruit each day too.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, comfortable & welcoming right in Union Square!”
Reviews.Author: QtownTraveller
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Chancellor for three nights this past August. Tired from a week on the road to get there, the staff were friendly and helpful from the get go. Check-in was quick and easy. Self-parking is secure and very close (one block walking) to the hotel. You can't beat the location of the Chancellor - so many cool neighbourhoods within walking distance, or an easy ride away on the cable cars or bus. Rooms may seem small, but who spends more time than sleeping in their room while visiting this awesome city? I would recommend the Chancellor to anyone! I suggest buying a multi-day transit pass for affordable and easy exploring while in San Fran!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price for 1st time in San Fran”
Reviews.Author: snackaddict
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 3 nights, location was great and super close to cable cars/transit and shopping nearby. Check in was easy, they even had a parking in the front just to park the car temporarily and unload. Room was decent, with only the bathrooms smaller than expected, but it is an older hotel. When we first arrived in the room, there was a musty smell but after we got the fan going it was fine. Did not get a chance to try their pillow menu, but the choices were interesting. We were on one of the higher floors facing the back of the hotel, so luckily we didn't hear too much noice as other reviewers had mentioned. Had breakfast mainly next door at Sears Restaurant- really reasonable and good food. Overall for the great location and price would definitely go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Another perfect stay -- this time just for a weekend for a family wedding and reunion!”
Reviews.Author: terpnut
Reviews.Content: I'm a repeat customer with high expectations, and Wes and the Chancellor delivered again! Small but comfortable rooms, perfect central location, and consistently great service! We also like the little touches like the free coffee and cookies in the lobby, free use of a computer & printer, a small but wonderful hotel restaurant for breakfast/lunch, and candies in the room (my kids and their dentist love this!). The only reason this hotel doesn't always get 5 star reviews on TripAdvisor is because some people don't realize that the Chancellor is an old hotel and there are a few things they CAN'T have or do. The Chancellor fully discloses these limitations so it's not their fault when people don't read and get these amenities. The Chancellor does NOT have the following: (a) large rooms (thus no double double bed rooms for example), (b) large modern lobby, elevators or hallways, (c) air conditioning, (d) on-site gym or (e) pool. Air conditioning is virtually unnecessary in San Francisco and even during 90 degree plus days (and we once stayed during such a summer "heat wave"), the hotel was very comfortably cool. If that isn't sufficient, each room does have ceiling fans. As for working out, the Chancellor has an arrangement with one of the best downtown private gyms located just around the block, so if you don't mind the one block walk (hey, you're going to workout right?), then this is actually an asset! And they have everything that we consider important: quiet, comfortable and clean rooms; free building-wide wifi, wonderful service (front desk, housekeeping, bellmen and restaurant staff), and nice other amenities. Anyhow, thanks for another super stay! We'll be back again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location”
Reviews.Author: CJ1920
Reviews.Content: We arrived in San Francisco after four days in Vancouver and a week cruising in Alaska. We were left slightly scared by the taxi driver who portrayed the city as a murder hotspot but found it to be one of the best cities we have visited. The hotel room seemed a little small when we first arrived, but if we kept it tidy there was no issue with space. It was clean and had all the facilities we needed. The location is unbeatable, right on Union Square and opposite Saks - the tour bus (if you choose to take one) stops almost across the road. We had a drink in the bar one night and picked up some useful city tips from the bar staff. We both appreciated the use of the computer by reception - free internet to check emails was a nice extra.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't praise this hotel enough-Amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: sarah5320
Reviews.Content: This hotel receives excellent review after review for a reason! First the location is fantastic, right on Union Square on Powell Street. All the shops you could want on the door step. Fishermans wharf is a pleasant 30 minute walk away straight down Powell St. Alternatively if you don't fancy braving the hills then the Cable cars stop right out the front door. A taxi cost less than $10. We walked to te wharf there and back every day for 4 days and enjoyed the walk. Next the rooms are great, very comfortable bed, pillow menu with a choice of a dozen pillows. All the usual room amenities tv, iron, safe, toiletries, rubber duck, ceiling fan. We were there during the height of summer and didn't need any air con, the ceiling fan was more than sufficient. Also noise was not an issue as some other reviews have stated. As we were on honeymoon we even received a bottle of champagne, chocolates and even a photo frame as a present. The hotel bar is great for cocktails and Rory the bar tender gave us some fantastic recommendations for restaurants. Scala the Italian across the road is very good. We also ate at a plae called First Crush which was a few blocks away and very good too. The coffee, cookies and popcorn available in reception all day every day is a lovely touch. They don't have coffee making facilities in the room but it is no bother nipping down for some. This hotel is amazing value and I would definately stay here again without a second thought! Thanks to the Chancellor for kicking off our honeymoon in style.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: jeanettemh
Reviews.Content: I spent 9 days in SF on a mother/daughter trip. No need to rent a car. This hotel is on the cable car line and only a short walk to the Subway. Union square is right outside the door. Great value. Staff was great. Food was great. Would stay again on a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not as good as the first time”
Reviews.Author: CUTiger81
Reviews.Content: This was the second time I stayed at this location. For a more full review, please see my first review of the Chancellor Hotel. Overall, it was a good experience. My only problem was with the housekeeping staff. I got the feeling that some of the staff were behind schedule and just did a spot check clean or they just didn't care. Over the course of the stay, the room was not cleaned as well as I thought it should have been. I filled the ice bucket the first day of our stay and it was never emptyed the remainder of the trip. There were a few times the dirty towels in the bathroom were not replaced (once they were just left on the floor or hanging up and new towels on the chair next to the bed). I am not totally writing off this hotel. Outside of this issue, I enjoyed my stay. The young lady at the lounge was very friendly as well as the front desk staff. I will give the Chancellor one more chance before I make a final decision.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT hotel! Very clean and perfect location! LOVED IT!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TriciaTravels
