Reviews.Content: Hotel was great! Very clean, friendly staff, and the location could not be any better! Just a random fyi -- stay away from a district called Tenderloin, it's not the safest place I've ever been. Other than that the city was great fun and enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Boutique hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: lutherkins
Reviews.Content: The chancellor is an older boutique hotel so the rooms are fairly small and there are things that give away it's age. However, it was comfortable, clean, and the staff was friendly. One complaint: the fan in our room made an annoying noise if you put it on the top speed. The hotel does not have air conditioning so I was concerned about sleeping at night due to the temperature; however, at night the temp drops enough that we didn't need the fan on full blast. The location was awesome! You can catch any type of transportation within about 2 blocks of the hotel. One thing to note though is the street noise. It didn't bother us at night because we kept the window closed, but it would have been a problem with the window open.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel, Perfect Location, Perfect Vacation”
Reviews.Author: LyndsJM
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I recently stayed at the Chancellor Hotel for 4 nights while on vacation. We chose this hotel solely based on tripadvisor reviews ( as per usual for me ) We were greeted by smiles and friendly staff, and even though we arrived around 1130 our room was ready when we arrived. I had emailed the hotel and requested a room on a higher floor on the backside as some reviews said it could be very noisy. We had room 1505 and I had no problems with noise. There aren't rooms on either side so we didn't hear anyone else at any time. The only noise we heard was from the ice machine which was on the other side of the shower. ( No big deal ) At night, as we were facing Union Square, it was quiet as long as we had the window closed. We ate breakfast in the hotel one morning, it was good! Our waiter was hilarious and the food was really good, and a little cheaper than other restaurants in the same area. For the price the hotel was perfect, the hotel was awesome the staff was great, not single complaints here! It was really nice to have the pillow menu, they have... 8, 10? on the menu that you can chose from, that was a really nice added touch. A few recommendations... The hotel is walking distance to the Wharf, Ferry Terminal and all the touristy spots. It took maybe.. 30? 45? minutes to walk to the Wharf, but is a beautiful walk. You can walk through China Town to avoid the hills if that's easier for you. When you arrive you get a package, there's a $5 off coupon for Bike and Roll bike rentals. We rented our bikes from there for $27, other places were a bit more expensive ( up to $35 at some places) I would definately recommend biking from the Wharf over the Golden Gate Bridge and into Sausilito (sp?) The ride isn't to bad ( a few hills ) and beautiful views of the bridge along the way. Riding over the bridge is just something you need to do, it's a great fun experience and a beautiful ride ( my bf even proposed while we were stopped on the bridge :) ) I would also recommend walking to the Ferry Terminal and buying fresh bread and cheese and having a picnic where you can find a spot. The ferry Terminal has awesome shops and restaurants that you shouldn't miss. All in all, San Francisco is a wonderful city and the Chancellor Hotel is the perfect place to spend your vacation. Oh.. if you're a sushi fan.. hit up Maru Sushi, just 2 blocks up.. best sushi I've had...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel....Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Paluppy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located in Union Square! So close to the square, restaurants, shopping and Chinatown. We had a great room on the 15th floor. We could open our window to hear all of the energy of the city, but all was quiet when the window was closed. Loved being able to look out of the window at the city and the neon signs from the Starlight room at the Sir Francis Drak Hotel right across the street. The cable car stop i right outside the front door. The hotel staff was incredibly frriendly and accomodating. Would definatly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed!”
Reviews.Author: jodaly
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Chancellor hotel about a week ago. San Francisco was the last leg of our road trip and we wanted to stay somewhere comfortable with a good location. We picked the Chancellor due to the very affordable room rates and reviews. We were not dissapointed. As soon as we got there, the staff was friendly and helpful. We valet our car which is a little expensive ($30 a night) but we are in a city and this is the way it is. We were aware of this. We checked in on the highest floor because I had heard it can be a bit noisy. Our room was small, very clean and fit our needs perfectly. The room does have a huge closet where we were able to store our luggage and belongings. The bed was very comfortable! E very morning I went and got free coffee in the lobby which is offered all day. This hotel is very warm and inviting. The only complaint I have, which is not the hotel's fault ,was there is construction going on on Powell St so if you want your windows open, it is all you hear. Generally speaking, we did not spend much time in the room and at night the construction was finished. Wonderful Restaurant across the Street. Delicious Italian!! We did use the cable cars but to be honest, it is great for the experience not if you are on a time schedule! Being that it is "tourist" season, most of them were usually packed and it was tough to get on. By the last day, we decided to take cabs. (which arent easy to get in this city either) Overall, great experience, would go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, tiny room - but who spends time in the room anyway??”
Reviews.Author: nelidee
Reviews.Content: Great location. We could walk almost everywhere! Would recommend it. When we first arrived we were greeted by the stench of urine outside the door. But that happens in San Fran, we got over that quickly. The staff were polite and courteous. I loved that the hotel (and everyone else in san fran) gave a sh** about the environment. We were given a plastic bag in the hotel room to collect recyclables, and encouraged not to renew towels. The bed was really comfortable, and the room was surprisingly quiet given the busy location. Yes.. I think I would stay there again. The small room really didn't matter. We were literally only there to sleep, shower and change... San fran has too many awesome things to see and do (and eat!)

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Sierra_Coll
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved this hotel. The staff were very friendly and eager to help. Cookies and fruit were supplied daily in the lobby. We were on the 14th flour up above any possible traffic noise. With our window open every night we were serenaded with a saxaphone which only added to the atmosphere. The room was big enough for two with a fridge and a great walk-in closet. The Chancellor even has a pillow menu, which I was happy to try out. We would highly recomend this hotel for anyone to stay in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great location ― Over furnished rooms.”
Reviews.Author: dr-sea-breeze
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location just off Union Square. It's very central to transit especially if you don't want to have to take a taxi to get to the hotel. The rooms are European style: small, comfortable, very clean, but over furnished. Our room had far too much bulky furniture. Given the size of the room, they would do better with having one small chair and table. There is no central air / or air conditioning. So if you're travelling in warmer months, you might find your room gets too warm. We were travelling in May (average 18C / 67F) and found it airless. The windows do open, but with the fire escape right there, we didn't feel safe having the windows open wide at night. The elevators are small and slow. The front desk staff were okay. Nothing special to note there ― they did their job with such lacklustre. But the man offering tour / visitor info opposite the front desk was very helpful. The bartender was also quite friendly. I think that on our next visit to San Francisco we'll look for other places to stay before returning here. That's not to say we won't return, but we'd like to explore other options offering something with a little more wow factor.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, excellent pricing, wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: DrmnOfMaui
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location!! The Chancellor Hotel is located conveniently in midst of Union Square with easy access to shopping, dining and transportation. Hopping on a cable car nearly in front of the hotel was not only a fun event for the kids, but the perfect way to reach Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 33 to Alcatraz, Ghirardelli, China Town and so much more. The staff was always friendly and extraordinarily helpful (particularly the bellman!), and yes the cookies were in the lobby and they were warm. No, there is no air conditioning, but a nice ceiling fan made up for that along with windows that open wide to the street below, plus August is usually cool with foggy days and evening. While I enjoyed the sounds of the city late into the evening, my husband was frustrated with the noise and had trouble sleeping. I've read that a request for a high floor on the back of the hotel may eliminate this problem. The room was appealing with a comfortable bed, and the candy dish made the kids smile. The hotel is lined with old fashioned fire escapes and I was heard to quickly proclaim "NO!" as my 12 year old daughter asked "Is that our balcony and can I go out there??" Luques was marginal... pricey for Dennys-like fare, I would not return. My recommendation is to try Honey Honey Crepery just down the street and around the corner. Charming hotel at a wonderful price in a very desirable location. My hotel of choice for trips to SF! To read more visit: http://livlifetoo.blogspot.com/2011/08/san-francisco-tourist-union-square.html

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Location”
Reviews.Author: Rob1065
Reviews.Content: Location was great right at Union Square and the cable car to Fisherman's Wharf ran right in front of hotel. Staff were friendly and rooms were clean. The free coffee & cookies in the lobby was a nice touch. The water pressure in the shower was the best I've ever had in a hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “This is a wonderful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: lkinney
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took a well needed vacation to SF and chose this from reviews on this site. It is perfectly located - 1/2 block from Union Square, walking distance to Powell St. BART station, and the cable car runs directly in front of the hotel. The hotel itself is small but wonderful. Staff was very helpful, from front desk, to room staff, to the tour guide at the booth in the lobby. The rooms were very nice, clean, and comfortable. The giant king bed was great after a long day of seeing the sights. Wireless internet access was FAST - (we took two laptops and were uploading pics faster than at home). Our room overlooked Powell street and the street noise was perceptible but not loud at all - kind of added to the ambiance. Also - the bathtub was full-sized and DEEP. You could fill it up and soak after a day of walking the hills and it felt great! There is also a Walgreens around the corner and a Starbucks nearby, so you can pick up anything you forgot, grab a snack or a coffee, at any time of the day or night. Very helpful on a tourist trip. Overall, we loved the hotel, loved the location, the price was just right, and we'd be happy to recommend this hotel to anyone. We will definitely come back here next time.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel... great location...best cookies”
Reviews.Author: EricOlthwaite
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights and found it all to be a thoroughly enjoyable experience. The staff were efficient , friendly and attentive - and, having e-mailed the Manager, Wes, before arriving, he gave some great advice about what to do in our limited time in the city. Location is fantastic - just by Union Square. Best of all - the great cookies on reception. Yum. If you're looking for somewhere to eat nearby, the Bangkok Noodle bar, just a block down the road is an unassuming, great value place with knockout food - particularly the soups. The Chancellor was a great place to stay in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Claire A
Reviews.Content: Kicked off a 2 week holiday with 5 nights here. It's a perfect location, right on Union Square, and the rooms were comfy, cosy and had plenty of space for the 2 of us. There was a bottle of cava waiting in the room on arrival and free coffee and tea available 24 hours a day in the lobby. I would definitely recommend this hotel for first trip to San Francisco. It's really central, easy to get around from and trams run past from early in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Colleen47
Reviews.Content: Chancellor Hotel was in a good location. We followed some of the reviews and requested a room on an upper level on the backside. We were not disappointed. People were very accommodating and polite. We definitely will use this hotel again. Superb location.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great staff and perfect location !!!”
Reviews.Author: Eddie A
Reviews.Content: San Francisco was the 1st stop of our vacations in US and we were really very happy from our hotel's choice. Chancellor is located in the center of the city, where you can find all the shops, trasportation (the cable car pass in front) and night life after sunset. Union Square was a safe place to walk even after dark. The hotel was very clean and quiet, the rooms not large like Las Vegas, but very confortable , with a large wardrobe with safe, free WiFi, TFT TV etc. The Ice Maker in every floor was perfect for our morning iced coffee. The vallet parking useful and almost the same money with self parking. Don't miss Sears Fine Food for breakfast, just right to hotel's entrance.

Reviews.Title: “In the Middle of Union Square...Awesome...”
Reviews.Author: Kelly M
Reviews.Content: We stayed @ the Chancellor Hotel on a Saturday in August. We had tickets to go see the S.F. Giant's vs. the Phillies. The front desk allowed us to check-in early because our rooms were clean and ready to go... We checked in and hopped in a taxi, and made in time to catch the National Anthem. After the game we came back to our beautiful room on the 13th floor overlooking a Union Square and the Cable Cars running up and down Powell St.. Our friends had the room next door, so we opened up the door between the rooms and had a cocktail before hitting the town...We didn't need our car because there are plenty of restaurants and shops within walking distance Union Square and the Chancellor Hotel. We stayed out on the town, and ended our evening @ the Chancellor's Bar. After meeting friendly fellow guests @ the bar, we retired back to our comfortable room. We definitely plan on coming back to the Chancellor Hotel, for more memories...

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of the city by the bay”
Reviews.Author: AcemanAndSpam
Reviews.Content: Generally speaking, excellent value. The room was small but comfortable, and the bed exceptional. The small bar provided reasonably priced beer. The restaurant is good quality, but rather over-priced, which is par for the city. As for noise, depends what you like. I quite appreciated the ring of the cable cars, but the bugle player on Union square needs shot. Friendly staff, always willing to talk about the baseball, which is on in the bar. The location cannot be beat. If you want to pay through the roof for the big name places across the street, be my guest, but for most people, the Chancellor is as good value for money as you'll get in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “No hesitation in recommending this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: CatherineBath
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. We had ainterconnecting rooms, though overlooking busy street they were very quiet. Ice maker further along corridor for my G+T. Very clean and such comfortable beds. Staff very friendly and helpful. "Bar" a bit soulless so we didn't use it, but free coffee and tea in lobby available at all times to compensate for none in room. Discovered after a couple of days that the restaurant for breakfast had better food and cheaper than diners nearby, though not as much fun. Very central location on Union Square which was a very pleasant place for people watching at all times of day, and right next to tourist bus stops. Don't be put off by lack of a/c. We were there in a heatwave and didn't even need the ceiling fans. Note could be long queues for buses for particular trips- well worth going over Golden Gate Bridge.If full , better to wait for the next one- liely to follow soon after. Alcatraz tour great, also tram ridesand the "Science Museum " in Golden Gate Park had a great aquarium. Easy to catch regular bus back int town. Japanese Tea garden very over-rated , similar to free municipal botanical gardens in UK.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, Clean, and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jlsatud
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at the Chancellor. It's right off Union Square, close to lots of shopping and public transportation. The rooms and bathroom are small because it's an older property, but everything is updated and clean. Everyone at the front desk is helpful. We booked through Hotwire and were NOT treated like second class citizens, like has happened in other places. I really appreciated that! Although we didn't take advantage of the service, they had a pillow menu on the bedside table which is fun and different. It's a good idea to get a Muni pass so that you can use the cable cars, street cars, and bus routes because there are a lot of hills between Union Square and the other tourist spots you'll probably be visiting.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mswheeldon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights at the beginning of our California coast drive holiday and were not disappointed. Our room was well equipped and comfortable. The staff were very welcoming, polite and helpful. Cookies and coffee were available throughout the day in the lobby and the breakfast in the hotel was very good. It was a very memorable stay made even more pleasant listening to the trolley bell and the lone saxophonist playing on the street corner as we drifted off to sleep. Wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Great, Central Location”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Bea_2010
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights in San Francisco as part of our honeymoon. The Chancellor was a solid contender. The rooms were clean and quiet, the staff friendly and the location wonderful. We walked to Fishermans wharf to the Financial District and back (there are trams for those not inclined to tackle San Frans hills : ) ) Happy hour was good value, drinks were well made and the complementary popcorn a bonus. As it was our honeymoon there was champagne and chocolates on our arrival which was a lovely gesture. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location!”
Reviews.Author: MaryJo72
Reviews.Content: The Chancellor Hotel is situated on Union Square and close to everything. The cable cars are in front of the hotel and you can go anywhere from here. The hotel was very nice and clean. In the lobby free coffee and tea 24 hours. The staff extremely nice and helpful. My room was on the second floor and was nice and quiet. Not too big but I didn't need more space for my four days visit to San Francisco. Breakfast good and healthy. When you check in you receive a discount for breakfast. Value for money for this hotel on a first class location!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it - exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: paula-from-nz
Reviews.Content: A very quaint hotel built in 1914 or thereabouts. This means the room is a little smaller than most. We had two single beds which were very comfortable. The room had a large wardrobe with a safe and a bathroom with a shower and bath. I loved how they'd kept the vintage hotel feel but had modern amenities. Of particular note were the apples and cookies at reception along with tea and coffee. The room had a jar of sweets/candy and in the bathroom were earbuds and cotton wool balls which you never usually get. Great location too, 1 block from Union Square and on the Cable Car line. Next door is a Walgreens and across the road is a Starbucks. Would definitely recommend this hotel. Also there was a book exchange on the mezzanine floor near the elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait to Return Visit the Chancellor Hotel”
Reviews.Author: joeei b
Reviews.Content: Service was excellent, can't say enough about the staff. Housekeeping even left us a thank you note for their tip-that has never happened in any hotel/motel I've ever visited. Room was small and comfortable, clean, and they even have a pillow list of several kinds of pillows for your personal comfort. Location was fantastic, right next to Union Square. Bath salts, soaps, shampoos, rubber ducky, umbrella, ceiling fan, flat-screen tv, in-room safe, great bed and bedding. All this for a great price. Lobby is intimate, updated, elegant and free internet. They have a small bar area and fantastic restaurant open for breakfast and lunch along with home-made cookies, popcorn and goodies all complimentary. Even a small gift store in lobby. I can't imagine what else anyone would need. We met an elderly couple from Ireland who were back for their 5th visit and never stay anywhere but the Chancellor. We loved it and will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay did the job”
Reviews.Author: PaulSHarris
Reviews.Content: We used reviews from this site to book our stay at this hotel and they were pretty bang on, so we knew what to expect. We had coolish weather and ended up with a room not facing Powell St. which worked out well, we both wear ear plugs at night any ways so noise was not a issue but might be if one is not used to it. The character of the hotel was evident and we appreciated that, no problems with elevator waits that sort of thing. Check in went pretty smooth, but I must say we got lucky I believe because I was able to get a parking spot pretty quick for the unloading of our bags, this could be a issue for sure if you had to circle block. I drove to the parking garage myself easy just around corner and from there its a valet service so if you have a valet key, bring it. The small lounge in the hotel was nice to use on occasion, and the complimentary cookies,coffee,tea, and papers were appreciated. The restaurant in hotel we only went to once for breakfast so sorry not much info there,we also requested a fridge for our room and got that at no charge. Overall we were happy with our stay, with the high price of parking in the city the ability to stay right down in Union Square was wonderful for us, this was our 3rd time in S.F. and the first time we stayed close to the square, very safe. We also might recommend for people that sleep in a king bed at home, getting the twin option might be the way to go by know means the hotels fault because there is no space but queen beds are a little lacking, pillows and bedding are very nice. Check out was easy but again I recommend a early start on the day if driving as traffic heading out of town is minimal, and be warned depending on what time you drive into S.F. it can be very busy at tool booth, so plan accordingly. Check out Sears Diner next door, as well as the places in Little Italy, lots of great food. Dont stand and Union Station to get a cable car too busy in summer get up early and have a fun ride to Fisherman's Wharf before people get out there, enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable and Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: charris714
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Chancellor for 3 nights in early August. It was a great choice for our first trip to the city--the staff was helpful, the location is excellent, and the rooms are well-appointed. There are also many unique details that make this hotel memorable: the pillow menu, the adorbale rubby ducky in the bathroom, the free coffee tea and cookies in the lobby (at all hours), and the super comfy bed. The rooms are quite small, but the closets are large enough to hold all of your luggage and serve as a dressing room, so we never felt too crowded. The front desk staff was very helpful, and we enjoyed meeting fellow guests at the bar. One of the best breakfast joints in the city is located right next door (Sears), and there's also a Walgreens on the block for snacks and other necessities. This is not a luxury hotel--and it's not priced like one--but it is extremely comfortable and charming. If you're looking to stay in Union Square on a budget, this is the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “OK for an overnight”
Reviews.Author: triptots
Reviews.Content: The hotel worked well for us because of its location near union square and the BART system. We arrived late and checked out the next morning. Additional pluses were the free wifi, nice staff, good beds and price. Down sides were the absence of air conditioning and fridge/mini bar, lots of city noise, tiny bathrooms, peeling paint and a lobby that needs a remodel. Would not recommend this hotel unless, like us, your stay is only for one night.

Reviews.Title: “The reviews are all true.”
Reviews.Author: CalCanuck
Reviews.Content: I've been to San Francisco many times and after reading all of the positive reviews I decided that on this trip I wanted to stay at the Chancellor. You won't be disappointed. Yes the rooms are small but they are updated, clean and comfortable. The service is excellent. I requested a fridge and discovered that it quit working overnight. Within 5 minutes of calling the front desk someone was at the door with a replacement! With the windows open you can hear a lot of street noise but once I closed them I couldn't hear any outside noise. I didn't expect the windows to be that soundproof You can't beat the location or the service.

Reviews.Title: “love the location”
Reviews.Author: skysydney
Reviews.Content: small hotel in great location next to union square - rooms are small but adequate . Free internet in reception , breakfast was fine and inexpensive . Best discovery was SCALA italian eatery accross the street - best food ever :)

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Averagejo2020
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading the reviews on trip advisor and I can saftely say I've not been disappointed. The Chanceller is in a very central location in the city, great for shopping with department stores and higher end shops minutes away. Acsess to public transport is good, cable car right outside and buses jus on the corner. Our room was 704, quite compact for an American hotel, more like something you would find in England with dark wood furniture and marble worktops but functional. The only thing which let's this room down was a lack of a view, a billboard obstructs the view of union square. Maybe the rooms a little higher are a bit more lucky? Free wifi helped me plan and navigate the city as well as keep friends updated with our holiday progress from my iPhone. Also the hotel app came in handy with deals and a good list of places to eat out in the area, a very nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: SBW2009
Reviews.Content: This was our third hotel on our honeymoon and was the only one that made us feel totally special. Everything about hotel was outstanding, although there is no kettle in rooms there is a tea and coffee station in the lobby which is always well stocked with cookies and popcorn in the evening! Can't wait to revisit!

Reviews.Title: “Fun little European style hotel”
Reviews.Author: TallSH
Reviews.Content: GREAT rooms - very clean and very comfortable!!! LOTS and LOTS of street noise (but the beds are very nice)- YYYEEEOOOOWWWW - but it should be expected, you are in the city - AND right on historic Powell Street! EXCELLENT Service - mediocre restaurant and breakfast - that was the only disappointment. Try to get a higher room and if possible, not on the street if you don't like noise. Very, very 'cute' in a european way.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you read is true - this is a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: stephrouthier
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our honeymoon, 4 nights of which was spent in SF at the Chancellor Hotel. Our impressions are very like a recent, previous review - upon checking in, we were informed that we were upgraded tot he best suite in the hotel - room 1502, on the top floor, with amazing views over union square. We had a sitting room, 2 full bathrooms, 2 TVs (not that we used them!), fridge and coffee making facilities, a pillow menu, and an awesome fire escape that we could sit out on in the evenings and just listen to the music drifting up from union square, admiring the views. We were given a free bottle of champagne and a picture frame as a special honeymoon present, which was a lovely touch. All staff we met were extremely friendly and helpful (special mention to Matt - you were great, always anticipating needs and so helpful - thanks :) But really, everyone was great. We had breakfast a few times in the dining room, and enjoyed that each time, and also enjoyed the bar for a drink before heading out each evening. The location is perfect, right on union square, right beside a cable car stop, and just down the street from a major transport hub, with MUNI bus, BAST and street cars very plentiful. All in all, this part of our honeymoon was our favorite, due to the fact that SF is such an amazing city, but especially because of how great the Chancellor is. Thank you for making our honeymoon so memorable; we will definitely be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Price/quality relation”
Reviews.Author: Lucas001977
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel with a very good location (just steps from Union Square). The room are clean and the staff very helpfull. Not a luxury hotel, but we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to cable car”
Reviews.Author: 4traveleyes
Reviews.Content: The Chancellor Hotel is a great place to stay. Located on Union Square, you are close to restaurants, shopping, and the cable car stops right outside the hotel. The staff was friendly and helpful. They recommended several restaurants, which we tried, and they were good choices. The room was quiet, comforable, and well decorated. We enjoyed sleeping with the windows open. After returning from a long day of sightseeing, we always found cookies and coffee/tea in the lobby. The Chancellor is the hotel we will stay in during our next visit to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back, if it is just us and not with the kids.”
Reviews.Author: sleepytraveller03
Reviews.Content: Great price and great location at Union Square (not directly across from the square) but very close enough. I have stayed in similar types of hotels in other cities. Older carriage type hotels partially renovated or kept up over the years. Smallish rooms, and lacking in some amenities, such as inhouse pool or gym (offering a pass to a local gym instead). The Chancellor is clean, the staff courtious and helpful. No air conditioning, and with it being in the high teens celcius in the Summer evenings in San Francisco, not really required. Our room on the third floor had a view of other rooftops, so we wanted to keep the blinds and curtains covered. We also got a good amount of street noise with the window open. There is a hotel bar and restaurant, but we didn't partake. When you are in Union Square and this close to the action, we figured we would only be in the hotel to sleep, which is pretty much it. Internet access a plus. Has a flat screen TV, but the poor quality of the standard hotel TV system means it is basically a waste of time.

Reviews.Title: “Three times is a charm!”
Reviews.Author: Claucat
Reviews.Content: This is our third time staying at the Chacellor and we just love this wonderful, privately own charming hotel. To begin with you could not ask for a better location, steps from Union Square on Powell street. The rooms are small but comfortable and clean and have been renovated since our last stay. The restaurant serves a very good breakfast for a fair price considering we are talking about San Francisco. Everyone from the reception to the waiter is extremely friendly. I know I will be back here again on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Quite, Quaint, with a Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: MrsWillis
Reviews.Content: Centrally located and the Concierge service is commendable. My co-worker and I only had one day in the city and we arrived at around 4 pm...we were able to catch the last hop-on/hop-off tour bus of the day thanks to the help we received from the hotel. The hotel didn’t seem to have a great selection but the pub next door was AMAZING! Don’t worry about going to the fancy restaurant across the street...the wait was far too long.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: OntarioSam
Reviews.Content: The Chancellor is an older hotel so rooms are a little small but adequate. Magnified makeup mirrors for the ladies and nice deep bathtubs with a rubber duckie to keep you company. Walk in closet that will hold your clothes, suitcases and still give you room to change in it! Great location for the shopping area and on the cable car line. Front desk staff are very nice and have cookies and apples available in the lobby to snack on. Very quiet hotel throughout the day.

Reviews.Title: “It was a great older hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Judyannnick
Reviews.Content: I could just imagine this hotel that was built in the early 1900's. It must have been quit the place. It is a wonderful place to stay in San Francisco. I liked that is wasn't large and is in a nice location. Chancellor is across the street from Union Square and close to the Hop on Hop Off shuttle buses that take you all over the city. The hotel has been tastefully updated keeping the integrity of the old building and would recommend the hotel to my friends.. The staff is very professional and will go out of their way to help you enjoy your stay in San Francisco.. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good rooms”
Reviews.Author: cutieperth
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nights. The location is great, right beside union square. Rooms are good, not huge but big enough. Didn't really have any encounters with the staff but the one I did have was great. We had breakfast in the restaurant a couple of days, it's convenient but I'm sure you could find much better value and service close by. I did love that the fitness facility was a gym around the corner. So rather than a small fitness centre in the hotel you get a fully fitted out gym. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: felinesStockton_CA
Reviews.Content: We were just there for overnight, some sight-seeing and a nice dinner which we try to do periodically (economy permitting). This was our first time at The Chancellor but not our last. The central location to downtown is a major point, plus it's CLEAN, quaint and cozy. We loved the "pillow menu" and the entire staff was friendly and helpful. Valet parking parks our vehicle and we walk, taxi or cable car everywhere. Also, in the AM they have wonderful coffee in the lobby you can help yourself to before breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, hotel dated, weird guest!”
Reviews.Author: suz09Uk
Reviews.Content: There is nothing wrong with the Chancellor Hotel but there was nothing to rave about either. The location is excellent and the staff very friendly. The rooms were fairly dated, small and not a great view out, and the walls far too thin. We could hear everything that was going on next door. The girl in the room next to us was very strange, came out of her room and just stared at us when we were going out. She looked out of it and was in a right state with her clothes all dirty. We could also hear her shouting and crying in her room and the next day she has put loads of black bags outside her room!! Not sure if she was a tourist or a local just using the room. We weren’t sure what to make of her and I know it was probably a one-off incident, but she didn’t help to give us a good impression of the hotel. I read that others travellers were offered better rooms, so if maybe staying in one of those rooms you would have a better experience at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in the best location”
Reviews.Author: backofthenet
Reviews.Content: The Chancellor is a beautiful boutique hotel in the heart of San Francisco. The location is perfect for the shops, bars and restaurants around Union Square and a 15min walk or short tram ride will take you to fisherman warf. The hotel has real character combined with boutique chic and modern luxury plus a really cool signature rubber duck in the bathroom. Great hotel and highly recommended; we will come back next time we visit San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Tman6487
Reviews.Content: Chancellor Hotel has a great location, right on Powell street by Union Square. It is VERY easy to get to from SFO Airport, take BART to Powell Street station and walk 4 blocks to hotel. The hotel is older but nicely renovated and well kept. The rooms are small and the walls are a little thin. The Powell line cable cars are right outside and can be a little loud if you have the window open. Powell Street can be very busy too. We were on the 6th floor, street side and the noise was not too bad. The couple in the room next to us did keep us up one night arguing about naked pictures on her cell phone, but other than that the noise did not keep us awake or wake us up. The beds and pillows are very comfortable. The bath room is pretty small but the tub/shower is good sized and the shower head worked great. The desk staff, cleaning staff, and door man were all very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Stay - We Can't Wait to Return!”
Reviews.Author: LornaMoore2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chancellor for 3 nights from the 14th - 17th of July. We were greeted by a really friendly bellboy/conceirge called Matt who couldn't do enough for us - he was great. Restaurant recommendations and bar recommendations were all spot on from him. We arrived at the room and realised we'd been upgraded to the best suite in the place with an incredible view over Union Square. We had our own sitting room, 2 bathrooms, 2 televisions, coffee perculator etc etc. It was exceptional! The staff had also given us some champagne and flutes on ice, a rose wood photo frame and some local chocolates to enjoy. Very generous and we were very touched at how thoughtful the Chancellor Hotel had been to us. The hotel is in an abosolutely perfect location and all of the staff were curteous and helpful whenever we had questions. The rooms themselves are in a lovely condition as the hotel has just gone through a refurbishment. All in all we would highly recommend the Chancellor and will stay here again when we return to San Francisco! Oh and an extra that is just so nice is the free tea/coffee and delicious cookies that are freshly baked throughout the day! It's worth staying there for those alone :)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel- amazing location”
Reviews.Author: Awesome__x
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great but the location is the main selling point- directly om union square. The only drawback is that there is no breakfast or fridge supplied which means dining out which is very expensive but the complimentary tea & coffee in the lobby is great! I would definately recommend this hotel. after visiting fishermans wharf I would advise staying on Union Sqaure rather than the Wharf

Reviews.Title: “Charming, loved it!”
Reviews.Author: CanadianMel
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Chancellor. Very old hotel (1930's) but yet charming. We were greeted by friendly staff. We got there 2 hours before check in time but we were pleased to find out that they had a room ready for us. We stayed on the 15th floor and had a good view of Powel street. The room is a little on the small side but hey, we were there to sight-see so we did not mind at all. The washroom is very small but it is a very old hotel. The room was very clean and the bed very comfy. No air conditionning but a fan on top of the bed. The weather in San Francisco was very cool so we left the windows open at night. Luque's bar and restaurant in the lobby is a great place to eat breakfast in the morning. The servers were friendly and service was good. In the lobby they have a tour desk and the staff is very efficient to answer all your questions. A nice restaurant to eat at is right in front called Scala's. French/Italian. Very good at moderate price. The cable cars pass by the hotel. DOn't go down the street to catch one. There are plenty of stops close to the hotel. Do like the locals and the tourists that understood never to wait 1hour and more at the end of the cable line to hop on. All in all, great hotel, good price and great service! We would return for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Broadabroad99
Reviews.Content: I chose the Chancellor as I was a solo female traveler. I felt safe and secure whilst there. The hotel is close to many attractions, and those that were further afield, were easy to get to as the hotel was close to transport!!

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: tofutti
Reviews.Content: We have no complaints about this hotel, it was in a great location, rooms were clean, lifts worked etc. Was very reasonablly priced and would stay here again next time we are in san fran. Have free wifi, cable tv etc.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: travellingrules1
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a trip of California, having stayed in many hotels during our visit this was by far the best. The location was perfect in everyway, the rooms were ideal (clean, well presented and amazingly comfortable beds!) and the atmosphere of the hotel was generally excellent. Probably our only complaint was with some of the front desk staff who we found at times were abrupt and unfriendly especially during check - in (at one point a member of staff found his mobile phone much more interesting than helping us out). However this is a trivial point in a generally brilliant hotel.. and a lovely staff member called Rory made up for what others lacked :-D

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Rocket0023
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel if you want to be in the heart of union square. Got a great deal on priceline. Staff are friendly and very helpful. We had a room with a view of union square and a balcony/fire escape. Asked the front desk if the fire escape/balcony was usable and they said yes, just not for smoking. No A/C but leaving the window open and gently falling to sleep to the city and street sounds below fostered the best sleep I've had in a long time. There always seemed to be a musician playing in the square until 2am which was great to fall asleep to. China town is just a few blocks away. Union square had massive amounts of shops and good food. It's right on the cable car line so it was easy to head out into the rest of the city. We'll definitely be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Old & new SF - a perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: andrewTee
Reviews.Content: A client put me up here; I hadn't heard of the place. Unusual property; small lot but high-rise (even for developed Union Square), eg around 14+ floors but less than ten rooms per floor. Essentially this is an older property that has been meticulously renovated, so you get that taste of old San Francisco along with cutting-edge furnishings. The room was not large but well laid out; it offered classically styled dark wood furniture and the now de-rigeur down comforter on the bed. Completely comfortable and spic & span, nothing seemed dirty or grungy or old or broken. The setting is spectacular; overlooks Union Square. I had a great view of the square and cable cars dinging by. Since there are no taller buildings next to it, I'd guess that nearly all of the higher-up rooms have views in different directions. Whereas most hotels clutter their rooms with signs trying to sell you stuff, this one had a few tasteful notes about things that were free: wi-fi, and incredibly a menu of about a dozen different kinds of pillows, available to borrow for the asking! Ran into many enthusiastic (20's ish) young people in the halls and elevator. Sole gripe would be the lack of an in-room coffee maker, though I've noticed other SF hotels don't offer that easier. I guess they're considered tacky but I find 'em handy. Will certainly stay here next time I visit the City. A real find.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, great price and a perfect service”
Reviews.Author: Mikedollard
Reviews.Content: The hotel was exactly what I expected, perfect location, great service would go back in a heartbeat. I have been to the city twice now and cannot think of a more ideal location. Every request I made was fulfilled and more. Just brilliant

Reviews.Title: “We won't be going back to this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: venom_sprite
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were staying for one night. When we arrived, it took an hour for valet parking to come pick up my car from a "no parking" zone out front where I was told to leave it. I was quoted 3 different prices on valet and given multiple excuses why the pricing was different when I showed them the website quote. Service was not friendly, AC unit in our room busted. Overall, the hotel itself was OK, but I wouldn't return because of the lack of friendliness with the staff. We seemed to be more of an inconveience to them than anything.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money in terms of location”
Reviews.Author: Juveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights and 5 days back in February. We booked this place after reading glowing reviews on trip advisor. Unfortunately the hotel itself was a little disappointing, yes the hotel is somewhat historic, but the rooms were very small and pokey. There is a tourist desk at the lobby, which is helpful when you're not familiar with San Francisco, but the lady there can rip you off and give you misleading information! She's a bit amusing though. The location of this hotel is possibly the best! It may not be as luxurious as the Westin which is two blocks away, but if you're only using the hotel to sleep in, paying the fraction of price is great value.. The tram stop is literally at the front, Macy's, saks fifth, Tiffany's and Williams Sonoma is across the road! You are definitely in the middle of union square! This is so convenient and there are great places to eat around there too! So the hotel although not fantastic, the location is amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Oozes Charm”
Reviews.Author: Passepartout56
Reviews.Content: This place simply oozes charm. I have stayed here three times now and I have never been disappointed. Rooms may be on the small side but they have everything you would want. Some nice touches are the free jar of sweets on the dresser, the pillow menu and the rubber duck in the bath! Very conveniently located for cable cars, Union Square and some brilliant restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chelle868
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a great location, there staff were friendly and the lady behind the bar was really nice, just wish the bar opened earlier! Our stay didnt include breakfast but we did eat in the hotel once and enjoyed it. The rooms were clean and the beds very comfy! We had to change rooms because the people in the room next door argued all night and were throwing things at the walls! This obviously isnt the hotels fault so wouldnt let it put me off staying again as the staff were really nice about it and put us in another room straight away.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in the heart of San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: futgal
Reviews.Content: We spent a week here on our first trip to San Francisco. Union Square location is great, it is walking distance to shops, restaurants, Chinatown, muni and cable car lines The hotel staff was wonderful, polite, and responsive to whatever we requested. We had a room with two twin beds. We asked to have two chairs removed which we didn't need. This gave us plenty of extra space. Also, room was located in the back of the hotel which made it very quiet. We had lunch at the hotel restaurant, delicious. Considering that it is in the central neighborhood of San Francisco, this hotel is a great value. Most of the other hotels in the area seem overpriced. The service and accommodations at the Chancellor are top quality. We will definitely return to the Chancellor Hotel and we highly recommend it to everyone visiting the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Location & Price”
Reviews.Author: ezd363
Reviews.Content: From the bellman to the front desk to the restaurant waitstaff, everyone we encountered at the Chancellor was warm, friendly and very helpful. Our room was small, but spotless and well-equipped. Due to warm weather, we opened windows and with that there was some street noise at night as others have said. Ceiling fan came in handy. Convenient location, half-block from Union Square. Unbeatable price, incl. FREE wi-fi. Overall, very charming.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I've stayed at, don't be afraid of the small rooms.”
Reviews.Author: ragamoffyn
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a little over a week at this hotel with my girlfriend, and we loved it. I was worried because of what I had read about the small rooms and thin walls, but everything was fine. We were in a twin room, and although it wasn't the size of a luxury room at a high-priced hotel, neither was it claustrophobia-inducing. It was just enough room to feel comfortable without wasting space, particularly because the huge walk-in closet gave us a place to put all of our luggage and newly acquired merchandise. The thin walls weren't a problem, either. I'm very irritated by noise coming from other rooms, and though now and then at The Chancellor I could hear a snippet of conversation from the neighbors, it wasn't enough to bug me. Plus, they have white-noise machines and fans available, which masked any noises the neighbors might have made at night. (I didn't hear them making any.) The free, all-day cookies and coffee were a pleasure. The staff was also very friendly and enjoyable -- they even excused me for losing the umbrella provided with the room because I confessed to doing so. Note that in the summer, you will likely need to keep the windows open, and if you are on the front side of the building, you will get a lot of street noise at night. The tradeoff is that you also get a great view. We sacrificed the view for one of the quieter rooms higher up and in the back, and we didn't hear a thing from the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, location and rooms”
Reviews.Author: meredith022
Reviews.Content: It would be hard to find a better location than this one, in the moderately priced range, near Union Square. The room was a reasonable size, and quite comfortable. Staff were friendly and helpful. Other reviewers had noted the lack of aircon - but it wasn't a problem for us, and the heating worked just fine. And try Sears next door - good (and judging by the queues, famous) for its breakfasts, but we were tired and had a lovely evening meal here one night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in a great city !”
Reviews.Author: LovingLifexx
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights whilst visitng California. The Hotel was ideally situated in Union Square and easy access to cable cars, attractions and The Shops!!! We had a great time. San Fransisco is an amazing place. The Hotel was lovely and clean, the bed really comfy, we could see Macy's from our window , it is situated in an area that buzzes with activity, the staff were friendly the price was great value for money. The rooms were not affected by the sounds of the city. If we are ever lucky enough to go back, I would be more than happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Small but in the heart of SF”
Reviews.Author: Oze63
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights at the Chancellor Hotel, as a solo female traveller, i was looking at the location more than anything else. It may not be a fancy 5star hotel, but looks can be deceiving. Its situated in one of the best locations in SF, right on union square, within walking distance to many attractions, restaurants and shopping malls. From the outside or the lobby it almost looks like it could do with a major overhaul, but the rooms, although small, are nice and clean, the bed comfy, which is needed after walking the hilly streets of SF all day long. Id recommend it to anybody who is need of a reasonably priced hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “No better place to stay, anywhere, anytime!”
Reviews.Author: Retired Educator
Reviews.Content: From beginning to end, our recent stay at the Chancellor Hotel in San Francisco was absolutely wonderful. Being that this was our fifth stay at the Chancellor, we felt an immediate “at home” sensation as soon as we walked into the lobby. It was like seeing old friends again. The warm welcome we received from Susie and Matt, in particular, was comforting after a long, trying day of travel from the east coast. Our room on the fifteenth floor overlooking Powell Street was fabulous. Being able to sleep with windows open in June was quite a treat for folks from North Carolina. Each night we went to sleep to the sound of cable cars and street musicians. This was quite a delightful experience and added to the charm of the nation’s most beautiful city. During our stay, we enjoyed several drinks at the hotel bar and several breakfast meals at Luque’s Restaurant. Allysia and Rorie made fabulous cocktails and were always a joy to converse with during televised sports events. Mao and Yesmie were terrific hosts in the restaurant and helped us get each day off to a great start. Our accomodations were immaculate, a testimonial to the great housekeeping staff of the Chancellor. They always went over and beyond expectations to make sure we never lacked for anything. Part of our visit to San Francisco included the opportunity to see the defending World Series Champion Giants, while taking advantage of the Chancellor’s baseball package. The seats were incredible, located nineteen rows above the Giants bullpen in field level seating. We were able to take great photos of Tim Lincecum and Brian Wilson as they warmed up before entering the game. What made an exciting baseball game even better was the Giants victory over the Minnesota Twins. We do love our Giants, even though it is sometimes difficult to follow them on the east coast. We will never, never, never consider staying anywhere but the Chancellor when we visit San Francisco and hope to be able to do so in future years. Until next time, thanks for everything Wes and staff!!!

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: auntjudy325
Reviews.Content: beautiful location. few block walk to china Town. Across from Francis Drake hotel. All large department stores with a two block area. Plenty of restaurants. Good one in hotel for bkfst or lunch. Room small and bathroom small, closet big but location great. Staff was outstanding. You could take cable car to Wharf but we took taxis - cheaper. Got hotel from priceline and that also made it a great trip.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: iandsmith
Reviews.Content: Locality close to Union Square gives this place an edge on many others as this is the main shopping area in San Francisco. It's not a new establishment but it's well maintained. Though others have lamented the smallness of rooms we didn't find it so because, in addition to the fact that there are two large beds in the main room, they have another room where you can store all your luggage and hang your clothing so that they don't clutter the space you mostly use like happens in other hotels. There's a writing desk and internet access (free, ask at desk for password). My only gripes were that you couldn't make a cuppa in your room, but that's common to the majority of hotels in America, and I felt that some of the staff were a bit lacking in skills. It seemed that some of the senior staff were excellent but others could have been more efficient and friendly. Parking, just around the corner, was very convenient, bearing in mind that you're in a major city. Overall, if you're looking for a good hotel in a prime location, I would suggest this one is a definite possibility.

Reviews.Title: “We would go back”
Reviews.Author: meclif
Reviews.Content: Great location, good service, freindly staff, great little bar to get started before heading out for the night.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot be beaten on location”
Reviews.Author: Alough
Reviews.Content: Location location location. Extremely clean. Comfy beds. Nice linen & pillows. 'Boutique' covers description of decor but still old fashioned. Lovely service at breakfast. San Fran weather is unpredictable so lack of air con a non issue. Bathroom was dated but spotlessly clean. Would defo recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in great location”
Reviews.Author: tigermark82
Reviews.Content: This hotel was an incredible value considering the price, location, quality of the rooms and service. The only drawback was it can be pretty noisy, but that is more a function of the neighborhood. I actually found the trolley bells kind of relaxing. The rooms are small, but it was just me and my fiancee and we do not require a whole lot of space. Parking is a short walk away and around 30 bux a day which is pretty competitive. If I go back to San Fran, and this hotel is around the same price, I wouldn't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the two of us”
Reviews.Author: mistervegas1966
Reviews.Content: The Chancellor is a great place to stay in San Francisco. Although the rooms are small, it was just what we needed for the two of us. The Hotel is very well kept. It is walking distance to many restaurants, but I would recommend getting the Muni pass for public transportation (buses, trolleys and cable cars). They sell them at the concierce desk at the Chancellor, but you have to pay for them in cash. The cable cars run right in front of the Hotel, and take you right down to Fisherman's Wharf. Make sure you go to Chinatown while you are there. And, of course, don't forget Alcatraz. We had breakfast one morning at Luques, and it was great. There is always coffee, cookies and apples in the lobby. Finally, make sure you ask about the duck in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel, small yet lovely rooms”
Reviews.Author: BlackMangoPhoto
Reviews.Content: The Chancellor on Union Square... is it? Or is it on Powell Street? Well we'll forgive them that as it is within spitting distance of the square, which is viewable from some rooms on the square side. We pulled up outside and was immediately set upon by the Concierge who informed us that the SFPD do not take kindly to cars parking against the flow of traffic, so keep this in mind if you have bags to drop off. We still unloaded and I disappeared to Hertz to drop the car off. We were booked in to the 17th floor on the side facing parallel to Union Square but a the next street over, if that makes sense? So we could see Union Square, but only by standing at at angle at the window. The window is fixed to only open a maximum of 6 or so inches, which is clearly a safety and security precaution as there was a metal fire escape directly outside. The fire escape did block our view somewhat, but then do you want to get out if the worst should happen? On Union Square there is a trumpet player who starts up around 6pm and plays till 11.30pm'ish, if he isn't your thing you may find yourself having to shut the window and the room can get a little stuffy as there's no air conditioning. The traffic noise can be loud, but that is to be expected. The rooms are small, at least ours was. They are very tastefully decorated, with classy furniture adorning almost every bit of free space, this did make the already small room feel very cramped. The bathroom was also very small with the toilet being immediately to the side of the door so you had to edge round it to get the sink and the bath, which housed the shower. Once you were in the standing space in front of the sink, there was no room for anyone else in the bathroom. The shower was good, but the head was loose, so the shower made a strange whining noise occasionally, though no great cause for concern. The saving grace for the room was the fact that there was a separate closet space, so we could stick out cases and hang our clothes out of the way. There was no fridge in the room, which was a bit of a disappointed. There were ice machines on every floor opposite the elevators, accompanying the smallest ice bucket I've seen! We used the plastic bin in the room and filled it with ice to chill the wine! The hotel uses the Lodgenet system for it's TV and film entertainment. This comes with 20 or so TV channels and other pay services like internet, films and premium TV. Be wary of the films, they are expensive and are automatically billed to your room, it is fairly obvious whereabouts the billing comes in, but if you click fast you may skip it. The films are $17 + tax, personally I would go to the cinema, but if you fancy a lazy night it's good to know they are there. With regards to the billing, we noticed that the Chancellor had put an authorization on our credit card, initially for $72 (odd amount) and then subsequent amounts of $50 and $32. Much of this was refunded, but just to make you aware of it. I think American hotels do this to covers incidentals, but they do not inform you they are going to do it, so do not be surprised if you see it on your online credit card statement. The location of the Chancellor can only be beaten by the much more expensive hotels situated directly on Union Square. It is ideal for San Fransisco's main shopping area and restaurants. The cable car turnaround is only 3 blocks at the end of Powell and runs all the way to Fishermans Wharf (Powell to Mason?). The one problem you may have with the cable car is the fact that it is such a tourist attraction. Getting onto a car at the stops adjacent to the hotel can be difficult as the cars are generally full from the turnaround. Sometimes it can be better to walk a few blocks to the nearest popular stop at the top of the hill where some people will get off, or be willing to wait at the turnaround, which can be extremely busy. Another option for getting around is the open top buses which make Union Square one of their stops. For $26 (I think - sorry can't remember exactly!) per person you can get a 2 day pass which allows you to get on and off at various stops around the city and they run very regularly (every 30 mins or so). Using this you can hop on the bus then get off near to a cable car stop where it will be less busy. We didn't use the facilities of the Chancellor much due to the amount of diners, bars and shops nearby. On the days that we were tired we ordered pizza from Uncle Vitos (2 blocks up from the hotel, but they will deliver) and got snacks from the ABC stores which is on the end of the same block. There is coffee every morning in the lobby next to the small bar and there are internet PC's next to the reception desk. Outside the hotel it is a very safe area, with many concierge staff lining the streets from other hotels and often there is an armed security guard outside the Bank of America branch, which is just a few doors up, so we never have any problems near to the hotel. A few blocks of walking brings you into contact the San Francisco's many homeless and you either need to steel yourself and avoid eye contact or drop a dollar or so and walk on. Some will politely thank you, others clearly have problems and are a little concern. A recommendation for breakfasts and lunch is Loris diner which is 1 block away going up hill. Very nice. All in all a nice hotel and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay at union square.”
Reviews.Author: Jerald475
Reviews.Content: Our stay here has been great. Friendly staff, clean room and the convenience of it all is what made the trip. It's seconds away from the trolley stop and union square it across the street. Small note if you've never been to San Francisco. Union square is extremely busy and noisy even at night. We stayed on the 8th floor and had the jazz musicians on the square put us to sleep while the trolley's bell and brakes wake us up! Not the hotels fault but should be noted if your a light sleeper. The area also seems to be much safer and less homelessness than any other part of town. A great charming place that I would definitely stay at again.

Reviews.Title: “Great first time, B team second visit 2 weeks later”
Reviews.Author: Sheena C
Reviews.Content: I was going to give this hotel a glowing report after staying 3 nights prior to a cruise to Alaska. My 80 year old father joined us for the last night. Everything about it was good, from the check in to the rooms and most definitely the location. In fact we raved about it to fellow passangers on the cruise. We decided to stay the one night back in San Francisco after the cruise before flying out to Honolulu and booked it through the hotel. However...................... we arrived at 9.30 am to a very surly welcome by the two gentlemen on reception. I won't mention their names but I am sure if the management is remotely interested they can check on 14th June. The rooms were not ready which is absolutaly fine as we did not expect them to be. We left our luggage in storage. We returned at 11am as we were to meet some old friends there. My father asked if there was any indication of when rooms would be ready and was told again, "check in is at 3pm" and that maybe, maybe by 2pm. We returned at 2pm as Dad was flagging. He was given his room but in a rude and unhelpful manner. We asked for our bags as there was nobody to get them despite the two gents and no other customers just 1 meter from luggage room. Eventually I asked them to call the porter who came. We helped Dad up to his room and returned to the lobby. Now this is not a large area. We sat directly opposite the front desk on one of the two sofas, used the computer behind the desk and waited, and waited. These two gents knew we we were waiting to check in. People came and went, a lot of laughter and chitchat went on. Eventually the shift changed. They avoided any eye contact. There was no hand over, it seemed, to oncoming shift. Eventually at 1545 I approached one of the the new team and she seemed surprised and said the room had been ready for sometime and was an upgrade to a suite. I was very annoyed as I got the distinct impression that this was done on purpose. We were tired and fed up and I do realise that the rooms have to be cleaned ect but it was like checking into two different hotels on each visit. It is a great little hotel but how easily poor customer service can influence our impressions of a place.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: ajssw19
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights at the Chancellor Hotel and found the location to be fantastic. It really is in the middle of everything which is great for sight seer's. As previous reviewers have said, this is an older hotel and the rooms are small by American standards although they are nicely decorated and are comfortable. Our room was facing over the front of the hotel on the 3rd floor and because this hotel is on Powell Street it was very noisy outside. We also had noise issues with people in the next room - you can easily hear people talking. I recommend the hotel for anyone wanting a central location at a reasonable price but you should expect that you're not going to get an amazing night's sleep unless you get a room at the back of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels we've stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: MartinDraycott
Reviews.Content: After a lot of research and price checking we settled on the Chancellor because it met our budget and got great reviews on Tripadvisor. We weren't disappointed! The hotel staff were friendly, professional and helpful. Mike on the Tour desk was excellent at getting information about a variety of excursions and arranging them for us. We had booked several tours before we went but we feel that if we go again we could quite happiily rely on the Tour desk to arrange everything for us. The location of the hotel was excellent. Right on Union Square and within easy reach of cable cars, MUNI buses and the subway. There are a number of restaurants and fast food places in the immediate vicinity depending on what takes your fancy. Shopping is great with Macy's, Levi's, Apple and the Westfield Centre (Bloomingdales, Nordstrom, etc) all within a short walking distance. The free tea/coffee/apples &cookies available in the lobby was great and real plus over other hotels that make you rely on over priced room service. We ate at Lucques restaurant on the ground floor a few times during our stay and were very pleased with the service and the quality of food. Our server Mao was extremely amusing and welcoming and we felt totally relaxed and ready for the day ahead. The rooms whilst small by American standards aren't as bad as some reviewers have claimed, maybe they have a larger bone structure! We've stayed at a number of hotels over the years both in the UK and abroad and have had rooms of equal size to the Chancellor and in fact some smaller. For us the hotel room is a base of operations, some where to lay our weary heads at the end of a days exploration and the Chancellor easily met these requirements. The Hotel has a new app which was useful for checking in earlier as well as finding out about offers and menus for the restaurant. There was also some useful tourist advice that was provided and I'm sure this will be built upon in the future. One thing I would suggest is a facility to contact the Tour desk prior to arrival as this would have been very useful for us, it would also have saved us some money on airport shuttles as the price we were quoted by the tour desk was about $20 cheaper than what we paid online despite using the company (Lorries) recommended by the Hotel in an email. Without doubt we were very pleased with the Chancellor and it went along way toward making our holiday truly memorable. We will recommend this hotel to all friends and family who consider a holiday to San Francisco and will definitely stay there when we return. Finally, the wifi facilities offered were great and allowed me to upload my photo albums each night as well as check my emails etc. There is a secure key provided in your room and I felt safe connecting to this network especially when I was also able to pick up other nearby hotel networks that seemed to offer no protection.

Reviews.Title: “San Francisco Gem”
Reviews.Author: HollywoodUk
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not particularly imposing on arrival, but the staff were fantastic. The room was great and the location unbeatable. Breakfasts were just perfect and again staff were brilliant. The longer we stayed here the better it was - we were sorry to leave. Cable cars run past the front door, Union Square with Macy's (and the Cheesecake Factory - great food and vibe) within minutes on foot, and all tourist attractions (and there are many) accessible by cablecar, on foot or by one of the excellent tour buses.

Reviews.Title: “Like Staying with an Old Friend”
Reviews.Author: 2011ChgoWanderer
Reviews.Content: I had high hopes for the Chancellor Hotel long before staying there based on the great customer service I received during the reservations process. and I was not disappointed when it came time for my stay. From the beginning to end, everyone I talked to was always patient and helpful with my many questions, in particular kudos to Kevin who went above and beyond to take care of my last minute changes and reservation worries. Yes, the Chancellor is an older hotel. Yes, the rooms are small. No, it may not have all the fancy bells and whistles that other nearby hotels do. But what it does give you is a homey, cozy, comfortable place to call home during your stay that will be the perfect end to a long day of running around. And their attention to detail in many ways will leave you feeling like you truly matter to them as a customer...after my second night, housekeeping realized I was always pulling the comforter down to the end of the bed and made my bed that way every day after that . Try Luques at least once for a great omelette and stop by the Tour desk for maps. On my first day they gave me the perfect map to help me find my way around town and thanks to them, I didn't get lost once which is amazing for someone as directionally challenged as myself!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and good value”
Reviews.Author: stokie1980
Reviews.Content: We stopped here for four nights at the start of our honeymoon. The hotel had left us a bottle of sparkling wine, some chocolates and a picture frame as a present. The room was spotless, tidy and a reasonable size especially if you're not planning on spending too much time in it. Location wise its just up from union square itself and close to all the main shops and the trams run right outside the doors. Staff are friendly and the free tea, coffe and cookies are a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “With the majestic charm of a Grand Lady”
Reviews.Author: Luv2travelNZ
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a wonderful week in SFO staying at the Chancellor Hotel Union Square. Upon arrival, we could see the location was fantstic., with Cable Cars, Buses, Taxis galore right outide the door. The decor of the lobby is nostalgic and welcoming as was the greeting from Voula on the Front Desk. As our flight arrived very early into SFO we knew the room would not be ready. Voula was extermey pleasant, courteous and helpful, so we checked our bags in order to go and explore. We checked in and our room was located on the 8th floor. The room was just lovely and we immediately felt 'at home.' The furnishings were very smart combining classic greens and a crisp white. The room and bathrom was immaculate. The cleaning staff are a credit! (Thank you Purita). It is amazing how quiet the room is having double glazing, so very calm and easy to sleep especially as the bed is extremely comfortable. The Chancellor offers many other lovely touches - Coffee/Tea/Cookies provided 24/7 , ice machines on your floor, and your 'Chancellor Rubber Duck' in your bathroom. Our check out was easy, and we were assisted well by the concierge. I cannot faut this hotel, the staff are a real assett and make you feel very welcome. We loved SFO and now can't wait until we ruturn and of course stay at the Chancellor Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Tell Anyone About This Little Gem ...”
Reviews.Author: WMD_Traveller
Reviews.Content: What a perfect, fairly priced, nicely modernized, charming, conveniently located, clean, and professionally-staffed beauty! Very knowledgable concierge staff. Great happy hour value. Many public transportation options easily accessible (cable cars, F-Line trolley cars to Financial and Wharf districts, easy 3-block walk to BART station to, e.g., SF Int'l. Airport (easy ~35-minute ride $16 RT). In the very heart of the shopping district. Also an easy walk to Chinatown, Little Italy ("North Shore"). The Chancellor is a perfect find. Don't tell anyone! LOL P.S. buy the 3-day public transportation pass from the hotel concierge for a mere $21. Forget about needing a car in San Fran!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travels_0505
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as the first stop on a recent US trip so it was the first place we arrived at after a 14 hour flight. Although there wasn't a room ready yet they held our bags and did everything they could to accommodate. When we returned and were finding it hard to stay awake on the comfortable couch in reception they were able to soon arrange a room. The only negative that I can think of was the staff speaking loudly outside our door one morning but as it was to another guest I find that understandable. I would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “As good as the last time”
Reviews.Author: tritonkid
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Cancellor some 8 years ago and enjoyed the stay. Little has changed at this hotel. The service from all staff remains very good, the room we had was pleasant. The location of this hotel was ideal for us in that it is central with good transport links to other parts of San Francisco. Would we stay there again? Yes we would. We like it and at the price it represents very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: Ace020
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading the reviews on TA. This hotel was much better than we expected, location was the best you can get & don't get me started on the bed & pillows... Honestly if I had a bigger suitcase I would of taken it with me!! Staff was very helpful & friendly. Excellent place to stay & we will definately be back! One thing to note - if you are getting tickets for the hop on hop off bus, the desk in reception sells the for $30 per person but you can get them for $25 at union square..

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: DTM555
Reviews.Content: Context: 30s professional couple on honeymoon, first time to SF. Rating reflects our expectations for this class/price of hotel. Hotels in SF were relatively expensive compared to LA/Vegas, particularly in Fisherman’s Wharf area. We plumped for this one as was just inside our budget approx $170/night. Room was small but clean and nicely decorated, traffic noise acceptable. Complimentary bottle of bubbly and chocs was a nice touch. Perfect location for shopping and everywhere else in SF is walkable or bus-able so no complaints really.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a couple of days in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: apc9
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, good value and comfortable room. Stayed for two nights here after arriving from London. A great location for seeing all the sights.

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: thetruth74
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff. They even helped us to find a nice restaurant to eat pizza. The housekeeping staff was awesome (Susan) they even left a "thank you"-note for the tip. The room was without AC.... you don't NEED AC in San Francisco!!!!! It was just fine! The hotel is a good "base" to start your shopping trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Average stay!”
Reviews.Author: lizapapa78
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a prime location right across from Union Square. Our experience at this hotel wasn't as good as what I expected considering it's highly rated. Once we checked in the hotel, our room wasn't ready which was fine as we got there very early in the morning.
