We walked around the city and by lunchtime, we went back to the hotel and our room was ready. Room: Looks nice for a 3 star hotel. Slightly smallish compared to other rooms we have been to but we got around that. We had a bit of a nap as we were exhausted from our flight and minimal sleep. Unfortunately, we were woken up by the room to our left as they were very loud during their fun "activities" (too loud), Not long later, the people on he right room checked in and I am not exaggerating, I could hear their conversation clear as. The walls of this place were paper thin. I was frustrated by this stage and my partner & I were whispering as we didn't want our conversations heard!!! We complained at reception and they kindly relocated us to a lower floor but warned us that this room would be noisy as we would hear the trolley. They did tell us that they could situate us to the other side of the hotel the next day as they didn't have a room available on that day. The also gave us a $25 voucher to use at the hotel for the inconvenience which was nice of them. They were right about the noise but it only bothered us when we got home at night until midnight which was only for an hour or so. The 2nd room also had a single bed set up next to the double bed when we checked in which left minimal room for our luggage so placed the luggage on top of the single bed. Wake up Call: We had to wake up at 3.20am the morning we had to leave so asked reception for a wake up call. I also set the alarm on my phone as a secondary precaution. Lucky I did this because we never received a wake up call. How bad is this?? Imagine if we had relied on this??? Overall, for the price we paid, the hotel was in a top location and rooms were ok. Would i go back there? No.

Reviews.Title: “Most comfortable bed I've ever slept in (including home)!”
Reviews.Author: Jan_Saussey
Reviews.Content: Most people consider location and cleanliness important. But If you also want a really comfortable bed and great showers, Chancellor Hotel can deliver! You even get a choice of several pillow types. The beds are heaven, and the showers strong, refreshing and always hot. Our room was quiet (we asked for the back area) and we found the location superb.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of renos going on, but a lovely stay.”
Reviews.Author: Allisonr30
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay at the Chancellor. The hotel was so central to the city and lots of great restaurants, shopping and tourist attractions! The room was small and there was a lot of noise though the walls from other rooms, however we enjoyed out 2 nights here. The staff in the restaurant and bar were very friendly, we enjoyed a very entertaining happy hour att he bar! Breakfast in the restaurant was fast and delicious! Free tea, coffe and snacks in the reception area was much appreciated on our 6.30 departure morning- as was the tour desk which helped us to book tours and airport transfers! Free wifi was great!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great stay”
Reviews.Author: Stiina
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel because of other tripadvisor recommendations and weren't disappointed. The rooms are not spacious, but you have everything you need. The breakfast is good and reasonably priced. We loved the rubber duck on the rim of the bathtub!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: janoota
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect. Clean hotel with friendly and helpful staff. If you don't put your card on your bed you will get clean sheets everyday so put the card out sometimes and help the staff workload and also the environment. If you are a Kiwi or Aussie you will agree that the coffee in San Francisco is not great but ask the concierge where Bluebottles is and get a great Flat White. Also the best hamburgers we had were at Pearls. Again ask the concierge and he will tell you where this is. Great shop called the Miner Miracle designer non profit making charity shop all new clothes at knock down prices. Come out of the hotel turn left cross to the right hand side of the road at the lights and it is about 50 yards down. Best fish is at Sotto Mare in Little Italy. We had a fabulous time. Thank you Chancellor!!

Reviews.Title: “Good clean, reasonably priced, quiet, well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: justlistennowisaid
Reviews.Content: Choose the Chancellor after good reviews on trip advisor. It is superbly located, mere minutes from Union Square itself and with tram stops literally outside the hotel. The hotel is relatively basic in itself - there is no on-site gym, and the bar and the breakfast area are all self-contained with no natural light and so I didn't use those so don't know if the food or drinks are good or good value. The rooms are a good size, the bathroom is decent enough and the hotel is pretty quiet given its location. There is a tour desk on the ground floor that will give you maps, information and make bookings for you. The staff are efficient and functional in their interactions. Free wi-fi is available and there is a PC available by reception where they will let you print things for free too, so very traveller friendly. They have a small "library" space on the 2nd floor for travellers to leave books and pick up those that have been left. It was in the process of being renovated and probably needed it as it does look a spot tired but is clean despite that. A good stay for the price and the location.

Reviews.Title: “i was here three years ago - still great as ever”
Reviews.Author: julieannboo
Reviews.Content: lovely small hotel in union square. it has still high standards as it did when i last visted back in 2008. the lady at the tour desk is MAGIC. very helpful booking tours and giving us advice on muni bus ticktets to buy. the rooms are small for america but not too small if that makes sense! the bathroom is small and there is a bit of a step - so look when entering. there is a big wardrobe almost like a small room with a safe in there. in the lobby behind the front desk is a computer that you can use. great hotel - would recommend everytime.

Reviews.Title: “Our third stay and not our last...”
Reviews.Author: EileenPerthWA
Reviews.Content: We were again lucky enough to stay at the Chancellor from May 2nd -5th. This time my daughter and son in law joined us and were equally as pleased. I have been raving about the Chancellor for the last few years to them, so now they can see why!! The weather was in the high eighties and picture perfect every day. The fact that there was no air conditioning did not bother us at all. We left our window open until we went to bed and the put the ceiling fan on, and that was perfect. Alisha in the bar makes great margaritas, and I made sure I got to Happy Hour every night just to have one! What else can I say, the best location, the best staff, run by the best manager, that is why it is so good. Thankyou all once again. We will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Still a great experience”
Reviews.Author: joe-7374
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Chancellor in 2005, I was curious to see if it was still the same. It's better! The location cannot be beat and the service has improved which was hard to do as it was great the last time. From the front desk to the bellmen, to the tour desk, the service was friendly and very accomodating. The rooms have been remodeled with new furniture and flat screen tvs. Although some might find the rooms small, we found them more than adequate for our 4 large bags. I will say that we had a wonderful suite that the General Manager, Wes Tyler, upgraded us to. We had breakfast on 2 mornings in the resturant downstairs and the service was super. The bacon was the best that I have ever had! The location is the best in San Francisco. The cable cars are just steps outside the doors and the other modes of transportation are within a block of the hotel. Please deal with Wes direct on reservations or anything else as He definitely goes way beyond any expectations on helping you. Thanks, Wes, for a great trip. We hope to visit with you again

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location - Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: richlcfc
Reviews.Content: Great hotel to be used a base for visiting San Fran. Staff were all policte and room was clean. Location is amazing as right in the heart of San Fran. Lots of places to eat, drink and sight see on your door step. Would definitely reccomend and would return if we go back to San Fran.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value in great location for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: Nightingale010410
Reviews.Content: Not a very big room, comfortable & big enough for us (we were out sightseeing all day), plus a big closet....recently redecorated so it was tasteful, neat and clean. We stayed on the 14th floor, excellent location on union square. Great value - and the price even dropped to $108 on our 3rd night (mid week)! The signs said they were renovating but we didn't notice any dust or noise. Right on Union square - easy to pick up all public transpo.....

Reviews.Title: “Location was perfect”
Reviews.Author: littlerosepetal
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel. Staff were fantastic and very helpful. Rooms were fine, nothing fantastic but comfortable and clean. Location was excellent!! Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in perfect location !!”
Reviews.Author: goodone26
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights and loved it ! Handy location to all transportation. Staff were excellent and helpful to all requests. The cookies were great as was the coffee. Great Thai food a couple of blocks away (Bangkok Thai). Also had several good meals at Lori's Diner - good variety for reasonable prices. Had a wonderful time in San Francisco and will definitely return !

Reviews.Title: “A superb experience in a historic hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Cunajo1
Reviews.Content: Had the great pleasure to enjoy four days in the care of the historic Chancellor Hotel. The Chancellor offers superb service, faultlessly maintained interiors that retain their original form and structure, and comfortable, immaculately fresh accommodations. The Front Desk personnel sets a standard rarely met elsewhere: friendly, helpful and crisply efficient, they strive to ensure that your stay is a pleasant, productive one. Fresh cookies and coffee are dispensed gratis 24 hours a day, and - uniquely - a fully equipped, Internet-ready office is provided free-of-charge. Located on the Powell Street boundary of the famed Nob Hill, the Chancellor is (quite) literally steps from Union Square, with an impressive – almost overpowering – array of World-class dining and shopping options at your fingertips. Were this not enough, the Hotel itself ups the ante by offering two superb dining options, in addition to an intimate sports bar. For superior quality and an equally superior experience at a surprisingly reasonable price, The Chancellor Hotel, San Francisco should be among the first considerations of any discerning traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Look no further”
Reviews.Author: kelmar81
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews and different hotels on here we decided on the Chancellor. Why we loved it Service was amazing - staff was ALWAYS willing to answer questions, give suggestions or directions. We were never a hassle to them. Tour desk operator "Michael" I believe, was great...very helpful all the time. Gave us detailed directions which made us comfortable. Yes the room is small as most say but the hotel is almost 100 years old and unique.... what do people expect? It was perfect size for us.. not sure how much space people really need in a hotel room. The bed was very comfortable and the room was clean Downstairs restaurant food was good. We ate breakfast twice and enjoyed it both times Location location location... so close to high end shopping or hop on a cable car and go to the warf. Either way anything you may need is very close by... loved it! I also really enjoyed the pride the staff have of the hotel, it says a lot about the behind the scenes of the hotel. I also really enjoyed reading the managers responses to people comments...says a lot that he reads them all. We will come back to this hotel again one..... thank you to the entire staff!

Reviews.Title: “I would return to Chancellor Hotel in a NY minute.”
Reviews.Author: TroyHoward
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here in March, 2011. What a bargain!! Cozy room and good mattress. Every staff member went out of their way to be helpful. Fantastic location from which to stroll or catch public transportation to other parts of the city. I felt very lucky to get the hotel I did for the discounted price I found. We got a rooom overlooking Union Square and were not affected by nearby cable cars. I asked the manager to give us a room he would give to his family. Guess he has good family relationships.

Reviews.Title: “quirky hotel near Union Square”
Reviews.Author: easyeric601
Reviews.Content: This is a cool hotel in the center of San Francisco, right off Union Square. Its a very good value overall, except for the parking, which is supplied by a 3d party company a couple blocks away and is very expensive. Motorcycles park for the same price as cars. Check in was quick and efficient & the staff professionally accomodating, if not particularily joyful. The lady working the travel services desk was nice, but it looked like she'd been up for a while. The bartender was nice & gave me advice on where to go & things to do. The hotel is a little old, but you couldn't say it was run down. The rooms were clean, but everything had the feeling of wear about it. The jar of mints was a nice touch. I didn't try the restaurant. No free breakfast but coffee & cookies in the lobby. Overall a good experience and value in the center of town.

Reviews.Title: “Gr8 location...small rooms...but fantastic stay in Gr8 city”
Reviews.Author: blondelinda
Reviews.Content: This hotel is highly recommened on this site, and I can see why. The hotel is extremely well priced for the location. Its right on Union Square, where all the great shopping and restuarants are. Cable cars run right past the door We arrived around 10.30 am but our room wasnt ready. We checked our bags and went off for a few hours for some exploring and and lunch. We returned around 1pm and checked into our room. The rooms are very small and tight, even by a big cities standard. BUT we didnt spend much time in the room so it wasnt a big deal. The room was tastefully decorated, but you should be prepared for not too much space. We where given a room overlooking union square which was really nice. The check in staff where really helpfull with dining recommendations and car rental enquiries. This is a great base for getting around the city. We only had 2 nights but we stayed midweek and got a great rate of $125 a night for this hotel. That was a bargain for a hotel in this location of this quality There are many many great restuarants close by, but Sears next door is excellent and famous enough for its brekfast that is has lines out the door for half hour or so! It was so good we went and ate one evening for dinner which was excellent. When we are back in San Fran we would definatley stay hear again , we where very impressed

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Does exactly what it says on the tin!”
Reviews.Author: Geebls5
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights on our honeymoon. Read all the reviews beforehand and expected a 3* hotel in an old building with small rooms, but in a great location. And that's exactly what we got. Was a bit disappointed with the room initially as ours was facing inside the hotel to a fire escape and was so dark we had to have the light on during a sunny day. Did consider asking if we could swap, but my wife (typical Englishwoman!) did not want to cause a fuss so we stayed put. In the end the room was fine and we were out exploring most of the time anyway so it was no big deal. Didn't visit the bar and restaurant as there is so much choice locally, but all the staff were friendly and helpful. It was our first visit to San Francisco and we loved the city - so much to do and see, we could have stayed a week and cannot wait to go back again one day. If you want a base at a reasonable price in a great location, then I would recommend The Chancellor, just don't expect The Ritz or Vegas size suites as you will be disappointed! p.s. Loving the Managers feedback to some of the reviews on Tripadvisor. Good to see a human touch with a bit of humour, rather than the usual corporate robotic hotel rep's comments. Keep em coming and keep up the good work Chancellor!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Mufcnumber18
Reviews.Content: Perfect location. Helpful staff. Overall can't fault the hotel and everyone working in it.

Reviews.Title: “Established hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ToffeeShaker
Reviews.Content: The rooms are a decent size for a city centre hotel with a comfortable queen bed, small ensuite bathroom and ours had a walk-in wardrobe (our friends' room didn't). There is a large TV and free WiFi, which you'd expect. There are signs of age in the rooms, but ours had been redecorated to give it a modern feel. None of the rooms have aircon, only ceiling fans, which I guess isn't a problem most of the time in San Fran but as we arrived in the warmest May for years we certainly noticed. We had to leave windows open in the day to create a through-draft or the temperature would have been uncomfortable when we returned to the room. All the staff are friendly, and the hotel has a pillow menu, which is a nice touch - choose a special pillow from a list in your room for no charge. You also get a free cable car ticket and discount voucher for th bar when you check in. The location was excellent. Union Sq is a good central base from which to explore - the cable car runs right outside, several Muni buses run from round the corner and the signtseeing buses all have stops on Union Square- but i believe a few sidestreets off Union Sq can be a bit rough at night. I would definitely stay here again - so long as the weather wasn't going to be too warm!

Reviews.Title: “Its a good hotel for a 3*”
Reviews.Author: zoe025
Reviews.Content: I think I had too high expectations after reading the excellent reviews. It was good for a 3*, but is definitely still 3*. The room and bathroom are small and there is no one to take up your bags etc. We were on the 5th floor which had a bit of street noise. However it is clean and pleasent. I think we paid slightly too much for it (perhaps because we went through trailfinders), but it is in a great location on the tram lines (which are great fun).

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in great location-easy access to transportation and shopping.”
Reviews.Author: Melnej
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed this hotel because of its charm (glass doorknobs on wooden doors, small library, cookies available 24/7). It was a bit noisy with the cable cars right outside and people playing instruments on the street but that really just added to the charm and never kept us awake. Free coffee, too, that was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Get Away”
Reviews.Author: ccardnut
Reviews.Content: We live in the east bay and decided to spend a couple of days in San Francisco and take in the sights and a show at the Orpheum. Took Bart to Powell St and walked to the Chancellor Hotel. The hotel staff is very friendly and well located. We enjoyed our stay and would recommend it to anyone..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: DJR43
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chancellor for four nights in early April, 2011 and were extremely pleased with our choice. The location was very central and within walking distance to many attractions and restaurants. Our room was exceptionally clean, the bed was very comfortable and all staff were most friendly and helpful. We enjoyed an excellent and reasonably priced breakfast in their restaurant as well as the complementary cookies and apples. We would not hesitate to stay here again if we return to San Francisco. Ottawa, Ontario, Canada

Reviews.Title: “I reconsidered...”
Reviews.Author: tjserapiglia3
Reviews.Content: I was too quick to review. After a bad night sleep i gave an unjust review. Not fair. This hotel is fine. Yes small bed but other than that great location. Good food right next door and great shopping all around. Easy to get to Bart/Muni. I got this hotel through Hotwire and I was unaware about the "No king beds" After looking at the web site of the Hotel I knew I was wrong on my previous review. Enjoy the location and the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Pubic hair on bathtub plug squashed in with hardened soap from previous guest. Nice room but when I asked about s”
Reviews.Author: Aluson
Reviews.Content: Good location. Bathroom is disappointing. Underside of plug was full of hardened soap and pubic hair. Shower pressure was terrible. Asked duty manager about shower pressure. He said I was drunk. Sorry Mike but I could still count and options ranging from 'trickle' to '3 streams' on the 'massage' setting were pretty bad even for a basic hotel. If you're all about location would recommend. For comfort - think again if you like hot showers.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: volfaninnc
Reviews.Content: Great location and the staff was very friendly and helpful. We liked that it was an older hotel with personality and charm. We opened our window and that kept the room from being warm. The room size was fine for us - bigger than what I thought it was going to be based on other reviews. I loved the deep tub for taking hot baths with the bath salts they provided and of course the rubber ducky!

Reviews.Title: “Great, Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: davidbryantirvin
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a Saturday morning and were able to check in early. The front desk clerk was very helpful and friendly. She even called Hertz to check on their hours so we could change our reservation and not have to pay overnight parking fees. The room and bathroom were very small, but very clean and well appointed. There is no air conditioning in the hotel, which we knew when making the reservation. It was cool enough at night with the windows open and the ceiling fan running, that it was very comfortable in the room. The location is excellent, right at Union square. You can catch a cable car at the hotel, and walk several blocks to catch the "f" line street car. There is also a very good restaurant, Sears Fine Food next door. We had breakfast there several times. There is an excellent Steak place (Mortons) around the corner. It was really good, but pretty expensive. On they day we were leaving, our flight was late in the afternoon. I called down to ask for a late checkout (2 pm) and without hesitation, they said "no problem." We got stuck away from the hotel, waiting on a cable car to get back. It was a few minutes after 3 when we finally got back and checked out. Even though they called to remind us that we had agreed to be out by 2, they were very understanding that we were running late. Every hotel employee that we encountered was very friendly. If you're looking for a nice hotel in a convenient location with a friendly staff, I would recommend the Chancellor. I will be staying here the next time I visit San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money, great location, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: beansfc
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by how good this hotel was considering the price we paid! The location cannot be beaten - right on Union Square with the cable car on the doorstep. It allowed us to easily explaore all of San Fran. While the rooms are small (as most are in America) they were modern and comfortable - partcularly the pillows and linen which were of an excellent quality. We had breakfast in the restaurant one morning and it was good. The staff were friendly and we loved the cookies provided in reception each day. All in all this is a great hotel for a great price - don't expect Hilton or Marriott standard but for a third of the price this absolutely does the trick. If I am ever in San Fran again I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ELKing2U
Reviews.Content: We are checking out of the Chancellor today, and have enjoyed a wonderful stay. Not often do I take the time to submit a review, but this hotel is so special I really felt the need to post the many positives. This hotel may be a 3 star, but the service and attention is that of a 5 star. The staff is very courteous, professional, and so very congenial. Thank you Oscar, for your attention and assistance during check-in. I wish I could remember names, but suffice it to say that everyone, and I mean everyone, treated us with the same courtesy and respect, this includes everyone at the front desk, tour desk staff, the bellmen, the restaurant/bar staff, and housekeeping. They were all well-trained, and it was evident that my satisfaction was the goal. Kudos to all. A special thank you to the Wes Taylor, GM, who took the time to personally answer my questions, and made a special holiday even more memorable. Thank you for your kindness, Mr. Taylor. There is absolutely nothing that needs improved upon from my our experience. The service is fantastic, the food tasty, the rooms clean and comfortable, and last, but not least, location, location, location! This gem of a hotel is an excellent base for any activity, with all municipal transportation within easy walking distance. The Chancellor will forever be a 5 star establishment in our minds. Thank you all again, and we will be repeat guests.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD value for money”
Reviews.Author: BzyBeeDK
Reviews.Content: Expecting the worst but proven very wrong by the small, intimate hotel in the heart of San Francisco; so central yet very quiet during the night much to our delight. Loved the neighbourhood, the local diner, the free coffee/tea and we warmly recommend the Chancellor!

Reviews.Title: “A few things marred what could have been a good stay”
Reviews.Author: Cdh299
Reviews.Content: So am going to be fair here. This is a charming hotel, very clean and with smart rooms. It's very good value for money. Our stay was marred by many of our clothes being ruined by an obviously incompetent laundry contractor. The hotel resolved this in a way we were comfortable with but I would recommend that you do not use their dry cleaning / laundry service during your stay. The bed sheets were stained both nights. The first night we were too tired to wait for them to be changed so we didn't report it, however when the new sheets the next day also were stained and ripped we asked for them to be changed, which there were quickly. Front desk staff generally ok apart from a particularly odious man called Oscar who had an air of arrogant self importance. Am sure The Chancellor was just having an unfortunate off couple of days as I can see why this is generally a popular hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel prefect location Great Value”
Reviews.Author: gbrose27
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located in prime spot. Charming boutique Hotel, Really helpful staff. Front desk recommended great restaurants all over city. Value for ammnenites and location has to best tops in the city. Like staying at the Westin St Francis for 1/3 of the price.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: siobhanxxxx
Reviews.Content: Only stayed here one night, but overall we had a great service and the staff were very friendly. Wifi in rooms was free and very useful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: John C
Reviews.Content: Superb location on Powell St to catch cable cars & close to city shopping. Room & bathroom was small size and a bit cramped after 4 days. Staff were generally good and friendly. Only issue was with reception or behind-the-counter-staff - definitely an issue with efficient or contentious customer service - we had two issue where they were just plain incompetent and did not perform their duties, or just did not care. Concierge and tour facilities were good and helpful A good choice for breakfast although some items a little on the expensive side. We would stay there again but may look a a different hotel in the same location

Reviews.Title: “Great location and reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Susann206
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Chancellor hotel for four days and were very pleased. The staff is excellent and the tips they gave us on where to go in the city were invaluable. Our bellman told us about some great restaurants, and the travel desk personnel were very helpful, plus knowledgeable about city transportation. The hotel has a restaurant which we found to have good food and reasonable prices. In spite of being a pretty inexpensive place to stay, the hotel still gives the guests little amenities such as a two for one drink coupon and a 10% discount coupon for the restaurant. And, the bathroom has a little rubber ducky that you can take home ! There are even apples and delicious homemade cookies in the lobby. The only downside was that our bathroom could have been cleaner and the room was pretty small. Oh, and the mixed drinks in the bar were not the greatest. Wine might be a better bet.

Reviews.Title: “A great Location (right in the heart of the city)”
Reviews.Author: more-botters
Reviews.Content: A must, you must have breakfast in Lori's Dinner, the waffles are great and coffee dam good. There is great local restraunts on Chestnut Ave. Great hotel, clean comfortable, rooms are not as big as other hotel we stayed in the passed, but this is a city hotel and you have to expect this. Me and my husband were on are honeymoon and they gave us champaigne and photo frame and it was really nice touch. The staff are great .

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and pleasurable stay”
Reviews.Author: Facemaker01
Reviews.Content: A comfortable cosy room in a fantastic location. The Chancellor was built in 1914 and this would be why the rooms are smaller than the other hotels we have stayed in. (with the exception to New York) The rooms are decorated tastefully and the bed was comfortable. Breakfast at Luques as well as Happy Hour were pleasant. I would like to see the decor of the bar/restaurant echo the architecture & age of the building, something to add a little more character and set it apartment from other boutique hotels. Standouts were the fresh cookies every afternoon/evening, as well as the tea/coffee cart near the bar area

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: NanookLondon
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay at the Chancellor Hotel, we got a great deal on the rate a few months in advance and we were not disappointed on arrival. Staff were friendly and helpful, the room was lovely and really tastefully decorated, we were on the 11th floor and had a good view over Union Square. The amenities were great with free wifi in rooms, but also a computer in reception with printer both free to use - ideal for printing boarding passes etc. There was also coffee, tea, cookies, apples and newspapers everyday in reception. The location was great and far preferable to the Fishermans Wharf area, it was very easy to explore all over the city and beyond, as the hotel is very close to the subway, cable cars, buses and BART stops. We took the BART direct from SFO to Union Sq (Powell Station) which took 30 mins and the station is a 5 min walk from the hotel so its very easy and cheap to get to the hotel on arrival, not worth waiting for/paying for a cab unless you have a huge amount of luggage. I'd venture a little further out from the immediate area around Union Square for meals in the evening, as with most city centre areas things are over priced (although Colibri Mexican restaurant on Geary which is just round the corner from the hotel was very good), try Polk St and Sutter a short walk away or Chinatown. All in all the Chancellor really contributed to an absolutely fantastic trip to San Fran.

Reviews.Title: “A good, affordable hotel in a great location. No complaints.”
Reviews.Author: Intrepid_Traveler13
Reviews.Content: The Chancellor Hotel is in a prime location at the North West corner of Union Square. It is relatively close to all transportation including the BART from the airport. Although you will have to walk several blocks with your luggage from the Powell St. Station. The cable car stops right out front. The people at the front desk are very helpful with directions and bus lines. The hotel is very affordable compared to the others in the same neighborhood. The staff was nice and helpful. The lobby had seating, a bar and a small restaurant as well as a tour desk. I suppose the tour desk (where you could also buy public transportation passes, get airport shuttles, even water and cigarettes) was a good idea, but somehow, I thought it brought the lobby down a notch. There seemed to be free cookies and fruit in the lobby. I was too shy to ask if they were free. And there was free coffee and tea at all times. I was disappointed in the restaurant. They were out of sourdough toast for my breakfast. What’s the point of being in San Francisco if you don’t have sourdough toast? The rooms were clean and renovated. They weren’t huge, but they weren’t ridiculously small either. The bathrooms were large enough. The hotel was fairly quiet, although I could hear my neighbor’s alarm every morning. The neighborhood is great, of course. There are great restaurants, a Starbucks, and a very very convenient Walgreens very close by. You will be going there a lot! Of course Union Square is known for it’s shopping. I may stay there again if I need an affordable hotel. I have no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, Small room”
Reviews.Author: JJB
Reviews.Content: My second visit to San Francisco and still like it. We picked this hotel because of the good reviews here and its very reasonable price. Cable car is at the doorstep and there are numerous great restaurants and shopping outlets nearby. We did not eat at the Hotel, though the menu looked good. Instead we have had breakfast twice at Boudin 5-minute walk down the street at Macy's and dinner at Sears Fine Food next door. Both are absolutely fantastic. The hotel room is really small, though very clean and comfortable. We were given a room on the low floor (3rd or 4th) but we could not hear anything from the street (with windows opened). The bathroom is tiny and what came out from the shower head were nothing more than water powders. You certainly need patience, esp if you have long hair. Pretty understandable though for old buildings. The free in-room WiFi was great. For its price and convenience I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Lucky_Eddie
Reviews.Content: Based on TripAdvisor reviews, choosing the Chancellor was a no-brainer. So I did, easily, on-line. In the meantime, a relative who visited SF 30 years ago had great memories of a hotel and went to check out which it was. You guessed it - this one. I'm sure a lot has changed since. Including the rubber duckie, which now carries an I-pad and cell phone. But a lot hasn't changed - it's clean, friendly, efficient and well-run. Our preferences for a quiet room were fulfilled perfectly - top floor, in the back. No view but good protection from street noise. Not perfect, but you'll never get country quiet in the middle of a city. Actually, we could hear the clang of the cable car over the general (low-level) noise. This was cool - a frequent reminder of the great city we were in. Yes, the room was small, especially the bathroom. However it somehow didn't feel that small. My wife loved the mirrors all over the bathroom (including a magnifying one) that made it feel bigger, but also was great for checking out her hair from all angles. And the room itself seemed to be set up quite efficiently. Maybe the high ceilings also give a sense of more space. Didn't hear any noise from other rooms or the hallway. But then, things were built a lot more solidly a century ago. One neat thing you should take advantage of: they have a big selection of specialty pillows you can try out for free. A big surprise was the restaurant. We had an excellent breakfast there a couple of times. This is a city of good food, albeit a bit pricey. The hotel restaurant gave quick service with quality food at prices below the other nearby places. We stayed seven nights, giving us time to check out the ins and outs of SF, not just the major tourist trophies. In that time, we could not think of a single complaint in the Chancellor. (Okay - just one: the wireless internet was abysmally slow.) If we return to SF, there's no question the Chancellor will be our first choice of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: georgeybaby
Reviews.Content: initially i got off on the wrong foot with this hotel. we arrived early (2 hours before check in) but were told no rooms were avaliable yet. i was so tired from jet lag and had an upset tummy that had been bothering me for days, i looked like death warmed up, all i wanted was a place to rest and a shower. in the end our room wasn't even ready at check in time. my husband went to the desk to repeatedly check on the room status and in the end the front desk lady had to go to find the cleaners herself to check if the room had been done. my husband said to them, give us any room please, we really just need to rest, meanwhile i'm just about asleep on the lobby lounge and asking to use their bathroom every half an hour (which requires a key pass) and other people checking in after us got rooms before us (and as far as i know, all the rooms are the same). now i KNOW that check in time means check in time, but many other times when we have travelled, if we have gotten there early, and the room is not ready, we get the response of 'the room allocated to you is not ready but if you would like the same type of room on a lower floor/different view/whatever we can give that to you'. i was REALLY hoping this was the case as i seriously just wanted to walk out in front of a bus at high speed i felt so crappy. but it was not to be! however, once in the room, the room was great. clean, fresh, housekeeping was great, internet adequate (sometimes very slow), view was nice (looking towards macy's) and as it was our wedding anniversary they left us a nice bottle of wine and some (wierd fruit) chocolates and a card, which was nice. we also got a $75 card for the in house restaurant which covered 3 of 4 meals for us, AWESOME! check in aside, this hotel was great. i would still stay here again. i think it was alot of bad timing and circumstance that we had an initial poor experience. any other time i would have been happy to dump luggage and toddle off to have a look around. by the end of the trip i felt much better though. and i fell in love with san franscisco. do mr toads tours (3 hour tour) and check out the haight ashbury district for vintage shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Old style charm with modern comforts and ammenities”
Reviews.Author: Lemonfish8
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay here. The room rate we got online was great and the location is hard to beat! It's right on the trolley line so getting anywhere is really easy. We had read that the rooms are small but we were actually quite surprised and found our room was just perfect for the two of us. It's hard to fault this hotel to be honest; my only frustration was the hairdryer as it was quite small so it took a while longer than I'm used to to dry my hair. But then the hotel offered so many little extras that really made our stay (umbrella supplied in your room came in handy!) and my partner was a huge fan of the cookies in the lobby that were available all day. Will DEFINETLY be back on our next visit to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: L0ve2Fish
Reviews.Content: STAFF: Fabulous service from Kevin on reservations. Everyone we encountered was genuine, helpful & couldn’t do enough to help you out. CHECK IN: was seamless. ROOMS: quaint, compact and well appointed. Walk in wardrobe very practical. LOCATION: fabulous – right on cable car line, near shops and restaurants. CABLECARS: we made great use of a 3day MUNI pass, clocking up 9x cablecar + 8bus + 3subway rides (not that I was counting). FOOD: make sure you visit www.eotrading.com for exceptional Asian tapa type food with great atmosphere. AIRPORT TRANSIT: we had pre-ordered Lorrie’s Shuttles $14pp. You could easily take the Bart for $8.50pp as the 500m walk uphill isn’t too steep, however if you have a few bags the shuttle is the way to go. You can get a return shuttle to the Airport for $11pp using brochure coupons. SUBURBS: Walked pretty much ALL of SFO. Golden Gate Bridge is a must. *Fisherman’s Wharf – tourist scene with great views of Alcatraz & Golden Gate bridge. Crab meal specialities. *Castro - gay/lesbian scene with some interesting shop displays & bars! *Haight - equivalent of Amsterdam / hippy scene (without the drugs). *North Beach – Italian. *Cow Hollow – upmarket speciality stores pampering for you and your pooch - including dog bakery / grocery stores! We would recommend this hotel to any visitor or business traveller. A home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: herbnurse
Reviews.Content: The room was a bit warm. We kept the window open during the night and that helped a bit.. the bed was very comfortable, clean. MANY choices of pillows. Matt the bellman was exceptional. He recommended 3 restaurants and they were incredible. The bar tender was terrific. Great cookies and coffee in the lobby all day. I would definitely go back again but make sure we have a room that does not overlook a building. Small issue in comparison to what issues I have had in my travels. VERY convenient to union square, the trolley, the busline and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “The Chancellor is our home away from home & I wouldn't consider another place to stay in San Francisco!”
Reviews.Author: Maniladuck
Reviews.Content: I love the Chancellor and it's staff. We have been visiting San Francisco about twice a year, consistently, since 1990 and Chancellor Hotel is our home. Being on Powell Street and Union Square is a dream. We walk everywhere and I'm more familiar with the city streets there than I am at home. Shopping and eating is the best!! I love Susan at the Tour Desk......she's like part of our family and goes out of her way to help with anything we need. Matt has been a pure delight and also is part of our family and so helpful.......many, many times standing out in the pouring rain to hail us a taxi. The staff at Lute's have also become familiar with us and are so very cordial and accommodating. We also love stopping by for a cocktail before going out for the evening. During our late Summer to Fall stays we've appreciated the ease and help with the Giants packages also. Our rooms are perfect and I make sure I get the large walk-in closet for plenty of room to store my acquired "treasures". The most perfect touch is the rubber ducky....my daughter has collected every one I've taken home, noting date and occasion on the bottom of each. They are quite a conversation piece as they are all proudly displayed on shelves. I also appreciate the Clippership Membership with the free night's stay as a bonus. The only request I seem to have is better lighting in the bathroom with an updated mirror. I realize the fixtures are very old, but it takes quite a while for the bathroom mirror to clear after it has fogged up from the shower. I appreciate everyone......front desk and room staff, included. Everyone is very friendly and makes us feel at home.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel to stay at right in the heart of Union Square.”
Reviews.Author: rsmith_328
Reviews.Content: I'm from San Francisco, and on my return from 9 months overseas, chose to stay here because of my previous experiences with the hotel and the people that work here. As a native, with an in depth knowledge of the hotels here in the City, I would hands-down recommend this as the best combination of price, service, comfort and location that you can find in SF. If you stay here, you will not be disappointed!!

Reviews.Title: “The Chancellor was friendly, convenient, and perfect for a visit to SF spent on the go.”
Reviews.Author: foxhunterbear
Reviews.Content: We found many positive reviews of the Chancellor on Trip Advisor.com and, along with the price, this enticed us to skip out of the conference hotel (Nikko) and try this family-owned hotel. The location cannot be beaten being just a few steps north from Union Square and across the street from a cable car stop. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We especially enjoyed the bartender/server in the small but well-stocked bar. There seemed to be some local regulars that stopped in and despite the small space, it was a lovely place to have drinks before heading out to dinner. The drinks too were incredibly reasonable in price which brought us back each afternoon. We ate breakfast two of our three mornings and enjoyed delicious omlets and eggs benedicts for again a very low prices compared to other hotel breakfasts. The rooms were small (to be expected in an old hotel), not alot of excess space to move around in but it was clean and quiet. As we were on the go alot, this simple place to come back to from a day out sightseeing, shopping, and conferencing was just fine. Be sure, if you are used to chain or luxury hotels, the Chancellor might initally make you think you are going to be roughing it but rest assured, you'll enjoy your time there. We definitely will be staying there on future visits to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and value”
Reviews.Author: SittingbourneOwl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 weeks ago, fantastic location of Union Square, booked thru Trailfinders, staying 5 nights but only paying for 4. Check in was very efficient and quick, stayed on 5th floor with a Powell Street view, didn't find it noisy , great view of Union Square saw the Chinese New Year parade. Room was on the small size, maybe needs a lick of paint, but it was still good, bathroom was definitely bijou but it had the deepest bath I've seen! Staff were very friendly, even the overnight front desk staff who I bumped into every morning when I went running, the lobby didn't seem crowded, didn't use the bar and restaurant, but the gift shop was very helpful, it is where you can buy Muni ticket and also book your ride to the airport. Now the pluses, bed and pillow menu was very tateful, papers are free from the lobby, as is the free tea/coffee/hot water, cookies and apples, a very personal touch that wouldn't happen in big chains. Location was great for exploring the city, 5 mins walk to Chinatown, don't bother with Grant Street and the tacky shops, for a real taste of Chinatown , walk thru the Stockton Street Tunnel and then the hustle and bustle of market shops hits you. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at the Chancellor hotel - good location, clean and comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: Renata1947
Reviews.Content: We got a good deal via Trailfinders and this hotel was recommended by a friend as well. Good choice! We were very happy staying there (4 nights). The staff was very helpful and the 24 hour hot drinks a nice welcome after a cold day/night outing. We could see Union Square and Macey's from our window and Saks was across the road. The cable car stopped right outside the hotel. Public transport and streetcar within walking distance as well as the hop on hop off bus. Very happy with our stay

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful gem in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: blutoes
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Chancellor Hotel several times now and have always been happy with everything. The rooms are clean, nicely decorated, and comfortable. They offer all of the services that anyone could need, plus they have so many little things that places of this size and prices don't offer, such as a selection of pillows, a safe, an umbrella, and the most wonderfully giant and deep bathtubs with your own rubber ducky. I feel like the staff at the Chancellor Hotel really care about making their quests comfortable and happy. Besides all this, the location cannot be beat! You can literally walk out the front door and hop on a cable car, or take a bus to anywhere in the city. Walk a few blocks down to Market Street and you can catch forms of transport to take you all over the Bay Area. And all of the best stores are in the Union Square area too, all within a few blocks of the hotel. I've read in some previous reviews that people have complaints about the size of the rooms, that there is no air conditioning, and that there is street noise. To them, I say do your research - it is not the hotel's fault if you don't. The Chancellor is a historic hotel on a main street in a major metropolitan city. Take a few moments to read the information at their web site - they are not hiding any of these facts. And all you have to do is look at any map to see that Powell Street is the main road for two of the cable car lines. I personally love the sounds of the cable car bells and the street musicians at night - it's what being on vacation is all about: experiencing something different. I have enjoyed every stay at the Chancellor Hotel and plan to stay there every time I visit San Francisco in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Gem in the Center of it All”
Reviews.Author: Cyndy305
Reviews.Content: My husband called the hotel when we changed planes in Las Vegas, and asked their advice re which restaurant we should choose for dinner that evening. They helped us make a good choice and they called and made us a dinner reservation. My luggage didn't make our connecting flight, but when we returned to the hotel that evening, my suitcase had been delivered and hotel staff put it in our room -- it was waiting for me there instead of downstairs at the front desk. Front desk was professional, helpful and competent. Soda, water and snacks were available for a reasonable price, and there were ice machines on every floor. The hotel feels classy and refined, with lots of brass and glass. Classic and tastefully understated decor. I rearranged the chairs in the room to give us a little more space -- but everyone says the rooms in SF are always tiny. Our room was small but not tiny. The bed was very comfortable. I didn't realize that they didn't have king beds, but the queen room we had (for a very reasonable price) was more than adequate. Great mattress and pillows. We didn't feel cramped. We are average sized people. If you are larger, you could request room with two twin beds and possibly put them together for a king? The bathroom was small, but very nice, and had a HUGE tub (no jets). They provided bath salts and I took advantage of a nice hot bath after we returned from walking all over SF for most of the day. No A/C, but we didn't need it. You can request a high or low floor, and you can request a "quiet" room. We were on the 10th floor on the back. It was perfect. We had a great view and no noise from the busy street on the front. This hotel is on the cable car line which runs up and down Powell Street. Very convenient. Just walk outside and there is a cable car stop -- you're on your way. The breakfast offered in this hotel was outstanding. Lots of great choices. I had New Orleans Eggs Benedict -- fantastic and fresh! Good coffee and service. Affordable and reasonable. Next door to Sears Inn, which has great swedish pancakes. Easy to get a cab to and from this hotel -- cabbies knew where our hotel was just by providing the name. I can't think of anything negative about this hotel. A great place to stay: great room, happy environment, very convenient location, safe area, close to great restaurants, stores and nightlife. All at a very reasonable price. You don't need to go through all the blind bidding on Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, Great location, Comfortable room, and linked to a full gym”
Reviews.Author: S-J-M_93312
Reviews.Content: I had an excellent stay at the Chancellor. From the moment I arrived the staff was welcoming and very helpful, and every staff member I encountered during my stay was very polite. The Chancellor was located perfectly for me. A couple blocks from the conference I was attending, right on the trolley car line, close to many restaurants, and a block from the gym that they are connected with rather than having a small workout facility on site. The gym was a nice bonus, as it was close and the staff there treated me like I was one of their members, getting to participate in group excercise classes as well as have full access to the rest of the workout equipment and the pool. The room was comfortable, and I was able to get a good night's sleep each night, and enjoyed trying out some different pillows from their pillow menu. Staff was helpful with giving directions to anywhere I needed to go and they recommended a great restaurant upon request.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC!!!”
Reviews.Author: chimakuni
Reviews.Content: I am a hotel snob! I was leery of staying at the Chancellor HOWEVER, it was one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. The staff - fantastic. The location - could not have been better. The atmosphere - great. We had adjoining rooms, facing Powell Street, on the fourth floor. I was concerned about the noise level from the cable cars - no problems. We were actually able to go out on the fire escape and watch the Chinese New Year's parade. The shampoo, conditioners and soap were replenished every day. They had souvenir rubber duckies to play in the (huge) tub with and then bring home, gratis. Sears, the restaurant was right next door, and their desserts (dinners, too) are not to be missed. The hotel's restaurant was very nice - we had breakfast there twice - Mao was a wonderful waiter. If you are traveling to San Francisco - do yourself a favor and stay at the Chancellor Hotel on Union Square. You will be so happy you did.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Boutique Hotel - great value and great location.”
Reviews.Author: wrobbins
Reviews.Content: The Hotel staff were all very helpful and made me feel welcome. I liked the room, I found it comfortable and had a great view looking onto Union Square. The free WiFi in my room was really handy. I was there during my Birthday, when I arrived there was a note wishing me a Happy Birthday and a bottle of white wine in my room (nice touch). I stayed in room 1505. I asked for a top floor to avoid the street noise as suggested in other reviews. I couldn't hear the street noise from the top floor but the rooms ending in 05 are next to the ice machine and the one on the 15th floor is very noisy (I have sensative ears, it might not bother everyone). The Hotel staff moved me to 1405 very easily and I slept well there (the machine on that floor is quieter). I was there during the Chinese New Year parade in February 2011. I could see it from my room. Watched it while enjoying my complimentary wine. I would definately stay at the Chancellor again - a perfect sanctuary to return to after a long day of sightseeing. It was a good deal in the off season.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Crossmen
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Chancellor Hotel for 6 nights during a convention at the Mascone Center. The Hotel is old but well maintained. At $156 a night in San Francisco I must say it was well worth the money. Plus.... Very small but comfortable rooms, very clean. It you like the old style soaking tubs, you will love this hotel. It's a 15 minute walk to the convention center with plenty of restaurants and jazz clubs within walking distance. Cons... If you are traveling with more than one person, the rooms are very small. Might be a little uncomfortable. The Internet connection is VERY slow. I could not keep a VPN connection while trying to do work. Tips.... If you are coming from SFO, you can talk the Subway to Union Square and just walk up two blocks. Very convenient. Plus you can save on the $50 cab fare from the airport. The Cable Car stops right in front of the Hotel. Can take you into Castro or China Town. There is a great Italian Restaurant directly across the street called Scala. Also a block down the street there are two Thai Noodle shops. Great Noodle soups...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LovedParis
Reviews.Content: Love tht it was right on Union Square, and on Powel Street. 4 blocks from the BART station. We had stayed right off of Powell a few years ago and found the other hotel noisy and were unable to sleep. This room was quiet, and yet we were even more conveniently located. The bar was great - happy hour specials that we weren't expecting in San Francisco. they even gave us 2 for 1 drink coupons, and discounts for the hotel diner. Didn't have time to eat there, so I can't comment, but our stay was great - rooms were clean, and as I said, can't beat the location.

Reviews.Title: “An Overall Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: Rahulm80
Reviews.Content: Pros: Great location with a friendly staff. The cable cars run right in front of the Hotel and Union Square is across the street. They offer off site parking for a rate lower than the norm for SF. Hotel was extremely clean, rooms, lobby, dining area, everything. We only stayed one night so we didn’t take much advantage of things other than the lobby and our room. Con: We stayed in a room with one king size bed, it might as well have taken the entire room up. It was quiet small and cramped. Those with small children may find this to be a slight issue. The walls were a bit thin also, we could hear the tv in the room next to us late at night. All in all a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Pixapins
Reviews.Content: Well-located, comfortable, clean, spacious room ... An excellent value for the money

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel...great staff...great location....great price!!”
Reviews.Author: Nicola W
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 night stay at the Chancellor Hotel..and to us it was everythng that all other reviews have said, so I wont repeat myself too much..well try not to!! Great location, in the heart of everything and right outside the cable car stop. Personal and friendly hotel, rather than a big chains, I can not fault any of the staff, Alisha behind the bar was amazing, giving us local recomendations of restaurants and bars, a wealth of knowledge of local places rather than touristy ones. She also helped us source some wines they sell from a local off licence, even calling ahead to ensure they had them in stock. She was fantastic!! So much so that on our last night we enjoyed her company so much we did not even make it to dinner!! Bell Boys also great, giving us more advice and help. Rooms were great, ample room for us, but I know that in the US you probably may think them a little small, bathrooms a little tired but quite possibly the best shower I have ever had. Little touches in the hotel, make this stick out....umbrella in room, sweets in room, pillow menu and the tea and coffee was great to get you going in the morning. Be sure to pick up all the local maps, they have great discount vouchers on the back, including the one behind the bell boys desk has a 2 for 1 wine tasting voucher at the wine collective at Fishermans wharf. A great escape from the rain for a few hours!! All in all a fantastic hotel that I would not hesitate to recomend to anyone, thank you to all at the Chancellor to making our trip to San Fran amazing!! Nicola & Mark

Reviews.Title: “Don't let the low price scare you, GREAT hotel.”
Reviews.Author: skrdina
Reviews.Content: This is our 4th time staying here and we'll be back again. The staff at this hotel takes pride in its hotel from the nice gal in the front desk to the sweet housekeeping lady offering extra towels to the cheerful waiter in the morning. Always consistent. Always clean. Best location. On my last visit I had a small situation and had to deal with the hotel manager. He was very kind and went out of his way to please me. Would definitely go back and highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “It was a great night at the Chancellor hotel with my husband!”
Reviews.Author: ingridlissete
Reviews.Content: I loved staying there the room was very cozy i wanted to sleep for days, we had a nice romantic stay and the breakfast was killer eggs benedict were the best!!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in the city, you haven't heard of.”
Reviews.Author: Esquire7800
Reviews.Content: I wanted to stay in Union Square when celebrating our anniversary, but can't stand staying at a large hotel that treats people like just a number. A friend recommended this place since its next to the park, on the cable car line, next to a city jewel pancake house and just finished a renovation. The staff is hysterical, the rooms have all new furniture, the location is perfect and to top it off your not going to break the bank on the cost of a room. Stay here. You won't regret it. TIP: Name the rubber ducky.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS.....VERY COMMON AT THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: dandfbud
Reviews.Content: So we gave this hotel every chance to redeem themselves. When we approached the front desk about bed bug bites that appeared after a single night's stay it was clear that it was not the first time they had dealt with this problem. They turned the room upside down, and gave us another room for the evening....we had no choice but to stay there. When we looked at the bed bug website - the financial district in San Fran basically had one big red blotch over it and seemingly every hotel had dealt with it. As for this place the higher level front desk person had close to zero customer service skills, and the manager never came to speak with us. I would absolutely tell anyone looking for a hotel in San Francisco to carefully research the area and the specific hotel. We had to dry clean or wash everything in hot water when we got home - vacuum all bags and put as much as possible in a hot dryer...it was a nightmare. Plus bites took a couple of weeks to heal. We choose this hotel for the location and price...but got what we paid for....especially bad service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: FloridatravelerTampa
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently locatec near Union Square. The street car stops almost in front of the hotel. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The bed was very comfortable. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “No need to hesitate - book your stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Vik_travel
Reviews.Content: Long story short: This is an amazing hotel! Book first, and ask questions later (seriously). Just to clarify, I got this room for a fantastic rate ($75 on Expedia.ca), so my review is coming from the perspective of someone who paid a very decent price for this hotel. PROS: +Awesome location: Everyone mentions this in their review, but I'd just like to reiterate what an amazing location the Chancellor is located in. Close to EVERYTHING, including Union Square, cable cars, food, shopping etc. You seriously can't do any better than this when it comes to staying in SF (Fisherman's Wharf is only about 10-15 mins away on the cable car) +Very, very clean: The housekeeping staff does a great job cleaning your room, and overall the room was very well maintained. (although the bathroom could use a slight refresh; no biggie though) The housekeeping/maintenance staff are also EXCEPTIONALLY nice. Can't say enough good things about them. Very polite, asked me how my day was etc., and were SUPER fast when I had a few things that I needed (phone wasn't working, requested a fridge and white noise machine) +The Pillow Menu: The Chancellor offers a "pillow menu" which has at least 8-10 different pillow types you can request - including pillows I had never even seen or heard of before. Definitely worth trying out if you're staying for a few days or longer +Not noisy (really!): A few reviews mentioned that the rooms tended to get a bit noisy at night time with all the traffic and all that. I slept with the windows open, and my room was facing Powell Street - and I slept like a baby (although maybe my 18+ hour sightseeing days kind of exhausted me as well!). A little tip: the hotel has some white noise machines which really help, so don't hesitate to request one of those. +Other pluses: A few things which I found useful: 1) There isn't really a gym in the hotel, but they do have an agreement of some sort with a full-sized gym ("Club One Health Club" if you want to Google it). It's literally a 5 minute walk away from the hotel (Mason & Sutter), and it has everything you'd need. I think it's a great idea, since most hotel "gyms" usually consist of 2 treadmills and a few free weights. This gym was great, and the staff there is nice too (tip: take your hotel card & one piece of ID with you...lockers w/ locks are provided) 2) Safe is included, as well a heater (not really sure when you'd need that in San Fran!) Oh, and including an umbrella in the closet was also a nice touch. 3) Mini-fridges aren't really included in the room, but you can request one without any problem 4) Great channel selection on TV: Didn't watch much of it, but they had all the useful channels (at least to me), including CNBC, CNN, ESPN and all the other good stuff. 5) Tour desk is staffed with a great lady (sorry, forgot her name!), but you can book everything through her (or at least get some info) - and muni passes are available from her (DEFINITELY get the muni pass if you're staying for longer than a day or two) 6) Can't forget the almost-famous rubber ducky in the bathroom ;) DEBATABLE: +/- Room temp: I went during January, and the weather was picture perfect (22-24 degrees Celsius, sunny all day). However, I DID notice the room was slightly warm during the afternoons when I came back to change clothes or something. There is a ceiling fan which helps, and you can open the window all the way. But honestly, I don't know how bearable the room would be in the heat of the summer. The hotel DOES NOT have A/C. Not really a big deal, but if you're going in the summer and absolutely NEED the A/C, then you may need to think twice. CONS: -Wi-fi Internet: Wasn't AWFUL, but it wasn't very speedy during many times. For some odd reason, the best wi-fi reception I got was in the bathroom (don't ask me how I know this :P) -Front desk staff: The staff is "pleasant", but honestly I did not find them particularly engaging. There was one particular woman at the front desk in the afternoon who was pretty stiff. I asked her how to get to the gym, and she rolled her eyes at me like I was bothering her or something. And when I got to the gym, the guy at the front desk said that guests need to bring a piece of ID with them - something the lady at the front desk didn't mention (luckily the staff at the gym are very nice, so I was able to slip through). Another gentleman at the desk, who I think is the supervisor/manager (young-ish looking guy) also didn't really seem to go out of his way to engage with people at the front desk. Not really a big deal, but kind of blemished the otherwise great hotel OVERALL: The hotel definitely made my stay in San Fran (which is an awesome city, btw) a bit more memorable and tension-free overall. Apart from the few slightly negative "cons", I wouldn't ever hesitate to give this hotel a second chance or to recommend it to someone else. I just hope the front desk staff can be a bit more consistent in their customer service so they don't tarnish the reputation of this otherwise amazing hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: dopeschool
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Chancellor Hotel for three days while on business in San Francisco and could not have been more pleased with our stay. The staff was kind and accommodating, the rooms were clean and well-appointed (although small) and the location was perfect. We would definitely stay here again when in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: czilbo
Reviews.Content: Chancellor in Union Square has a perfect combination of wonderful location and excellent service.Rooms are a little bit small but absolutely comfortable.The only negative point is that they don't include breakfast and this would be great.

Reviews.Title: “They do everything right!”
Reviews.Author: barrytunes
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small, but the hotel makes up for it with exemplary service. EVERYONE on staff has a positive attitude and does everything possible to accommodate concerns or requests. Traffic sounds were occasionally an issue at night (trucks beeping, emergency vehicles). Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly placed hotel for those wanting to explore the city”
Reviews.Author: WarmCargo
Reviews.Content: The Chancellor was one of 7 hotels we stayed in during a recent trip across California, and this was without doubt the best of the bunch. It's by no means a 5 star hotel, but for the price I don't think they could be beaten. The hotel is right on Union Square with the Powell St cable car stop right outside. The rooms are nice, the bathrooms clean and functional, and the room we had included a large walk-in wardrobe. For those that like to stay connected, the hotel has fast free wifi available with solid signal strength. The staff are very friendly, helpful and knowledgeable about the city. We will definitely be staying here again the next time we're in San Fran.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: vlp50
Reviews.Content: This hotel is small but neat and clean it has a European feel about it. Very convenient to downtown San Francisco across from Union Square. Tea, coffee and cookies are available 24/7 which is a very nice touch, we have stayed here before and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel but beware of poor treatment if you book through Priceline...”
Reviews.Author: nreitter
Reviews.Content: I stayed just one night (for business) at the Chancellor. The location is excellent but that is where the excellence ends. I was treated like a complete second class citizen because I booked through Priceline &, assumably, received a discounted rate. The man loudly & distainfully said "since you booked through Priceline all we have for you is a twin bed". Really? I'm a 38 year-old business traveler, not a 10 year-old at a slumber party. Anyhow, I asked if the two twin beds could be moved together to make a larger bed & he flatly said "no". When I got to my room I had a lovely view of a cement wall & ventilation system. The room was fine. Nice flat screen TV. The bathroom had some sort of fan in it that did not seem to be able to be turned off so I had to sleep with the bathroom door shut. Also, it had a white shower curtain that seemed worse for wear to me. I ordered a side of pancakes, 2 scrambled eggs & a small orange juice for breakfast & the bill was $20-- ouch! Would've been ok except it wasn't any sort of special OJ-- just regular boxed stuff & the pancakes, I'm almost certain, were the "add water" box/mix kind. They were dry & chewy. Anyhow, i doubt I would stay again & I certainly would not stay if I am a Priceline user. You WILL be treated poorly.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: SmileyGirl_77
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Chancellor was awesome! Upon our arrival, I found a bottle of wine and a birthday card - what a way to start the weekend. The hotel staff was friendly/helpful, the hotel is located within walking distance of many stores, resturants, and the trolley, and it is such a cute boutique hotel. Don't forget to take advantage of the pillow menu!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location on Union Street”
Reviews.Author: gouroudesmers
Reviews.Content: Great location on Union square. Old Hotel but well refurbished. Rooms are small but very clean, bed is good. I was on the 13th floor, not oriented on Powel street, so it was very quiet, no noise at all. I guess if your room was on the 1rst floor, oriented to Powel street, the noise of the stret and of the cable car is probably high. There is a parking for your car just one block from thye hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel - excellent value, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: SDR-rattler
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I just spent 3 very pleasant nights at the Chancellor. We were there on a multi-purpose trip and love the location. It's right on the cable car route, easy walk to lots of restaurants, in the heart of shopping district, close to Chinatown, etc. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. Rooms are a bit small (European style), but very comfortable and have everything you need. If you're worried about street noise, ask for an upper floor room. Beds are great, room service is quick, great little bar in lobby with exceptional bartender. This was my second time at the Chancellor and I will definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in the Heart of S.F.”
Reviews.Author: Athena222
Reviews.Content: What a surprise. I've stayed at downtown hotels (Union Square) for business, spending hundreds each night. The rate here was totally reasonable, and location can't be beat. The desk folks let us check in at 10:30 a.m. (due to an early flight from the East Coast) and were very friendly and accommodating. The room was on the small side but perfectly adequate. Though it's an historic hotel, all bathroom fixtures were modern. The bar was very welcoming, with a great bartender. All staff were helpful in helping us figure out how to negotiate the city via public transportation. The only downside was paying $29 a day for parking, but tha't par for S.F. Wish the hotel had been able to negotiate a discount. All in all, a terrific, affordable, friendly place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a top location”
Reviews.Author: Lysh09
Reviews.Content: Fantastic little hotel with an old world and homely feel. The hotel has obvioulsy been refurbished recently and the decor has been well chosen, it was nice to have a hotel with a bit of character rather than a sterile chain hotel. Our room was very comfortable and spotless, we also appreciated the large safe so we could fit laptops etc in our room, rather than putting them in a hotel safe. The location can't be beat, great restaurants and shopping right at your front door. The cable car also stops right outside and takes you directly to Fisherman's Wharf. The price was very reasonable as well, we got a deal for $95US a night which I was very happy with. We also stayed over New Years and were pleased with the hotel security, each guest was given a wrist band and you weren't admitted to the hotel without it.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel - superb value and service”
Reviews.Author: gerbilsontour
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 4 days whilst at a conference at the Westin Union Square. This hotel was great and really good value. It is small and private and homely rather than ultra modern. My room was medium sized but large enough with a nice desk and tele and large walk-in closet and good sized bathroom with full bath. The bed was large and comfortable and there was a great pillow menu. being at teh back my room was quiet. There is no aircion but there is a ceiling fan. There is no tea/coffee making facilities in the room but they provide free tea/coffee/biscuits/apples in the reception bar all day - this was fantastic as instead of having meetings standing in the very busy lobby of the Westin I could invite guests to come and meet with me at the lovely quiet small lobby of the Chancellor. Internet is also free at this hotel. They are happy for you to order food to eat in your room from nearby cafes - so when I arrived late on a saturday night I had a nice delivery pizza. There is a small restaurant in the hotel that offers good value simple meals (sandwiches etc). Good value cocktails during happy hour (5pm - 7.30pm). All the staff were very helpful. There is a shuttle bus to the airport for $14. A very nice home-from-home stay with great service, great value for money and a great location right on Powell Street on Union Square. Why pay more at flash chains when this little gem offers so much!!

Reviews.Title: “Location Location”
Reviews.Author: calucatoo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location right next to the tram line and walking distance to all the shopping in downtown San Francisco. The room was small and the bathroom very small. Parking is very expensive an add on cost that we didn't need. Every other hotel even 'budget' hotels have provided free parking. So it would only be worth staying here if you don't have a car.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in best location”
Reviews.Author: Italiandreamer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights after completing our California Coastal Road Trip. We arrived at 1500 hours but only 1 room out of 4 ready however they let us leave our baggage and we helped ourselves to their free tea/coffee and fresh cookies which is available 24 hrs a day from the bar/reception area. Our rooms were ready within 30 mins so not a major problem and the porter took our bags up for us. We were all allocated rooms on the 9th floor so heard no traffic noise at all for such a central spot. Room was not huge but adequate, very clean and freshly decorated. Bathroom was very small but was clean with great shower with plenty hot water and toiletries/towels provided. Bed was extremely comfortable with a choice of pillows offered to order. Complimentary bottle of wine given in room and jar of sweeties too. The concierge Susan was very helpful in organising sightseeing trips and shuttle bus for us to the Airport at a very good price. After wondering around SF this hotel was definately in the best location in a very safe neighbourhood overlooking Union Square. Exceptional quality for the price paid (GBP 80 per night) considering how good the hotel was. Far better choice of restaurants and close to shops and nicer area than Fishermans Wharf which is noisy and very touristy and not where I would choose to stay. Would recommend the Chancellor to anyone either business traveller or tourist alike.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tshaw9
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Chancellor for nine days 4/13th December. What more can I say fantastic, great staff, great location, great little bar with great Happy Hour, room and bathroom a little on the small size but very comfortable and clean, even got used of the street noises in night. Overall a very pleasant hotel to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Nice Price, Great Location, Super GM”
Reviews.Author: Belle-Lettrist
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at Chancellor Hotel. The location in Union Square is stellar and makes up for the fact that the hotel is in need of a gentle makeover. The hotel has a wonderful history, great location, nice architecture, fabulous rates, and great bones, and needs only some small improvements to make it more comfortable for the business traveler. However, as someone who is on the road for work at least a couple of times a month and stays in all kinds of hotels, I can't recall a more responsive, hands-on, accessible General Manager than Wes Tyler.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: WendyVacaville_CA
