Reviews.Content: When looking for a centrally located hotel in the Union Square area of San Francisco, the Chancellor Hotel fits the bill. Staff pays attention to your needs. Rooms are well done and comfortable. Price is decent for what you are getting. First class restaurants are a short walk away. All in all...one of the best hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel; loved the location”
Reviews.Author: Wood501
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights here on our way to Fiji & New Zealand. Well positioned rooms with nice decor the bathrooms were a little dated but plenty of hot water and good pressure. Fantastic location just off Union Square with the cable car running right outside the front door which takes you directly to the Wharf. Friendly staff that were very helpful. Can't comment on breakfast or the food served at the hotel as we chose to eat elsewhere. I am a fussy customer but if visiting San Francisco again I would stay here.

Reviews.Title: “If your going to San Francisco, be sure to”
Reviews.Author: Howard-Moon
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located near Union Square the hotel is well situated to take in all San Francisco has to offer with either nearby public transport (trams directly outside and main bus routes within a few blocks) or within reasonable walking distance. The hotel is a little dated and not sure whether this made it ‘quaint’ or in need of a bit of modernisation. The bathrooms although functional had the feel of the facilities in my Granny’s house. However, not withstanding this, the room was large enough and clean and served our needs more than adequately for our short stay in San Francisco. As mentioned by others the free tea and coffee facilities in the lobby were a nice touch and free internet access also in the main lobby was also useful. Staff also excellent and very helpful We stayed for three nights on a stop over to New Zealand and managed to take in a lot of the local attractions. Easy access to the main sights either by walking or public transport – a short walk to Chinatown (albeit up some of the hills), tram down to Fishermans Wharf, local bus (No 5) out to Golden Gate Park and a 15 minute walk to the Ferry building for the start point of some of the tours. City Tour (from Ferry Building) takes in most of the local sights and includes trip over the bridge to Sausalito for lunch – ferry back past the ‘Rock’ and then last trip out to Alcatraz (in the dark - very eerie and atmospheric) Segway Tours – takes in some of the backstreets and a chance to have a bit of a tear up on the pier Top Tips : Shuttle bus from the airport $30 as to $60 in a cab Get the trams back from the Wharf terminal as opposed to the 'Cannery' terminal which can get very busy with long queues Plenty of Restaurants within easy walking distance of the hotel off Union Square – so no need to venture too far in the evenings

Reviews.Title: “Top Hotel, top location”
Reviews.Author: Eekthecat88
Reviews.Content: We stayed over the Christmas break. Great location on Union Square. Cable car outside and next to the restaurant Sears. This hotel is old and not one of your newer chain hotels but has character and everything you would need for the right price. We followed advice on trip advisor aand asked for a high floor room as you will hear the cable car bell on lower floors. We didnt use the restaurant but the tour desk was run by a super efficient woman called Susan who was very helpful. Staff were nice and cleaning staff very efficient. Stay here you want excellent location for a great price. Pillow menu option was a nice touch. Free Wi Fi Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed several times - now too expensive and not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Shakti1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel annually for a conference. Three years ago the rate was $59/night, then $89/night and this year $180/night. This year, they charged my credit card for one night stay three days before arrival - actually charged the card - even though the cancellation policy is 24 hours. I was told "it is our policy to check the card to make sure it goes through." What? In my 100,000 miles of travel/year usually, i have never had this happen. In this instance, it seems their outsourced credit card processor actually put through the charge which supposed to have been reversed.. When a five star hotel is $99 in this economy, the OK Chancellor is no longer worth it. The hotel can command this price because it is in immediate proximity of this conference but the bloom is off the rose. The rooms are very small - tiny - there is no temperature control system and no room service. No exercise facility whatsoever. Checking in with a car is difficult as there is rarely room in front of the hotel to pause one's car to unload. I previously considered this hotel an incredible find with courteous service. Tonight, the manager engaged in a circular conversation, repeating the obvious without solution until Monday.

Reviews.Title: “Old Hotel Charm”
Reviews.Author: criticul
Reviews.Content: My only criticism was that because we booked through Priceline, we were given twin beds. Made the romance focus of our trip a tad challenging.

Reviews.Title: “Fab location”
Reviews.Author: Carlau
Reviews.Content: We loved the Chancellor, lovely hotel with old city feel. The room was comfy, nice bed, massive closet enough room to keep two suitcases in and lots of space to hang clothes. Bathroom was quite small but we didn't find this an issue. Sweets left in a jar each day in the room was a nice touch and the free cookies in reception were yummy. Tram stops right outside hotel, although we walked a lot, walking distance to China Town. Lots of nice bars and resturants in the area, lovely little pizza resturant on the corner which was open til late. Hotel close to lots of shops and mall and main train station close by which takes you straight to the airport. We felt the hotel was a great choice. Only negative and no reflection on the hotel itselfs but there are a lot on beggers in the area but we did not feel unsafe as area is very busy at night.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and great value for money - lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: USAFAN_11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Chancellor for a short part of our 3 week honeymoon. This hotel was lovely, it had great character and the staff were very helpful. The rooms were clean and quiet and we were a short walk from everything in San Francisco. As it was our honeymoon, when we arrived in our room we found a bottle of champagne and some chocolates. I would definitely stay at this hotel if we were to return to San Fran and would certainly recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for just about everything”
Reviews.Author: Tuckers24
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a lovely time at the Chancellor Hotel. We only stayed for 4 nights, as part of a longer holiday, and found the Chancellor to be all that we had hoped for. The location, right on Union Square, was perfect for exploring San Francisco and, despite being right in the hub of the city, the rooms were very quiet. The hotel staff were friendly and the free coffee and cookies in reception were a welcome treat and something not experienced at other hotels in the US where typically nothing is 'on the house'. My only complaint was that the rooms were a little on the small side and the bathrooms were a little dated but for the price and location the hotel is difficult to beat on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “A very enjoyable four night stay.”
Reviews.Author: serengeti49445
Reviews.Content: My fiancee' and I decided to leave our cold Michigan December winter and fly to San Francisco for a four night escape. We loved our stay at the Chancellor Hotel. Such a wonderful location, friendly staff, great food in the restaurant and those delicious cookies and coffee in the lobby. We were originally assigned a room with no view, but after requesting a change we were immediately accommodated. We have stayed here before and we will stay at the Chancellor again. Thanks again for everything!!! Happy New year, Joe Piziali

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Vbg
Reviews.Content: Our French family wanted to visit San Francisco so we booked 3 rooms for 2 nights. The room rate was great for San Francisco and included free parking half a block away. You cannot beat the location on Union Square. The rooms were stylish, clean and very comfortable with a choice of pillows. A family member forgot some clothing in the room and they arranged to have it shipped. We will no doubt stay at the Chancellor again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Very Comfy Beds”
Reviews.Author: Ohjustpeachy
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is as good as it looks, right at Union Sq with cable cars passing outside, the bart/muni within one - three min walk and major shopping stores within one! The rooms are NOT at all tiny, they comfortably sleep two with room enough to accommodate suitcases, shopping etc. They come with free wi-fi, modern flat-screen tvs, plenty of green tea toiletries, bath, shower, in-room safe, large closets, pillow menus, and in our case we were presented with a card and complimentary bottle of bubbly to help celebrate. It's the small touches that count and this hotel has them all. Free tea, coffee & cookies are available in the lobby all day, there's a starbucks on the corner if you prefer something else. Chinatown is about four mins away, there's so much to see close by that we walked everywhere. I wouldn't hesitate to use the hotel again or recommend it to friends; it's clean, warm, charming, staffed with helpful & friendly people and reasonably priced. What else do you need??!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: CandGSLO
Reviews.Content: The Chancellor gives you fantastic service, terrific location, and very clean and comfortable rooms. With the parking package, it's the best deal in the city!

Reviews.Title: “So close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: imasecretagent
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at The Chancellor for 4 nights and found the hotel to be fantastic. However, we didn't spend much time in our room! The beauty of the hotel is its convenience to the transport, the shops and all of the action of Union Square. You will not believe how close you are to everything - brilliant!! It is NOT fancy. In fact, it is quite dated so don't expect to find a modern suite or a large room. We stayed in a twin single room and it was comfortable for the 2 of us and we found the free WiFi throughout the hotel to be one of our favourite features, as we spent a lot of time after the day's/night's activities chatting to friends back in Australia on our laptops for free. The bathroom was quite old and small but clean and functional. There was a huge walk-in wardrobe which allowed us to get our luggage out of the way. The beds were comfortable and there's even a pillow menu. My only concern about the room is that there is no air-conditioning which for us travelling in winter wasn't really a problem. However, we couldn't sleep with the window open due to the degree of street noise and we slept with the fan on even in December to get enough cool air circulating in to sleep comfortably. I imagine on a warm night this could be a problem. Overall though, small criticism for a really great hotel experience for an amazingly good price. By the way, breakfast in the hotel is sensational! We are yet to have a better breakfast in the city and it was good value. The happy hour cocktails at the bar are, likewise, excellent! San Francisco is an amazing city - enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: jennobrn
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located near various transportation options. It was perfect for hoping on and off the cable car. We had a room overlooking Powell St., it was a little noisy but exactly what we had expected. If you must have it absolutely quiet to sleep don't stay on that side of the hotel. We enjoyed listening to the city below. Room was clean, small (but large enough for the 2 of us), nicely decorated. Staff was friendly. Would definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “It Is A Treasure”
Reviews.Author: gavve60
Reviews.Content: My 3rd stay here and it is a perfect fit. Stayed for 5 nights and this time was placed at the front of the hotel which I thought would be noisy. However once window closed there was only the faint noise of the cable car which if you on union square is a lovely sound. I like that you are in the centre of everything and able to use transit to get to all areas of the city and then be able to return to your cosy room at the end of the day. For a solo traveller the rooms are roomy and as stated the closet is very large. The bathroom is small and adequate and has lovely green tea bath products. Pillows and bed is very comfy and as stated the hotel is historical so the hallways are a little tight . Staff are very friendly and will store your luggage if you have a later flight so you can explore more. Free access to printer and internet in lobby. Had breakfast in restaurant one morning and was scrumptious. I was contemplating trying a different hotel on this visit. I am glad I didnt!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: lizone
Reviews.Content: This isn't the first time I have stayed at the Chancellor and I'm certain it will not be the last. Once again the staff were all so helpful and attentive and I think as well it's all the little things that make staying here a rewarding experience. The cookies, coffee and goodies in the lobby, the pillow menu, the gift on arrival, really good bed, deep tub complete with rubber ducky, really good value breakfast in Luques restaurant, free internet, umbrella etc etc. On top of all this the location just can't be beat. Walk out the door and you are in Union Square with Cable Cars going by, it's perfect. Looking forward to my next stay already.

Reviews.Title: “Swell time on our anniversary...”
Reviews.Author: Marc019
Reviews.Content: We liked this cute hotel. Our room was "smallish", but spotless, featuring a very comfortable bed, plenty of pillows(hurray!), and enough room for two people to move around. We selected this hotel online, mostly because it featured discounted parking and was right on Union Square. We don't regret our choice. The only downside for us was the spotty availability of hot water for tea in the lobby. We missed having a microwave or a coffeemaker in the room to make getting hot water more convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and well located”
Reviews.Author: loobs40
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights as part of our honeymoon and we were delighted to find chocolates, a present and a bottle of wine waiting for us when we checked in ! We had a room on one of the higher floors (17th perhaps ?) and we had a view of Union Square from the window. The location is fantastic, with the cable car running to Fisherman's Wharf, just outside the hotel door and large department stores such as Maceys within five minutes walk. The bed was extremely comfortable and the decor and furniture in the room was tasteful. Some may think the rooms are on the small side, but maybe because we are from Europe and have different expectations we found the room size perfectly adequate. We enjoyed a drink (or was it five?...) at the small bar on the second night and found Rory the barman to be a perfect host. We ate breakfast most mornings in the hotel restaurant and the service was good. The hotel offers some dicount vouchers for both the restaurant and bar when you check in. Suzy on the Tour Desk was extremely helpful and pleasant. Overall we really enjoyed our visit to San Francisco (see my review of green Dream Tours also) and we intend to visit again, but for a longer holiday. I will certainly book the Chancellor again.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy in the city!”
Reviews.Author: RVanslot
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed over Thanksgiving weekend! My husband booked the trip. I had some reservations about the hotel because, it was quite inexpensive. But, then I read the reviews which, were very positive. The hotel is in the heart of the CIty, on Union Square. Eventhough, it was very busy on the street, once you walked in to the hotel it was quiet, clean, cozy, and welcoming. Everybody that worked at the hotel was very helpful, nice, and unpretentious. The pillow menu was a really, unique and nice touch as was the, rubber ducky. The decor in the rooms was simply chic. The bed and pillows were very comfortable! The walls were a little thin but, we slept just fine! I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Over rated hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Stephen_301
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the locale if you want to be in the heart of SF. Great for shopping but with the location comes a lot of people and noise. Not my idea of an R&R destination. The room was small and rather worn. Mattress was not comfortable. Heat was from a portable plug-in heater. No onsite parking, parking is one block away and + $25/night. not out of line for the area Have stayed at other boutique hotels in the area a few blocks from Union Square which offer more in terms of space, room quality and in a relaxed atmosphere at similar price.

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite hotels”
Reviews.Author: moniclio
Reviews.Content: A great hotel, no unnecessary frills, but full of thoughtful details. I loved the simple and elegant room decor-very tasteful. They had a "Pillow menu" and some of the best quality sheets I have ever slept in a hotel. It felt like home. Great location. Excellent service. This is what i would call a "Minded hotel", making sure all your needs are met. When ever in SF again, this is my home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Would Not Hesitate to Stay at the Chancellor Again”
Reviews.Author: Mailgirl
Reviews.Content: I booked the Chancellor Hotel when I decided to add 2 more nights to an already planned trip to San Francisco. I contacted the hotel directly and received a great rate. I had a corner room on the 12th floor that overlooked Union Square. I had read the reviews of the Chancellor on here and was hoping it would live up to the hype. It did. I did not run into any employee who was not friendly or helpful. And they had answers for every question I asked about the hotel and the area. My room was very nice. The bed was comfortable and I really liked the tiled bathroom. It's not a modern an new place, it's quaint and historic. I expected the room to be on the small side, but there was plenty of room to move around. And the closet was so big, you could change inside it! And in there was a safe, an electric radiator, an umbrella, an iron & board and extra bedding. The first day I arrived, it was pretty warm. I just opened the window and turned up the ceiling fan and the room was quite comfortable. I even slept with the window open and the street noise did not bother me. The free wi-fi was a plus. I did not go to the restaurant or bar. (only because I was not there too long)

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Everything close by!!!”
Reviews.Author: Allison062
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location with the cable car out the front. Yes, the room was compact, but it was clean, tidy and comfortable. Who wants to sit in a hotel room while on holidays anyway!!! Great service in the restaurant and bar, a tour booking service and the staff were very obliging. And those homemade cookies in the foyer were delicious - a lovely touch to a great hotel. Take a trip to the Napa Valley from here - fantastic wines. Would definitely recommend and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: SophiaDeen
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect for all the downtown/Union Square Attractions and shopping. The room was comfortable, as was the bed. Overall it was a great value for the price and location. The staff was up to par, but not exceptional. We did like the girl who worked overnight on the night of check in. There is no coffee maker :-(, the heat does not work and there is a little plug in heater that does not really do the job, but other than that I would have given it 4 stars!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location,price and service”
Reviews.Author: jwj0909
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect, and the price is great for downtown San Francisco. The room is smallish but not a problem at all. The ceilings are high and it has a ceiling fan. The bathtub was large and comfortable. The bed was great. I found the sheets uncomfortable(scratchy)the first night, when I mentioned it to the front desk they were changed and I was very satisfied. It is very helpful that you can rent a car and/or buy a MUNI pass all in the hotel lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - the hotel "does what it says on the tin!"”
Reviews.Author: JKPUK
Reviews.Content: First class location in heart of San Francisco. Rooms adequate in size but certainly not large. Standards of cleanliness were OK. Staff friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value and Top Hotel in San Francisco!”
Reviews.Author: CardinalsLady
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a five-night stay at the Chancellor and found it absolutely perfect. I am astonished at the review that said she had a horrible bed - we had one of the BEST beds we've ever slept in at a hotel. The location is perfect for access to Union Square, the BART, the cable cars, and there are lots of wonderful restaurants in the area. The entire staff was very helpful, remembering us by name, and doing everything they could to be of assistance (making dinner reservations, looking up BART departure times, getting us a cab, etc.). They provided a mini fridge to our room upon request too. Some may comment on the smallish room and bathroom, but we found it to be more than adequate - and about the size of nice hotels in Europe. If you want to pay extra to say in a suite, fine - go for it. We didn't need air conditioning in November and found the overhead ceiling fan and open windows more than adequate. And our room (909) was incredibly quiet. NO street noise other than the occasional cable car. I can't say enough good things about this hotel and I will definitely recommend it to all of my friends - and should I ever return to San Francisco, this is the only place I'll consider staying. The Chancellor made my trip to San Francisco absolutely wonderful. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Smiles all round”
Reviews.Author: Evan_the_middle_one
Reviews.Content: You can't beat your first night ever in the States! Shell shocked, jet lagged? Stay here and feel welcomed. A great plus was the family atmosphere, by that I mean I felt like a part of the family. The rubber ducky is a nice touch as so many say, but the Irish bar tender and added booze made me fell very welcolmed at the small bar. He actually ran out onto the street to return my forgotten coat when I had left it behind!!! As an iside, the restaurant next door won't disappoint. Having swatted up on San Fran watching 'The Birds' it was so cool to be staying so close to the opening scene! I would recommend this hotel to anyone who would like to be central, with no bother, and a friendly smile. My only negative is that I did not meet the manager who writes decated responses to the dastardly comments on here, he seems like a real card!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Corey71
Reviews.Content: You can't put a price on the history of the Chancellor hotel and surrounding area. The cable cars run right in front of the hotel and you are in easy walking distance of Union Square and tons of restaurants and rental car locations. Starbucks across the street is handy as well. Very nice!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location-Bad Beds!”
Reviews.Author: tabbi_traveler
Reviews.Content: On our Babymoon to San Francisco, we had a fantastic time considering I was 28 weeks pregnant. You literally cannot beat the location of the Chancellor Hotel, but be prepared for horrible beds and rude staff. The lady in the lobby (can't remember her name) who helps you with attractions was the best though! It was a mixed bag, but considering the price and value I'd stay there again...

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location, Wonderful Staff, Will Definitely Stay Here Again!”
Reviews.Author: RebeccaQuinn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chancellor Hotel on Union Square for 4 nights. Everyone we encountered was very helpful and nice. We always felt safe and comfortable. Here is some more helpful info: 1. Close to the MUNI and the cable cars, so the location is very convenient. Plus, there is a Border's right next door for Seattle's Best Coffee (and there is free coffee in the hotel lobby, too!) 2. There is a place right in the lobby of the hotel that you can buy a MUNI passport at, and you can also get an airport shuttle there for just a few dollars more than the BART, and it is a much more comfortable and convenient ride. 3. The young lady at the front desk printed out our boarding passes for us - and she was happy to do so! 4. The cute yellow duckie in the bathroom was too cute! And the bath salts and deep bath tub were a plus - they helped soothe my aching calf muscles after walking up hills in Pacific Heights lol. 5. The food at Lucques was delicious! Everything was very fresh and cooked to perfection. I recommend the breakfast burrito - YUM! 6. We were greeted EVERY day by someone whenever we came and went from the lobby- we felt like royalty. 7. They have a pillow menu, but we didn't need it. We slept like babies on the pillows that were already on our bed.

Reviews.Title: “What a Lovely Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: ShantiGohil
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel for 6 nights in Nov '10. The Hotel is all you want from a Downtown Hotel. .From the SFO airport its a $8.10 usd ride to Powell Station on the BART and a 4-Block Walk and one is home and dry. The Location............... is absolutely spot on,walking distance to Cable car station,BART station.Union square is facing this hotel surrounded by all Designer shops and MACY's Dept.stores,this info is for shoppers only. Evenings can be spent in the Restaurant area on O'Farell street,which is 2 mins walk, 3 Irish Pubs are 2 mins walk which has live music very personal not staged.By the way they all serve good pint of Guiness. Transport.............Very good transport system the city has.As mentioned before SFO Airport by BART if required.But a must and i would recommend to any visitors to bye a Travel pass. 3 or 7 days avail, We bought a 7 day pass for $ 26 which can be used on Cable Cars,Buses and Street cars (Electric cars.under/over ground). Attractions.........Alcatraz Island tour is a must at $ 28 pp.pls book in advance depending on the time of the year.We booked a day before and was available because we were out of season. Golden Gate Bridge is also worth a visit.One can use travel pass to reach the Golden Gate by bus or Cable car and then walk on the bridge.Lovely view of SF city. and Alcatraz island. Amenities......The Hotel rooms are lovely and clean and room serviced every day.Hotel has free WI FI which is a Plus for this hotel.Flat Screen TV.Coffee and cookies available all day at the ground floor.And it has a small friendly Bar one can have a drink.Reception staff are very polite and friendly Conceirge personnel.As I mentioned before this is a No Nonsense hotel.All one needsfrom a City hotel. Only one little gripe if i had was that the TV programmes avail.had no Internation News Channel.only USA news.But i would not let this little minus scar the hotels review. So all in all a very good clean comfortable no nonsense downtown hotel.I would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: cyraxote
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nearly perfect. Any time you leave home, you’re bound to run into some hassles, but the Chancellor does an excellent job of minimizing those hassles to the point of invisibility. I don’t really trust any of the negative reviews I’ve read; I think these people had a bad day or just have an axe to grind. I corresponded a little with Wes Tyler, the Chancellor’s manager, after we made our reservation. He was extremely pleasant and, when we arrived, our room was exactly as we requested. We had a room on the front of the 13th floor; we didn’t realize until the 3rd day that the window was slightly open, but we had no trouble with noise before that and no trouble with temperature after closing it. The ceiling fan was more than sufficient for cooling (and I’m extremely sensitive to heat when sleeping). One caveat: because of the size of the bathroom and the placement of the toilet, larger persons might have difficulty getting comfortable on it. I’m 6’3”, 275 lbs, and I felt a little like a bear on a tricycle. It’s not a complaint, really; more just something to be aware of. In addition, since this is in the news quite a bit at the moment, I am happy to report that there are NO BEDBUGS! A sign in the room asks that tips for the housekeeping staff not be left in the rooms; however, tips are welcome (and deserved), but the front desk will provide an envelope for your tip at checkout if you ask for it. We didn’t try the hotel restaurant, but we had three good meals at Sears’ Fine Food, next door, and one at Lori’s Diner, half a block up Powell. The cookies always available in the lobby are excellent, especially the oatmeal-cranberry cookies. The Tour Desk in the lobby sells Muni passes and can arrange rental cars and transport to and from the airport. [We also recommend Mr. Toad’s Tours (mrtoadstours.com) and Jay Gifford’s Victorian Home Walk (victorianwalk.com; starting point is a half-block from hotel). House of Nanking (on Kearny St.) will change the way you think of Chinese food.]

Reviews.Title: “Great value for union square”
Reviews.Author: RickvanG
Reviews.Content: Great 'budget' hotel, early booking price $99 and an excellent base to explore the rest of San Fran

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: beaglemomCalifornia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a two-night stay at the Chancellor, We usually stay at the Orchard or Orchard Garden, and wanted to try someplace different. The Chancellor is exactly as advertised on the hotel's website, and I got a great rate by booking early through the hotel. The rooms were very quiet, but there is street noise (even on the 14th floor) -- wear ear plugs. We enjoyed happy hour at the hotel bar each night, and met other travelers, as well as locals who stop by after work. I appreciated all the nice touches like large bath towels, bathroom nightlight, and bath salts. What really makes the Chancellor stand out are the wonderful employees. They even accommodated my request for a late check-out. We had dinner and breakfast across the street at Scala's and I actually preferred the breakfast. The Chancellor is my new "go to" hotel in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, cheap, no AC, room OK, good service”
Reviews.Author: aroundZEEEEworld
Reviews.Content: PROS : Nice location Wifi Good services Room are ok Cheap rate Cable car in front shopping around CONS: NO AC = impacting the quality of sleeping since you need to open the window. Lots of action at night in that neighboorhood. The bar is a joke. You definifly dont want to have a drink there. Havent eat at the restaurant but it didnt inspire me at all. The bathroom doesnt meet the standard of a top 10 hotel in tripadvisor. Overall for the price its very good, but i dont think that the hotel should rank #9 on tripadvisor

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very clean and very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Antonia2424
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and i stayed here for a week in September. Our room was modern and very clean. All the staff we met were very, very helpful. Every day, no matter what time we left our room, we always came back to a very clean room with fresh towels etc. I would like to take this opportunity to say thank you to all the maids, hope someone enjoyed the bottle of wine i left. The location is fantastic. If i am ever lucky enough to go to San Francisco again this is where i would stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great value & location”
Reviews.Author: iridevail
Reviews.Content: The Chancellor hotel is a quality property, conveniently located with easy access to public transportation, China town, North beach, and the water front. The service was top notch, the restaurant was good, the room was clean & updated. And the price was very reasonable for all that was delivered by the Chancellor hotel. Next time I visit San Fransisco I plan to book my stay at the Chancellor and I would recommend this hotel to others as well.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful small hotel in perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: kenrichfamily
Reviews.Content: This was a great find. The location is the best and the hotel is very comfortable. If you expect granite in the bath, a state of the art workout room and a wonderful mini-bar look else where but if you want a comfortable bed with down comforter, 24 hour complimentary tea/coffee and cookies and the most wonderful location in San Francisco all at a super reasonable rate....this is the hotel for you. The rooms do not have AC so we slept with the window open but were at the back of the hotel so it was quiet. The only slight negative was not so great water pressure in the shower. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, Clean, Caring staff, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: ATravelerMidwest
Reviews.Content: I/we selected The Chancellor Hotel on Union Square based on good reviews and our own criteria. Great hotel and staff, we were so very pleased. First, the location is perfect---perfect for transportation, shopping, dining and within walking distance to Chinatown. The hotel is located on Union Square on Powell St.. where the cable cars run directly in front of the hotel. You can't beat the location as all the high end stores are within a short walking distance of the lobby. Sak's Fifth Ave. is directly across the street, Border's Books next door, Sear's Famous Restaurant is located next door as well, Walgreens at the corner, Lorie's Dinner. Around Union Square are Macy's, Neiman Marcus, Levi, Prada, Tiffany, Coach and many more high end and casual stores. Restaurants both casual and upscale are within a very short walk. Secondly, transportation is very good. You can purchase a Muni pass at the tour desk in the lobby and catch the cable car at Union Square, or walk a couple of blocks to catch the BART, etc. and other public transportation options. You can take the cable car directly to Chinatown, Fisherman's Wharf & to Lombard St. Lastly, the hotel is very charming, very clean, well kept, and has nice furnishings. The rooms and baths are small, but understand that this is part of the charm of a San Fran turn-of-the-century hotel. The rooms have all that you need, desk, chair, two sitting chairs with table, silver service and glasses, flat screen TV, dresser and nice comfortable beds with good bedding. There is a pillow menu. The bath is small but it has tub, shower and nice items such as bubble bath, cotton balls, Q-tips, shampoo & soaps. The shower has soft water. No AC, but not needed with ceiling fan and windows which allowed fresh air---it was fine, not a concern. A nice sized walk-in closet, dressing room with full size mirror, safe, extra pillows and blankets. The closet was perfect for setting up luggage and kept the room mess free. Located in the lobby, the Tour Desk is very helpful, managed by a lady named Susie who is knowledgable and helpful. Also, the hotel restaurant was very good, as we ate breakast and one lunch there. Food was good and wait staff was polite and friendly. We ate lunch on our last day, extremely tasty and good quality, waiter name was Mao and the service was excellent---to match the food. The receptionl staff was friendly as well. There is a business center/computer in the lobby. We were very pleased with the hotel and the service. Our room was on the front, so we had a view of Union Square and it was fairly quiet, considering that the cable cars with bells travel in front of the hotel. It was a wonderful vacation, in part to such a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: jen2951
Reviews.Content: Only stayed for two nights wish it could have been more.The hotel is in a perfect location very close to Union Square , the trams and the Bart.The staff were extremely helpful and even when the loo broke at midnight it was fixed within 30 minutes , very impressive.The rooms are not huge but there is a large walk in closet to store luggage so no problem there.We did not meet the Manager Wes Tyler but he ensured our stay was perfect nothing was too much trouble and we would definately stay here again if we visited San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Eimear99
Reviews.Content: I have just returned fro a 4 night stay in the Chancellor hotel in San Francisco. I booked it on the basis of reviews that the hotel got and they don't lie. The location is second to none, right on Union Square surrounded by fab shopping and restaurants. Yes, the rooms are a little on the small side, but that is the only negative. The beds were so comfortable after a long day sightseeing.The staff were really helpful. There was free internet access in the lobby and free apples,coffee and cookies. We had breakfast one mornimg and it was lovely but we ate out all other times.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, great service, good location near public transportation”
Reviews.Author: sunewlsu
Reviews.Content: The room is small but comfortable and well furnished. My room had a large walk in closet and two luggage racks so there was no need to stumble over suitcases even though the room is small. No air-conditioning so my husband attempted to sleep with the window open the first night. Powell St. is very noisy all night long. We learned to open the window early to cool the room and then use the ceiling fan for comfort with the window closed to sleep. No problem with noise that way. Pay the extra $10 per day for the food and drink credit and you will receive a card with $25 per day to spend in the hotel restaurant and bar, Luques. Breakfast is excellent and better than Sears restaurant next door which is famous for their breakfast. Also, you won't have to stand in line to get in. We will stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “What a lovely time we had”
Reviews.Author: jimmywallymac
Reviews.Content: What a lovely friendly hotel this is. All the staff are so helpful. The front desk staff even checked us in online for our flight back to UK. The hotel has a lovely period feel to it and we hope it stays as it is. The rooms are very comfortable and clean. No aircon but the ceiling fan is fine. And what an amazing choice of pillows. Being in the city you get the city noise but we didn't find it intrusive. The breakfasts are excellent and good value. We tried Sears once next door but there always seemed to be a queue, so straight back to the hotel for immediate and excellent service.. The location is excellent, being on the Powell/Market Cable Car line for Fishermans Wharf. A short walk down to Market St and you could catch a streetcar to the other end of the Embarcadero for Alcatraz. A tip, don't walk to the end of Powell to get the Cable Car, theres always a queue, wait outside the hotel as they always seem to squeeze a few more on at that point. Turn right outside the hotel and there is 'Borders' the best book and music shop in the universe., you name it, they've got it. Union Square and surrounding streets is a shoppers paradise. To sum up we thought the hotel was fabulous and thanks to Mr Tyler and all his staff for such a lovely time.

Reviews.Title: “Courteous responsive housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: cbthomp
Reviews.Content: My wife and I failed to empty a drawer when we checked out....called housekeeping. They had the items. They were mailed, priority mail and we had the items in three days. This was an incredible response, given that service employees now days often don't seem to care. Rooms are a bit small but Chancellor is a tremendous value.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Friendly Staff and a clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PEH12
Reviews.Content: We based ourselves in San Francisco over our 2 week trip and used this hotel as our base to travel to other locations. Over a 2 week period we checked in (and out 4 times) staying for 2 x 3 nights and 2 x 1 night periods, so got a chance to sample 4 different rooms, check in staff etc. On each occasion we could not fault the staff. As we were flying domestically (and we're from the UK) the Hotel also stored our main luggage for us so we could pack carry on bags for the internal flights (Thus saving us around $120 we would have paid by checking luggage into the hold). We asked for the quieter rooms at the back and we were given these on all 4 occasions. There is very little difference between the rooms. The rooms are a good size and include a desk and chair and also 2 other chairs and a table so not as small as you would imagine reading some other reviews! The bathroom is small but is actually bigger than our one at home so no complaints there! The bathrooms were clean and practical with hot and cold running water and a powerfull flushing toilet. The shower is over the bath and is perfectly functional and does what it should do!! We arrived on a Thursday when it was a hot day (25C - double it and add 30 for F !!) and found the room overnight to not be unbearably hot with the windows open and the ceiling fan on we had a good nights sleep! Jetlag was our biggest problem sleeping - but can't blame the hotel for that can I? We had breakfast quite a few times in the hotel and weren't disappointed. We also had "Bar" food in the evenings during happy hour and again the food was very good! All in all we thoroughly recommend this hotel, I was going to mark it down 1 star as I wanted to see Wes the General manager (Love his replies to other reviews) but luckily saw him walk past me in the lobby on our last day - he didn't notice me but great to put a face to the comments!! This hotel is bordering on a 4 star, in fact I would give it 3.75 rating if there was such a thing, if you are looking for a high standard, clean, execellent location and value for money hotel then this is the place for you, and its a breath of fresh air from the sterile chain hotels. Thanks to all the staff but especially Rory and Alicia who made us feel very welcome and can you let me know who wins the "Pumpkin" competition and which numbers tally up with which staff member - we voted for 1 and 5.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at the Chancellor”
Reviews.Author: nebraskamom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the Chancellor in September for 5 nights, and I can't say enough good things about the hotel! We loved everything about it! We had a room on the 15th floor facing Union Square, so the view was spectacular. The room itself, though somewhat small, felt spacious because of the high ceilings, and was decorated very tastefully. We loved the flat screen TV! The bathroom was spotlessly clean, and I loved how bright it was. I've been in hotels where the bathroom lighting is so dim you can't see to put your makeup on, but not here! Everyone working here was cheerful and pleasant, and went out of their way to be helpful. And of course, the best part of the Chancellor - the wonderful location! Definitely the best location in the city! Would I stay here again? Without a doubt!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: emptynestraveller
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful time staying here, good proximity to restaurants (Sears for pancakes in the morning was right next door), cable car, Hop-on-Hop-Off tour, etc. Staff was more than helpful. Coffee, cookies and apples in the lobby were a nice touch. Only drawback was the person working at the tour desk in the lobby and the recommended Lorrie's shuttle from the airport. Try another shuttle if you don't want rude, unhelpful service.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you could want”
Reviews.Author: TedSManchester
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on the basis of the many excellent reviews on here and the very human management responses to any negative reviews. We stayed for 3 nights in September 2010 and it met all our expectations and more. Very helpful staff, great location, very central. Cofee, fruit, cookies and lemonade in Reception. Some one earlier described the reception/lobby as a living room and that is quite accurate. Yes the rooms are on the small side especially for our North American cousins who seem to prefer to sleep in more spacious rooms but ithas verything you need and represents great value. ( Go stay in the Westin if you want to sleep in a football pitch ) Very nice breakfasts at reasonable prices in Luque's , the house restaurant. We would definitely return and recommend to others. Loved the pillow menu.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Salpi82
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chancellor in San Francisco mid October this year. On arrival, the front desk staff member who checked us in (Rory) was so helpful. He gave us tips on what to do, where to see and eat at (all excellent recommendations). We were also very pleased with the other front desk staff who were lovely and very helpful. Although the rooms are quite small, they were clean. The all day, complimentary tea/ coffee and cookies were also a treat! The location was excellent with great food options close by, and the tram literally just outside the front door. Overall, a good experience!

Reviews.Title: “Lobby is like your living room on Union Square”
Reviews.Author: TuckerCA
Reviews.Content: Booked one night at the Chancellor after reading all the positive reviews and walking past it (to get to Sears for breakfast) for years. A good choice - it was clean, it was pretty modern in terms of amenities, the shower was hot & strong, the bed was comfy, and the cable worked. Loved the free wifi option. Rec'd a nice 2 for 1 voucher to the lobby bar with check in, so I had to give that a try - and it was during my second glass of merlot that I realized the lobby was just like a living room. The bartender knew many of the guests and asked how their day went. The reception area offered cookies & fruit, and the comfy sofas offered a good view of the eclectic SF pedestrians. It's right off of Union Square and the shopping opportunities abound. Loads of decent restaurants within walking distance. A bit of a hike to/from BART, but since it was the only exercise I got during this last business trip, it was fine. (I may not have been as pleased if it was raining!) I think I'll stay here again on my next trip...

Reviews.Title: “Quiant Rooms - Great location - Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: snodallion24_com
Reviews.Content: This is a very cool hotel in a perfect location. The staff handled a reservation issue very quickly and without hassle - the way problems should be solved! The rooms are on the small side, but it's not a problem for 2 people. My only complaint was how warm the room got. I'm not sure why it was so warm in the room since it was late October, the heat wasn't on, and it was fairly cool outside. There is no AC so the only way to cool down is to open the windows and turn the ceiling fan on - neither helped much. Once we opened the windows it was quite noisy (it is union square after all). So, between the heat and noise, we didn't sleep well. I would try for a room on the "quiet side" on a higher level to reduce noise if you have to open the windows. Overall, it is a good value and I would recommend it for someone looking for a good value in Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Cosy Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: AjayP
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed here for 4 nights at the end of september for our 10 year wedding anniversary. We were on a road trip down to LA via the big sur and needed a good start in San Francisco to set us on our way. Booked with trailfinders and were very pleased with the hotel choice. Good service all round, checking in was a breeze , lovely room with a view of Union square , comfortable bed , small yet adequate bathroom. Shower was powerful and considering that it was very warm during our stay the lack of air con was not a problem as the fan above the bed was nice and cooling. Loved the free tea and cookies in reception. Didnt have breakfast in the hotel as sears is next door and heard that they cooked a lovely pancake sandwich so ate there every morning and i wasnt disappointed. Quite a few places to eat nearby in the evening. if you get up early you can get onto the trams before they get busy . Wait at the stop up the road opposite outside starbucks. All in all a fantastic start to our holiday and would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small but friendly and a great location”
Reviews.Author: rosiepDorset
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights at the end of our holiday, having chosen the Chancellor because of the favourable reviews and got a great deal through Expedia. We were not disappointed. The staff were very friendly and extremely helpful (thinking to direct us to the local Alamo garage to return our car saved us at least a couple of hours getting to and from the Airport). Our room was on the second floor and was a bit small with no view but we were expecting the size from other comments. It was still extremely comfortable, and had a very useful walk-in closet where we could store our luggage. The location is fabulous, we have stayed in San Francisco before and Union Square is just the best base to explore the city! We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “End of the line”
Reviews.Author: Rex1702
Reviews.Content: Having taken a long leisurely road trip from LA to San Francisco via Death Valley, Yosemite, Big Sur and the like, a few days in San Francisco staying at the Chancellor was the perfect end to a wonderful holiday. Everything about the hotel was excellent, the only downside was having to catch an early morning flight back home, but even at 6am the coffee and cookies in reception helped no end.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Mykeldaygar
Reviews.Content: Hotel very comfortable & staff very professional and friendly! No air conditioning but fan in room, out the 7 nights, only felt hot & unfortable one night only! Bedding very comfortable, room big enough. Travelled with 2 others all stayed in separte rooms, two of the rooms had walk in wardrobe which was amazing. Location was fantastic with Union SQ right at your doorstep with transport at your reach if required. Will hope to stay there again when i return to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: blueglenn1954
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights on our honeymoon. It was east to find only being a few blocks up from Powell Street BART station. First impressions were of a 1st class clean, well managed hotel. Check in was simple and the receptionist made us feel welcome , and gave us directions to our room, she offered us the services of a bellboy but we did not need him, nothing was forced on us. When we entered the room we were immediately impresseed with the clenliness and quality of the fixtures, decor and bed, they even left us a bottle of wine ! We were on the 12th floor and really enjoyed the views over Union Square, especially at night when all the lights were on. The street below can be noisy but the window effectively shut out that noise so we got a good nights sleep. If we return to San Francisco we would certainly stay here again, we would thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous location, excellent staff!”
Reviews.Author: janiem_10
Reviews.Content: My parents celebrated their 40th Wedding anniversary recently and went on a holiday to San Francisco. They stayed in The Chancellor Hotel on Union Square and can't speak highly enough of it!! They were upgraded to the penthouse suite, which they absolutely loved! They said the location was fab, very central, and the staff were excellent - very efficient and friendly. Would highly recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “The best!”
Reviews.Author: Benjii
Reviews.Content: Not allot to add that hasn’t already been said on the Chancellor that hasn’t already been said before. We stayed at the Chancellor first back in 2008 in a suite (complementary upgrade) so when we were coming back at the end of September we looked again but the rates were a little over budget as we were spending a total of 3 weeks touring California. The General Manager offered me the same rate I could get a much lower rated hotel so of course I took his hand off! And that about sums the Chancellor up really, they’ll bend over backwards for their patrons. It’s obviously not just for return customers either as the first time we were given the suite after we couldn’t get a standard room with a requested ‘good view’. This time around we got room 1500 on the top floor, a standard room with a killer view of Union Square. I was glad to get a standard room as I’m aware most of the Chancellors negative reviews relate to small rooms? By European standards I’d say it was above average in size, loved the décor and the bed was really comfortable. We arrived to the surprise of a bottle of wine and a gift in the form of a photo frame-nice touch. Can safely say that the weather was unseasonably warm when we arrived (three figures at times) and we never felt hot despite the lack of air conditioning. I did want to try and meet Wes on this visit and commend him on the good work he and his team do but unfortunately never got the opportunity. But I’m sure he’ll read this as he seems to have his finger on the pulse of his customers. Having stayed in a standard room the Chancellor is probably my favourite hotel in the world, it was like coming home on our return, I’ve stayed in bigger and fancier hotels but it’s the customer service, and little touches that really set them apart from the crowd-oh and of course the location isn’t too bad either!

Reviews.Title: “Appalling”
Reviews.Author: CDN2
Reviews.Content: Arrived here in a "heatwave", apparently. Yes, it's quite warm. But our room is a SAUNA! No air conditioning. Complained to reception, who said they'd send us an extra fan... We're still waiting, and melting!!! Can't believe all the positive reviews. This hotel needs a good SCRUB. Someone just running a sponge along doors, cleaning mirrors and toilet seats - call me old fashioned. VERY disappointed. And not looking forward to another sleepless night because of the heat.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - fabulous location!!”
Reviews.Author: Toni1012
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is in a terrific location - right on Powell Street at Union Square. The cable car runs straight past the door. The rooms are small but perfectly functional and have everything you need. They're clean, and have great pillows!! The staff are more than happy to help with anything you may require.

Reviews.Title: “I Can't Find Anything To Moan About!”
Reviews.Author: Stabler12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chancellor for 9 nights on our trip to San Francisco, and had a great stay there. The Chancellor doesn't blow you away with anything amazing, but there is absolutely nothing here that is sub standard. The staff are wonderful and extremely helpful, the rooms (if a bit small) are nicely fitted out, and the beds are REALLY comfortable. There is a friendly bar that serves anything you want, and cookies and apples are left out for the guests to take when they want. My one moan was going to be no gym, but on arrival I found that all Chancellor guests have use of a very good gym one block away. A lovely stay in a perfectly situated hotel. I would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: joshaurora
Reviews.Content: I stayed five nights in September as part of attending Oracle Openworld 2010. As such, I was interested in a hotel that was close to SOMA. My room was on the third floor and was very nice. The room was more than large enough for my needs. What I liked: by far, the walk in closet was really, really helpful; the bathroom had cotton swabs--nice touch; the room was so quiet that I never heard anyone else except once, quite amazing; service was great--I got exactly what I asked for, usually quite quickly; real bathtub; variety and number of pillows; very friendly hotel staff; free coffee in the mornings was quite tasty; the fitness club was great!; ventilation was good, even on hot (80's F) days; What could have been better: shower pressure was too low (probably Californian regs); no ethernet connection in room; I got the hotel through the Oracle convention and the rate was pretty good relatively. While I would not personally pay the going rate, I would recommend the hotel unreservedly.

Reviews.Title: “A really nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Medder
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed at this hotel for our honeymoon. The hotel is located right in the heart of the city which makes it a perfect base for going out exploring. Union Square is literally about 50 yards away and the cable car runs right past the front of the hotel with 2 cable car stops within a stones throw of the front door. Open top tour buses run from Union Square and the cable cars are the perfect way of travelling around the city and to the Fishermans Wharf area. The staff in the hotel are very friendly and helpful. There is an Information desk/gift shop which we only used to book a taxi when we were leaving, however there was plently of information available and the lady on the desk was very helpful. Our room was a standard double room on the 11th floor. On our arrival the hotel had left us a nice bottle of champagne and picture frame in the room as a gift to celebrate our honeymoon, which was a nice touch. The room was clean and the bed was large and comfortable. Nice TV with cable. While we were there the weather was unusually hot (record high temperatures) and our room had no air conditioning, although there was a ceiling fan. This made the room slightly hot and uncomfortable at night although this might not be a problem in normal weather conditions. The room has nice large windows and although we could just about see San Francisco Bay in the distance over the tops of the buildings there was not much of a view, although this didn't really bother us. The restaurant in the hotel was closed due to refurbishment while we were there so we didn't use it, however we had breakfast in the bar area a few times. The food and drink prices were reasonable and the food itself was nice. San Francisco is a brilliant city and we thoroughly enjoyed our visit there. There is lots to do and the people are really nice. We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel which I would describle as really nice and in a great location. I would definitly stay here again should I ever return to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: VancouverBertle
Reviews.Content: As you guessed, primo location! Everything about this hotel was perfect for a typical San Fran boutique hotel. The ONLY issue you may have is the very, very small rooms. Maybe 12 X12 with a bathroom that you must enter in the direction you wish to face because turning around might be ifffy......BUT none if this posed a problem for my daughter and I. Rooms very cozy and nicely decorated. Comfy beds. Staff very, very pleasant. We were out and about most of the day so room size didn't bother us. I felt the regular prize ($200 per night) was steep for such a small room but watch for deals on Expedia, we got for $125 and my sister leaves next week and got it for $99. San Fran is amazing...just go with the location (there are areas like the Tenderloin that you definately DO NOT want to be in). The small room size is a good exchange for price and location

Reviews.Title: “Customer service is excellent; perfect location”
Reviews.Author: zztip
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival the reception staff were excellent and helpful. They ensured we were well looked after. Susan, at the gift shop/kiosk, was also helpful and very friendly. We had a room that was on the 8th floor, quiet enough from the street noise, when the window was closed. No a/c but good ceiling fan in room. Found the beds very comfortable. In the lobby there was always coffee/tea, great fresh cookies and apples. For an older hotel, it was kept in wonderful condition. Price was very reasonable as well.

Reviews.Title: “2 star hotel with some nice 3 star amenities”
Reviews.Author: flash54
Reviews.Content: This is a nice comfortable hotel with a very reasonable price in an excellent location. The lobby staff was friendly and helpful, and it only took a few minutes to check in and out. There are two elevators and they are fast enough that I rarely had to wait long for one. The room was a good size for the price, but be warned that they only have rooms with one queen bed or two singles. I had one with two beds and I don't mind a single. The photos I saw here on Trip Advisor are accurate. Decor is nice, but in my room paint was chipped in a few places and in the bathroom a white coating had started to peel off in places, revealing the original green tile beneath. Try to get a room away from the Powell Street side - the view is nice, but the street noise can be a bit annoying. Fortunately, it quiets down after midnight. As for amenities, this had a few that are usually reserved to more expensive hotels. For instance, there were often cookies and apples in the lobby. There is a pillow menu (that I wished I tried) with lots of choices if you don't like the supplied pillows. There is a nice big umbrella in the closet. A well-equipped fitness facility around the block and across Mason Street is free to hotel guests. I wish it was actually in the hotel - but hey, this is not the Westin. If you like to swim laps for your exercise, the fitness center even has a nice indoor lap pool - wish I'd brought a swimsuit. I had breakfast in the hotel restaurant a few times, and that is very good. Try the homemade corned beef hash. All in all, an enjoyable stay. I have been coming to San Francisco for the past few Autumns, and next year, I think I'll stay in the Chancellor again.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we needed.”
Reviews.Author: Vacay1234
Reviews.Content: My fiance & I only stayed for a weekend (arrived late on a Friday evening and left on the Sunday morning). Check in was easy, i think we were on the 2nd floor and were not bothered by outside noise (our room faced the street). Beds were extremely comfortable. Bathrooms are a little small, but really, its not like we needed a huge bathroom. Complimentary coffee & cookies in the lobby was nice. Breakfast at the hotel was really good too. Overall it was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: DaFairy
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed in the Chancellor Hotel in January 2010 for 4nights, we were doing the California coast for 3weeks. This hotel was everything we wanted and more. Value for money, comfort, location location location, the staff were so so helpful. The beds were the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in EVER! There was a range of pillows to choose from, never even heard of such a thing! The Hotel is right beside the Chinese quarter, right across the streets from all the main shops Sacks, Macys, more more more. There was a lady in the lobby each day who can help you with sight seeing trip and more. I made a blunder while booking our day trip to Alcatraz, before I went out to San Fransisco, we were very disappointed but she managed to get us into a slot for one of the days, we were so thankful as we would never have got to see it, its a must see. She was so helpful, and gave us great advice on what to see & what not to see. The bar is small but fun, we met some other travellers there and had great fun. The main enterance is not great, could do with a re-furb but the room was so cosy clean and very well decorated. There was complementary coffee/tea and cake in the afternoon. The breakfast was excellent but at an additional charge, but seeing that we paid €35 per person per night in a city center location we were not complaining. There was a Irish guy at Reception who was really friendly, Rory is his name. Great help. Overall, for comfort, location and price this hotel is a must to stay in San Fransisco. You only sleep there and the beds if we could would have taken them with us... they were so cosy. Many thanks to all the staff there for making our stay so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a city break - super comfy room - great location”
Reviews.Author: LondonTravellerVW
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for a city break when you want a little more comfort and luxury during your stay. Our room was spacious with a separate closet where we could store all our luggage. The bed and pillows (you really do get to choose from a fancy selection of posh pillows) were super comfy and the location was great for exploring the city - just off Union Square. Also close to lots of restaurants. The bathroom is pretty basic (not as nice as the room itself) but it has everything you need and was very clean. The brief interactions we did have with staff were a little odd but they didn't disturb us and when we requested the pillows for example, they delivered them quickly. The only aspect of the room I didn't like was the proximity to the air conditioning/ kitchen unit down below. Our room was on the back so we didn't get any street noise but the humming from the machines did initially disappoint me - I was looking forward to a returning to a peaceful room after a day out in SFS. I have to admit after the first day, I didn't notice the sound any more and I am sensitive to noise. They also supplied us with a white noise machine. This made lovely rain sounds which meant I could fall asleep without any worries. I do think they should include a breakfast in the price but for convenience sake, there is a paid restaurant downstairs in the hotel lobby. I wouldn't recommend this unless you just want a quick refuel. It's a depressing place to start your day. For a tasty breakfast you can head just next door to Sear's fine foods which has a great atmosphere and much much yummier food. I have rated this hotel average because there was no good option and 'very good' was a little too generous.

Reviews.Title: “A slam dunk great place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: rbet
Reviews.Content: As an ex-travel agent, I've stayed in many hotels. The Chancellor ranks right up there for value. Only people impossible to please would be dissatisfied!! Great location, nice rooms, great service! We had previously stayed down at the Wharf, but strongly preferred this location instead.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: 110910Jules
Reviews.Content: This was the first stop on our honeymoon. There was a bottle of sparkling wine and a photo frame waiting for us which was a lovely touch. The rooms are large and the beds comfortable. All the staff were very helpful and efficient. My one slight complaint was that the bathrooms needed updating. They were clean but very tired. Good central location which was great for sight-seeing. We would return!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel. Will be best with some investment !”
Reviews.Author: Clauvadazz
Reviews.Content: As in top 10 of Tripadvisor, we picked this hotel for couple days. I like the room as very comfortable from the pillow to the bed or the bathroom. But not happy with the size, very small. Location i will say it is good but the area is noisy, very noisy actually. It is on the powell street and many many cars, trolleys as well. The staff here were helpful, attentive. But some of the hotel facilities need to be upgraded : for example : the bar and the restaurant. Bottom line, it is a good hotel, need some maintainance in some common areas but the room is good. Will recommend !

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: SorrentoSun
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 5 nights and have to say a very comfortable experience. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful - our room was spacious and had modern decor. The location is excellent - very central. My only snag was the cost of breakfast in the restaurant - a little expensive I'd say - would have been nice to have had some deal as we were staying there for 5 nights. However would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at The Chancellor for comfort”
Reviews.Author: CalgaryABEil
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to The Chancellor and we enjoyed it as much as the first time. The beds are very comfortable, room cleaniness was perfect. The staff were very very nice and helpful and you are so central. I have to say though that the thing that sets you apart from being a 4 star hotel is NOT having the "kettle" in the rooms...This would make for a perfect stay. We have already recommended this hotel to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent quality / price relation !”
Reviews.Author: Bifffy
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for 8 days through a special action at half the usual rate. Check in was the fastest ever. Location couldn't be more central, with lots of connections to Bart / Muni nearby. Comfortable rooms and very comfortable bed. Good wifi connection. Helpfull staff. No complaints here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Crayon755
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Chancellor for 8 nights in Sept. Great hotel for the price, great location. We enjoyed late night meals at the bar as well as breakfasts in the restaurant. A noisy ceiling fan was fixed the same day. We were in #1304 with not much of a view but enough sounds of the city to remind us where we were! Yes rooms and baths are small but with walk-in closets for the luggage and adequate internet access. The room was always clean when we returned. The pillow menu was a nice touch! No A/C so we kept the ceiling fan on and the window open - very comfortable. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: paisleyss
Reviews.Content: The hotel and location was great. Rooms are older, but are very well done with lots of little extra's. Love the pillow choices and bath salts. Only improvement would be the a/c. We were never sure if it worked. We left the windows open, but if it was hot it might have been an issue. We will def. stay here again. Thanks, Laura

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait to Stay Here Again!”
Reviews.Author: plmille2
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I visited San Francisco for the first time and stayed at the Chancellor Hotel. Upon arriving, the service was excellent and the room was spotless. Don't let the reviews about small rooms ruin your decision about staying here! I have never stayed in a hotel room that felt more like home than this one. Listening to the city sounds at night when our window was open was amazing, and made us really feel like we were part of the city. You could hear the trolley bells below. The noise never bothered us, especially since it stops around 8pm! You can't beat the location either. The hotel has a visitor desk where you can buy transportation passes and other novelties. For those with children, there is a very family friendly restaurant next door that serves breakfast, lunch and dinner all day-- and it has good food! With just a quick minute walk to the trolley/bus stops, the Chancellor will definitely have our business again when we visit the beautiful city next year!

Reviews.Title: “Eloise had the Walfdorf; Dale loves the Chancellor.”
Reviews.Author: buddhaface
Reviews.Content: Front staff always helpful, kind, pleasant. Comfortable lobby. Clean rooms and sitting spaces. Endless coffee/tea/cookies/good company for those of us who struggled with time changes. Met Europeans who felt that they had come to a European hotel. I've traveled a fair amount, and that's precisely what I liked about the Chancellor. Well run, efficient but downhome as someone in my current home state of GA might say. Restaurant good. Easy access to anywhere. Folks in reservations were very helpful even before I got there. And I thought service had gone the way of money having meaning. Not in this case. Dale Tushman 9/2010

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in great location - loved SF!”
Reviews.Author: Anderida
Reviews.Content: We used this hotel as our first base in SF to San Diego road trip. Booked thru Trailfinders and our main contact Ryan could not have been more helpful. Everybody at Trailfinders was knowledgeable and helpful and would highly recommend! Ryan came up with draft itinerary and we tweaked the hotels using TripAdvisor and we were not really disappointed. All recent reviews for the Chancellor are about right! Perfect location - hotel not luxurious - in fact a little tired - but staff were friendly and we are very comfortable. We asked for a quiet room - we are very light sleepers. Room initally allocated was on the 2nd floor at the rear but dark and quite noisy due to aircon units on neighbouring buildings. Were moved to a much lighter room on 9th floor by very helpful and understanding receptionist. Still some aircon noise but would be fine for most "normal" sleepers! Would consider hotel nexttime and would recommend. We didn't eat at the hotel but ate for 3 nights in Scala's just across the road which was excellent (do book first if pos)! NB booked car thru Alamo via Trailfinders for our departure day - they are very handily located for Union Sq (there are other hire firms nearby) and despite the perceived nightmare of driving in central SF it was very simple to get out of town heading south (towards Monterey) using their directions and satnav/GPS which would highly recommend (about £20). Car (auto VW Jetta) was reliable and easy to drive.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with the great location at the reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: IlgasPlaukas
Reviews.Content: Rooms are pretty small, however clean and have everything you might need. Service is outstanding, great location. Bar needs to be updated badly, but with all the restaurants and bars around it's not a big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and City”
Reviews.Author: txangel60
Reviews.Content: I loved San Francisco and the Chancellor Hotel. I would stay here again. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean but small (which didn't matter we were hardly in the room). The trolly ran in front of the hotel and the bus was just a few blocks away. Be sure and get a bus pass, it pays for itself quickly. You can purchase it right in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: Marmargron
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly located, in the center of San Francisco. Close to Union Square, shops and the cable car. I would stay there again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Blondie1348
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights here in August and had a lovely time. The hotel is in a great location right near Union Square. The room itself was nice, with comfy beds. The only thing i would say needs updating is the communal areas as they are a little tired, but definitely nothing to put me off staying. The concierges were very helpful and the complimentary cookies were yummy! The hotel was very reasonable in comparison to others and would definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cookiecherub
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in August 2010, great location in Union Square. Really comfy hotel, clean and friendly too.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for budget business trip”
Reviews.Author: Tarpon_Traveller
Reviews.Content: Old fashioned altough super well located (union square), afordable rates for a budget constraint trip and a great staff that is super available to help you out. Rooms are clean, decent size. I would recommedn if you are travelling on a business trip that those not requires you to bring a client for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Hotel in every way..location, service all top notch”
Reviews.Author: TravelTime40
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on the reviews I read and I can honestly say we were not disappointed. From the moment we stepped into the hotel we felt like we were at home. The staff welcomed us and were very friendly and responded to a couple of requests promptly. For instance the washroom door creaked a bit, we made mention of it at the front desk it was fixed before we returned to the room later that day. We ordered pillows from their menu, they were delivered in less then 15 minutes. There were always cookies and apples available as was the coffee and tea. There is a lovely bar and a nice restaurant at the hotel too. The room was small, but we knew that going into the hotel. We did have a great walk in closet that stored everything nicely so the room did not feel too cramped. The only reason the room is rated a 4 is due to size. The location is fabulous. The trolley stops outside the door, or you can walk to the bottom of the hill and catch it from there. You can travel to the hotel from the SFO airport using BART. It is a bit of a walk, but the hill is not very steep. There is lots of great shopping in the area such as DSW (shoes), H&M, Victoria's Secret, BCBG Max, GAP, Tiffany's, Macys, and a great Mall. We walked to China Town, North Beach and to Fisherman's Wharf one. We even spent one day walking back from the Golden Gate Bridge, through the Pacific Heights. The weather was perfect for this. Buses can easily be caught on Market St,. The staff at the hotel were great at identifying which buses to take. There are also many different restaurants in the area as well. We mainly had breakfast at the hotel, but we did try Lori's up the street. Please know that if you select this hotel, you will not be disappointed that you did.

Reviews.Title: “Just as good as I remembered! Kudos again!”
Reviews.Author: Parrotthead
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chancellor during the first week of September for four nights. I had stayed there three years ago and had a superb experience. My second stay was just as exceptional. This little gem of a hotel runs like a well-oiled machine. Every staff person we encountered was lovely, efficient, friendly and well-mannered. We stayed in Room 1203. I had asked for a high floor room facing Union Square which was acommodated. After the first night, I mentioned to Rory at the front desk that the bed was not quite as comfortable as I had remembered it being during my previous stay (in a different room). We returned to the hotel late that afternoon to find that a foam topper of some sort had been placed on the mattress. Problem solved! The valet parking was easy and convenient and well worth the cost. $29 I believe. Allow 30 mins. for your car to be brought around. Well worth the value and convenience, since SF is a terrible parking city. The cleanliness of the room was exceptional each day. I can't say enough about this. The linens and douvet are very nice and the pillows are extremely comfortable. I cannot say enough about what an outstanding hotel the Chancellor is. As evidence of this, check out the piece in today's (9/9/10) NYT, the Chancellor and Wes Tyler, the GM are featured, in a piece about bed bugs. You will see how seriously he takes the management of his hotel. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: onedogcity07
