Reviews.Content: My college aged daughter & I stayed here in Aug. We LOVED the location - a few min. to Market St, w/in 10 min. walking to Chinatown & a 20 min. leisurely walk to The Ferry Building (for your foodies). LOTS of shopping & restaurants in Union Sq. As everyone mentions the room is small but it reminded us of the boutique hotels we've stayed at abroad. We took the advice of others & asked for a quiet room in the back; it was quiet enough that we slept w/ the window open. The front desk staff was consistently friendly & informative. As we had arrived at midnight, we chose valet parking. For valet parking, you leave your car at the front entrance & give the car keys to the front desk. Of the 4 nights we stayed, there was only 1 night where we had to wait 1/2 block away in order to leave our car in the front due to many other people checking in. Also as the cable cars travel right in front of the hotel, you need to be aware of them. At the midnight check-in I reminded them that I had requested a mini-fridge; their service person was just leaving the room as we got there. Oh, the wireless is also slow. We will definitely stay here again on our next trip. We didn't eat bkfast in the hotel but did enjoy the Swedish pancakes next door at the Sears Fine Foods; we shared the plate.

Reviews.Title: “Not amazing, but good all together.”
Reviews.Author: BrittanyS3
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for large rooms and extravagant rooms, then this isn't the place for you. It was an older building, but nicely furnished. It's a little more on the expensive side, because it's located in the midst of union square. A wonderful location for those looking to take buses, cable cars, and taxis. They have a nice restaurant too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: outandabouttoronto
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just stayed at the Chancellor in August for our two year anniversary. It was our first time to San Francisco and what a perfect choice this hotel was. Upon arriving we received a bottle of Champagne and two glasses with a letter congratulating us on our Anniversary. The room was clean and the decor was exactly what you see on the website. I asked for a room on a higher floor for a view, no problem We stayed in room 1205 and over looked union square it was terrific. As others have mentioned not the biggest room but we had what you needed, the closet was large enough for both our suitcases so no real problems regarding the size. A little noisy at night but no more then any other city, you have to remember you are downtown San Francisco. This hotel is right in the middle of everything and you can take a cable car or walk to just about anything. They where very helpful at the front desk when every I needed any help, I would stay at this hotel again hands down. Great value make sure you visit their website for internet specials.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in SF!”
Reviews.Author: Stulf
Reviews.Content: It is right at Union Square, within walking distance to Market place (Bart, Tram, bus).Many restaurants, shops, etc around. Cable car in front of the hotel, but our room was quiet. Nice and clean rooms, very nice and helpful staff. I can only recommend the hotel, if you want to stay in downtown SF!

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensice and exceeds expectations”
Reviews.Author: hopoidos
Reviews.Content: Of the thre SF hotels I stayed in on this trip The Chancellor was the cheapest and, by some way, the best. The location cannot be bettered for being at the heart of the city; cable car, buses and downtown city life on the doorstep - indeed right outside the fire escape balcony view I had. Of course it's therefore noisy and in a heatwave the room was warm - efficient ceiling fan but no a/c. But city centres are noisy and heatwaves unusual. In the room, wi-fi and local calls free. Small and welcome seating area; solid furnishings; excellent bed and pillows; large LCD TV; ; small free extras a plenty inc. coupons (2 for 1 drinks for example); small services kiosk in lobby. Didn't eat there but Lori's Diner across the road is cheap and simple. The service was warm and there was a cheerful atmosphere and bags of personality about the place, which is independently owned. I was only sorry I didn't spend more than two nights at this excellent hotel as its location and value of money cannot be matched if on a vacation break in SF.As has been noted, it's just 5 mins walk up from the Powell St BART - ideal and economical for SFO and other poiints around the Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small rooms, very clean, great value!”
Reviews.Author: mizzles
Reviews.Content: Here you go 1) DON'T FORGET to have a drink right across the street at the Starlight room at Sir Francis Drake Hotel which has a spectacular view of the city. 2) love the always flowing free coffee in the lobby 3) make sure you get your macy's coupon and 2 for 1 lobby drink coupons from front desk 4) rooms are small and not really elegant 5) rooms are clean and smell nice 6) lots of nice little extras here and there (cotton balls, q-tips, umbrella, rubber ducky) 7) couldn't get the AC to work but no prob just opened the windows 8) solid maid service

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in SF.”
Reviews.Author: SydneyEngineer
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Chancellor whilst attending a conference. Was attracted to the decor and location, as the hotel appealed to my taste. The hotel exceeded my expectations in every way. I had a great view of Union Square, and was able to walk or take a cable car to everywhere I needed to go. Room was very clean and quiet. Staff were very helpful, especially the concierge, who arranged transport for us and advised on places to visit.

Reviews.Title: “best bed ever”
Reviews.Author: sifab
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close union square, the shopping heart of the city, and in front of Lori's diner (SO fracking good!). Bedroom is confy, nice and clean and the king size bed is just perfect! Never slept better!

Reviews.Title: “another great stay at the Chancellor”
Reviews.Author: Sundae1966
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chancellor for the second time. It is one of the best things about san fran. The rooms are small (as expected as it is an old hotel!!) but well set out and a great feel. The rooms and hotel have character. Our room was on Powell Street and amazingy quiet. We love the bar - met a great barman on the Sunday night and the hotel staff are really friendly. We used the gym around the cornr which was fine. The service was a bit slow at breakfast but nothing to really worry about. A few healthy options non the breakfast menu would be good. The hotel is in a great spot and we love coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Super location and great service”
Reviews.Author: Kippur
Reviews.Content: At the Chancellor you can just step out directly onto great shopping [Macys, Nike Town, Tiffanys etc], great cafes and restaurants and the trams. The metro is also only 10 minutes away. The rooms are compact [as reviewed] but comfortable enough. The reception staff are very welcoming and helpful and there is also a concierge who can arrange tours and travel passes. There is parking for hotel guests a block away which they will direct you to upon arrival. Coffee and tea is available for guests to help themselves to near the bar area.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, top location classic feel”
Reviews.Author: Antilooped
Reviews.Content: We stayed in april 2010 and foudn the Chancellor to be a pretty good hotel. Although not the best ive been to it was still great. Faults that stand out are: Poor restaurant, Tiny (and i mean TINY) rooms, arrogant staff (everyone we met had 'issues'), Bathrooms need work - are VERY outdated, overpriced. Highlights: Clean, great location, comfortable beds. Overall it's a good place to rest your head if you want to be in central San Fran its the place to be - everything is in close proximity to the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Only one complaint.”
Reviews.Author: howweoperate
Reviews.Content: We had read numerous reviews before booking, so we were aware of the small room size and lack of air conditioning (which did not bother us). The only complaint we had is that the beds were very, very uncomfortable. For this reason (and this reason alone) we would not stay here again. Our experience at the Chancellor Hotel was otherwise quite positive. We were able to check in early. The room decor is nice. The customer service is outstanding. The hotel serves a good breakfast (and you can have it delivered to your room at a specified time for a small charge). The hotel is right on Union Square, and the cable car line. Close to shops and many restaurants, and a ~ 30 minute walk to the Fisherman's Wharf area. Aside from the beds, this is a great find and worth the price you pay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, value and service”
Reviews.Author: Vacationmatt
Reviews.Content: Very reasonable hotel for the money. An older but very comfortable and clean hotel. Very good location on union square - we had a good view out over union square. Breakfast wasn’t included – we bought ours in the hotel restaurant – reasonable choice and price. Free cookies and tea/coffee in reception was a nice touch. Staff were always friendly and helpful. The room was comfortable and had several nice touches like the jar of sweets and the pillow menu where you could choose from several different types of pillow! We wanted to eat at the Italian opposite but it was packed – recommend getting there early or booking ahead. Would recommend a hop on hop off bus tour – we didn’t and ended up walking miles. Also the trams can be tricky to get on, as the chancellor is only a couple of stops from the turnaround the trams were always full when we tried to get on them.

Reviews.Title: “Our second stay here, and we'd come back again”
Reviews.Author: angelaki
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay here, and our first choice when we returned to San Francisco. As before the staff were amazing and the rooms are lovely and clean. We'd requested a quiet room and been given one at the back of the hotel. Unfortunately we then ended up with the same problem we'd had during our last stay - one of the buildings at the back has a powerful extraction system and it makes the whole of one side of the hotel vibrate and hum. As a result we spend the first night awake, although the staff were willing to move us at 3am there were no other rooms available. We were moved to one of the middle rooms that overlooked the Square for the second night and that was a lot more peaceful - traffic noise is easier to ignore than the constant humming is. I do wonder how anyone else puts up with it. As others have said, the location is ideal for visiting Union Square, it's also less than 10 minutes walk to Market Street. The free coffee and cookies are great for a first breakfast (and then you can pop out for a larger one later on in the morning! The best thing is the location and the helpful staff, the worst is that humming in "quiet" rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Characterful, comfortable gem right on Union Sq”
Reviews.Author: dodgye
Reviews.Content: So nice to stay in a hotel with character instead of the cookie cutter places that make up the majority of US hotels. The Chancellor Hotel is excellent value for money. OK so there wasn't a second queen bed to put our bags on but really when did that become a necessity? There was plenty of room for a bed, bedside tables on each side, a coffee table, two comfy chairs, TV, a dresser, suitcase racks for our bags. Some of the touches that I loved : lots of extra pillows and blankets , an umbrella in the wardrobe for our use, a jar of candies, nice toiletries including bath salts, fluffy towels, comfy bed with a duvet and crisp white sheets, friendly staff, free internet, high ceiling, fabulous views, secure parking just around the corner, great location, creative decor... given that the trams run up the hill outside, and you are right on Union square, it is noisy and there are bright lights outside, which again we loved - we wanted to be right in the middle of SF and this hotel certainly met expectations. We were very touched that the hotel gave us a bottle of champagne, chancellor hotel champagne glasses and a wooden photo frame as we chose this hotel for our honeymoon. That was in no way a bribe and I would write a glowing review because of all the great features listed above. If you are planning a trip to SF it would be a mistake to stay anywhere else

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay, right in the centre of San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: yogspiers
Reviews.Content: Great service, great location. Highly recommended. You can even choose from about 7 types of pillow!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Daltry
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days while we explored San Francisco. It's in an ideal location for everything and I don't think we couldn't have picked a better hotel in a better location. The room was lovely and very clean, the staff helpful and friendly and it was very convenient to have a restaurant serving breakfast in the hotel. Another bonus was the free wifi in our room. It was pleasure to come back to the hotel each night after a fantastic day looking around San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TravelerfromCO
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for a long weekend to celebrate her birthday. The hotel is very conveniently located and its easy to get every where you want to go in the city from Union Square. I had requested an upper floor room with a great view and the hotel met every request. We were on the 11th floor and had a great view of the city and you could even see the barges out on the water between the buildings which I thought was great. They provided a bottle of wine and box of chocolates for my friends b-day which was a great touch. The staff was exceptionally helpful and nice (front desk, bar staff and concierge). The rooms are exceptionally clean and very quaint with a historic hotel feel and comfy beds. They aren't large but the 2 twin bed room had plenty of room for the 2 of us especially with the huge walk-in closet for your luggage and were very well appointed. The bathroom was very cute and they provided great bath products and of course loved the little ducky which I took home. I would recommend this propety to anyone looking for a great place to stay in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “not new but neither am I”
Reviews.Author: tdan49
Reviews.Content: The Chancellor is ideally located for Union Square. Its a little dated but looks like its just had a redecoration. We asked for and had connecting rooms with our kids ( 19 and 15 ). Lovely room, hotel had a nice feel to it. If you need any advice ask Rory the Irish barman. would return.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: brydie2905
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a superb location. Little frills but the service and room was superb. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: HKWYorkshire
Reviews.Content: We managed to get a really good price for this hotel and so don't know if we would have been so enthusiastic if we had to pay full price. It was in a great location convenient for walking to all the sites in San Francisco. The staff were so friendly and helpful and the room was quiet, spacious, clean and very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & room, parking a little tricky”
Reviews.Author: WATrooper
Reviews.Content: Got a last-minute deal, so for the money I paid, the location and room were both great. Room comparable to a standard 3/4 star hotel. Parking was a little bit of a hassle, as there is no on-site parking and we had to park our car in a garage a block away because we took advantage of the discounted parking offered by the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: iamjong
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the best location ever, on the Powell Street cable car line in Union Square. We had a total of 7 nights here, the rooms were very clean, though somewhat small. Appreciated the bathroom amenities, loved the free WiFi in all rooms. And, of course, the walk-in closet! We had a very pleasant stay. Great hotel but reception staff lack of enthusiasm. They were efficient, but lack of smile.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: royuk_7
Reviews.Content: On a two week fly drive package arranged by Trailfinders I’ll be reviewing all of the hotels on our vacation in California between SF and LA, so if anyone is interested they can follow the thread. Flying in from London Heathrow we arrived at San Francisco on the Monday afternoon of Labor Day right at the start of September. The weather was lovely and the road from the airport was very quiet, the cabbie said it’s not normally like this! Our first destination was three nights at the Chancellor Hotel, Powell Street, Union Square. Wow! What a lovely hotel in such a fantastic location, just a very short walk to the main Union Square and right on one of the cable car lines. Being from England I don’t fully understand the concept of ‘blocks’ we don’t use that term, but perhaps half a block to the square? Whatever it’s very close. The people on reception are very helpful and friendly and on our check out day they advised us on the best option for collecting our hire car. The office was only on O’Farrell but they got us a cab there because of our luggage. Ok our two rooms didn’t have a coffee maker but we always bring our travel kettle and tea bags, so we purchased some milk from a store just a few yards away. And there were flasks of complimentary coffee available on the ground floor near the bar area, with cookies and popcorn also. We had breakfast in Luques on two mornings and loved it there, and the other morning we ate pancakes in Sears which is right next door...delicious! The first evening we didn’t really eat much as it was around 3-4 am in the morning on our UK time, so we felt a bit spaced out. The next night we had takeout pizza and the last night we ate at the Cheesecake factory on top of Macy’s. This had great views over Union Square. All in all we loved this hotel and loved SF, what a fantastic place! On Thursday morning we picked up our hire car, got upgraded to a seven seater Chevy Uplander and started our journey to Yosemite View Lodge.

Reviews.Title: “Good location with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Epp79
Reviews.Content: The rooms are a little old fashioned/ quirky but the staff are friendly and helpful and the location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I had booked a hotel nearby”
Reviews.Author: hogwild12
Reviews.Content: There's nothign really bad about the Chancellor to say. I just know know if i would rank it in the top 10 hotels in SF on trip advisor as i've stayed in better hotels just about everywhere. The goods: Location - next door to the famous pancake house and right off Union Square. What i didn't realize until i got there, is there are at least 10 other hotels just off Union Square too. Price - It's cheap compared to other hotels in the area, although i personally wouldn't have mind spendign a few more to stay somewhere else. The bads: The room is very small. The hotel hallways have that "old hotel odor" I would recommend this hotel for travelers that want to stay near Union Square at a bargain, but stay away if you like your nicer hotels with lots of room and extra soft beds.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great stay”
Reviews.Author: bateacher
Reviews.Content: We booked The Chancellor by telephone and were pleased with the rate given. They have both valet and offsite parking. We chose the offsite parking as it was a very reasonable rate and only ½ block away. We felt we got good value for our money with this hotel, which is in an excellent location and is a very nicely family-run hotel. The room was small, but very comfortable and nicely appointed. It was also quiet, as we had asked for a quiet room at the back. It looked exactly as portrayed on the website. Everything was very clean, the bed was comfortable, the linens were good quality, and the bathroom was spotless with good water pressure in the shower. All the staff we met were very helpful and pleasant. We purchased our Muni pass from the gift shop, they have 1 computer for guests if, like us, you don’t travel with your own laptop. We used a 2 for 1 coupon for a drink at the bar and it was very comfortable with soft jazz playing in the background. Complimentary coffee and tea were always available along with cookies and apples. The location at Union Square on the Powell Street Cable Car Line can’t be beat. Breakfast is not included, and we chose to just grab a coffee and croissant at one of the many places along Powell Street each morning. All in all, we loved the Chancellor Hotel, felt it was excellent value, and would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time At the Chancellor”
Reviews.Author: bjkelley
Reviews.Content: The location is the best - right on the cable car line, across from Union Square, close to BART (short walk). Everyone at the hotel was very pleasant and eager to please. Rooms are very clean, though somewhat small. We had a very pleasant stay and yes, I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Best small, affordable, delightful hotel in San Francisco!”
Reviews.Author: NandJ2
Reviews.Content: We love staying in small hotels that are centrally located. We had been told that the Chancellor was a great small hotel. We will be telling others the same. It has just about everything a small three star hotel has in Europe and more. The bedding was lovely, the amenities in the bathroom were great and the service was as good as it gets. It also had a save in the closet. We hesitate to praise the hotel too much for fear of not being able to get a reservation when we return.----"A three star hotel with a five star location."------so true!

Reviews.Title: “Another good review for the Chancellor...”
Reviews.Author: tymetraveler222
Reviews.Content: We booked the stay, eat and park package at the Chancellor Hotel. We chose the valet parking option, which is an extra $7 a night. Check-in was quick and easy, and the front desk staff was always friendly. The lobby itself is nice, but I think they need to replace at the least couch! It just looks old and tacky. There is a computer (behind the front desk-off to the side) guests can use, and there is about a 20 minute time limit, if someone else is waiting. There is also another small desk/concierge area, that also sells common items and snacks etc. The parking garage is located nearby, and whenever we wanted our car, it was there in front within 5 minutes. We only got it out twice during our 5 night stay. Location-simply cannot be beat. Right in Union Square, across the street from a small park, and the major shopping venues like Macy's. There is a Walgreen's 2 doors down for any items you may need. Several restaurants within a short distance. Public transport is either right there at the front of the hotel, across the street or down a block or two or three. The hotel is on a slight hill. The restaurant located in the hotel is excellent. Small. Very friendly, professional waitstaff. Very clean. The food was excellent. We were full and didn't need to eat lunch at all. Nice decor. Our room: we were on the 15th floor, which I had requested. It was very quiet, we NEVER heard anyone in the hotel close a door, walk by our room, nothing. The rooms are small. But the huge walk in closet more than makes up for it. We had a queen bed, which was comfortable. The linens are very decent. We asked for and got our extra pillows. They have a menu of like 15 different kinds of pillows. 2 nightstands, each with its own lamp. Alarm clock/radio. One drawer in each nightstand, as well as an open area under. Ceiling fan. Two chairs, and though they are OK, not the kind you are going to stretch out in and be comfortable for any length of time. A table between them with a silver tray with a dish of candy (peppermints, etc.), an ice bucket. Very nice desk with chair. A couple drawers in desk. 3 drawer dresser with TV on top. The closet: LOL. Loved it. Safe and iron/board in here. 2 luggage racks. Plenty of hangars, ask for more if needed. Extra blanket and pillow on top shelf, which extends length of closet. More than enough room to hang all your clothes (bring some of your plastic hangars from home), stash your several pieces of luggage, dirty clothes bag and still move around. I stashed all my shoes on the top of the safe, they were out of the way and off the floor. Umbrella provided. Full length mirror, I think.....! Bathroom: Deep, old cast iron soaking tub with your very own yellow rubber ducky. You can take this home, they want you too. :) Good water pressure, several different types of flow. One sink, large mirror, small shelf. Toilet. Wastpaper basket. Very nice towels. Nice bath products. Hairdryer. Everything worked well-lights, plugs, TV, remote, hairdryer, safe, alarm, locks, water pressure, iron. Like many if not most hotels in SF, this one does not have A/C. It was warm in our room most of the time, though we had the ceiling fan going all the time. We opened the window, which opens a whole 3 inches or so. Now I do not know if you are suppose to, but guessing not, we got the bolt out and were able to open the window all the way. We felt much better with the air blowing in. We also bought a small fan at Walgreen's, though I sleep with a fan on, and it was originally meant for that purpose, but had it going all the time, also. Though we heard all the city noises with the open window, we didn't mind. We closed it when we went to sleep and when we were gone, of course. You can still hear sirens, loud yelling from the street, whistles, and maybe the Cable Car clanging, but it never bothered us and I am a very light sleeper. We loved our view of Macy's and the park. Checkout was just as quick and friendly. The concierge is nice and helpful, though we got some short answers from her. We chose a different tour company than she suggested and she didn't say one word about them. I was left stammering some sentence, I felt like I had to appease her. But I just thanked her and walked away. We took one taxi, and they had it arrive in 5 minutes. We never used the evening bar area. We did get coffee though, and it was OK. They also had hot chocolate if I remember correctly and it was very good. Very happy with our stay, and with the price paid. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Sturich19
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Chancellor on the 22nd and 23rd July 2010. It is our honeymoon so the hotel gave us a room where we could just about see union square and they also left us a bottle of champagne in our room which was nice. It is an older hotel and therefore the rooms are quite small but they are well equipped, clean and have all you need considering you are just sleeping there. The front desk and concierge were very helpful and willing to ask if we needed help around the city or any restaurant advice. The hotels location is great, 20 yards from union square which is a fantastic place with loads of great shops for example macy's, levis, nike, tiffanies. Also the cable car is literally feet away from the hotel which is great. Make sure you ride the cable car and stand on the side, it's definitely worth it for the fun of going up and down the great hills of San Fran. We have no idea how this hotel rates to others but we came away happy so you can't ask much more than that.

Reviews.Title: “An incredible trip in an INCREDIBLE HOTEL!!”
Reviews.Author: Marshalynn
Reviews.Content: First let me say that we found the Chancellor at Trip Advisor....thank you!!! When we arrived everyone was very helpful...but the best was seeing the location.....right outside our door was the cablecar!! Across the street was Union Square!! (Doesn't get better...yes it does!!) Two restaurants that we learned about from Trip Advisor...one was next door to the Chancellor and the other was across the street. (I have bad knees, so this was wonderful). The best part of the hotel was....EVERYTHING! The only bad thing....and it really wasn't so bad...the room itself, was lovely...clean big fluffy pillows...great shower.....just a little small. Still, if we were to return to San Fran it would definetely be to the Chancellor Hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay!”
Reviews.Author: glamourprincess
Reviews.Content: We booked Chancellor based on the good reviews on TA. We had a very pleasant stay at the hotel. We were given a room facing the back, and it was very peaceful and quiet. Exactly what we needed after a long journey. The room was on the small side, but was of no big problem to us. The walls are quite thin so we could practically hear the neighbors phone conversations, but fortunately there was low activity around us so we were not that bothered and the bed was very comfortable so we slept well during our stay. It's not the most modern or glamorous hotel in SF, but we had everything we needed and it felt fresh and clean, and it's great value! Loved the free WI-FI! Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Bathtub Ever!”
Reviews.Author: marycorrigan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chancellor for 4 nights and had a great experience. The staff was very friendly and helpful. You can't beat the location, we walked from the BART, and took the trollies and buses the whole trip (I highly recommend getting a MUNI Passport) it allows you to get on and off the buses/trollies at will. We had a delightful room in the front of the hotel, it was a little noisy but we expected this being in the location we were in. The beds are great, the rooms were clean-I can not rave enough about the tub! I am a tub person, I love to soak in the tub and did so every day of my stay. The rubber duckie was a cute touch. Free Wi Fi is nice (sometimes the signal is slow). THe hotel provides free coffee/tea service 24/7 with cookies and apples on the side. Sear's restaurant is right next door for fantastic pancakes(get there early on the weekend they do get a line out front.

Reviews.Title: “Still the Best in Town”
Reviews.Author: poppajoe42
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the Chancellor, and it was just as wonderful as we had previously experienced. The staff are so caring and considerate, that you feel right at home the minute you walk through the door. The redcoration of all the rooms has been completed since our last stay, and together with the really comfortable beds and choice of pillows our stay was very good indeed. There was a complimentary bottle of wine in our room and the free internet is always a blessing when you are travelling. Cookies and tea/coffee are always available in the foyer for your use at any time. Breakfast and lunch are served in the hotel and the quality is very good, there are plenty of restaurants in the area for dinner as the hotel is situated right on the corner of Union Square, close to the BART station, and the cable cars run right outside the hotel in Powell Street. We highly recommend the Chancellor to anyone who likes to be looked after while they are away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, helpful staff, nice touches, tiny/noisy rooms.”
Reviews.Author: stokes007
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in June 2010. They have no a/c, which is standard in this part of the country, so you sleep with the windows open. It was perfectly comfortable (we didn't see the FIRST insect, it was cool and breezy)...but it was noisy, because we had a room fronting Powell Street, directly off of Union Square. If you stay here, and you certainly should, just ask for a room on the back side of the building, away from the street. Aside from that, our only complaint was the size of the rooms - since its just two of us, and didn't spend a lot of time in the room, it was just fine. The bathrooms are VERY small though - the kind where you almost have to stand in the shower to shut the door, because the toilet is in the way. Again - just fine for us. And we're average sized people. But they're definitely smaller than average (its a historic property). Room was terribly comfortable though - and their pillow menu was really cool. We sampled two, and I may even buy myself a buckwheat pillow now. I slept like a baby. Very comfortable bed as well (including the standard pillows). They had lovely relaxing bath salts along with the standard shampoos, etc. SPECIAL TOUCHES: The front desk staff routinely gave us easy bus directions and great maps to help us out. We also arrived on our anniversary, and the hotel left a bottle of sparkling wine (Napa) and some truffles in our room. The cable cars stop DIRECTLY in front of the hotel, and the F-Tram line is a few blocks down the street. We used the city bus system mostly, and several lines stop within a block or two. Its location on Union Square makes it an easy crossroads for transportation and shopping is great. Several restaurants in the area as well. We didn't eat the hotel restaurant though, so can't include that in the review. Hint - there's a Borders a few doors down, and they have hot breakfast sandwiches and lovely pastries with their Seattle's Best coffee, for much less money than the local restaurants. In sum - ask for a room away from the street (and a high floor perhaps), and if you don't mind a smaller room, this makes a GREAT home base for exploring San Francisco. We would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Chancellor!”
Reviews.Author: fujido
Reviews.Content: My first trip to the Chancellor was in the early 1960's with college friends. I always remembered the huge deep bath tub and great location and promised myself I'd return some day. It took a long time but my husband and I visited in May 2010. Our room was a bit small, but very clean and elegantly modern. Service is outstanding and friendly and they are responsive to individual needs. My husband walks with a cane and he was told he could park our car in front of the hotel in the loading zone as often and as long as he needed to. The same staff person even recommended a tasty Indian restaurant we both enjoyed when we tired of the (delicious) tourist spots. We loved the Thai prawn salad in the in-house Luques restaurant and had the best martinis in the Luques bar every evening. When we wanted to visit the Japanese Garden in Golden Gate Park in the rain, there was even an umbrella hanging in the closet for us to use. And that bath tub was just as fabulous as I remembered! We will never consider staying anywhere else--you get so much for the money and feel so well taken care of.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value.”
Reviews.Author: FalkirkMurph
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in this hotel and found it to be very acceptable. It was a fairly small, narrow hotel and the rooms were not that big, but all that you wanted. The rooms had a safe, ironing board / iron, and even had an umbrella supplied. To be honest we couldn't fault the hotel apart from the restaurant not opening in the evenings, but there are plenty adjacent. The tour desk was very helpful in explaining the transport system and what was available.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: amethyst984
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to San Fran to celebrate our 1 year wedding anniversary and stayed at the Chancellor. We absolutely loved it! What a great location!! It's walking distance to restaurants, shopping, and tons of exploring!! As others have mentioned, the rooms are a bit on the small side, but who cares? It's just for sleeping! Our room was very clean, the staff was friendly and very professional, and I absolutely loved the fact that they had cookies and tea/coffee available in the lobby at all hours :)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, fabulous people and decor”
Reviews.Author: Janellelizabeth
Reviews.Content: We have been visiting the Chancellor for about 5 years and have always appreciated the retro feel of the building and the location. We were very pleasantly surprised to return and discover that everything we had enjoyed had improved! The decor of our room was lovely and we had a large walk-in closet that gave us much more room than we had anticipated. All the people who worked there from the front desk, to bell-person to housekeeping cheerfully and graciously helped make our stay fabulous. You can't beat the location!

Reviews.Title: “Good base for touring SF”
Reviews.Author: Sophdoph86
Reviews.Content: After arriving on a long flight from the UK we were glad to arrive at the Hotel and be swiftly checked in. Our room was on the 15th floor and had clearly been recently refurbished. The room was small but had everything we needed, good free wi fi and good storage space. The bathroom was very small and needed updating. The shower head is very low! The lobby is small but has a decent little bar, which is reasonably priced. Cookies, apples and tea/coffee are all free and this was a great little extra. We had $25 room credit included in our rate and we used this in the Lucques restaurant for breakfast. The short stack pancakes come highly recommended! Excellent location, easy to use the cable cars and we found that most sights were in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Old Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shastabob
Reviews.Content: Very nice early 1900s hotel. Lots of charm. Clean well-appointed room. Comfortable bed. Friendly & helpful staff. Fantastic location -- right on cable-car line in Union Square. Very quiet except for some brief loud clanging sounds in the middle of the night from street below. We were lucky and got upgraded to a two-room suite. We did not use any of the amenities (except the free wi-fi) but there were many. We were on the 14th floor with a pretty nice view. We will stay there again. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: matm48
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in a great location. Being a boutique hotel, the rooms are on the small side, but who needs floor space to sleep. We were travelling with my very young daughter. They setup a crib and we had no issues. The windows could use upgrading (with the cable car passing just in front, it can be noisy), but once the car stops around midnight, I had no trouble sleeping (the great bed helps a lot!)

Reviews.Title: “Location and value”
Reviews.Author: JAG458
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently for a conference at the moscone center. It represented one of the better, if not best deals, in the union square area. It made getting to the conference a nice walk and plus there were shuttles to nearby hotels from Moscone if needed for my conference. The room was small (it is a redone old hotel afterall), but it was clean, nicely put together with good amenities (comfy beds, flat screen tv, free wifi). Others mentioned issues with noise from the street, but although we were on the 3rd floor, we were facing the backside, so what we lost in view (we had none of any use) was made up for with quiet. Would definitely recommend for the right price,.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: jenniren
Reviews.Content: I'd e-mailed the hotel about booking airport transfers and they recommended Go Lorries who picked us up promptly as arranged. Always nice to get off to a good start. CHECK IN - smooth and efficient and we were allocated a room on a high floor as requested. Reception staff were very helpful and very happy to offer directions when asked. The only irritation was with the tour booth lady who jumped on us before we could get to the lift and thrust leaflets in my hand trying to sell tours/bus passes etc. I told her we'd take a look, but had already booked a couple of tours online to which she made a face and promptly grabbed them back. Quite amusing really, but it did put us off approaching her again for a couple of days, although I must add that when we did she very efficiently arranged our transfer back to the airport. ROOM - our room was very well furnished, spotlessly clean the whole visit and the jar of sweets was a nice touch. As mentioned in many previous reviews they're not huge, but considering the extremely reasonable cost not really a problem. We were only staying for 4 nights so didn't want to fully unpack and therefore found it quite difficult to fit both cases in, but again a minor problem which we managed to get round. The bathroom was very small and did feel a bit cramped, but again spotlessly clean and for a short stay quite adequate. FOOD - we only ate in the hotel restaurant for breakfast on our third day as we were usually out early for tours. The food was very well cooked and reasonably priced, but the waiter although very efficient wasn't particular friendly - just going through the motions would be the best description. LOCATION - very central with easy access to the cable cars. Particularly good if you like to shop - not really our thing so no reflection on the hotel, but we would probably opt to stay on the Embarcadero if we visit again. OVERALL - we very much appreciated the complimentary coffee and cookies in reception, especially when going off at silly o'clock for the tours. Also the free WiFi in our room. Extras like this lift The Chancellor a notch above most budget hotels. As I've said in previous reviews, it's all about expectations and this hotel more than met ours.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great room, great location”
Reviews.Author: lkreporter
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Chancellor Hotel and it was great. I booked my room with an online service. When my sister and I checked in, they had us in a room with one queen bed. I then asked if there was a room with two twin beds. They told us they didn't, but immediately offered a suite at no extra charge to give us more room. We thought with the extra room we could get a rollaway bed then. When we saw the suite, it was more than perfect. Each room had its own bathroom, television only one had a queen bed and one had a couch and table. They even had their own doors to the hall The rollaway bed fit perfectly in the couch/table room after reaaranging the furniture. It even had a fridge. In the end we wound up with two little mini rooms. No sharing of bathrooms - bonus. The room was clean, quiet, and stylishly decorated. The bathroom amenities were even nice - loved the body lotion in particular. The staff were very friendly and accommodating. The location was perfect for us shoppers as all the stores were withing walking distance. Even the cable car was only a five-minute walk away where it turns around. I would highly recommend this hotel and I actually booked it because others rated this hotel so highly on this site. I was grateful for the reviews. That's why I felt compelled to write a review on the hotel myself.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend, excellent service, wonderful food in the dining room and close to everything.”
Reviews.Author: marbleOntario
Reviews.Content: Being at Union Square, enjoy the sounds of the Trolley cars. the night music of the cars add to the whole eperience. Being so close to the trolley line is indeed a plus. We loved our time. We high, high highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in the city.”
Reviews.Author: Rudydugan
Reviews.Content: My stay at The Chancellor was outstanding! It is a fantastic old historic building that holds it's charm and character well. Yes, the rooms are smaller. Yes, the floors creaky in spots. Yes, you can occasionally here the folks in the next room. IT IS AN OLD BUILDING! If you want new, shiny, fancy perfection, don't stay here. If you love old buildings and history, this is the perfect spot! The staff was excellent. My bed was excellent, as was the huge tub! I WILL stay here again when in San Francisco! Thank you Chancellor, you made my stay comfortable and complete!

Reviews.Title: “The icing on our holiday cake.”
Reviews.Author: babydinosaur
Reviews.Content: We finished our road trip here and having travelled over 3000 miles this was far and away the best hotel we stayed in. Firstly it transpired that we were going to arrive a day early. We thought about finding somewhere else to shack up for the night before deciding to try our luck at The Chancellor. Not only did they squeeze us in but when we arrived they had managed to juggle things so that we had the same room for our entire stay. We even got a small discount! As we had requested upon booking we were put on a high floor (luckily the top) and had cracking views over Union Square. The room itself although slightly on the small size fitted us and all our rubbish in comfortably. Nice tall ceilings and quality furishings welcomed these weary travellers. Thoughtful little touches such as the personalised rubber duck and the jar of sweets made you feel that the staff genuinely were pushing the boat out to make your stay special. Another plus that we hadn't yet encountered on our trip was the kiosk in the reception where we were able to seek help on all things SF and touristy! All the staff were great and just themselves, rather than being just faceless uniforms. Even the tram goes right past the front door! A faultless stay. If we are fortunate enough to be able to return to SF one day then I hope The Chancellor have a spare room.

Reviews.Title: “It's like coming back to a familar place that you know and love.”
Reviews.Author: marrone1012
Reviews.Content: We love staying at the Chancellor from the friendly staff to the great location it always makes for a perfect get-a-way. It's convenient to get to by car and the garage is close by. You can walk most anywhere in the city within a 3 mile radius. There are tons of great places to eat nearby and if you can't sleep you can always go next door to Borders and get a book. Room 206 is perfect in the back with your windows open and you can walk down to the lobby, plus the oversized tubs and water pressure are amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MarkAusTx
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a good value for the money. The staff was super helpful and friendly. The location is Union Square which makes it very easy to hop on a cable car. The rooms are very clean, but small. The only thing I was unhappy with was the restaurant... the service was terrible each morning. Waiters walk right past you without looking to see if you need anything. Food was decent.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: oceangirl25
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Chancellor, first time in 2006. Choose this hotel again, for its location and comfort of the room.Appreciated the coffee and cookies in the lobby. Was great to be able to buy a Muni pass from the gift shop in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: alwaysathome
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed several nights at the The Chancellor and thoroughly enjoyed the ambiance of an old hotel updated with modern conveniences in a PRIME location with helpful, friendly staff. THE BEDS ARE OUT OF THIS WORLD! The small restaurant was excellent, as well. Ask Mao for his special coke and coffee drink!

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: tpaterry
Reviews.Content: We chose the Chancellor based on Trip Advisor reviews and were not disappointed. We loved the location, the European feel of the hotel and the friendliness of the staff. Yes the rooms are small, but that came as no surprise since it has been mentioned more than enough in other reviews. Air conditioning was no factor since we knew in advance there was none. This too was mentioned many times in other reviews. However, it always seems to catch a few by surprise. The staff went out of their way to accomodate our every request. Most notable was houekeeping. We never saw them but the room was kept spotless....that's the way housekeeping should operate. If we had special requests, we left a note in the room and it was immediately taken care of. The coziness of the bar, the friendliness of Alicia the bartender, , the restaurant breakfast crew especially Mao, all added to a great stay. We will visit San Francisco again and will surely stay at the Chancellor Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Staff and location only bright spots.”
Reviews.Author: fishingtater
Reviews.Content: First time in San Francisco. Good points first...the staff was awesome! Everyone was nice and friendly. The location in Union Square was convenient for cable cars and buses. Now the bad. The rooms were very cramped. Double beds were more the size of military cots! Would pay a few more dollars for more comfortable rooms at a different hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location - Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Conners17
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Chancellor Hotel for 4 nights. Check-in was straightforward and the staff in reception were helpful with directions to nearest carpark. Our room was on the back of the hotel so was quiet. The room was large with two chairs, coffe table, writing desk, drawers, large flat screen TV, iron and ironing board, safe and a walk-in wardrobe. The pillow menu is a nice touch and they are delivered quickly to your room. The bed was massive and very comfortable. Its a small hotel in a fantastic location right on Union Square, surrounded by shops and restaurants, the cable car runs past the front of the hotel on Powell Street. The staff are friendly and efficient. When I told them it was my husband's birthday trip we were surprised with a bottle of complimentary champagne in the room on our return from a day out and the receptionist sang 'happy birthday' when we checked out. I would have no hesitation in recommending this friendly hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, Location, Staff”
Reviews.Author: pgad
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel through TripAdvisor recommendations. This hotel is not a national brand name, but across the street from big name and $ hotels. I'm looking out the window at Union Square and can see the Ferry Terminal and Bay in the distance. Cable Car is out the front door. Rooms are well appointed, Wi-Fi, hair dryers, LCD TV's, comfy beds and very clean. Staff is very helpful. Breakfast downstairs was excellent for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service”
Reviews.Author: Zamilah
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect, cable car out front and walking distance to most other places. Yes the room is on the small size but the great service, free tea and coffee and homemade cookies in reception makes up for it. I dealt with Kevin Vossen to prepay and amend my booking before arriving and can not speak highly enough of the prompt replies l received.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location... and free perks!”
Reviews.Author: suleeny11
Reviews.Content: I'm a regular customer and I continue to return each year because I enjoy the small feel and the many simple perks that come with staying there. I was a long-time SF resident, and I have stayed at some of the best hotels in SF, but Chancellor is the most fun. They have free apples available daily, free cookies, free coffee and, best of all, free wifi... it's all great. The hotel has a definitive boutique feel - which is great because you feel like you live there. The people are kind and the location - well that just couldn't be better. I've stayed at the 5 star hotels, but I always end up staying here every time I go.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service, Outstanding Value”
Reviews.Author: 08Bandit
Reviews.Content: Service was outstanding. Examples include holding bags before and after checkin/checkout, delivering complimentary refrigerator to room, free coffee/cookies all day, and they allowed us to check in extremely early. Room wasn't huge, but it was big enough for a couple. We were worried about bathrooms based on previous reviews- they were small, but had a nice tub. The bed was extremely comfortable. They have new LCD TVs, but only 20 channels (HBO). Free wi-fi was adequate for web browsing, but don't expect to stream video. Location couldn't have been better. You're right in the heart of Union Square. You can walk out the front door and get on a cable car that takes you to Fisherman's Wharf. There's a major transportation hub about 4 blocks south of the hotel that can get you on a train to SF Giants, Oakland Athletics, Airport, and Stanford University (1 transfer). Definitely no need for a vehicle. You also have the option to travel one block to a pretty nice gym (complimentary). We booked our room as a package with a flight on Priceline.com and got an incredible deal. The employees here genuinely care about the customers. An incredible experience, I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional value, tons of charm, & the perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: neb_1984
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stay at the Chancellor every time we visit San Francisco. The rooms are clean and comfortable, every staff member is very pleasant and helpful and, above all, the value is exceptional. The Chancellor is centrally located on Powell in Union Square, making it easy to hop on a cable car and head up to the wharf and the Golden Gate or down to Market where you can catch the muni and explore the city. It is within walking distance of good food, good shopping , and, conveniently there is a bank of America and Walgreens a few doors down. I love this hotel for it's convenience, value, and charm - I wouldn't stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Great service & accomodations & convenient to everything.”
Reviews.Author: alwaytraveling
Reviews.Content: Even though the room was small, it was very well decorated and comfortable. We would definitely stay there again. We were traveling with friends and the hotel staff was very tuned in to our needs to have rooms close together. Also, it was great to choose a special pillow.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, all that we needed!”
Reviews.Author: ThePrests
Reviews.Content: We knew it was a budget hotel but, that considered, everything was fine. It is a great location, perfect for a short stay in SF! Very clean, helpful staff. We would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: seaweedsprites
Reviews.Content: We selected a quiet room during the booking process and it was located high up on the rear of the building, far away from the traffic and tram noise at the front. Breakfast via room service was excellent although down in the restaurant, the breakfast service was a bit variable. The bed was amazingly comfortable but the shower head over the bath will be too low for anyone over about 4ft tall ! The location of the hotel is superb.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean, good location.”
Reviews.Author: Bearcatgirl08
Reviews.Content: This hotel us right on union square. A great location for sightseeing. One of the trolley lines runs right by the hotel. You are close to great shopping and china town. The rooms are small; probably not great for families. They are clean and the beds are comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: MNHoneymooner
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend over Memorial Day weekend. Check-in was seamless. I had requested for a mini-fridge in our room for the duration of our stay - it wasn't there when we checked in. But I made one call to the front desk and it was brought up within 15 minutes. The rooms looked very true to the website. We had the twin beds and they were very comfortable. I loved that we could open the window, the ceiling fan, and the walk-in closet. We noticed that our door did not automatically shut all the way, so we had to make sure to close it tightly ourselves. It was also difficult to get the bathroom door to shut all the way. We were in room 1400 - we did notice the elevator noise in the morning and I could hear other rooms' toilet flushing. But it wasn't anything that would cause us to change rooms or anything, we only noticed it when we were awake. The location was great. We could see Union Square from our lobby, the cable car stopped right outside the door. We had a really yummy breakfast next door at Sears (try the pecan waffle!). I liked that there was coffee available in the lobby. Susan at the guest services desk was very helpful. She told us about the $13 one-day MUNI passes that we used all day and she booked us on a shuttle to the airport. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location at a reasonable rate”
Reviews.Author: bjmmmm
Reviews.Content: The Chancellor hotel is located close to Union square - it does not get any more downtown than this. The staff was incredibly friendly and helpful with my requests, the room was clean and surprisingly well-furnished. WLAN was somewhat slow in the evening hours. When booking I requested a quiet room on a upper floor - probably I got one of the most quiet ones available. However, I could still listen to other guests talking in the adjoining rooms and I could hear noise from the city. Then again, it was bearable and the latter probably always comes with a city hotel. The remote control of the TV did not work (come on, how long does it take to check this before guests check in?) but was exchanged promptly. Rooms are not air-conditioned, which is fine at that time of the year but I can imagine that some people will suffer during summer. Especially since keeping the windows open is not really an option due to the noise. Obviously, the hotel is not the Ritz but rates are reasonable given the location and the service you experience. If I ever get to San Francisco again, I will stay in the Chancellor, for sure.

Reviews.Title: “A memorable stay”
Reviews.Author: netoll
Reviews.Content: We chose the Chancellor Hotel for our stay because of the reviews on TripAdvisor. We were not disappointed. From our arrival to departure the staff was friendly and helpful. The rooms are small but well-equipped with everything we needed. (There was even an umbrella in the over-sized closet.) It was my husband's birthday and when we arrived in our room the hotel had a bottle of champagne and a gift in his honor. What a nice surprise! We highly recommend this hotel for your stay in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “worst room ever”
Reviews.Author: trvlrs2
Reviews.Content: very small room was tolerable but bathroom door wouldn't close, view was of fire escape and brick wall and loud plumbing sprayed water when other guests flushed! they finally changed us second night to more acceptable room but still would not recommend as tour agent for hotel spoke broken english and knew very little about area. Desk clerk seemed inconvenienced by our request for another room. They left window to fire escape open with our luggage in room, broke lock on window so anyone could have entered from that floor.

Reviews.Title: “Gross Bathroom!”
Reviews.Author: GlamourSparty
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel for its location, reasonable price and good reviews. Location is excellent definitely. The room itself is ok, the bed looked clean and the furniture was okay. However the bathroom was completely disgusting. The shower curtain was way too long and the bottom 6 inches laid in the tub. It was so dirty that I did everything I could to prevent any part of my body from touching it. Also the sink was cracked and the toilet and floor permanently dirty. It is in desperate need of updates! I personally wouldn’t stay here again, I’d rather pay a little more and be in a slightly less desirable area than be grossed out while trying to get ready.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly, conveniently located, this hotel is a gem.”
Reviews.Author: OnionOrion
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located close to Union Square, this hotel was clean and quiet (even though our window opened on the cable cars). Though not large, the room was quite adequate, reminiscent in size and decor of a small European hotel. The somewhat old-fashioned bathtub had a high lip (could be a problem for some) and a modern shower. There's a quiet bar and a breakfast and lunch restaurant in the lobby, and a good, not expensive restaurant (Sears) next door, something of a tradition, we're told, for San Francisco breakfast. Having coffee and tea available in the lobby throughout the day was a nice touch for tired tourists. Our limited contacts with the staff were pleasant. A great value for the price!

Reviews.Title: “4 star service in a 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: TerriLondon
Reviews.Content: The Chancellor Hotel is situated in a great location near Union Square, the train from the airport takes you to a station about a 10 minute walk away (10 minutes with suitcases as it's up a hill but 5 without!). It's more or less directly opposite Union Square and one of the cable cars stops right outside the hotel which is handy for China Town and getting up all those hills. The rooms were smaller than they look on the promotional material, difficult with two suitcases as there is only a small area to hang clothes up and not anywhere really to put folded clothes. There wasn't a fridge in the room and as I found out with all American hotels there aren't any drinks facilities in the room like tea / coffee. There is a TV in the room. The beds were very good and they pride themselves on being able to choose a multitude of pillows to suit your needs! There can be a bit of noise outside but then again you are on a main street... The reception staff were brilliant, very friendly and knowledgeable, the lady behind the shop / excursions counter is great. By the 3 day travel pass from her, you'd have probably made your money back within a day and a half, you need to use the cable car and trams quite a lot to get around - everyone says San Fran is small but we thought everything was really spaced out plus there are so many hills! You can use the internet for free in the lobby so don't use the one that's available in the room, as you have to pay for that and it's really slow. We tried and then went to reception who told us about the free one and refunded us the charge from the room. We got a reasonable deal on this hotel by booking direct and although you get what you pay for, it's definitely a worthwhile place to stay purely for its location.

Reviews.Title: “The Chancellor goes above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: hoel
Reviews.Content: The rave reviews about this hotel are absolutely true. The location in Union Square can't be beat, and the hotel itself was perfect. We stayed in Helen's Suite on the top floor, which offered a nice living area, two bathrooms, and the bedroom. The bed was super comfortable and offered a great night's sleep. The bathroom products were top of the line and were replinished daily. The general manager Wes and his entire staff go out of their way to make you feel welcome. From the two for one drink coupon at the hotel bar, to the complimentary maps of the city, everything was well thought out. This will be our hotel of choice from now on in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel; very comfortable; excellent location”
Reviews.Author: ChrisP26
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights at the start of our holiday in California. The location of the hotel was excellent - I can't think of a better, more central location as it was right next to Union Square, near to major public transport hubs, and had the Powell Street cable cars running right past the front door. The staff were friendly and helpful. You could buy MUNI transport passes at a tourist desk in the reception area. There was a lift to all floors. The room wasn't huge (as you would expect from a hotel right in the city centre) but was very comfortable and nicely decorated. The room had a two queen beds, a flat-screen TV, free wireless with a decent connection speed, a large closet, and a compact but well kitted bathroom. There were a couple of rather nice more personal touches that set the Chancellor apart from many of the chain hotels I've stayed in. In the bathroom was a rubber duck with a snorkel. And the hotel provided a 'pillow menu', allowing you to choose from a range of extra pillows (real down; buckwheat; memory foam). I know that these are just little touches, but it does show that the hotel makes the effort to just offer that little bit more in terms of customer service and personality.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here!!!”
Reviews.Author: Skimberly
Reviews.Content: We just came back from an amazing trip to California starting with 4 nights in San Francisco. I did quite a bit of research on hotels prior to booking, and I will say, without a doubt, that the Chancellor was an EXCELLENT choice. Everything about the hotel was perfect... the location, the room: very clean, amazing view (we were on the 15th floor), the gigantic bathtub, the staff is so friendly and helpful.... every person we encountered greeted us with smiles and went out of their way to answer questions/give advice. Support local business and a book a stay at the Chancellor... you will love it! Thanks Mr. Tyler to you and your staff!

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT CHOICE!”
Reviews.Author: APMQUITO
Reviews.Content: Great location in Union Square!! Very clean. A little old but didn't matter to us. Cable car stop on the corner of the hotel. Very close to everything!!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Kept Secret in SFO”
Reviews.Author: licricket_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chancellor Hotel, quite by accident. We were at another hotel in town, and were not happy. One morning when we were looking for breakfast, we stopped in to the Chancellor's Luques Restaurant and were so impressed with the service and food that we decided to check the hotel out. Well, we checked out of the other hotel and into the Chancellor. Everything was perfect for us: the wonderful staff, front-desk, cleanliness of the hotel and rooms, etc. We could not have been happier and have recommended the hotel to our friends. We will always stay there when visiting SFO

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel fantastic location fantastic city!”
Reviews.Author: KatDallas
Reviews.Content: Chancellor Hotel was recommended us, and it did not disappoint. The location was perfect (4 blocks from the BART) and right on the trolley line. Older hotel, but in fantastic space and it looks like the rooms had recently been re-done. The price was fantastic and the hotel staff friendly. We LOVED having the window open and hearing the trolley cars go by. Eat breakfast at Sears next door and get the 3 day trolley pass for $20. Would return to the Chancellor and actually we are looking forward to our next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: lizzy2012
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading reviews on here. Great central location with the famous trams stopping just outside, great for exploring SF. The main shopping area is all around you and it is within walking distance of all public transport. The staff were great, especially when we got stuck there after the Ash Cloud!! The rooms are cozy, but really comforable. The free tea, coffee and cookies in the foyet in the morning seemed never ending!! If we return, we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “very nice and comfortable stay, great location !”
Reviews.Author: akesas
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Cahncellor for 8 days. Cable car was just in front of the door. Market street was in walking distance. Our room had Unio Square view. The staff ( Matt, Zack, Nate and SUSAN and all the others) were very helpful and smiled all the time. Cookies and coffee at the lobby, we enjoyed so much. I will definitely stay here if I go back to SF again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and well kept”
Reviews.Author: Statikfeed
Reviews.Content: The hotel makes you feel like you stepped back in time. It feels very historic but it was remodeled well. The rooms were small but the furniture didn't seem to crowd the room to much. We were on the 15th Floor and enjoyed the view. The staff was helpful on arrival - thanks Matt- and we enjoyed the breakfast at the hotel. We used the valet service and the car came back in the same condition. The location was great access to Union Square and the price including parking and food credit was lower than many surrounding hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Chancellor hotel is excellent in every way”
Reviews.Author: LondonHulaBaloo
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel on trip advisor and read mostly good reviews and a few less favourable so in my experience as a traveller you may find the following review helpful too.... The location is excellent - cable car exactly opposite the hotel, and not only that but you are about 30 seconds away from union square so if you are a tourist you can easily catch any of the hop on hop off bus tours, which for anyone staying in the city for a week or more may find it useful to know that for about 40 dollars you can go uptown or to fisher mans wharf over and over again. The main benefit of this is that you won't need to waste money on taxis. The tour guide gave us a whole week of travel and we literally covered the city centre,north beach, china town, fishermans wharf, golden gate bridge, sausilito, golden gate park and more for two people. Basic advice? Ask for a bargain and you will get one. Hotel room was excellent. Emailed manager to ask for room high up and it was provided. Don't know why some reviews say the room was so small. Our room had a queen size bed, large tv, walk in wardrobe, drawers, two chairs and a table, as well as a full en suite bathroom. We got all of that at a bargain rate of just over 110 dollars plus tax per night. I don't know anywhere you can get that much for so little. Hotel is so clean. Annie and Maria cleaned our room to a very high standard and the entire hotel is immaculate so it gets a ten out of ten for that. Breakfast was fairly good with excellent service every day and again all food served quickly and everything was very, very clean. Susan on the tour desk / gift shop was very helpful and efficient and the front desk staff were good too. Free coffee and cookies as well as newspapers available in lobby every day, Susan always willing to assist with everything and this is a hotel I would most definitely be staying in again. Susan arranged bike tours as well as airport transfers for us so again worth her weight in gold. Bad points - nothing for the price. Not one bad remark I can say about this great little hotel to be honest. Suggestions - might be nice if coffee was available in the room - that's the only suggestion but it's not the end of the world as it is provided, but it's the only thing I felt would be a convenience. Other than that? This is a brilliant hotel and yes it's not the ritz but if you want clean, stylish with good service, a central location and something above and beyond a soul less travel lodge this is the best hotel of it's kind in San Francisco. Well done chancellor for really providing a beautiful hotel that is safe and sooooo clean!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location. Room not exceptional.”
Reviews.Author: TripleMLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights at the beginning of our holiday. Having caught the BART from the airport the hotel is a short uphill walk from the Powell st station. Check in was quick and the room was ready on our arrival. The bedroom appeared to have been recently renovated and was very nice, if slightly small. The bathroom hadn't had the same treatment and was a bit dated. The room had a new flat screen TV and free Wi-Fi and looked out onto the rear of the hotel. This meant the view was virtually non existent but cut down on the noise from Union Square. The hotel location is excellent and the tram stops right outside the entrance. MUNI passes for the public transport network can be purchased from the front desk. The cafe diner next door to the hotel was also excellent for breakfast. Overall i would say this hotel was excellent value for money and a great location right on Union Square. Im sure there are better hotels in the area, but not for that price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: WindyOaks
Reviews.Content: Our initial stay was extended by over a week due to the volcano and we were very happy here. It is in a great position, if you like shops, cable cars, eateries and activities in Union Square and obviously comes with the buzz that these things bring. Easy to walk to Chinatown. Rooms attractive and beautifully kept; those at the back are quieter. Eat at Sears and browes books in Borders; great.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a super location”
Reviews.Author: LorraineMac
Reviews.Content: We had booked this hotel for 3 days and ended up staying 7. It was very clean with great staff and the room was a great size for the 2 of us. Loved soaking in the big tub. The location was great - very central. It is right on the cable car line and also within walking distance of a great many attractions. The coffee and cookies in the lobby are a great touch. This was our first visit to San Francisco and the whole experience at this hotel was great. It was very quiet at night even with the windows open although we were on the back of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome boutique-y hotel”
Reviews.Author: BeakerTravel
Reviews.Content: I booked the Chancellor based on the recommendations here on tripadvisor for a short vacation with my mom, to celebrate her 50th birthday. The hotel did not disappoint! We had two twin beds, and the room, while smaller than typical business hotels, was the perfect size for us. I requested in advance a room on the quieter side that still had a view, and we got just that. We had no problems sleeping, even with the cable cars going by the front of the hotel. Also, since the hotel knew we were celebrating a birthday, they left a very nice note, bottle of wine, and chocolates for my mom. The location was excellent and it was easy to catch the cable car or the bus to get to every corner of the city. The room and bathroom were very clean and comfortable. The coffee, tea, and cookies in the lobby were always a welcome sight after a long day of sightseeing. And the WIFI always worked for us and was a great resource for us. The hotel reminded me a lot of the smaller boutique hotels I've stayed at in Europe. Overall I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting in San Francisco. I'll stay there the next time I'm in San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “We will stay here every time we visit San Francisco!”
Reviews.Author: ProvincetownMexbound
Reviews.Content: We spent nine wonderful days at this hotel. It was clean, convenient to everything and safe. The staff were all very helpful, cheerful and friendly. The beds were extremely comfortable, there is even a pillow menu to choose from. Very nice! We requested a little fridge for the room which was very useful. We took full advantage of the free wi-fi, and even on the top floor, had little trouble connecting. The rooms are very small, and the TV only has about 15 channels. However, we could live with that considering all the pluses. We would definitely stay there again. The free coffee, tea and cookies are just an extra bonus, as is the wonderful restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Bit of Europe in Union Square”
Reviews.Author: gum57
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chancellor for three nights over the weekend of the 17th of April and had a fantastic time. Because of the terrific location of the hotel, my husband and I walked everywhere which is something people don't usually say about San Fransisco. It's steps from Union Square and right on the cable car line which is why you should request a room at the back of the hotel which makes it quieter. Our room was 1305 which still had a view of the square, but was quiet enough for us to sleep with the windows open. And sleep we did. The beds are very comfortable although a queen is the largest. My husband is very tall but was still comfortable in the small room. Our closet was big enough to hold both of our duffle bags leaving the room free for us to walk around the bed. There was a safe and all the ammenities. I even took what was left of the shampoo because I liked it so much. In the lobby, they sell Muni passes for the cable cars and bus systems. It's a good deal. The valet parking package is also a good deal. There is a little breakfast and lunch place in the lobby as well as a small bar which has coffee in the morning and serves wine or cocktails in the afternoon and evening. Chinatown is within walking distance as are all the best shops in and around Union Square. It's located right across the street from the Drake, which is a fun place to have dinner in the looby and people watch. We took the Go shuttle from the airport which is linked into the Hotel's website. It was very cost effective. The staff was friendly, helpful and eager to please. This is a great find. I hope it stays this way.

Reviews.Title: “Very very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: GroovyGreg
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location and is within walking distance to the underground MUNI/BART station and the cable car stop for Powell/Hyde and Powell/Mason is right in front of the hotel. The hotel staff is very friendly (especially the concierge), the hotel itself is clean, and the rooms are spacious enough with large closets and a manageable bathroom. Shopping and dining options are plentiful in the Union Square area. There is a pharmacy/grocery mart half a block away. The hotel's restaurant Luques serves very good breakfast at reasonable prices. (they also serve lunch and dinner, but we only had breakfast there). Overall I very highly recommend this hotel to anyone who is staying in San Francisco. We felt very safe, very comfortable, and very satisfied! We will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Believe the reviews- this place is great!”
Reviews.Author: njewell
Reviews.Content: I'm always a little wary of hotels that have all excellent reviews on tripadvisor, but the Chancellor Hotel deserves all the best reviews and more. I just got back from a week long stay at the Chancellor and it was great. My husband and I met my parents in San Francisco to celebrate my mom's 60th birthday. Before we arrived, I was contacted by Monica, the events coordinator. She arranged flowers and champagne and chocolates to be delivered to my mom's room for her birthday. It was great service. The hotel admenities are great as well. The rooms are big enough. Very clean. Great bathrooms, comfortable beds, etc. The staff is at your service for whatever question/request you have. The breakfast we had in the hotel was great...very good eggs benedict! All in all...this hotel made our trip to san francisco perfect. We had the best time in such a great city and I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stu_Robbo
Reviews.Content: What a fabulous hotel in a great location. We had a room that overlooked Powell Street and if you opened the window you could hear the cable cars and the general hub bub of a wonderful city. The rooms were not huge but definately not tiny, we had a cot in our room and still had plenty of room for the three us. I found the hotel charming as it wasn't part of a big chain and just had a very personal feel. The tour desk lady was very helpful make sure you book things with her as you find they are usually cheaper. I have rated the service as good as there was a couple of mix ups when we had to extend our stay due to the ash cloud.
