The mix ups happened due to the lack of communication between the front desk staff and the back room reservation staff. The staff however were very helpful providing us with boiled water for our baby and did deal with the mix up well.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: manyhappydays
Reviews.Content: I would highly reccommend the Chancellor Hotel on Union Square to anyone visiting San Francisco. My husband and I were in San Francisco for the first time and stayed at the Chancellor Hotel for 4 nights over Easter and found the location very central and value for money excellent. For an older hotel, the rooms were renovated, large and most importantly, clean. We were lucky enough to have a room that looked out onto Powell Street, accross to Union Square, with the Cable car right outside the hotel. What a great start to our U.S holiday - I just wished we had the same experience in New York!

Reviews.Title: “I think if you aren't high maintenance the place is great.”
Reviews.Author: PhoenixBunn
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is great. Very easy to access the Trolley cars, bart, and muni. We purchased the 3 day pass and we used it for 2 days and it had more than paid for itself. As for the hotel - the service was great. It is very much a boutique hotel and looks a bit warn. The rooms get a bit humid and uncomfortable during the night because there is no air conditioning. The walls are a bit thin because we could hear the neighbors a little too well in the evening. I am a light sleeper, but my husband didn't even wake up. For the amount we paid it was just perfectly located and we used it to sleep so it served it's purpose. We celebrated a special occasion and the hotel treated us when we arrived with a bottle of champagne. I think if you aren't high maintenance the place is great. I also recommend the pancakes and french toast from sears next door and don't eat at Lori's Diner. I would definitely try a different hotel the next time I visit san francisco only because of the humidity during the evening.... i take showers at night and I don't think it helped. Also wifi worked great!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and great value for money”
Reviews.Author: LMMDublin
Reviews.Content: Despite reading good reviews of this hotel it still exceeded my expectations. The location is great - it's beside all the main department stores and shops ( macy's, saks and borders are within sight of the front door), the trolley runs along powell st, there's plenty of places to eat nearby and all of San Francisco's attractions can be easily reached. While our room wasn't very big it was bright, clean and fresh with a walk in storage area/wardrobe and the room/bathroom was fitted with everything we might need - hairdryer, iron, ironing board. Trips and bus tickets can be booked in the lobby. Internet access, an atm and complementary tea / coffee are also available. I wouldn't normally submit reviews but I thought this hotel was a little gem particularly in terms of location and value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Will always try to stay here.”
Reviews.Author: 9x9
Reviews.Content: Lovely day-staff(very helpful girls, always friendly and smiling and helpful).The boys/men don't acknowledge that you've entered the hotel, which is only bad because it's a relatively small lobby and impossible not to notice (but they're fine to deal with and their hours are more unsociable than the girl's I suppose.....). When helping you to book something like a restaurant, tours etc, the girls immediately note that they're calling from the Chancellor to get a little respect, the guy that we dealt with didn't mention that at all when he booked a meal for us, and so he could have been anyone and the restaurant didn't do anything that he requested re seating etc. Rooms are nice and ours was perfect because there was a walk-in closet for our suitcases and clothes and it's great to be able to put them away out of site. V.comfortable bed. Nice and quiet. Slept like babies. Nice big deep bath. Ice machine on every floor. There is a ceiling fan in the room, I would imagine it gets very hot during the summer. Was fine in April though. Quiet hotel, not one of these huge hotels with hundreds of people walking around. Right next to/on corner of Union Square. Excellent location for everything. Short walk to anywhere from there. Only a few minutes walk to Macy's (The Cheesecake factory is at the top and has a great view over the square and is not too expensive). No Coffee machines in rooms, there is coffee available in the lobby 24hours, but it was rare that it was actually hot(coffee, de-caf and hot water are all left in flasks, but maybe need to be scalded out first, or just changed more regularly). Saw lots of people bringing in their own coffee from outside coffee-shops instead. There are plenty of shops and coffee shops nearby if you need anything.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: FloridaJojo57
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a real gem - we booked the package including parking and dining credit (which covered great breakfast for two each day). The price was a real bargain compared to other hotels in area. Rooms were recently renovated, clean and tasteful. Bathroom is really tiny - similar to European hotel. Location is fantastic - staff was extremely helpful. They put us on the "quiet" side, unfortunately, there was a loud guest staying on our floor who was outside his room talking at all hours of the night, but not hotel's fault. Highly recommend hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great holiday”
Reviews.Author: VictoriaC2
Reviews.Content: Perfect location - fun, charming hotel. Cozy, clean, quiet - very friendly and comfortable. Cable car right outside so easy transport but great sound proofing so never bothered by this. Good price. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Chancellor hotel - great location but small rooms and older hotel”
Reviews.Author: leecat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chancellor hotel - Can't beat location- we took the train from SFO airport to Union Square and then we walked with suitcases about 4 blocks. Right on Union Square and on cable car line. Awesome to hear the trolly cars! Union Square - huge Macys/Nordstoms that you can see from Chancellor hotel. First impression of hotel - OLD. Small rooms and bathrooms. We had two twin beds - The hotel has no A/C but it's was cool in San Francisco. They really need to update the lobby! The price was great and again the location is the best. If I had to do it again - I think that I would stay in little more modern hotel but the location and price are what the Chancellor is all about..

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: LT1979
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the first leg of our honeymoon trip to California. The hotel was about 20 minutes or so from the airport. I had emailed ahead to tell them it was our honeymoon and they had given us a complimentary upgrade, along with a nice little welcome note congratulating us on our marriage (and a very welcome bottle of wine!) The staff were friendly and helpful and overall we really enjoyed our stay there. The room was clean, spacious and the bathroom was just fine. For a good value and great location you can do no better than here.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, unique hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: charmless
Reviews.Content: I will say upfront that the rooms at the Chancellor are SMALL. If you like to run laps around your room, this is not the hotel for you. The building itself is old. The elevators are old and slow, but the Chancellor provides the sort of mix of modernity and timeless elegance that really appeals to me. The furniture in our room was new and modern, but maintained the aesthetic of a European boutique hotel. The mattress and linens were top-of-the-line. I always travel with my own pillow, but the pillows were so nice that I was tempted to sneak one of them into my pillowcase, on the way out. There was even a request sheet for specialty pillows (i.e. a body pillow or between-the-knees pillow). We didn't need any, but I wish we had tried them anyway. The bathroom was tiny and a bit older looking, but very clean and functional. Only one person will fit in there at a time and there isn't a huge counter to pile your toiletries on. Again, if you and your companion need a lot of space, or you're not fond of pedestal sinks, look elsewhere. High-end toiletries are provided and the rubber duck was a thoughtful touch. The location is very central. I would NOT recommend driving around San Francisco, but you can travel just about anywhere from Union Square, by Muni. We picked up a 3-day pass for $20 and it took us everywhere we needed to go. The Caltrain station to San Jose (where we went for a hockey game) was a 10-minute ride away. On a nice day, you can walk to a number of spots, if you're willing to dedicate a few hours to meandering around. One thing of note about Union Square is that it is in the downtown core. There were homeless people roaming around the neighborhood and one perched directly outside the hotel door, on one occasion, but I did not feel unsafe at any time. No in-room coffeemakers were provided, but complimentary self-serve coffee and tea were available in the lobby. Valet parking is offered by a third-party company, for a reasonable fee (given the location). If you need your car for any reason, you must provide 20-30 minutes advance notice so the hotel can contact the valet company. Keep this in mind, if you're on a tight schedule when checking out, or if you're the sort of person who accidentally leaves things in your car, like we did. Two things prevented my stay at the Chancellor from being 100% perfect. Firstly, the Wifi was terrible. We planned on going online to look up addresses and transit schedules, but it was often too slow to be functional. On the bright side, it was complimentary, so at least we weren't paying extra to be frustrated. We were also on the very top floor. Depending on the location of the hub, I wouldn't be surprised if the connection would have been better elsewhere in the hotel. There also wasn't a fridge in the room. Fortunately, we were traveling with a cooler and there was an ice machine nearby. If you enjoy having snacks in your room, this is something to note. All in all, I thought the value was fabulous, for the area and the quality of the accommodations. Unless I was interested in staying in a different part of the city, the Chancellor would be my first choice, the next time I visit San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Comfy Beds and awesome service”
Reviews.Author: 1girl1boy
Reviews.Content: After picking the hotel from fellow trip advisor comments I was not disappointed. The hotel location was great right on Powell st for the cable car. The service was impecciable. Warm welcome on arrival and even a happy anniversary surprise in our room, champagne, glasses and a picture frame from the management, thank you Hotel is quite small, think thin front but deep back. We were on the front side with our window on Powell St, I read other reviews that said the street side was noisy. I didn't find this at al when the window was closed. Yes, the rooms are small but the service and comfy beds (and I mean comfy beds) definitely out weigh this. Spot on Chancellor thank you for making our stay so memorable

Reviews.Title: “Glad I chose to stay at the Chancellor.”
Reviews.Author: UNCMOM2011
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a week at the Chancellor Hotel at the end of febuary and we really enjoyed our stay. I even found a lower rate for a competing hotel and e-mailed them and they matched the rate another example of their great customer service. The rooms are small but are comfortable and the huge walk-in closet is great since we were able to store all our luggage,shopping bags etc. in there. The staff are very friendly and courteous and the bartender at the Clippership bar in the hotel pours a generous drink. The WI FI worked great and they even brought up a small bar fridge for free to use in the room which I had requested through e-mail. We ate breakfast at Luques in the hotel one morning and it was very good and the man that ran the place was very nice and even brought us free OJ because he forgot my husbands hot sauce again great customer service. The location is perfect such easy access to the Muni,Bart and Cable Cars. We used public transportation exclusively and even to and from the airport it was great we loved not having to get into the car for a week. We would definitely stay at The Chancellor again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: PedroPerth
Reviews.Content: This was perhaps the most impressive low cost hotel I have ever stayed in because I have never felt so welcome. They do so much to make you feel like a valued guest. Really unusual in this day & age. Lots of lovely little gestures and signs in the room to top notch reception and free tea & coffee making facilities (and cookies) during the day at the lobby bar. Fantastic location right outside a cable car stop. This approach to running a business is what some people call old fashioned but I believe is basic good business sense. Word of mouth means so much more than paid advertising and I am telling you.... if you are looking for a low cost hotel right in Chancellor Square then this is it!!! My congratulations and deepest thanks to Staff & Managment.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxation in Busy City”
Reviews.Author: casadedale
Reviews.Content: Comfortable room to come back to each day .... small by US standards, but comparable to European hotels. Though small, very adequate -- the choice of pillows is an added plus!! Great bed - and isn't that what it's all about anyway?? .... Centrally located - walk to Chinatown and shops - across from Union - cable car pick up in front. ... Next door to Sears restaurant, but quite frankly for breakfast, the hotel restaurant is just as good w/o the waiting in line and higher prices. ..... Parking is a challenge in this city (and quite expensive), but the hotel has reduced "off-site parking" about a block away - if part of your accomodation package, will reduce your expenses for parking (with in/out privileges). There is temporary parking in front of the hotel for loading/unloading. .. Wireless internet in the room wasn't too good however - perhaps a problem that needs correction. ..... Would come back again.

Reviews.Title: “I guess the secret is out...”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkCityAlex
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Chancellor each time I visit SanFran (about twice a year for the past 4 or 5 years). I just returned from yet another stay. It is, as the other reviews say, a wonderful hotel. Yes, the rooms are very clean, the coffee in the AM is great, and I like the apples, but what makes it wonderful for me? Note to the manager: the staff at the front desk know the importance of being pleasant. No hassles. No "I'll see what I can do later." No phony attitude. Just a pleasant group of folks. I arrived early from a flight out of New York and I much appreciated there was no hassle: "Here's your room." And that was it. No "Sorry, you are early, come back at 3pm." Great. Also to management: here is my criticism - I hated those peppermint cookies; PLEASE bring back good old-fashioned chocolate chip. One last point to newcomers: Eat at Lori's Diner up the block. Wonderful food. Not fancy, but delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been any better”
Reviews.Author: travel_forever25
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our honeymoon this hotel met and exceeded our expectations.Awaiting in our room when we arrived was a wedding gift a bottle of champagne and a photo frame and lollies.The hotels location is perfect. It's right in the heart of the city opposite union square.Walking distance to Chinatown.You cannot beat this location.The rooms were very clean and tidy.The reception staff were always very polite and helpful. The housekeeping staff were great the room was always made up when you arrived back after a long day.The pillow menu was fantastic you could just call up and order a pillow to try. We liked the memory foam ones so much we went out and bought some.There is a computer by the reception to use for free or if you have a lap top there is free internet in the rooms, which is awesome.This hotel is value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location & Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BeakerRX
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights and really loved the hotel. It's location is right on a stop on the Powell Street cable cars and only 4 blocks from the BART station. We took the BART train from the airport and its about a 5 minute walk from the station. The rooms are small but well appointed, the beds are comfortable and you can't beat the 12 item pillow menu. It was my birthday while in SF and the hotel had a bottle of wine, chocolates and a gift for me in the room when we arrived. That was a really nice touch! We never ate at the restaurant in the hotel due to the early times of the tours we did but it looked good and people were always in there. I recommend buying a MUNI pass if you plan on riding the cable cars and/or busses around SF. One ride on the cable car is $5 and they sell MUNI passes at the travel desk in the lobby at a rate of $20 for 3 days or $26 for 7 days. Our paid for themselves in a little over a day. I would highly recommend the Chancellor Hotel for any stay in SF. We're planning on staying there any time we visit SF.

Reviews.Title: “what an ideal spot!”
Reviews.Author: NWroamer11
Reviews.Content: I hadn't stayed at the Chancellor or perhaps 20 years, but based on reviews decided to try. THIS IS A TERRIFIC VALUE! We used to BART from the airport and easily walked the 3 blocks on a slight uphill with our rolling bags. Our room was ready (early), was on the 12th floor, and very clean and perfectly quiet. The room as small ONLY if you are used to American oversized rooms. Very much on the order of a small European Hotel with small but perfectly adequate room with all that we needed. Firm Queen Sized Bed. Nice little bar off the lobby. We didn't try the restaurant but went next door for Sears pancakes! The "business center" is one wee computer right next to check in- again very European in feel. Great location from which to explore the city

Reviews.Title: “we realy enjoyed this hotel we will be back”
Reviews.Author: gandffarms
Reviews.Content: i can not say enough about this hotel form susan the travel agent to all the people we met at the resturant everyone was warm and friendly it was our first vacation in san francisco and we had a great time we will be comming back and we will be staying hear again

Reviews.Title: “You can't get a better deal”
Reviews.Author: SusanWillits_CA
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I've stayed at the Chancellor and it's the greatest place to San Francisco. It's right on Powell St. and the cable cars go right by the front of the hotel. It's right by Union Square and it's great shopping. The rooms are small but so cute and full of personality. It's the first hotel I've stayed at that had a pillow menu. How great is that? The staff is really friendly and go out of their way for you. Some one taught them excellent customer care. The best part is the parking. The valet parking is $7 more! How can you beat that. You can't even park in SF for $7 for an hour. The best deal in town.

Reviews.Title: “I'm coming back!”
Reviews.Author: JondyJ
Reviews.Content: This hotel is simply the best deal you can get. It is conveniently located, clean and the staff is great. We arrived via BART and walked up the street to the hotel. This is completely "do-able" for most anyone and is probably the least expensive route to take to the hotel from SFO. You won't be alone as you will see others doing the same (pulling their luggage up the street). The Chancellor is only 4 blocks from the BART stop (up hill.. but not too bad). We went the same way when we left and it was fine. The rooms are small but we seriously only ever slept there. They were nicer than most hotels that cost twice as much. Everything in the room worked great and the safe was a nice amenity to store my laptop. The front desk and the tour guide were always helpful. The cable car stops right outside of the hotel. If your room is on the front of the hotel - and you leave your window open - you'll hear noise from the street. This isn't the hotel's fault though.. it is kind of nice to hear the cable cars early in the AM. We never tried the restaurant but it always looked busy. We always had somewhere to be early in the AM so we never got the chance to eat there. OH - almost forgot to mention! Pillow menu with 12 different pillows. The buckwheat was GREAT! This hotel is a GEM and I won't stay anywhere else when we visit SF again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay...perfect location...exceptionally clean...LOVE IT !”
Reviews.Author: London.dreaming
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Chancellor several times now and it just gets better and better. The staff are SO friendly and eager to make your stay perfect. The room staff (for us it was Alice) was fast and super effiicient - the restaurant staff couldn't be more patient and attentive. We love this hotel...it is in a perfect location and for those light sleepers, just ask for a room to the back of the hotel. Not much of a view there but very quiet!

Reviews.Title: “From now on my default hotel to stay in town”
Reviews.Author: Jeja08
Reviews.Content: After trying a couple of hotels near the Moscone Center, we came across Chancellor, hotel located right across Union Square that proved to be a jewel. The price we paid over Expedia was fabuolous and the hotel certainly proved fantastic value for money. Let's start with the location - Chancellor excels by being close to almost everything you need in this part of San Francisco - Moscone (conferences), food (definitely try the mexican restaurant just one block down), shopping (Macys, Apple store), as well as the cable car. Rooms were very clean, cosy and the staff was great. There is a concierge service in the lobby run by a lady that was very helpful, even got us a limo to the airport for the price of a town car. From now on, Chancellor Hotel on Union Square is definitely my default place to stay in SF.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot beat the location”
Reviews.Author: brunettegirl07
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chancellor Hotel for 3 nights in early February. We always base our hotel selection on location and trip advisor reviews. You simply cannot beat the location for the Chancellor. Cable cars stop directly out front of the hotel and every other mode of public transport is within quick walking distance. You are also within easy walking distance for great shopping (which may or may not be a good thing). The hotel was clean, the staff were helpful, unnecessary but nice touches in the room (such as the rubber duckie, jar of lollies and biscuits) and the room size was more than adequate for two of us particularly when we were only sleeping there. Speaking of sleep - the Chancellor has the most comfortable bed and pillows. We got an amazing rate on line which included parking at a parking station just around the corner. The price could not be beat. It also included free wifi in the room. Would definately stay here again when we go back to San Francisco. If you are going to be travelling on many and varied modes of public transport throughout your stay, get a MUNI pass. They are accepted on all public transport and valid for the whole day or 3 depending on what pass you get. A cable car is $5 one way and an all day MUNI pass is $13 - you very quickly get your money's worth out of it.

Reviews.Title: “Best bang for the buck!!”
Reviews.Author: Jsphotog
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel a few hours before check-in but called to see if we could park our car since we couldn't find parking near the mall. They told us we could park early and let us check in so we didn't have to worry about it later. When I booked the hotel online, I requested a bottle of champagne be in the room and when we walked in...there is was. Delicately wrapped with two glasses and a big bow! Our room overlooked Union Square and the view was spectacular both day and night! The hotel was soo close to EVERYTHING! Walking distance to AMAZING restaurants, shopping in Union Square, and the Trolley stop was right out front! We didn't have a chance to eat in the restaurant in the hotel but I was impressed when they offered me a cup of French Press coffee in the morning when I came downstairs. All the staff were so friendly, knowledgeable, and helpful. We will definitely stay here again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in ideal location.”
Reviews.Author: PeterMk
Reviews.Content: We arrived for a 4 day stay as part of a world trip. The reception staff were very helpful and we were shown to the room by a helpful bellhop. The room was clean and comfortable, and looked out to the front. The only noise we heard was the cable car, but there was some comfort in hearing it. The location was excellent, and we would recommend the restaurant next door - SEARS - the food was excellent, and what breakfasts. We also use the Daily Grill one block down, and can recommend that restaurant as well. We enjoyed our stay and will be returning to San Francisco in the near future, and although there are many other hotels in the area, we will return to this hotel. The Chancellor offers that feeling of old fashioned customer service and good value -Well done.

Reviews.Title: “Take a chance in The Chancellor Hotel”
Reviews.Author: isseyb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Chancellor on Powell Street for 3 nights during January2010.Although the room on the 7th floor overlooking Powell Street was not the largest we have stayed in, we found it quite adequate for the 150$ per night that we paid.We found the hotel staff very friendly and helpful and although we only had breakfast in the hotel restaurant we thought it offered good value.Penny Pinching Tip: look at the menu before you enter the restaurant and if your meal does not include tea or coffee take one in from the lobby as its free!

Reviews.Title: “If your going to San Francisco be sure to wear some flowers in your hair.”
Reviews.Author: isseyb
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 5 week holiday in New Zealand staying over in San Francisco for 3 nights going out and 3 nights in Perth on the way back.Looking at the reviews on hotels on Trip Advisor we decided to stay at The Chancellor, Powell Street on Union Square.We paid 150$ a night for a room on the 7th floor overlooking Powell Street.Although the rooms are small as stated in other reviews, we found it to be more than adequate and good value.for the money.We found the staff on reception very pleasant and although we only had breakfast in the hotel restaurant we were very satisfied with the quality and price.PENNY PINCHING TIP: look at the menu before you go in and if tea or coffee is not included in the price take one in from the lobby as its free out there! I would definitely recommend this hotel along with these other suggestions: a 3 day MUNI travel card for 20$ an absolute steal, you only have to take 4 journeys on the cable car at 5$ a time to be in profit.Go on an URBAN TREK with Anton, there are 4 to 5 hour trips or longer 7-8 hour trips when you will be guided by Anton around San Francisco on foot.He has a vast knowledge of SF and will give you advice on where to eat ,how the transport system works etc.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel with character in a great location”
Reviews.Author: politikgirl
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel with huge discounts online and I was generally impressed with my experience here. The hotel is located in a very convenient part of town, steps away from cable cars, the BART, buses, shopping and restaurants. The service was very good as well. The hotel has a distinct character and style that sets it apart from the hotel chains. My one criticism with the hotel is that the beds were way too soft, as were the pillows. Other than that though, highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “One night - Perfect location, no complaints”
Reviews.Author: Gblyn
Reviews.Content: I chose the Chancellor due to trip advisor reviews, and recommendations to stay near Union Square as we were only in SF for 24 hours and the price suited out budget. I have no complaints at all. Excellent location, clean, friendly hotel - we were given a suite on the top floor - maybe because it was for one night and it was vacant..... excellent if you were staying a few days - or had more than a couple staying. I concur with previous posts - close to everything - we didn't have a problem with noise from next door - although our room was at the end of the hall, and the other adjoining wall to the bedroom was our sitting room. Bathrooms (2) were extremely clean. The building is an older style, but everything has been done up very nicely. they had free wi-fi, which whilst travelling I found to be an excellent convenience (used it via my iphone), so much so that wherever I book in the future will have free wi-fi (in all the hotel, not just the lobby).

Reviews.Title: “Top location but...”
Reviews.Author: luffsnoopy
Reviews.Content: My partner and me stayed at The Chancellor from 9 - 20 Feb. Location wise, the Chancellor was absolutely fantastic. Just minutes away from the main shopping area and with the cable car stop right outside, we were able to get to most of the must-see destinations and do our shopping easily. Even when we needed to take the buses, it was very convenient as the bus stops were within walking distance (five minutes on average). However, do note that as the hotel has rather thin walls so you might occasionally be awakened at night if other guests return late at night and make lots of chatter in the common corridor way. We were aware of the thin walls from previous reviews so we were prepared for it. There were a few nights when other guests came in late at night and we were woken up by the chatter. There were previous reviews about the room being small but it was good enough for us. The closet room was big enough for 2 our big suitcases. There was a safe deposit box in the closet room as well. Hot coffee, teas and cookies available 24 hours at the lobby. The tea selection is quite good. For those who want to explore the city and beyond, you definitely have to speak to Susan from the Tour Desk. Susan is a GEM! She is a friendly lady who always smiles and greeted us everytime we passed by her when we headed out. She is very knowledgeable on the tours and will help you to book tours to Monterey Bay, Yosemite, Napa Valley and many others. We signed up for almost all the tours available and had a fantastic time. The customer service at Chancellor Hotel before we arrived were splendid. My gf keyed in the wrong expiry date for our credit card during reservation and Mike McConnell (reservations agent) helped to rectify it very quickly. As we were staying for more than 10 days, we requested for a high floor room with a view of Union Square. Mr. Kevin Vossen (reservations manager) was superb in answering all our enquiries via email before our arrival and did helped to arrange a high-floor room with excellent view of Union Square for us! Unfortunately, our final day stay was marred somewhat by some hiccups. We were woken up at 7:30am twice by phone calls from the front desk who mistook us as the ones who had an airport pickup at that time. We checked with the front desk after we woke up and found it strange as the guest who arranged for the pickup had a totally different surnname from ours. We were quite disappointed as the staff didn't make any apologies for their mistake. This is strange as they are in the service industry. A second hiccup followed later in the afternoon. We had earlier twice informed and confirmed with the front desk during arrival and also the day before our check-out that we will be extending our check-out time to 4pm and were well aware that we will be paying extra for the late checkout. While we were catching on our sleep (having been woken by the front desk in morning at 7:30am), we were woken up again at 2pm by the front desk telling us it's time to check out. These are just minor issues but it's good to note as guests will still review the hotel based on overall experience. Other than this, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay in the Chancellor and will definitely recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “don't stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: bam1748
Reviews.Content: Have stay in plenty of downtown hotels, the Chancellor is at the top of the list. I email the hotel in advance for a rate and booking, Wes the Manager himself emailed me back to say all was in order and room confirmed. I got the room I asked for (low and to the front) without fuss. Better hotel than many who charge two or three times the price. Helpful staff, clean rooms, good price, good location, no reason to stay anywhere else. My girlfriend already wants to stay there on our next visit. Thankyou Wes and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Sellerina
Reviews.Content: Old, but really well maintained. Spotlessly clean, rooms are small but not cramped and the location can't be beaten! Friendly, helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific”
Reviews.Author: TucsonJimi
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Chancellor in mid-February 2010. Just 4 or 5 blocks up Powell from the Powell St. BART station, the Chancellor was easy to find. Our room was ready for us even though we checked in at noon. The room was modern, very clean, quiet and reasonably sized. The staff were helpful, and the free coffee and cookies in the lobby were great after a day of sightseeing in the cold. You just can't beat the value of the Chancellor in San Francisco. The location is ideal for seeing the major sights and you don't need a car to see 'em. We walked to Chinatown and North Beach but if you don't feel like walking we discovered the #30 bus on Stockton will take you to Chinatown, North Beach, Fisherman's Wharf, the Palace of Fine Arts and the marina green on it's route. Jump on any Powell St cable car heading up the hill just outside the lobby, and arrive at Fisherman's Wharf in style and grab an Irish coffee at the Buena Vista right at the end of the Powell/Hyde St line. We had a terrific stay and I will definitely return here again and would not hesitate to recommend this fine hotel to my friends considering traveling to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Castalla
Reviews.Content: Great loacation, very friendly and helpful staff, rooms small but very comfortable, great value for money, free Wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Charming!”
Reviews.Author: HeartTravellin
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here after eloping in Napa Valley. After our stay in Napa we drove down and spent two nights here. I loved that it is privately owned, you can tell the service is very genuine. Everyone we encountered from the bartender to the bellhop was more than happy to help and answer any questions we had. When we got up to our room we found a bottle of champagne waiting for us as well as a little gift. It was a Chancellor Inn Hotel picture frame. I loved the pillow menu! From what I recall there were 7 different choices. The room was really clean, free internet access was a plus and the decor was cute. And you can't forget to mention the location!!! In the middle of Union Square, but my favorite was the trolley right in front of the door! Cross the street to head toward the wharf and after a long day of sightseeing, it takes you right back to where you started!! Awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: CottonWoolOz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Chancellor for 3 nights before heading to Lake Tahoe skiing. It was excellent value so we booked 3 rooms for ourselves and 4 teens. The rooms were smallish, but more than enough space. How much room do people need? We had a massive walk in robe so enough space for suitcases and 2 huge ski bags. Bathroom is smallish, but again, very adequate. The rooms are very nicely renovated and spotlessly clean. After a 15 hour flight from Australia, we slept like logs. The location is excellent and if travelling through San Francisco again, we wouldn't hesitate to stay at the Chancellor again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great people, great breakfast, and parking included!”
Reviews.Author: EBChico
Reviews.Content: We loved the Chancellor Hotel on Powell Street right across the street from Union Square. It is such a nice hotel! The rooms are pretty in apple green, white and black. The employees there are so so nice, from the bell "boy" to the waiters in the restaurant... All very nice! We especially liked our waiter, Mao. He was very nice and efficient. Parking and breakfast was included in the price. We got on the Cable cars right out side the hotel and everything is so centrally located, it was fantastic to be here in the Chancellor.

Reviews.Title: “a terrific hotel”
Reviews.Author: Creyton
Reviews.Content: This is the third consecutive year I've spent Christmas - New Year at the Chancellor and my praise is undiminished for this splendid hotel. The entire experience - staff, ambience, service - cannot be faulted. I can only continue to offer my highest praise and my highest recommendation for this gem in the heart of San Francisco. BARRY CREYTON

Reviews.Title: “A Gem of a Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: 120Rocks
Reviews.Content: We were in one of the corner rooms, I suppose any of the floors with the room number ending with 03. We actually found the room large for the price and very well appointed. The work desk was comforatable and we had chairs and a table. Very spacious. Everything about our stay was right from the moment we walked in the lobby to the time we picked up our car to head home. We even met one of the folks who has his photo on the wall honoring his 30 years working there, seems he is nearing 40 years now, what a remarkable feat that is. They must do much right, not just with guests but employees too!

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms”
Reviews.Author: pemil66
Reviews.Content: Had another wonderful stay at the Chancellor. All the positive reviews are absolutely right on. Spotless room, wonderful shower, comfortable bed, friendly staff, great value. Why would you stay anywhere else. Love it

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Ksarul
Reviews.Content: The Chancellor is ideally situated about 20 yards from Union Square, with easy access to the cable cars and hop-on hop-off buses, as well as plenty of department stores if you like that sort of thing. A well run hotel, friendly staff, lovely bedding, perfectly adequate and nice room for the price. We also got a $25 voucher per night's stay to spend on breakfast or bar (we chose the latter generally!). The hotel is just over a 5 minute walk to Dotties True Blue cafe on Jones St., which doesn't look like much but has really great breakfasts, enough to last you until dinner! Free wifi very reliable and a decent speed.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: JJDB1400
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the weekend, taking the BART from SFO. Took 20 min. and only costed $8. It was only a 3 block walk from BARt, which was awesome. The staff was fantastic and let us check in early. The room was about size of a Motel 6. Not tiny, not huge.Very clean. The bathroom was small but very clean. Awesome water pressure in shower. Had a nice view of Union Square (you can request a view). Lady at attraction desk in lobby sold us a Muni Pass for $20, good for 3 days.With that, rode bus, cable cars, and muni unlimited. Public Transportation took us everywhere! Golden Gate Bridge, Park, Wharf, China Town. Don't bother with a car. Cabs also take you everywhere for about $10. Cable car stops in front of hotel. Starbucks across street.Very safe, no homeless in front of hotel, lots of shopping. Very happy with our stay! Liked the pillow menu, fresh cookies in lobby. Got a roll away bed within 5 min of request. Awesome value for an excellent location

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, nice room, great staff”
Reviews.Author: marcathy
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the West Coast and our last stay was San Francisco. Chancellor is in a great location, walk to Chinatown and North Beach, right on trolley line. Staff was really helpful and room was small but adequate, clean and attractive. Parking is reasonable which is a real plus. The room with parking was a real value for a big city. Would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Tiny rooms....Thin walls....”
Reviews.Author: MelbNYC
Reviews.Content: San Francisco .... the hardest place on our trip to choose a hotel that sounded like it would be "safe and quiet". After scoping over all the trip advisor reviews on San Fran hotels it became apparent that Chancellor was the ONLY choice :) What attracted me also was the fact that if there were any negative parts of a review - management would come on trip advisor and try and explain the "WHY" - it shows they have a lot of self respect for their customer service. When we arrived we were served by professional and friendly staff who gave us vouchers for a drink in the bar later on (which also had friendly people serving.). We were taken up to our room and soon after the fridge I had order for medical reasons arrived - only problem was someones left over ice cream was still in there! But I was happy that is arrived so quickly after we arrived (unlike other establishments with poor service). Let me begin with the room - in a country where it's all about BIG - these rooms were tiny - but in saying that, that is what you should expect from a boutique hotel. The beds were single beds - quite small and soft. There's a bay window that looked out onto the street below where we watched a busker outside our hotel getting rowdier and rowdier as the day went on - this is not a hotel you want to be in if you want to keep the windows open lol - unless u like noise. With the windows closed I didnt find it at all too noisy. The bathroom perhaps needs a face lift (as the new feature wall and bed linen in the main room has given it a great look) but for all intent purposes was fine. Free wireless internet was fabulous and fast. Apart from being small - the rooms were clean and comfortable. Biggest flaw with the rooms - The extremely THIN walls.... in the middle of the night we were awoken (and kept awake!) by noises that well, were a tad "R" rated - with a 5am wake up call the next day we were a bit tired the following day. Location Location! Union Square is right there - shopping district surrounds you and the cable cars "ding ding" at your front door step. Tour buses are easily booked and acessible from the Chancellor. Restaurants and food places are just a hop, skip and a jump away. My personal favourite - "Bangkok: Noodles and Thai BBQ" - 110 Powell St - yummy fried rice! Actually - best I've ever had! Stay at chancellor for the location and the service :)

Reviews.Title: “The only good thing is the location”
Reviews.Author: jayne2164
Reviews.Content: After reading other reviews prior to booking i was extremely disappointed. The room was one of the smallest i have ever stayed in and the bathroom awful, long overdue for a refit and cramped. Even on the 11th Floor the noise from traffic and Union Square is terrible, keeping us up at night and awake early in the morning. The room became very hot but if you open the window the noise gets worse and the room fills with cooking smells from some nearby extractor - absolutely vile. If we had been here for more than 2/3 nights (my husband arrived one night before me) i would have checked out and stayed elsewhere. The bar is dark, dingy and uninviting, so much so we didnt have one drink despite a free drink voucher! Except for the green decor our room looked nothing like the pictures on the website. There must be one nice room somewhere and we were not in it! You can lose the will to live waiting for the lift. Good points - the location, proximity to shopping and free coffee in the lobby. Unless you are on a very tight budget stay elsewhere! I travel extensively worldwide and can honestly say this is one of the worst hotels i have stayed in in a very long time.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: emah
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Chancellor for 4 nights in mid January 2010, on the basis of reviews on Tripadvisor. Initially I booked for $149 a night on the hotel website, but a couple of months out I found a better rate ($89 a night plus taxes) on Expedia, so I took that rate with a smile. I arrived at 2pm but my room was not available until 3pm, no problem - they took my bags and I went for a walk. They gave me a room on the 12th floor in the corner looking out over Union Square. It's a small room but it has a walk in closet, and its very well furbished. The bed was a little hard the first night (I have a princess and the pea back) but the next day they put a egg-crate foam topper on the bed and that made it incredibly comfy. There is the full complement of toiletries - shampoo, conditioner, lotion, soaps, plus cotton buds and tips, shower cap - and your own take-home rubber duckie. Mine came with a mobile phone and filofax! There is no mini bar but when I realised this, I asked if it was possible to have a bar fridge brought up and it was delivered within the hour. There is a Walgreens on the corner to buy milk etc - I prefer to have cereal in my PJs - can't handle company before breakfast! The room has a desk, chest of drawers with a big flat screen tv, table and chairs, and lots of lamps. Nice heavy curtains keep out the neon lights from the Square. I only realised it on day 3 but my window was open about an inch which was why it was so noisy - when pulling the curtains on the morning of day 3 I noticed curtain billowing outside and followed it back to the source; once I closed the window it was really quiet and peaceful! Nice carpet, nice soft towels and flannels etc. There is a pillow menu with 12 different types of pillows but I just stuck to the down pillows. The location could not be better; a 5 minute walk down Powell takes you to Market St, and the cable car stops just outside the hotel so you can shoot up to the tourist sites without having to queue down on Market. Get a Muni Pass if you are visiting - 3 days for $18 compared to $5 per trip on the cable car; I estimate I would have 'spent' $15 a day on local transport without the pass. Tea and coffee are available all day in the foyer, along with REALLY yummy cookies and fresh apples. There is a tour desk down there too - the woman behind the counter has a lot of zeal! They can book you on the airport shuttle for $14. The front desk staff are incredibly helpful and friendly - even with my extra demands (fridge, bed) they didn't blink - and they lent me packing tape and scissors when I decided to see how much stuff I could pack into one of those flat-rate boxes the USPS the sells ($56 to Australia, up to 20lbs - I managed to get 17.5 pounds in there!). The rooms and the foyer are all wireless - and its pretty high-speed for wireless too. Plenty of power points throughout the room and the bathroom - and the light switches are night lights which is cool because the bathroom is a step-up and the light always reminded me. There is a restaurant downstairs for breakfast and lunch, and room service is available until 9pm. I had breakfast there on my last day, using the discount voucher they provided on check in and it was absolutely fine. I would definitely stay here again - it was really good value.

Reviews.Title: “Classy Staff, Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: vjmelzer
Reviews.Content: Had a short but sweet stay here and everything went smoothly. The staff were all on target (the folks that tend tables at the breakfast restaurant downstairs are amazingly attentive), the location is central for San Francisco shopping or sightseeing, and rooms are relaxed and pleasant. Plus is easy to spot from the surrounding streets with its bright vertically-lettered signage! No chance of losing your way.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, excellent location, good bargain”
Reviews.Author: Educator1411
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 2 nights on a spur-of-the-moment trip to San Francisco after New Year's. We loved the Chancellor...excellent location one block from Union Square and about 5 blocks to Chinatown. We walked all over the area both days...through Chinatown, down Broadway (North Beach/Italian area) and down to Fisherman's Wharf. We caught the cable car back, which dropped us off one block away. All of the major high end shopping retailers are in the area. Our room was small but well-appointed and very comfortable. Lobby always had complimentary coffee and cookies. The parking garage was around the corner but quite reasonable. We will definitely stay at the Chancellor again; probably fly into SFIA and then take the shuttle to the hotel ($14 per person one-way) in case we don't want to drive.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: pusskin
Reviews.Content: The staff here at brilliant - they refused a tip for valet parking the car on several occasions, went out on the street and hailed a taxi cab for us using a whistle (I felt like I was in the movies), helped carry out my luggage and put it in the car without my even needing to ask, were upfront about the hollandaise sauce needing to be redone for my husband's eggs benedict and brought toast in the meantime. Great idea to have free coffee and apples in the lobby at all times - especially nice to see some fruit in America! Brilliant location for shopping and the tour the staff advised us to go on was great -the tour company even picked us up outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small comfortable hotel with an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Holiday1234England
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights over New Year and were really impressed with the hotel. The staff were really friendly and helpful. The rooms were well equipped with comfortable beds. The location was perfect for Union Square and surrounds with everything you need on your doorstep (including Walgreens for forgotten items and refreshments). The complimentary coffee, apples and cookies were really welcome after a day of sightseeing too. For a central location hotel the Chancellor Inn is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Small but comfortable and close to Union Square”
Reviews.Author: KennethM2
Reviews.Content: The room was a bit small and a tight squeeze to enter (corner room). The room was clean, the water hot, and the staff friendly. Plus the price was reasonable considering the location. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Cracking hotel lives up to its reputation”
Reviews.Author: clifford_david
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel based on numerous recommendations and it certainly lived up to its reputation. A cracking location right by Union Square, lovely rooms (we had a 15th floor panorama) and at a good price. However, what made our stay over Christmas 2009 so memorable was the consistent excellence of all the staff. This really was a team effort with everyone - from front of house to the lovely ladies who cleaned our room - friendly, courteous and efficient and focused on making this hotel a cut above the rest. It's rare to find a place where all the staff consistently provide service above and beyond the call of duty and who go out of their way to help and make your stay a special experience. We would recommend unreservedly - you'll have a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: klimag
Reviews.Content: A thoroughly helpful bellboy took care of us when we arrived, all jet-lagged and crazy. Thereafter we enjoyed a lovely comfortable clean room overlooking Union Square. This is a gracefully aging and elegant hotel at an affordable price.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect budget hotel on Union Square”
Reviews.Author: irishpines
Reviews.Content: This fit the bill exactly for us - we were arriving from Ireland with two days to spend in SF before getting in an RV, and we wanted to stay somewhere central without spending too much. We only used the hotel for sleeping in, so I don't know about the bar/restaurant or anything else. However it's a nice 3 star hotel, perfect location and no complaints about the small, clean rooms or the friendly service. Incidentally, when looking for a hotel in SF we saw the great Tripadvisor reviews, with a few complaints thrown in about bathroom size etc. What caught our eye was the responses from the manager, who answered them with no BS and no apologies to those who just wanted to whinge or who had been hoping for a freebie - very refreshing attitude, and when we stayed there we had no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay - location is the best”
Reviews.Author: UKJosie
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a family of 4 with 2 teenagers in rooms with an interconnecting door on the 12th floor facing the front. It wasn't too noisy with the windows closed. Everything has already been said in previous reviews - clean, helpful staff, good breakfast, so not much to add. We liked the free never ending coffee from the lobby, free WIFI, brilliant location and trying out the pillows. There was nothing we did not like in fact. We had breakfast on day one there and it was fine - friendly service, good food. We liked it. I have often seen questions in the forum about whether to stay near Union Square or Fishermans Wharf and having stayed at the Chancellor, Union Square would win hands down. There is so much to do and the Chancellor is just in the best place for it. You can't beat the location.

Reviews.Title: “Another voice in the chorus of admirers”
Reviews.Author: SightViewer
Reviews.Content: There is nothing really to add to all these reviews. Yes, the staff is great, the location is perfect, the cleanliness is superb. I think it might be noisy in rooms, facing the street, in the summer time. One piece of advice to guests with cars: there are plenty of garages in the neighborhood and attendants appear to be very flexible on rates. Will stay next time at the Chancellor and recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Traveler14698
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on holiday for 4 nights in December of 2009. In short, everything was grand! For a traveler on a budget I doubt you can do better. The long version. Pros: - Splendid location. The hotel is in the heart of Union square - a busy shopping district in the centre of town. The area is also very pretty at night (around the holidays there's a massive Christmas tree lighting up the square). - Price. I booked the room for $100 per night - very low for a decent hotel in San Francisco, so excellent value for money. - Comfortable rooms. Great beds, free wi-fi in the rooms. Lovely (walk-in) closet. - Friendly and welcoming staff. Cons: - Room size: the rooms are comfortable, but small. - Slow (free) wifi. Good for surfing the web, but too slow to stream video. Tips & tricks: - Guests have complimentary access to a great health club just around the corner. Or you can just get a room on the top floor and walk up the 15 floors of stairs instead of taking a lift. :) - Delicious coffee, tea (and biscuits in the morning) are available in the lobby around the clock and free of charge. - Because of the lack of AC, the bathroom window needs to be opened regularly to avoid getting mold spots on the mirror and walls. - Room doors have standard locks, but no door chains - a first among dozens of hotels I have stayed in and should be trivial to resolve. Overall, I had a fantastic experience and will gladly stay here if I holiday in San Francisco again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a prime location!”
Reviews.Author: frequenttraveler234
Reviews.Content: Location: The hotel is in one of the best San Francisco locations - one block from Union Square, close to shopping, restaurants, night life, cable car lines and numerous city bus lines, a few blocks from Market Street, Chinatown, and downtown. The area is safe, with many locals and tourists during all hours of the day. The hotel itself: It is a boutique hotel, which is of course a difference from a large chain such as Marriott or Hyatt, but the experience was great. The hotel staff were polite and helpful but not intrusive. A few notes about the building: it is older; less space in the staircases/elevators; no A/C in the rooms (ceiling fan present) but SF doesn't get that hot/cold during most months. Rooms are cozy, but furnishings were functional and in good condition. Inside the room: flat-screen TV, free wi-fi in the rooms and in the lobby, no coffee maker (but you can place a request), free coffee and cookies in the lobby, free access to the Club One gym a block away (no fitness center inside the hotel), well organized walk-in closet, comfortable and clean bedding, all light fixtures were in order. Reservations: You could get a better nightly rate by booking ahead on a third-party site. In summary, the hotel was a great deal in a prime location, with a nice ambiance and friendly staff and they didn't nickel-and-dime for standard amenities. I would recommend it to friends and stay there again. A hidden gem in the heart of SF.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: MallyBeckenham
Reviews.Content: For a 3-star hotel this was perfect! When we booked with trailfinders we were offered several 4-stars at the same price but based on the reviews we took the Chancellor and were not disappointed. Firstly the location is perfect, could not ask for any more. We stood on the 8th floor of Macys in Union Square (after dinner at the Cheesecake factory!) and could stand on the balcony and see our hotel, you don't get closer to the action than that! The rooms may have been small, but in reality, if you've been to Toyko, they are actually quite spacious!! We had 3 suitcases and had no worries fitting them all in. A nice size closet was included and an in room safe. The beds were so comfortable, if only I had similar at home! There was an umbrella supplied for the wet weather and a lovely little rubber duck in the bath (ok so little things amuse me!). The lady on the tourdesk arranged airport transit for us with 5 mins notice, was very efficient and helpful. We didn't eat in the restaurant or use the bar so can't rate this. On the whole, we have no complaints, would definitely stay here again and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect SF Hotel”
Reviews.Author: d_p_richards
Reviews.Content: Location: Excellent - near all sorts of public transit. Hotel sells day passes for the SF MUNI as well. Walking distance to Chinatown, Ferry Building, BART, Caltrain, etc. Room: Small, but nicely laid out, clean, and huge closet, also an in-room safe. Service: Very friendly, very accomodating. I asked if they could store some medication for me in the fridge and instead they offered to bring us a small bar fridge for our stay. Value: Great - booked on Expedia and got a super deal for downtown SF. I would stay here again without hesitation. Really a gem of a find.

Reviews.Title: “This a gem of a hotel in a perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: mrstuna
Reviews.Content: We liked everything about this hotel: Location, staff, amenities, restaurant, bar, etc. It is a small comfortable hotel on Union Square. The rooms are small, but that really didn't bother us at all. They are very well arranged and worked just fine. The decor is nice, the beds comfortable, the hotel is well maintained, the wireless access works, the restaurant serves a good breakfast (the only meal we actually had there), the staff is pleasant and helpful. Also, we got a great deal--look at the specials on-line! Our absolutely only problem was that the room was overly warm the first night we were there, even thoughwe turned the thermostat way down and ran the ceiling fan. We discovered the second night we could open the window because it had a safety stop on it. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “You can count on this hotel to deliver each and every time”
Reviews.Author: nancyesca
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the perfect location - adjacent to Union square and the cable car really does stop outside. The rooms are perfect good...flat screen TVs, serviceable bathrooms, good cleanliness and a great value for the price. Since it was winter A/C was not an issue and the umbrella in the closet for use while you are there is very handy. The huge tubs are great for soaking feet and body after a long day of sightseeing and walking. HINT: LUSH, the bath products store is just a couple of blocks down the hill towards Market St. Another HINT: get the 1 or 3 or 7 day MUNI pass, it makes taking the cable cars and other public transport very reasonable. We ate breakfast at Luques the restaurant in the hotel each day and thought the food was good. Another HINT: there is an Irish type pub a block down the hill and to the right...cannot remember the name, but they have a piano and it is a great sing along bar. To get from the airport to the hotel - you can take BART for $8.10 each way...and the hotel is 3-4 blocks up from the Powell and Market BART stop I have stayed in this hotel at least 5 times and it remains my "go-to" hotel in San Francisco. Also the bellman...I did not get his name but I remember him from last time, gave us a good hint about how to get to the Presidio by bus...which saved us lots and make it a great adventure. Free PC and printer in the lobby is great to look things up and sign in for your flights.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, lovely rooms, great staff - what more could you want?”
Reviews.Author: Brighton_Claire
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel - the location is great. We had an internal facing room, with a view of a wall, but we did get the room really cheap, and it was really quiet at night - so complaints there. The decor is lovely, really chic and the room was spacious enough for a city center hotel - great walk in wardrobe big enough to store suitcases open. The staff we dealt with were really helpful and friendly. We didn't eat anything in hotel, so can't comment on the food. But when your in heart of SF you've so many choices. Right next door there is Sears which is famous for breakfast (although we didn't make it cause the queue's were SO huge!). I'd definitely stay here again, and I loved SF - hope to get back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Would Recommend Hands Down”
Reviews.Author: cp2011
Reviews.Content: I have no complaints about this hotel. The location is central, right in Union Square, with the trolley right outside the door of the hotel. We rented a car and the parking offer at Chancellor Hotel was key in our decision to book here. Parking can get expensive in SF, but having the in-and-out privileges attributed with the hotel's parking made this choice a no brainer. We got the car each time ourselves and had no safety issues with the garage. There are places around the hotel to eat so if you prefer to stay nearby for dinner, you'll have lots of choices. We were very impressed by the cleanliness of the room (though small, but what can you expect being smack in the center of the city?), the friendliness of the staff and to top it off, the free tea/coffee/cookies were a nice treat. The wifi worked fine for us in the room using our laptop. I would recommend this hotel hands down to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Auntie033
Reviews.Content: I booked the Chancellor for my first trip to San Francisco, based on the price for the location and on the trip advisor reviews. On subsequent conversations with people about where I would be staying, I discovered that 2 or 3 people I knew had previously stayed there and they raved about the hotel so I was really looking forward to my stay there. I was not disappointed. We stayed for 7 nights in a twin room on the 14th floor. I had emailed the hotel a few days before my arrival to request a high floor if possible – and received a very prompt and personable reply from Kevin, the Reservations Manager. As some others have said, the room was small, but we didn’t need a lot of space, and anyway we spent very little time in the room. The closet was the biggest I have seen and we had our suitcases in there so they were not taking up space. The bathroom was also small, but sufficient. I have a similar sized one myself at home and it’s perfectly adequate. The free wireless internet was a big bonus as you often have to pay for it at more expensive hotels. It worked absolutely fine for me. The internet terminal in Reception is also a great service, as we booked something online that we needed a printer for. All the staff that we dealt with in the hotel were super nice and very efficient. We had an issue where the safe in our room went to ‘sleep’ twice but when we reported this to reception it was fixed in less than 10 minutes on both occasions. The lady at the tour desk gave some great recommendations for restaurants. Although she did tell us that the Alcatraz night tour that we booked online 3 months earlier didn’t exist which sent us into a bit of a spin, but a phone call to the company quickly sorted that it was in fact running !! We ate breakfast in the hotel a few mornings and it was lovely and the restaurant staff were great. The cookies at reception were delicious, I wish I had started eating them earlier in the week than I did!! The location of the hotel is absolutely fantastic and one of the cable cars runs right outside the door. I loved San Francisco and will certainly be going back sometime in the future. I will definitely stay at the Chancellor Hotel again and will tell anyone I know that’s going to San Francisco to book this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superb...everything about it!!”
Reviews.Author: MelbTraveller85
Reviews.Content: This was actually my boyfriend's favourite hotel we stayed at for our whole 3 week holiday! To be honest, we didn't like San Francisco all that much but were thrilled with this hotel. As everyone has said, it is RIGHT in the middle of everything you need - shopping, restaturants, BART and you can walk anywhere. We ended up doing a walk from the hotel, alllllll the way up the hilly roads, turned left and walked a bit more to the really zig-zag windy street, then allllllll the way DOWN to Fisherman's Wharf. It was a long warm, but a quick cable car ride back and a very comfy bed to hop into to rest our exhausted bodies. I read the reviews here beforehand and noticed that the rooms were said to be quite small. I agree they aren't huge rooms, but I wouldn't say they're small. 2 of us and a fair bit of luggage were more than comfortable in it. The decor of the rooms is beautiful and adds an old-fashioned, classy feeling to the place. The lady at the bar was very friendly when we went down for a drink, as were the staff at the restaurant when we had lunch there on our departure day. There is a little kiosk/desk where we were able to get some help organising a shuttle back to the airport, buy a ticket for the cable car and also a postcard and stamp for me to send. Front desk then sent the postcard for me which was a nice touch by them. As everyone else on here, I would definately recommend staying here. And the free tea, coffee and cookies come in very handy too!

Reviews.Title: “Superb, clean hotel in an amazing location with bags of character”
Reviews.Author: LeeGuffy
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here after researching heaps of hotels in San Fran. We wanted somewhere central for the four days that had some character and soul. Step up The Chancellor Hotel complete with superb service and favourable rates. After sending an enquiry about the rooms, a helpful chap called Kevin got straight back to me and offered me a room for the period we needed and reserved them. Keen to make sure things were ok I ended up calling him and having a chat and to my pleasure, he was even nicer on the phone. he offered to give us a room at the top facing the square; what more could you ask for. As for the stay, well it was as good as the email and phone experience. Very clean hotel, amazing location on the square, helpful staff (especially the lovely lady who runs the bar) and rooms that we're just right. I've read that people think the rooms are small and a little run down. Nonsense really as the hotel is a real, proper San Fran hotel that's not a template chain. They are super clean, have everything you need and perfect for a stay in San Fran. What on earth do folk want a big room for? A party? In short I'd whole heartedly recommened a stay here. I've seen a lot of hotels on my travels and this is one I remember for all the right reasons. I'd stay again AND recommened which I guess is the true test of whether it's any good.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon revisited”
Reviews.Author: Rogerw303
Reviews.Content: 34 years ago we stayed for 10 days at the Chancellor on our honeymoon. The property has been updated since then but it has not lost any of it's charm. I advised the General Manager it was our anniversary and the first time back, and we were greeted by a nice gift and a bottle of Sparkling wine in our room on arrival. Rooms are small, but neat and recently refurbished. Luques bar is a hoot at night. Hotel is just off Union Square and right on the cable car line, which makes it convenient to Fisherman's Wharf as well as a multitude of nearby restaurants, theaters, shopping and other attractions. Rates are reasonable, staff is very friendly and accommodating. If you are used to 5* hotels you may find this hotel to be less than your expectations, simply because of stature, but I stay in 5* accommodation frequently and I would definitely stay at this boutique hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Do your self a favour, stay here”
Reviews.Author: KymSydney_Australia
Reviews.Content: After returning home from a very long holiday and having gathered my thoughts I would like to post this review of the Chancellor Hotel on Union Square San Francisco I would like to say you can't go wrong staying there, 5 stars to the Chancellor we stayed in the beginning of August, the room was a decent size just right for the two of us , with a large wardrobe which had a personnel safe inside ,comfortable queen bed, nice and clean room with pleasant decor, table and chairs by the window, we even had a view of Union square it is very nice indeed there was a Fan on the ceiling which was so good especially if you get hot through the night, just enough to keep you cool and if you don't like the sound of the city, just close your window and it is nice and quite the bath tub is a nice deep one, so relaxing that I fell asleep in it, after we had a wonderful day doing a Segway tour and walking around San Francisco how good was that and what a location right there in the middle of the city, nice places to eat next door or just around the corner, Staff were very friendly and helpful at all times and best of all, they had a sense of humour so all in all if you want a good hotel to stay in, that is central city with cable car at the front door, right on good shopping outlets, nice eating, drinking etc with rates that wont break the bank this is the place for you, Stay there, see for your self, Best to Wes K&K

Reviews.Title: “Quaint But Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Heisler49
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night on way to HNL via SFO. Room comfortable but smaller than anticipated. Would not try to swing a cat with a long tail in there. (Hard to get a sense of the size from on line pics) Very handy to Union Square & the cable car system. Lots of good eating down the side streets. H

Reviews.Title: “Chancellor - a great stay every time”
Reviews.Author: traymd
Reviews.Content: I've been visiting San Francisco for around 13 years now and all but one of my stays (except the first time as I didnt know this hotel existed) have been at the Chancellor. The hotel was first recommended to me by my travel company and I have never felt the need to even consider another hotel when visiting San Francisco. Standout points for rme are: - Excellent customer service from all the staff I have encountered in my visits - Ideal Union Square location - Home from Home feel - Spotlessly clean rooms & bathrooms - Very comfortable beds - Flat Screen TVs and Free Wifi - The hotel has real character and isnt one of your slick cookie-cutter chains - Excellent value for money - Nice quirky little features like the sweet jar, the rubber duck and pillow choice. Yes its not going to float your boat if you insist upon your typical marble clad 5 star hotels with the attendant features but give me character over sterile uniformity any day. I'll be visiting the city many more times in the future - the Chancellor is the only place I want to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A masterclass in customer service”
Reviews.Author: Godiver
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth visit to San Francisco and we've previously stayed in the bigger, business hotels that you can book through Trailfinders in the UK. However, on this trip we were bringing my sister and mother - who have never been to the USA before - so decided on the Chancellor because it is more central, the positive reviews on tripadvisor, and the reasonable rates for ten nights. Like so many others that have stayed at this hotel, I was very impressed. The hotel is right on Union Square and, whilst you might expect it to be noisy, we found it surprisingly quiet. It is an older-style hotel, but tastefully decorated, clean and comfortable. We found the rooms more than adequate for ten nights and the bed really comfortable - in fact, I haven't slept so well in ages. We ate at the hotel restaurant for breakfast every day and, again, thought it was excellent value; we also liked the cozy bar, which was great for a drink before going out for dinner in the evening. What really sets this hotel apart is the quality of the customer service; all our requests were dealt with efficiently and quickly and everyone - from reception staff to cleaning staff - was so helpful throughout our stay, and seemed determined to make sure that we were enjoying our visit. My mother and sister are now asking me to take them back to San Francisco so they can visit their 'friends' at the Chancellor Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: buzzLeicester
Reviews.Content: originally booked the chanceller for two nights. on arrival dealt with in a very proffesional friendly manner .Rooms are clean and well equipped .booked for a further two nights for the following week on our return to san francisco and had a street facing room which had a great view of union square.the standard of the hotel was fantastic and the location is ideal for shopping and site seeing. will definately be staying there again

Reviews.Title: “Good decision”
Reviews.Author: Aatu
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on its rating on TA, great price we got, and because of the location. I usually prefer business hotels and tried to find another place until the last minute. However, this hotel seemed to offer best value for money and we decided to stay there. This was a good decision. Having read all the great reviews about the service in the hotel I was disappointed at first. I felt that we needed to make the initiative to get the service, i.e. ask about everything as nothing was explained in the beginning (coffee, breakfast, bar, fridge in the room..). However, as soon as we did this, it was apparent that the reviews we correct. We got very good and personal service. Everyone working at the hotel was very polite and easy to approach. The tourdesk downstairs is the best. You can book tickets, buy Muni Passes and get all tourist information you need. We stayed in the hotel on two different occasions during our visit to SF. Both times the rooms were clean and nice with good pillows, flat screen TVs, good sized closets and best of all free internet. Rooms don’t have air conditioning, but this didn’t bother us at all. Open window and a ceiling fan did the job. Bathrooms were a bit on the old side, but perfectly usable (and clean). As said earlier, this is not a standard business hotel, but a hotel with character. One negative aspect was the noise from a room next door on our second stay. Our first room was very quiet but in the second one we could hear our neighbors talk and at night, snore. It felt as we were in the same room. The noise coming from the street didn’t bother us at all – it was nice hearing the streetcars pass by and ring their bells. We had breakfast on four of the six mornings we stayed downstairs in the Luques Restaurant. It cost abt 35 USD (tip and tax included) for 2 and was definitely worth it. We didn’t see the point in going to the restaurant next door as they pretty much had the same menu and prices. Service at the Luques was very good and friendly. Location of the hotel is perfect, right next to Union Square. In addition to the shopping and restaurants, it is an excellent place for public transportation. You can hop on the cable car to get to Fisherman’s Wharf or walk down two blocks to Market Street and hop on a tram/bus to get to Ferry Building (or if you go the other way - to Castro District). You can also easily walk to Chinatown and to Financial District. Overall the hotel has character, offers great service and has a good location. I would definitely recommend it to all my friends looking for value for money.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: travelbug007ny
Reviews.Content: We chose the Chancellor as recommended and we're so happy with ther advise. The hotel is centrally located in downtown San Francisco, we didn't need to rent a car. The rooms are on the small side like a European hotel but the space is enough for us. I like that they have a closet for the luggages and a safe deposit box. Our room is quiet,very clean and the beds are comfortable. The free coffee/tea and the delicious homemade cookies and apples available 24 hours in the lobby adds a very nice, homey touch. The staff are very friendly especially Susan the concierge who helped us book our trips and point us to the good and reasonable restaurants and gave us helpful tips while touring the city. We will recommend your hotel to our friends and will definitely stay in the Chancellor again .

Reviews.Title: “Great find; super cute; very comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: Karla888
Reviews.Content: The historic Chancellor Hotel on Union Square is (much to our surprise!) very reasonably priced, especially given it's location and the beauty of the premises. It's got that old world charm without going over-the-top or being tacky. The only drawback may be that the rooms are not airconditioned (they are fitted with ceiling fans) - this really wasn't an issue for us since October nights are cold, but it may be a sore point for anyone visiting during the summer. Also, some make take issue with having to keep the window open as there is a bit of noise from the street. You just can't beat the location, though (close to EVERYTHING); and the staff are very warm and friendly. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: LAScotty
